Government authorities are merely coming and clicking pictures with their mobile phones,” said Soha Lal Bishnoi, a farmer of 12KND village in Sriganganagar.“Almost 1 lakh hectares in Sriganganagar and nearly 2.6-lakh ha in the remaining nine districts have been affected by locust attacks. We have written to Prime Minister Narendra Modi and urged his intervention in expediting the relief process. We demand a compensation of Rs 20,000 per acre to each farmer,” said Sehgal.

Title: India calls Pak official over abduction of Hindu girls
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: The foreign office on Friday summoned a senior official of the Pakistan high commission to protest against the abduction of minority Hindu girls in Pakistan.

"Pakistan has been conveyed the grave concerns as expressed amongst various quarters of Indian civil society at such a shocking and deplorable incident involving minor girls from the minority Hindu community in Pakistan. The incidents have been strongly condemned and immediate safe return of the girls to their families has been sought," government sources said.

Highlighting the travails of Hindus in Pakistan, MEA officials focused on reports of the recent case of two minor girls, Shanti Meghwad and Sarmi Meghwad, who were allegedly abducted on January 14.

"They belong to Umar village, Tharparkar, Sindh, Pakistan. In another incident, a minor girl, Mehak, also belonging to the minority Hindu community, was abducted from the Jacobabad district of Sindh province in Pakistan on January 15, 2020," the MEA said.

The Modi government's Citizenship (Amendment) Act is intended to make it easier for persecuted Hindus, and five other minority communities, from Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh to find an easier route to citizenship in India.

Title: Genelia D'Souza looks absolutely pretty in these Instagram photos but the captions full of wisdom deserve your attention!
Content: Kangana Ranaut fans were in for a surprise on August 21 as the actress announced her arrival on Twitter. And within 10 days of her debut on the micro-blogging site, Kangana has clocked 1 million followers. In an exclusive interaction with ETimes, Kangana Ranaut opened up about her tryst with social media, how she deals with trolls and all things Twitter. Excerpts from the interview:

Title: 'Dr Bomb' held in Kanpur, was planning to flee to Nepal
Content: KANPUR/LUCKNOW: Dr Jalees Ansari, aka " Dr Bomb " - the 68-year-old Rajasthan serial blasts convict and accused in over 50 other explosions, including the 1993 Mumbai bomb blasts - had plans to flee to Nepal , police said. He had jumped parole in Mumbai on Thursday, and was arrested in Kanpur on Friday. He was serving a life term.Ansari had disappeared from his Mumbai residence on Thursday, a day before his 21-day parole was to end. He was picked up by the UP Special Task Force (UPSTF) as he walked out of a mosque after offering prayers.DGP OP Singh said the UPSTF was alerted about Ansari by the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) around 11 pm on Thursday. "He admitted to jumping parole," said the DGP. Police have also seized Rs 47,780 from his possession.IG STF Amitabh Yash said Ansari was headed to Sant Kabir Nagar as his relatives resided there. From there, he had planned to flee to Nepal.A resident of Mominpura in south Mumbai's Agripada, Ansari was on parole for 21 days from Ajmer Central Prison, Rajasthan, said Yash. He was expected to surrender before prison authorities on Thursday but had gone missing ."In the parole period beginning from December 26, he was ordered to visit Agripada police station every day. However, Ansari did not visit the police station on Thursday. His son had filed a missing complaint," said Yash.Ansari, who completed his MBBS from a Mumbai college, got in touch with Abdul Kareem Tunda of LeT in 1988 during a visit to Hyderabad. He soon became adept at making bombs and the moniker "Dr Bomb" stuck. He was also trained by Harkat-ul-Jihad-al-Islami, a fundamentalist organisation based in Pakistan , in the making of bombs.In Video: UP STF arrests 'Doctor Bomb' Jalees Ansari in Kanpur

Title: Nadda set to be elected BJP chief on Jan 20
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: BJP working president J P Nadda set to take over as party chief replacing Amit Shah , who has been holding the post since 2014.

Poll in-charge Radha Mohan Singh announced the election schedule on Friday according to which nominations will be filed on January 20. Polling, if required, will take place the next day. However, Nadda is likely to be elected unopposed, sources said.

Singh said internal polls were completed in 21 of BJP's 36 state and Union Territory units. BJP's constitution stipulates that its national president can be elected only after at least half of the state units have completed organisational elections.

Title: As 'owners' battle for custody, pet dog spends night in prison
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

RUDRAPUR: A pet dog, Tiger, had to spend a night in police custody in Udham Singh Nagar, after two people claimed its ownership. Interestingly, the dog also seemed to know both the persons.

Sub-inspector Madan Singh Bisht, in-charge of Katoratal police station, said one Nirmal Singh had registered a complaint with the police that his pet labrador had gone missing on December 26.

"On January 12, one Amit Kumar posted on social media that he had rescued a labrador from railway crossing in Kashipur. Nirmal's son noticed the post, approached Kumar and returned home with his pet," Bisht said.

However, on January 16, another person, Anurag Chauhan, reached out to Kumar and claimed the dog was his. Bisht added, "The photo brought by Chauhan resembled the one that Kumar had rescued. Chauhan then went to Nirmal Singh's place and claimed he was the dog's owner. When they reached us we found that the dog was responding well to both the persons. We then decided to keep it in our custody until the matter was sorted."

Bisht said, "But on Friday, we decided that we will leave the dog at a point from where he can reach his owner's house and keep an eye. Whichever house the dog chooses to go will be recognised as the owner." The experiment worked when Tiger reached Singh's house on his own.

Title: No SC relief for Azam's son in election annulment case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Friday declined to stay the annulment of Mohd Abdullah Azam Khan's election to the Uttar Pradesh assembly in 2017 from Suar constituency. He is the son of SP politician Azam Khan.

On a petition filed by BSP candidate Nawab Kazim Ali Khan, the Allahabad HC had annulled Abdullah's election on finding that he was ineligible to file his nomination in January 2017 as he had not attained the age of 25 years. Abdullah had challenged the decision in the SC.

Appearing for Abdullah, senior advocate Kapil Sibal said the HC judgment was not based on evidence, which showed that the appellant was born in 1990. But the bench asked why the senior advocate was shying away from showing the school leaving certificate. " It is not that the HC has recorded a finding without any evidence. We will not stay the HC judgment," it said, but issued notice to Kazim Ali Khan.

Kapil said that the authorities had initiated proceedings to prosecute Abdullah for alleged forging of documents. "That proceeding should be stayed," he pleaded. But the bench declined the plea.

Title: CBI books 3 IRS officers in Rs 160 crore import scam
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

MUMBAI: The CBI has registered a case of corruption, cheating, forgery and conspiracy against 17 people, including three Indian Revenue Service officers of the customs, in an import scam . Diamond merchants, with the connivance of valuers and officials, inflated the value of precious stones brought here and used the trade route to transfer black money out of the country.

The officials who have been named in the FIR are Vinay Brij Singh, then commissioner at Airport Special Cargo Commissionerate and deputy commissioners Ashiquzzaman and Chandravanshi Y Manikanhaiya, posted at Precious Cargo Customs Clearance Centre, Bharat Diamond Bourse. In July 2019, Singh was dismissed by the government invoking rule 56(j) of the Service Rules. Manikanhaiya is currently posted in Hyderabad while Ashiquzzman is posted in Rourkela.

The DRI said the importers inflated the value of the imports from Rs 1 crore to Rs 160 crore. DRI officials said over Rs 3,000 crore is believed to have been taken out of the country in 18 months.

The FIR says that one Girshi Kadel, based in Hong Kong and with operations in India, imported rough diamonds from Switzerland to Hong Kong in the name of his companies. Some of the same diamonds were sent to India. The total quantity of the diamonds was valued at Rs 156 crore.

The FIR says that the diamonds were put up for valuation to two specific valuers who said the declared value was 'fair'. Another valuer recorded his objections. The FIR says that Singh influenced the subordinate officers to call for a particular member in the customs panel and instructed the member to give a favourable report for the diamonds.

Title: 3 arrested in Muzaffarpur double murder case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARPUR: Three persons were arrested from different locations on Thursday evening in connection with the double murder committed in the town on January 7.

Unidentified criminals had bludgeoned Ajay Kumar Sharma, a retired assistant IG of land registration in state prohibition, excise and registration department and his wife Renu Kumari Sharma at their residence at Gyanlok Colony under Brahmapura police station area.

Muzaffarpur SSP Jayant Kant told reporters on Friday that the investigating team would soon reveal the motive behind the crime. “The probe is still on. We can arrest some more men involved in the gruesome killing,” he said.

the SSP said one of the accused, Nitesh Kumar, was arrested first. “Later, Md Sohail and Rakesh Kumar were arrested on revelations made by Nitesh during interrogation,” he said.

Authoritative sources said their involvement in real estate business was the reason behind the couple’s murder. “Sharma was constructing an apartment in Bhagwanpur locality under Sadar police station. Some miscreants had demanded extortion for allowing the construction work, but Sharma refused to pay any money. Meanwhile, a white-collar real estate muscleman tried to mediate, but in vein. And finally, the goons killed the duo,” he said.

Title: 15 helicopters to cover over 16,200km-long human chain in Bihar
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Students rehearsal of Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali human chain formation at Gandhi Maidan

PATNA: The final rehearsal for human chain formation was done at Gandhi Maidan on Friday. The participants formed the map of Bihar while the songs based on environment were being played in the background. The real human chain event is scheduled across the state on Sunday to promote the state government’s Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali campaign , along with creating awareness regarding prohibition and against child marriage and dowry. Gandhi Maidan will be its epicentre as chief minister Nitish Kumar will formally inaugurate the event here.

Patna DM Kumar Ravi said around 5,000 people, including Jeevika members, Asha workers, Anganwadi workers, students, role models, people belonging to third gender and representatives from all the religions participated in the rehearsal on Friday morning. “The final event will be organized similarly. People are free to participate wherever they feel like,” said Kumar, adding, “Safety of people is our prime concern and all the officials have been told to leave their place of duty only after each and every individual goes back home.”

He further said the event at Gandhi Maidan will be recorded by six drone cameras and the chains emerging out from here will move in four directions, touching the border of Bihar. In Patna district, the chain will be 696km long, including 167km on the main route, 256km on sub-routes and 273km on other routes.

However, the length of human chain across the state has been targeted to be 16,200km and over four crore people are expected to participate in it. This will be third such event in Bihar. The first human chain formed in 2017 was 11,285km long in favour of prohibition. The second human chain was against dowry and child marriage and it was 13,660km long.

Education department officer Vinodanand Jha said the entire event will be covered with the help of 15 helicopters, unlike earlier when only drones were used for photography.

Even though the opposition is targeting chief minister for the event, his alliance partner BJP has asked all its party cadres and leaders to participate in it. Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi and BJP state incharge Sanjay Jaiswal instructed all the party workers to make it a success. They not only appealed to the members of various wings of the BJP, but even appealed the traders and businessmen to stand outside their shops and form human chain.

“The motive is to connect common people with the cause of the event. In the next three years, the government will be spending Rs24,500 crore on renovation of ponds, puddles, aahars and paines,” said Modi though a press release.

Title: Bihar: 5% fall in road accidents in second half of 2019
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: There was 5% decline in the number of accidents and 6% fall in accident deaths in the state in the second half of 2019, said state transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal on the concluding day of the Road Safety Week on Friday.

Speaking at an event on ‘Advancing Road Safety in Bihar’, Agarwal attributed the decline in road accident and death cases to strict enforcement of Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act, 2019. Seven districts in Bihar have registered a significant fall in road accident deaths in 2019 after the special drives. “In Bettiah, only 40 deaths were reported in 2019 against 54 in 2018, which is almost 26% less than previous year. Banka registered 14% fall in road accident fatalities, Lakhisarai 12% and Sitamarhi and Samastipur 5% each while there was 2% decline in Bhagalpur and Purnia each,” he said.

Agarwal said the department has targeted to make 100% helmet coverage for two-wheeler riders in all 38 districts in the state by the end of this year. The coverage is in the range of 90-100%. He said the situation in Patna is better with around 94% of the two-wheeler riders in the city wearing helmets. “It is now difficult to find people in Patna not wearing helmets while riding a two-wheeler,” he said and added: “Earlier, only 14% used helmets in almost all the districts. However, the situation has improved significantly in the recent months owing to awareness and strict enforcement of rules. Almost 45% two-wheeler riders in Munger are wearing helmets against 10% in 2018. Gaya stood at 46%, Darbhanga 63%, Muzaffarpur 59%, Chhapra 61%, Bhagalpur 58% and Purnia 32%.”

“The department issued e-challans through hand-held devices and driving licenses of a few people were also cancelled during the weeklong road safety week drive,” Agarwal said.

He said 1.5 lakh vehicles were checked and 1 lakh people were fined in the state in 2019 for violating new traffic rules, which included not fastening seatbelts and wearing helmets while driving and jumping red lights and over-speeding their vehicles. “Altogether 29,000 e-challans were issued through monitoring CCTV cameras at 35 major road intersections and crossings in Patna alone,” he said.

State transport commissioner Seema Tripathi said the department has targeted to achieve 7% fall in the number of fatalities in road accidents in 2020. “We have already initiated several measures like speed radar guns and speed governors in vehicles,” she said.

Seema said unlike earlier, nodal officers have been appointed in all the 38 districts to improve traffic management and ensure strict implementation of traffic norms.

Agarwal said after successful piloting of hand-held devices in Patna for issuing e-challans, the department is going to introduce this mechanism in other districts from February 15. The hand-held device was launched in Patna in 2018. E-challan device has a mobile phone to take record of violator, printer and a Wi-Fi device for network connectivity.

The secretary said the traffic police can maintain track record of violators and details of their previous offences by using the hand-held devices for issuing e-challans.

Title: Patna University teachers to get revised pay in February
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: All the teachers and non-teaching staff of Patna University (PU) will get their revised UGC payscale for the month of January. Retired teachers and staff will also get their revised pension with effect from January.

PU vice-chancellor (VC) Rash Bihari Prasad Singh told this newspaper on Friday that the state government has sanctioned Rs 60 crore towards the difference of revised pay from March 2019 to February 2020. “Therefore, the arrears of revised UGC pay from March to December 2019 will be paid to all the staff, both serving as well as retired, before Holi,” he said.

The state government has also reportedly released a sum of Rs 11 crore to PU towards the arrears of pension paid to its employees during the past several months. The VC said, “PU had made these payments from its internal funds.”

Now, the employees of all the universities will get their salaries and pension in the revised 7th payscales from February onward. Sources said the state education department is likely to release necessary funds to all the universities soon. Higher education director had already assured the universities of releasing the funds by January 15.

About a couple of months ago, the department had released funds for two universities — Tilka Manjhi Bhagalpur University and Pataliputra University. Now, the remaining universities will be getting the required funds from the department.

The state government had notified the implementation of revised UGC payscales for college and university teachers of the state more than a year back, but the same was not paid to the teachers till date due to delay in fixation of pay of university staff in the revised scale as per the pro forma designed by the education department. Ironically, all the government employees, including schoolteachers have been getting their salaries in the revised scale since long.

Title: Bihar: 4 guards axed for tampering with donation box
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

GAYA: Four employees of the Bodh Gaya Temple Management Committee have been suspended on the charge of tampering with the donation boxes placed in the vicinity of the seat of the Buddha’s enlightenment. They were night guards. Action against them has been taken on the basis of CCTV footage showing the employees attempting to open the box.

The suspended employees were deputed elsewhere in the shrine and as such they were not supposed to be in the donation box area. The suspension letter was issued on Thursday.

According to Temple Management Committee member Arvind Singh, the shrine on an average receives about Rs 5 crore per annum from the offerings made by the devotees. The donation boxes are opened under strict vigil once every three months, said Singh.

In their written explanation, the night guards maintained that the donation boxes were sealed and as such tampering was not possible.

Confirming their suspension, Gaya DM Abhishek Singh, who is also the ex officio chairman of the shrine management committee, said the process to dismiss the employees from service has also been started. An FIR has also been lodged against them, the DM said.

Title: Bihar: RJD to contest four seats in Delhi assembly election
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

RJD national spokesperson and MP Manoj Jha

PATNA: RJD will contest four out of 70 seats in alliance with Congress in the Delhi assembly election to be held on February 8.

However, RJD national spokesperson and MP Manoj Jha said his party would like to contest one more seat. “We have demanded one more seat. We have already scaled down from our previous demand of seven seats,” said Jha, who refused to share the names of four constituencies his party was allotted by the Congress.

Party national secretary general Qamar Alam, who along with Jha is looking after RJD’s Delhi assembly election preparations, said the talks were going on and by Saturday everything will be cleared. However, RJD sources said the party would contest from Burari, Kirari, Palam and Karawal Nagar as of now.

Interestingly, Burari is home to a large number of migrants from Uttar Pradesh and Bihar . AAP’s Sanjeev Jha had won the seat last time against BJP’s Gopal Jha. Sanjeev is again contesting on AAP’s ticket, but BJP has not declared its Burari candidate yet.

Even Kirari has a sizeable population of Poorvanchalis and BJP has named Anil Jha as its candidate against AAP’s Rituraj Jha, the sitting MLA.

BJP is fielding Vijay Pandit from Palam and Mohan Singh Bisht from Karawal Nagar, while AAP has retained its sitting MLA Bhavna Gaur from Palam. Durgesh Pathak will be contesting on AAP’s ticket from Karawal Nagar from where rebel AAP leader Kapil Mishra had won last time.

While AAP has released the list of all its candidates, BJP on Friday released the names of 57 candidates.

Title: ‘Job creation a major challenge’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: India's fundamental challenge is going to be creation of jobs as there is a large population of young people in the country, Professor Johannes Urpelainen from Johns Hopkins School of Advanced International Studies said here on Friday.

Delivering a seminar on ‘Powering Growth in India’s Small and Medium-Sized Enterprises’ organized by Asian Development Research Institute ( ADRI ) and International Growth Centre (IGC), Professor Urpelainen said: “Without jobs, one cannot invest in basic necessities of life. Small and medium-sized industries form an important component of these jobs.”

He said affordable, abundant and reliable supply of energy is an essential precondition for economic growth. “India's growth story is unusual as it has grown without any large contribution from the industrial sector. In India, household electrification has progressed rapidly, but productive use of energy remains constrained,” he said.

Analysing micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in Bihar, Prof Urpelainen said, “Most of these firms use a large chunk of their power consumption on lighting and fans among electronic appliances. An exception that he came across in Bihar was flour mills. Only 17% of the GDP of Bihar comes from the industrial sector as compared to all India average of 23%. Government intervention is required to move to larger, electric pumps in Bihar for tapping groundwater as the overwhelming majority of pumps use diesel,” he emphasized.

Professor Urpelainen also explained the energy constraints that small and medium-sized enterprises in rural and urban India face. He also argued for a strategy that focuses on improving energy supply in towns that are ready for rapid economic expansion.

State industries minister Shyam Rajak said the MSMEs in Bihar face difficulties in marketing their products. He said efforts were being made to solve these problems. “There are a number of village-based industrial clusters in Bihar. These include cluster for leather works, rice mills and flour mills among others,” he said.

While introducing the speaker, ADRI member secretary Shaibal Gupta said Professor Urpelainen has been conducting research in Bihar for several years now on topics like how to improve energy supply. Kumar Das, the programme policy manager, IGC India, proposed a vote of thanks.

Title: Youth engaged in survey thrashed in Darbhanga
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

DARBHANGA: A youth from Mirzapur in Uttar Pradesh was thrashed by a group of people at Karamganj under Laheriasarai police station of the district on Thursday on the suspicion of gathering personal details of local residents as part of the CAA and NPR. Prince Singh’s repeated plea that he was working for a private TV news channel and not for any agency related to CAA or NPR, however, went unheeded.

The residents of the locality inhabited mostly by people belonging to minority community didn’t stop there. They summoned the councillor of ward No 37 and subsequently handed him over. He, in turn, lodged a complaint with Laheriasarai police station accusing him of illegal trespass and misbehaviour with women. Laheriasarai SHO H N Singh said the youth was booked under Sections 448, 419 and 504 of IPC.

The SHO further said the accused was released from the police station as the charges against him were bailable. As the youth was concealing his identity and not willing to disclose the name of the TV channel which had hired him for conducting the survey, the residents became suspicious of his activities.

The youth, on the other hand, claimed that other members of the team have also been assigned the task and doing the work in other parts of the district.

Title: Dhawan joins early Paytm backer SAIF
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Digbijay.Mishra@timesgroup.com

Bengaluru: Sonia Dhawan , who returned to Paytm in June last year after being accused of data theft and blackmail , has left the digital wallet company to work at venture capital firm SAIF Partners , people aware of the matter said.

She has joined the venture capital firm as adviser — corporate communications. She will be working on communications and marketing for SAIF’s portfolio companies, which include Paytm besides food delivery startup Swiggy , logistics venture Rivigo , and home services company UrbanClap .

SAIF Partners confirmed the development to TOI. Dhawan also confirmed to TOI that she joined SAIF earlier this year and that she left Paytm late last year. SAIF Partners has been an early backer of Paytm since 2007 and are currently holds about a 20% stake in the company.

After getting bail in the case of extortion of Paytm founder Vijay Shekhar Sharma last year, she had joined the Noida-based company’s gaming business unit — Paytm First Games — as its head of corporate communications and marketing. Though Sharma had filed the case in 2018, he had told The Economic Times that she might have been a pawn in someone else’s plan.

Dhawan was also allotted employee stock option plans (ESOPs) of Paytm in June. She is out on bail right now as the case continues in court.

Title: Airline staffer who refused wheelchair to flyer dismissed
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolkata: The SpiceJet staffer at the check-in counter who had refused a wheelchair to a woman with spine disorder has been dismissed by the carrier. The step followed an inquiry after a TOI reported on Wednesday.

The ground staffer at counter 15 had, on Tuesday morning, refused a wheelchair to Mamta Agarwala, who was travelling to Coimbatore for a spine operation. It was only when the airport director’s office stepped in that a senior airline official made the wheelchair available.

Following the TOI report on the incident, SpiceJet launched an investigation, speaking to the senior official who had resolved the issue, as well as other ground staffers working in adjacent counters that morning. The probe concluded that the staffer concerned was guilty of breach of the airline’s code of conduct.

“The incident was viewed very seriously and an inquiry was initiated. The said employee has been terminated. SpiceJet has a zero-tolerance policy towards such acts and takes the strictest possible action in case of any violation. Our code of conduct policy lays down guidelines for employees to follow and has to be strictly adhered to by all,” a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

Agarwala said she did not wish for the employee's dismissal and would have been happy if the woman had been told to be more sensitive.

Title: Man booked for stealing jewellery of dead accident victim
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Rajkot: A man was booked on Thursday night for stealing gold jewellery worth Rs 18 lakh from an accident victim in Vanthali police station of Junagadh district.

Police said the accused, identified as Sunil Solanki, had taken gold jewellery worn by Ishan Mir after he was killed along with four others as the SUV they were travelling in had overturned near Vanthali of Junagadh district on August 29 last year.

“Solanki has been booked on the complaint of Mir's father Saleem Mir. After the accident, when Solanki called up Saleem, he told him to take off the gold jewellery worn by Ishan. Later, when Saleem asked Solanki about the jewellery, he said he had kept it safely. However, when Solanki refused to hand him over the jewellery to him, he lodged the cheating complaint,” said N B Chauhan, sub-inspector with Vanthali police station.

Along with Mir (20), those killed in the accident included Ezaz Mir (25), Bhavik Makwana (20), Kunjan Aparnathi (20) and Payal Lathia (20). The SUV was over speeding and it had lost control and overturned while negotiating a turn.

Title: Morbi farmer shot at over land dispute
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Rajkot: A farmer was shot at by a man in a land dispute in Wankaner boundary of Morbi district on Thursday.

The land owned by Dhanji Rojasara was allegedly usurped by Veerji Bhagat, the priest of a temple. When Rojasara went to take measurement of his land, Bhagat ordered his men to attack him.

“Eleven people led by Bhagat, Bhagat’s son Dalsukh and Naran allegedly attacked Rojasara. Naran fired one round from his .12 bore gun at Rojasara. The bullet did not hit Rojasara as he ducked it. However, Rojasara suffered fracture in one of his legs after he was attacked with bats and iron pipes,” said R P Jadeja, sub-inspector with Wankaner taluka police station.

Meanwhile, the police have launched a manhunt for the accused.

Title: Higher education minister honours Army personnel in Dehradun
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

DEHRADUN: State higher education minister Dhan Singh Rawat honoured Army personnel in Dehradun on Friday at an event held at a city mall to commemorate Army Day which was on January 15.

Ten army personnel were felicitated during the event namely Brigadier CB Thapa (retired), Major Shakti Nandan Tripathi, Captain Sagar Chhetri (retired), Naib Subedar Avtar Singh, Havildar Jeetendra Kumar, Major Hosiyar Singh, Commandant Rajkumar Negi, Captain Tejpal (retired), Lieutenant Colonel Rajneesh Joshi and Major Aman Kumar.

Meanwhile, CM Trivendra Singh Rawat , who was scheduled to be at the event but couldn't attend it, joined the programme through video conferencing and thanked the soldiers for their services.

The CM said, “I would like to thank the organisers for conducting an event in which we are felicitating our brave soldiers. We can’t thank them enough for their selfless service. Due to them, our country is secure and peaceful.”

Title: Piramal sells health insight business to US firm for $950 million
Content:
Piramal Group chairman Ajay Piramal (File photo)

MUMBAI: Piramal Enterprises (PEL) is divesting its healthcare insights and analytics business — Decision Resources Group (DRG) — to US-based Clarivate Analytics for $950 million (around Rs 6,500 crore). PEL had invested $650 million in 2012 to acquire DRG , of which $260 million was infused as equity.Through the deal, the group has realized 2.3X its initial equity investment.PEL-DRG Dutch HoldCo BV, a 100% subsidiary of PEL and holding company for DRG, has signed a definitive agreement for the sale of the insights business to Clarivate, a global leader in providing analytics with revenues of over $5 billion. The transaction includes $900 million on closing, and $50 million to be received at the end of 12 months from the date of closing. It is subject to shareholder approval, and is expected to be completed by February-end.Piramal Group chairman Ajay Piramal told TOI, “The deal is in the best interest of shareholders, with good returns. At 5X the company’s sales of $190 million (March 2019), it was the right time we think, while creating 29% for our shareholders. This transaction demonstrates our continued commitment to create sustained long-term value for all stakeholders. Along with the ongoing equity capital-raise in PEL, this transaction not only further strengthens the company’s balance sheet, but also marks another step towards significantly unlocking value in future.”PEL, with revenues of over $1.9 billion, majorly contributed by financial services and pharmaceuticals, sold its domestic formulations business earlier in 2010 to Abbott at an attractive valuation of 9X its sales. Later in 2014, Piramal sold his 11% stake in Vodafone India, reaping a windfall of around 52% return in two years.Sales of Piramal Dutch IM Holdco BV (consolidated) — which includes financials of wholly owned subsidiaries PEL-DRG Dutch Holdco BV and DRG — for FY2019 were at Rs 1,331 crore. Net loss for the year stood at Rs 218 crore. The PEL scrip jumped over 5% on the BSE to Rs 1,627 by close of trade on Friday.“With this divestment, the rights issue (Rs 3,650 crore) and Rs 1,750 crore raised through the preferential allotment to Canadian institutional investor Caisse de dépôt et placement du Québec (CDPQ), we will have around Rs 12,000 crore — enough money on our books,” he added.DRG, the data, analytics and insights business of the group, specialises in enabling the world’s leading pharma, biotech and medical technology companies to achieve commercial success in complex health markets with the creation of effective patient-centric commercial strategies.With this acquisition, Clarivate will be well positioned in the $19-billion life sciences analytics market, which is enjoying double-digit growth, to support customers across the entire drug, device and medical technology lifecycle from research to outcome.Clarivate Analytics executive chairman and CEO Jerre Stead said, “This milestone acquisition, which doubles the size of our life sciences business, is accretive to our 2020 earnings and sets us up as an essential, end-to-end, industry-leading data and analytics provider in the highly attractive life sciences ecosystem.”

Title: Seamstress’ son clears CA final exam
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ganesh with his mother Alka Patil

SURAT: Since early childhood Ganesh saw his mother feed both of them and pay his fees too, from the meagre earnings she makes by sewing clothes. This was an everyday story for the last two decades after Ganesh’s father left the house one day when he was just five years old.

Today, all of 25 and ready to shoulder all household burden, Ganesh Patil , finally saw light at the end of tunnel as he cleared his CA final exam after six years of hard labour.

“We live in a 400 sq ft room in Dindoli’s Om Nagar. I have been seeing my mother, Alka Patil , toil very hard to raise me in all these years,” says Ganesh, who got success in his second attempt.

“I want to start CA practice as soon as possible. I want to replicate what others have done to me. I too want to help other poor aspirants like me fulfil their dreams,” he asserted.

Title: Diamond worker, merchant commit suicide in Surat
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A young diamond polisher ended his life by jumping into Tapi River from Utran bridge while in another incident, a diamond merchant committed suicide by consuming poison in the city.

Ajay Antala, 20, hailing from Moldi village in Savarkundla taluka of Amreli district, had joined a diamond factory in Varachha as a trainee diamond polisher eight months ago. Ajay, who was pursuing third year BCom in Amreli, was living with his cousin brother, Prakash Antala, at Varachha’s Yogi Chowk.

On January 15, Ajay left house early in the morning. In the evening, he called up his cousin brother to inform him that he was staying back in the factory for night duty. On the next day, Ajay sent a message on the mobile of his real brother Vishal Antala living in Varachha stating, ‘He is leaving this world’ at about 6.30am.

DK Bharwad, police sub-inspector at Kapodara police station, said, “Vishal saw the text message at about 7am. He immediately called up Prakash with whom his brother was living, but he was not there. However, he searched for his brother and found his motorcycle parked on Utran bridge. He informed police and fire brigade and the youth’s body was recovered from the river.”

Bharwad added, “The deceased was suffering from headache for a long time and taking medicines too. He was not using social media platform and had no love affair. We are investigating the case.”

When contacted Ajay’s brother Vishal Antala said, “We are shocked why he took such an extreme step. There was no financial issue as he was learning diamond polishing work. I am also working as diamond polisher for the last four years.”

In the second incident, Narayan Kakadia, 54, a diamond merchant operating in Mahidhapura diamond market, committed suicide by consuming poison on Thursday. Narayan, a resident of Sarthana, was shifted to SMIMER hospital where he died during treatment.

PR Chaudhary, police inspector of Sarthana police station, said, “We are yet to find out the exact reason behind his death, was it financial crisis or something else. The diamond merchant is survived by two sons and wife and was not suffering from any illness. We have registered a case of suicide and begun investigation.”

Title: 1 kg smack seized in Jodhpur, 6 held
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

In a major drug haul, Jodhpur police seized one kg smack and arrested six persons including two carriers from Pratapgarh district. On the basis of preliminary interrogation, police have identified the main supplier of the contraband and hunt for him is on. The two carriers, who had reached Jodhpur on Friday, have been identified as Naru Meena and Mahendra Meena from Pratpapgarh and were picked up by a special team while handing over the consignment.

Title: Rajasthan: 75% turnout for phase 1 panchayat polls
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Voters line up outside a polling booth at Boraj gram panchayat in Maujamabad panchayat samiti on Friday.

JAIPUR: Nearly 75% polling took place till the end of voting across 31 districts in the first phase of panchayat elections in the state on Friday. In Jaipur, till the end of voting, 83.65% voting took place in Aamer panchayat samiti, 86.90% was recorded in Jalsu and 85.90% was registered in Maujamabad.

In Bhilwara, an assistant polling officer, Ratan Lal Bunkar, who was on duty at the Lakshmi Kheda polling station in Bijolia died of heart attack on Friday morning. Bunkar, a native of Jaipur district, was working as a Grade III teacher at Gega Kheda government higher secondary school of Kotdi panchayat samiti in Bhilwara.

State Election Commissioner P S Mehra said, “It is estimated that the turnout in the state will be around 75%. We are yet to receive data from 13 districts. No major violence was reported from anywhere.”

District collector and election officer (DEO) Rajendra Bhatt condoled the death of the polling official and immediately provided a financial assistance of Rs 20 lakh to the kin of the deceased person. The sanctioned amount was directly transferred to the account of the deceased's wife Leela Devi. District collector reached the hospital in Bijolia and handed over a letter of condolence and financial assistance acceptance letter to Bunkar's elder brother Jasram.

After post mortem, the deceased's body was handed over to the family. Over 93 lakh voters decided the fate of 17,242 candidates for the post of sarpanch and 42,704 candidates for the post of ward panch in the first phase of panchayat elections. Even as the elections were largely peaceful across the state, stray incidents of violence, stone pelting and minor scuffle were reported from some districts. Meanwhile, at state control room in Jaipur, many calls that came were queries about when the polls to remaining gram panchayats, affected by delimitation, will be conducted. In the first phase, polls were held to 2726 gram panchayats under 87 panchayat samitis.

Title: China’s Great Wall to buy GM’s plant at Talegaon
Content:
Employees work on an assembly line at the General Motors plant in Talegaon. (File photo: Reuters)

CHENNAI: Chinese automobile major Great Wall Motors (GWM) will acquire the Talegaon manufacturing facility of General Motors (GM). The factory will be used by GWM for an Indian debut. GWM VP (global strategy) Liu Xiangshang said the transaction would underpin the company’s plan to enter and invest in India. “The Indian market has great potential, rapid economic growth and a good investment environment. Entering the Indian market is an important step for GWM’s global strategy,” said Liu.A company statement said, “Under a binding term sheet, the GM India legal entity, which includes the Talegaon facility, will transfer to GWM. GWM will officially debut its Haval brand and GWM EV at the Delhi International Auto Show, and launch its Indian market plan.”GM India’s other Indian plant at Halol has been taken over by MG Motor India, which is owned by another Chinese major — SAIC. “Since focusing the Talegaon plant on manufacturing for export markets in 2017, GM has been exploring strategic options for better utilisation of the site. Our decision to cease production at Talegaon is based on GM’s global strategy and optimisation of our manufacturing footprint around the world,” said GM senior VP (international operations) Julian Blissett.Going forward, GM, he added, will “work closely with the state and national governments to secure the required approvals so that GWM can elevate production at the plant even further and maintain Talegaon’s status as a vibrant vehicle manufacturing region”.GM will provide a separation package and transition support for impacted employees, as well as an orderly transition for partners. The transaction is expected to close in the second half of 2020. However, Chevrolet, he added, will continue to honour all warranties and provide aftersales support, including ongoing service and parts requirements for existing customers in India.

Title: MUHS VC visits GMCs under anti-ragging project
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Under the pilot project of Maharashtra University of Health Sciences (MUHS) to improve its anti-ragging policy, a committee headed by MUHS vice-chancellor Dr Dileep Mhaisekar on Friday visited Government Medical College Hospital (GMCH) and Indira Gandhi Government Medical College and Hospital (IGGMCH).

The team interacted with students and staff separately to take feedback on anti-ragging initiatives in these colleges.

The team is on a tour of all government and private medical colleges to collect ragging and discrimination-related data. The tour will be over by February 10 after which the team will present a comprehensive report in March.

“This information will be submitted to the government as well as to the Medical Council of India. It will be an important documentation while revising the anti-ragging policies in medical colleges,” Dr Mhaisekar said.

The VC informed that he met undergraduate, postgraduate students and staff members separately. He also interacted with the deans and in-charges of anti-ragging cells.

IGGMCH dean Dr Ajay Keoliya said that the visit was an important step towards updating anti-ragging policies. “Both UG and PG students gave their feedback directly to the VC. We are working towards achieving the goal of zero-ragging incidents in medical colleges,” he said.

GMCH dean Dr Sajal Mitra said that meetings were held in a positive atmosphere. “The committee members interacted with UG students and junior doctors independently without any pressure of seniors or staff. Anti-ragging cell in GMCH is functioning effectively,” he said.

MUHS formed this committee headed by VC especially after the suicide of Dr Payal Tadvi, a junior doctor in Mumbai, in May 2019. Tadvi committed suicide allegedly due to caste-based discrimination by her seniors.

Title: ‘Future homes will be designed around tech’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The model interiors on display at ABID, the interior fair at Science City.

KOLKATA: Home design is undergoing a metamorphosis from a demand for maximum space utilisation to appreciation of minimalist decor. In the years ahead, interior designers and architects foresee trends being driven by connected homes.

“Modular is the way ahead. Young customers do not like permanence. They are constantly changing jobs and shifting cities. Hence, they want furniture that can be easily assembled and dismantled. Homes in future will be driven by technology and everything else — furniture and furnishing — will have to fit into the design trends that the tech devices set,” felt interior architect Indranil Dey.

Other designers, too, feel devices will dictate the next change in the industry. While TV serials had ushered in bright colours, tech devices are usually white, black or grey and may usher in a preference for muted shades in future.

Another preference shift is in favour of trendy interiors that last only a few years from durable interi-ors that survive decades. “People now want to change the look every five years. They want excitement in life,” said interior designer Ritu Duggal.

While frequent makeovers mean more business, there are many challenges that designers have to confront now. If TV serials had introduced the masses to the world of interiors a )decade-and-a-half ago, frequent trips abroad and internet on cellphone have increased their exposure — so much so that designers say their creating instincts are being stifled by customers who hire them but believe they now know everything about the trade.

“The interior market has exploded. In the past 15 years, business has increased five times. If there were 350-400 designers in Kolkata earlier, now there are more than 2,000 in business. But only one in five customers actually gives designers the creative freedom. Most of them dictate what they want, and it is either something they have seen on a trip abroad or on the internet. We are becoming copy cats,” rued veteran interior professional Ajit Kumar Jain.

Speaking to TOI, many designers said they felt demotivated by clients’ demands to simply copy others’ ideas. “Interiors of a house should reflect the personality of people who live in it. The process of designing the interiors is a collaborative one, with us getting to know the clients and their requirements, designing the home, consulting the client, factoring in changes and then executing it. But when customers believe they know everything and dictate everything, one is left wondering what our role is,” said designer Abhijit Saha.

Title: Surat: Newborn tied with manja found dumped in dustbin
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Two paramedics who saved the newborn girl

SURAT: A newborn girl , abandoned in a dustbin near the EWS housing society at Panas in the city was rescued by two paramedics of 108 emergency services. The infant was found wrapped in clothes with glass-coated kite flying string entangled around her body.

Emergency Medical Technician (EMT), Narendra Parmar and his colleague Ankit Parekh had rushed to the EWS housing society at Panas after they received a distress call from one of the residents about the infant in the dustbin at about 8.32 am on Friday.

Talking to TOI, Parmar said, “The infant was dumped just an hour after she was born. The baby girl was wrapped in four to five clothes with the kite string. The glass-coated kite string was tied in such a manner that it almost cut into her soft skin around her neck and we could see blood oozing from the wounds.”

According to Parmar, the infant was breathless and unable to move as she was wrapped very tightly in the clothes. The girl was taken out from the dustbin and the sharp thread had to be cut very carefully without damaging the girl’s body. any farther. The baby was later brought inside the ambulance and cleaned up. As her skin was getting pink she had to be kept under halogen lamp to keep her warm.

Parekh said, “This is first time in my many years of working with the 108 that I have seen such a condition of a newborn child. We were aghast to see kite string being used to tie the infant.”

“The girl’s condition improved after being given halogen light, fluids and suction. We immediately contacted our head in the 108 and decided to transfer the girl in the New Civil Hospital,” said Parmar. Iqbal Kadiwala, head of the nursing department of NCH said, “The infant girl weighs 2.2 kg and was doing fine. She has been kept in the critical care section of the hospital and is being looked after well by the staff.”

Title: Voda Idea stock sinks on AGR order
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

(File photo)

MUMBAI: The stock price of Vodafone Idea , which is expected to be hit the hardest by Supreme Court ’s rejection of a review petition relating to AGR dues to the government, lost more that a quarter of its value on Friday, while RIL , which runs Jio and is expected to gain the most due to lower competition, rallied over 3%.

Bharti Airtel, which is also expected to be hit by the AGR verdict but is in a better financial position, also rallied on Friday with the sensex scaling a new high at above the 42K mark.

On Friday on the BSE , the Vodafone Idea stock dipped nearly 40% in early trade on the back of the AGR order of Thursday evening, but closed 25.2% lower at Rs 4.5. A report by SBI Caps Securities said that after Thursday’s order on AGR, there’s a likelihood of Vodafone Idea shutting shop, unless the government agrees to a staggered payment of AGR dues, totalling about Rs 53,000 crore on it alone.

Bharti Airtel, on the other hand, will have to pay about Rs 35,600 crore. The report also said that if Vodafone Idea shuts shop, Bharti Airtel and Reliance Jio together will need to spend about Rs 1 lakh crore to acquire the customers of Vodafone Idea.

In Friday’s market, while Vodafone Idea tanked, RIL rallied 3% and closed 2.8% higher at Rs 1,581. Bharti Airtel, which recently went for an institutional placement of shares to meet AGR dues, rallied over nearly 6% and closed with a 5.5% gain at Rs 500.

Title: Hyderabad: Underpass in Uppuguda gets a creative makeover
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Walls of a road leading to Uppuguda underpass in Old City

HYDERABAD: The underpass in Uppuguda, under GHMC’s Charminar zone , will become operational in February. The project has been pending for four years, primarily due to issues related to land acquisition and shifting of utilities.

One of the main features of the project is transformation of side walls. Artists have painted city monuments such as Charminar and Golconda Fort. Alongside, paintings of agricultural sector with ox-drawn ploughs and farmers can also be found. Part of underpass has been painted in blue, with stars and the sky as the theme.

The underpass, being built at an estimated cost of Rs 9 crore, is 7.5 metres wide and 310 metres long. Approach roads are also being laid. “Once the underpass becomes functional, it will ease traffic woes at Uppuguda main road,” said Sohaib Ahmed, a commuter.

Another commuter said that because the project was taking so long, the underpass turned into hub of anti-social activity. “Illegal activities such as drinking, people coming in groups and whiling away time on the dark roads was common,” said the commuter.

Title: VMC launches new system for recycling, waste mgmt
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Varanasi: The Varanasi Municipal Corporation launched Material Recovery Facility (MRF) in Public-Private Partnerships mode at Bhawania Pokhri, Belupur on Friday.

The facility has been started in partnership with Tetra Pak, Deutsche Gesellschaft für International Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) and The Energy and Resources Institute (TERI) as a part of Development and Management of Nationally Appropriate Mitigation Actions (NAMAs) in India to increase collection of recyclable waste and help strengthen waste management in the city.

The NAMA project is funded by the Federal Ministry of the Environment, Nature Conservation and Nuclear Safety (BMU), Germany. The ministry of environment, forest and climate change (MoEFCC) is the nodal ministry for the NAMA project.

The new MRF will function as a waste sorting centre where plastic, mixed-waste paper, paper-based cartons will be separated and baled. While the MRF will focus on dry waste, the location of the MRF has been chosen strategically as the compound also hosts a VMC bio gas plant to process the wet waste collected and turn it into electricity, making it a truly zero-waste site.

Municipal commissioner Gaurang Rathi said this decentralized MSW management model is ideal for replicating in other parts of Varanasi and other cities.

The event was also attended by vice president Sustainability, Tetra Pak Asia Pacific Jaideep Gokhale, director-Climate Change, GIZ India, Ashish Chaturvedi, and director, Environment & Waste Management, TERI, Dr Suneel Pandey.

Title: Maintain values of Constitution: Parekh
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

TNN

Mumbai: HDFC chairman Deepak Parekh has called for maintaining values of the Indian Constitution , stating that “while times and circumstances change, strong values and principles do not”.

The veteran banker recalled the words of late jurist Nani Palkhivala who said that the Constitution should not be subject to “hasty and ill-conceived” changes.

Parekh was delivering the vote of thanks at the 17th Nani Palkhivala memorial lecture . Earlier, in his address, Tata Sons chairman Chandrasekaran spoke of “suspicion and micro-management” as the impediments faced by businesses in India.

Parekh pointed out that this was Palkhivala’s birth centenary and his memories stayed because of values and beliefs. Quoting Palkhivala, Parekh said, “Our Constitution is primarily shaped and moulded for the common man.” “The great makers of our Constitution clearly intended that the integrity of the Constitution should be preserved against any hasty or ill-considered changes,” said Parekh. Palkhivala, who passed away in 2002, was a staunch defender of the Constitution and had argued in several cases of constitutional importance.

Pointing out that the quotes were 50-year-old, Parekh said, “The inferences are for you to interpret, but to my mind, it still seems starkly relevant in these present times,” he said.

Parekh highlighted another quote from Palkhivala: “With the growing powers of government all over the world, it is eminently desirable for any democracy to have fundamental rights which cannot be curtailed or abrogated.” He said that while we should hold on to the learning that Palkhivala left behind, it is important not to be consumed by “pessimism and doom-mongering”. “I am an optimist. I am confident about the future of India and that our youth will see India’s best days,” said Parekh.

Title: Temperature dips below 20C again
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Panaji: For only the second time during this season, the mercury dropped below 20C, as India meteorological department ( IMD ), Goa, recorded 18.3C on Friday morning - the lowest reading of minimum temperature of the season.

On January 5, the mercury had dipped to 18.3C after dropping below 20C for the first time this season. But the mild chill didn’t last long the wind changing its direction. December, the peak month of winter, in 2019 ended as the warmest during the last five decades, as not even once the mercury dropped below 21C.

On New Year’s day, for the first time this season, IMD, Goa recorded a minimum temperature below 21C at 20.4C.

During the last few days, after hovering around 21C, the minimum temperature came down to 19.8C, 1.4 below normal, on Thursday from 21.1C on Wednesday.

“This is due to northeasterly winds, but after two days, the mercury will rise again,” Krishnamurty Padgalwar, director, IMD, Goa said.

The northeasterly winds bring in the chill from the north, but on Monday, the wind direction is likely to change to easterly. “The minimum temperature may go down by half a degree or remain constant, but will rise after third day,” Padgalwar said.

The maximum temperatures have been below normal during the last few days. IMD, Goa recorded 31.3C, one degree less than normal on Wednesday and 30.8C, 1.6 below normal on Thursday.

Title: Rel Jio’s ARPU drops by 1.2% to Rs 128.4
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

TNN

Mumbai: Reliance Jio ’s average revenue per unit (ARPU), a key performance metric, stood at Rs 128.4 in the December quarter of fiscal 2020. It is down 1.2% when compared to the Rs 130 ARPU reported a year ago, and up 7% when compared to the Rs 120 ARPU reported in the previous September quarter of fiscal 2020.

ARPU is the total revenue of the telecom operator divided by the number of users on its network. Jio, which was launched in 2016, has 370 million subscribers, making it the world’s second-largest single country operator.

The 7% quarter-on-quarter rise is on the back of Jio ending free voice calls on its network and charging subscribers for the services. RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani said Jio is focused on giving unmatched digital experience to consumers at most affordable price and accordingly expanding network capacity and coverage to keep pace with demand.

Title: SGST unearths Rs6.56 crore ITC scam of seven firms in city
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Surat: State Goods and Services Tax (SGST) department raided seven export units and unearthed input tax credit (ITC) fraud of Rs6.56 crore by them by showing fake supplies of goods in the city on Friday.

Official sources said the raids were conducted at 18 locations which included Begumpura, Magob, Sagrampura and Golvala Jakatnaka and huge amount of documents were recovered from the seven export firms. The scrutiny of the documents revealed that the firms had fraudulently claimed Integrated Goods and Services Tax (IGST) from the government by showing fake supplies to the tune of Rs64 crore.

During investigation, it was found that these export firms availed fraudulent ITC for seeking IGST refund from customs formations. The exporters used to show entries of non-existent bogus firms with fake addresses, which had taken GST registration based on forged documents without paying GST.

The department has recovered about Rs2.5 crore from the seven export firms so far.

Title: Bihar: Centre trying to divide society, says Tejashwi Yadav
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Tejashwi Prasad Yadav

PATNA: The Centre is trying to divide the country and create communal strife in the society, said leader of opposition in Bihar assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav on the second day of his ‘Pratirodh Sabha’ in Araria on Friday.

Tejashwi, who is on a tour of Seemanchal area against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), NRC and NPR, said Union home minister Amit Shah visited Bihar to create hatred but he does not know that people of this state are intelligent enough and will not be trapped by him. “It is the same Bihar which has once stopped Advani Ji’s Rath Yatra and now people will teach them the lesson in 2020,” he said and asked chief minister Nitish Kumar to stop NPR in Bihar, if he was against NRC.

“I will salute my sisters, even those sitting at Shaheen Bagh in Delhi and other parts of the country, for coming on roads to protect the Constitution. We all will win this fight and the dictators will have to step back,” he added.

On Saturday, Tejashwi will address another rally at Katihar.

Meanwhile, RJD supremo Lalu Prasad and his wife Rabri Devi took to Twitter on Friday to lash out the NDA government. Rabri tweeted in Bhojpuri and said the price of all the commodities had increased five times and common man had no money to eat, but the government was hatching a conspiracy to snatch the citizenship of the poor.

Lalu targeted Nitish and his human chain programme and said crores of rupees were being spent uselessly just for photo session and children, women and elderly were being forced to come on the road in winter.

Title: Kolkata: Park Circus protesters get bio-toilets, running water
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Civic officials have installed four bio-toilets and stationed two water tankers inside Park Circus Maidan.

KOLKATA: Women protesting against CAA and NRC at Park Circus Maidan got some relief on Friday with the KMC providing them with bio-toilets and making arrangements for running water at the venue.

More than 250 women — with their children in tow — have been camping at Park Circus Maidan since January 7 to protest against CAA and NRC. The peaceful protest has also been referred to as Kolkata’s Shaheen Bag, referring to the venue at the Capital where thousands of women have been protesting since December 15.

Civic officials have installed four bio-toilets and stationed two water tankers inside Park Circus Maidan after they received criticism for ignoring the plight of women protesting there. The women were spending nights under the sky in the biting cold and had just one washroom at a nearby mosque that they could use. They also didn’t have permission to use microphones.

The protesters, however, had turned down the offer by the civic body to set up a tent and said they would do it themselves. At present, two small temporary sheds have been set up where the women are sleeping at night.

“It has come as a huge relief. Many women were unwilling to participate due to the absence of toilets and running water. We are thankful to the authorities for looking into our demands,” said Tarannum Khan, one of the protesters.

“Absence of basic amenities were hampering our movement against CAA and NRC. Women have been forced to step out of their homes because our existence has been threatened and fundamental rights are in danger,” said Ansari Begum, a homemaker from Topsia who has been a part of the protests for the past 10 days. “More than 70 women stay here at night. It is cold and we were not allowed to put up tents. But we are thankful the government has finally decided to accept our request,” she said.

Several halogen and LED lights have also been put up to illuminate the venue. The KMC has also assured protesters that conservancy staffers will regularly visit the venue to clean the place. Two ambulances have also been parked near the protest venue in case of emergencies.

“We have tried to provide whatever the protesters requested. In future, too, we will help them,” said local councillor Manzar Iqbal.

The protesting women have also decided to send 2,500 postcards to the Chief Justice of India requesting the SC to deliver a fair judgment when the case comes up for hearing. “We are not budging till the government rolls back CAA,” said Ladli Khatoon, another homemaker at the protest.

Title: Bihar: Dalai Lama holds special prayer
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar with Dalai Lama in Patna

PATNA/GAYA: Buddhist spiritual leader the Dalai Lama on Friday held a special prayer at CM Nitish Kumar ’s official residence here for peace, happiness and prosperity in the state, country and the world as well.

The CM also participated in the special prayer. Patna-based Buddha Smriti Park’s priest Revta Bhikhu Bhante assisted the Dalai Lama in the special prayer near the small Bodhi tree, which was planted there on November 18, 2011. Prominent persons who were present during the prayer included Bihar assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Choudhary, state legislative council’s acting chairman Haroon Rashid, Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi , building construction minister Ashok Choudhary, JD(U) MLC Sanjay Kumar Singh alias Gandhi Ji and state’s chief secretary Deepak Kumar.

Earlier, Nitish accorded warm welcome to the exiled Tibetan leader and presented him a bouquet, traditional ‘angavastram’ and an idol of Lord Buddha. The Dalai Lama gave his blessings to the CM by presenting him a memento and ‘Khada’, a traditional ceremonial scarf used in Tibet.

The Dalai Lama reached here from Bodh Gaya after his three weeks’ sojourn. He left Bodh Gaya by a special plane to the state capital where he will stay for two days before leaving for Dharamshala in Himachal Pradesh. He had come to Bodh Gaya on December 24, 2019. in the forenoon.

Title: United political opposition need of hour: JNU professor
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The event at Jadavpur University.

KOLKATA: “There is a big struggle between the forces of democracy and fascism , where the situation in the country is that of civil war where only one side is armed,” said Prabhat Patnaik, emeritus professor of JNU, at a programme at Jadavpur University on Friday.

“All the pillars of democracy have been reduced to rubber stamps to weed out dissent. Universities across the country are under attack by those aligned to the right-wing ideology because they are leading the fight against fascism,” the economist and political commentator said, adding, “A united political opposition is the need of the hour.”

“The government has money for NPR, CAA and NRC, but they don’t have money to finance higher education. They are taking education cess from the public, but doing away with the grants. They are trying to divert the attention of people from the real issues,” said Aligarh Muslim University student leader Isteaque Ahmed .

The programme, which was organised by the SFI unit of JU , had several other speakers, like Presidency University professor Zaad Mahmood and film-maker Kamaleswar Mukherjee.

Title: Will create 1m fresh jobs by 2025: Amazon
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Elite club: Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos with industry leaders on Friday

Bengaluru: E-commerce giant Amazon on Friday said it will create a million — or 10 lakh — new jobs by 2025. The announcement comes a day after commerce and industry minister Piyush Goyal played down on Thursday the Seattle-based company’s $1-billion investment in India as “not doing a favour (to the country)”.

Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos on Wednesday had said he will invest $1 billion to digitise small and medium businesses and export ‘Make in India’ goods worth $10 billion to the e-tailer’s global markets by 2025. Amazon said it has created 7,00,000 jobs in India already, directly and indirectly, over the last six years and the total jobs created by the local arm would stand at 1.7 million by 2025. These jobs — both directly and indirectly — will be across industries like information technology, skill development, content creation, retail, logistics and manufacturing, the company said in a statement. The direct jobs created by Amazon in India stand at over 60,000. “We’ve seen huge contributions from our employees, extraordinary creativity from the small businesses we’ve partnered with, and great enthusiasm from the customers who shop with us — and we’re excited about what lies ahead,” said Bezos, the world’s richest man with a net worth of $115 billion.

His comments are of significance amid Amazon’s tension with government officials, who have been reluctant to meet Bezos, unlike his last visit in 2014 when he met PM Narendra Modi as well. To add to that, just before his arrival in India, the Competition Commission of India ( CCI ) opened an investigation against Amazon and Walmart-owned Flipkart over issues like deep discounting, favourable terms to select sellers. Goyal’s comments on Thursday made the strain in the relationship evident.

A TOI analysis of direct jobs on Amazon’s global jobs portal showed there has been a rise of almost 75% in India at 2,235 openings currently compared to 1,236 a year ago. These numbers of openings — the highest compared to other markets in Asia-Pacific — are across Amazon arms like e-commerce, payments and cloud. Amazon said its job creation is aligned with the Indian government policy that has prioritised this and skilling initiatives — including the training of more than 400 million people by 2022 — in rural and urban areas.

In his letter on the Amazon India platform, Bezos said he is adding 10,000 e-rickshaws in Amazon’s delivery fleet and that it will eliminate single-use plastic from its fulfilment network by June. “The boundless energy, innovation, and grit of the Indian people always inspire me,” he added in the letter. On Friday, Bezos also met senior business leaders in Mumbai including Reliance Industries’ Mukesh Ambani , Airtel’s Sunil Mittal , and Future Group’s Kishore Biyani .

Title: With 19 billion in 2019, India No.2 in app downloads
Content:
(Representative image)

CHENNAI: India is the second-largest market worldwide for app downloads as the mobile-first country registered the strongest three-year growth among the top five app economies as per analytics firm AppAnnie’s recent report.At 19 billion, app downloads in India in 2019 grew a whopping 195% from 2016 compared to a worldwide growth of 45%.Download growth in mature markets like the US was just 5% during the period, while China saw 80% growth.Globally, consumers downloaded record 204 billion apps during the year, shows AppAnnie’s annual flagship report State of Mobile. The average Indian mobile user spent 3.5 hours per day on mobile in 2019 — just slightly below the global average of 3.7 hours — but representing a growth of 30% year-on-year compared to global growth of 10%, data from AppAnnie showed.However, at $370 million, India contributed to just 0.3% of the total worldwide consumer spending on mobile apps at $120 billion in 2019 with China making up almost 40% of the spends.“As with most emerging markets consumer spend in India lags behind more mature mobile markets, however with increased consumer and business focus on mobile we expect to see this consumer spend grow in the coming years,” a spokesperson for AppAnnie told TOI, noting a 185% increase in app spends by Indian users from the year 2016.Subscriptions contribute to almost 95% of spends, with three out of four top non-gaming apps monetizing via subscriptions. Video and dating apps propelling spend as Tinder, Netflix and Tencent Video topped spends chart globally, the report said.Tez (Google Pay) in finance, Amazon in shopping, and MX Player for video streaming, and TikTok among social apps, are a few of India’s “breakout apps” in 2019, as per AppAnnie. The research firm defines breakout apps as those that registered maximum year-on-year growth in the respective metrics used in the category. Spending 750 million hours on TikTok in 2019, time spent by Indian users on the short-videos app grew 240% year-on-year.Among gaming apps, PUBG Mobile registered highest consumer spend in India, and the app Carrom Pool was top in terms of downloads. Further, across categories, India also ranked in top three markets when it comes to time period for which users interact with the app (sessions) and average usage levels.In a sign of increased proliferation of digital payments, Indian consumers accessed finance apps 129 billion times, with sessions count doubling from 66 billion in 2018. Similarly, monthly average usage for fintech apps grew 63% year-on-year in India compared to a 22% global growth, data showed.Food and drink apps emerged as another Indian favourite, with user sessions on such apps rising at 182% from 2018 compared to worldwide growth of 106%.Time spent by users on shopping apps grew the highest among markets analysed in Indonesia at 70%, compared to India’s 51% growth (at 4 billion hours) and a worldwide growth rate of 34%.

Title: Customs dept waives off bank guarantee for Surat Hira Bourse
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Surat: Diamantaires in Surat are a relieved lot after the customs department of Ahmedabad waived off bank guarantee for Surat Hira Bourse (SHB). This means that exporters in Surat would no longer have to depend on Mumbai to export polished diamonds and jewellery.

The total export of polished diamond from India is pegged at Rs 1.50 lakh crore per annum. Majority of the exports is handled by BDB at Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) in Mumbai. The diamantaires send the diamond parcels to Mumbai for the direct export to various parts of the world.

SHB, operated by the Diamond and Gem Development Corporation (DGDC) at Katargam, had to provide bank guarantee under the electronic data interchange (EDI) system for export of high-value valuable parcels.

As a custodian, SHB was unable to pay bank guarantee for goods above Rs 100 crore. This complelled Surat exporters to send their consignments from the Bharat Diamond Bourse (BDB) in Mumbai without bank guarantee.

CEO of SHB, KK Sharma told TOI, “De-linking of bank guarantee from EDI has opened the doors for the SHB to carry out export of polished diamonds of any amount. Earlier, we had to keep certain amount reserved in the EDI for carrying out exports from Surat. In case of big export consignment of over Rs 200 crore, we were unable to process the same and that the exporters were forced to do it from Mumbai.”

According to Sharma, the annual export of polished diamonds from SHB is pegged at Rs 25,000 crore. After the delinking of bank guarantee, the export will double up in the next one year. Exporters from Surat will not have to send their parcels to Mumbai, bearing extra cost of shipment and insurance.

Atul Mehta, owner of Facet Virtue, a diamond exporter said, “Our parcels are high in value and we were facing lot of problems exporting them from SHB due to bank guarantee issue. As the problem has been resolved, we are all prepared to ship all our consignment from SHB. This will save us hugely on the transportation cost of the diamonds and other costs including agents.”

Girish Patel, chief accountant of KARP Impex, told TOI, “The parcels were held up for days due to the bank guarantee issue at SHB. Thus, we preferred to export our parcels from Mumbai. As now the bank guarantee has been waived off, we have an opportunity to use the SHB facility by exporting goods of any value.”

For Graphics

Adding to the glitter

Annual export of polished diamonds from India: Rs 1.50 lakh crore

Total export of polished diamonds from SHB: Rs 25,000 crore

Till now, SHB had to provide 1% bank guarantee on the total value of exports

After waiver, SHB aims for Rs 50,000 crore export in next one year

PIC QUOTES

“The bank guarantee waiver will allow Surat diamantaires to export diamonds of any value, which was earlier impossible. We feel that the exports is going to double up from Surat in the next one year.

KK Sharma, CEO, SHB

“When you have export facility at home, there is no question of going to Mumbai and spending extra money to export your goods. SHB is the most convenient option for the entire industry after the bank guarantee has been waived off.

Kirti Shah, diamond exporter

Title: Mahindra First Choice Wheels acquires Fifth Gear Ventures for Rs 31 crore
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Chennai: Mahindra & Mahindra’s used car business Mahindra First Choice Wheels (MFCW) will acquire up to 100% stake in Delhi-based e-commerce company Fifth Gear Ventures (FGV) for Rs 30.5 crore.

The transaction, said the company in a stock market filing on Friday, will be done in one or more tranches by way of cash and issue of shares of MFCW. Fifth Gear Ventures runs the website www.carandbike.com, an e-commerce market platform for old and new vehicles. The acquisition will be completed by March 31, 2020.

“MFCW is acquiring FGV with the objective of expanding its presence in the digital automotive space and seamlessly integrating the online and offline user experience,” said the company in a stock market filing.

The transaction will include upto Rs 16.44 crore to be discharged by cash and upto Rs 14.01 crore to be discharged through issue of equity shares of MFCW aggregating approximately 0.75% of MFCW's fully diluted share capital.

Title: AGR toll: Franklin Templeton writes off Voda Idea debt
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

TNN

Mumbai: The Supreme Court ’s order on a review petition by telecom companies on AGR dues that went against Vodafone Idea and Bharti Airtel took its first toll in the mutual fund (MF) industry as Franklin Templeton MF wrote off its entire Rs 2,050-crore investments in Vodafone Idea’s debt papers.

According to sources, UTI MF , which had about Rs 560 crore invested in the struggling telecom company’s debt, is expected decide on its investments in Vodafone Idea soon. Mutual fund houses that also include Aditya Birla MF and Nippon India MF, had a total exposure of about Rs 3,400 crore in Vodafone Idea’s debt, industry data for month ended December 2019 showed. Aditya Birla MF had an exposure of about Rs 500 crore, while Nippon India MF had Rs 225 crore (see graphic).

In a communication, Franklin Templeton MF said Vodafone Idea’s securities held in its various fixed income schemes are still rated at investment grade, which currently limits the options available to the fund house. “Clarity may take some time to emerge even if the company takes recourse to a curative petition or other measures available to it. As a prudent measure, and in order to protect value for existing unit holders in these schemes…securities of Vodafone Idea held in various fixed income schemes of Franklin Templeton have been marked down to zero. The valuation adjustment only reflects the realizable price of the relevant securities on the date of valuation and does not indicate any reduction or write-off of the amount repayable by (the company),” it said.

Industry experts said other fund houses are also expected to write off their investments in Vodafone Idea, fully or partially.

Title: Locust terror revisits 3 villages in north Gujarat
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

A pic of fresh ‘intruders’

Palanpur: Despite the intensified war against locusts , three villages in north Gujarat including Mavsari , Radhanaseda and Kundaliya were under fresh attack by swarms of the insect that spread across 5,000 hectare of agriculture land on Friday evening.

According to the sarpanch of Mavsari, Prakash Vyas, swarms of locusts that had been sighted in the border area have spread in about 5km radius area and settled in the fields and desert areas. “The renewed attack of the insect have made farmers really worried. I have immediately informed the agriculture department,” Vyas told TOI.

Deputy director of agriculture department, Banaskantha, has reached Mavsari village. Talking to TOI, the official said: “I was camping in Tharad and therefore managed to reach the affected village within an hour. We have set up control room and action is being initiated on war footing. However, we will have to wait till morning when anti-locust pesticide can be sprayed in the affected areas.

Assistant director, pest control, Palanpur division, KL Meena, too has reached the spot along with his team.

Title: 10 stolen vehicles worth Rs12.10L recovered
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020
