Nashik: Police have detected five vehicle theft cases in the past fortnight from which they recovered 10 vehicles worth Rs 12.10 lakh. As many as nine people have been arrested for their alleged involvement in the vehicle thefts.

A senior police officer said vehicle thefts have become a menace in the city with over 400 vehicles getting stolen every year. On this backdrop, the crime branch had started focusing on vehicle theft cases from the beginning of this year. Among the vehicles recovered were two cars worth Rs 10 lakh.

The central crime branch detected a case of car theft that was registered in Goa last year. “We have arrested two people in this case. The central crime unit arrested four more suspects in connection to another car theft registered with Nashik Road police and recovered the vehicle worth Rs 5 lakh,” a police officer said.

Further, the crime branch unit 2 police arrested a man and recovered a bike worth Rs 35,000 in a case registered with Songad police, Gujarat in 2018. Another theft case registered with Mhasrool police, where a bike worth Rs 95,000 was stolen, was also recovered.

Three more bikes worth Rs 1.60 lakh were recovered by the crime branch unit 1 after arresting a burglar in connection with a vehicle theft case registered with the Nashik Road police last year.

“Last year till December 29, we had registered 480 cases of vehicle thefts in different police stations of which 101 have been detected,” the officer said.

Title: China’s Great Wall to buy GM’s plant at Talegaon
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Employees work on an assembly line at the General Motors plant in Talegaon. (File photo: Reuters)

CHENNAI: Chinese automobile major Great Wall Motors (GWM) will acquire the Talegaon manufacturing facility of General Motors (GM). The factory will be used by GWM for an Indian debut. GWM VP (global strategy) Liu Xiangshang said the transaction would underpin the company’s plan to enter and invest in India. “The Indian market has great potential, rapid economic growth and a good investment environment. Entering the Indian market is an important step for GWM’s global strategy,” said Liu.

A company statement said, “Under a binding term sheet, the GM India legal entity, which includes the Talegaon facility, will transfer to GWM. GWM will officially debut its Haval brand and GWM EV at the Delhi International Auto Show, and launch its Indian market plan.”

GM India’s other Indian plant at Halol has been taken over by MG Motor India, which is owned by another Chinese major — SAIC. “Since focusing the Talegaon plant on manufacturing for export markets in 2017, GM has been exploring strategic options for better utilisation of the site. Our decision to cease production at Talegaon is based on GM’s global strategy and optimisation of our manufacturing footprint around the world,” said GM senior VP (international operations) Julian Blissett.

Going forward, GM, he added, will “work closely with the state and national governments to secure the required approvals so that GWM can elevate production at the plant even further and maintain Talegaon’s status as a vibrant vehicle manufacturing region”.

GM will provide a separation package and transition support for impacted employees, as well as an orderly transition for partners. The transaction is expected to close in the second half of 2020. However, Chevrolet, he added, will continue to honour all warranties and provide aftersales support, including ongoing service and parts requirements for existing customers in India.

Title: ‘School transportation policy in Patna this year’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: The state transport department will soon bring ‘ School Transportation Policy ’ to regulate buses, vans and auto rickshaws engaged in ferrying schoolchildren.

Speaking at an event on the concluding day of road safety week on Friday, transport secretary Sanjay Kumar Agarwal said, “We are going to make rules and regulations for school vehicles to ensure safety of schoolchildren. It would be the responsibility of all schools to maintain a register of the number of vehicles engaged for ferrying children with details of the drivers, vehicle’s registration number and contact number of drivers. We have prepared a draft copy of the rules and regulations, which would be implemented this year after the state government notification.”

Under the new policy, the schools will also have to ensure that vehicles ferrying schoolchildren follow all safety measures, including installation of GPS tracking system, closed-circuit television (CCTV) cameras, first-aid kit, fire extinguisher, speed governor and all required documents.

Agarwal said action will be taken against the schools for not following the rules. “We will also take feedback from people as well as private schools about the policy, which will be the first step to regularize school vehicles about which we don’t have any record now,” he said.

He also talked about other measures, including paid training for commercial drivers. “Experts are imparting training to the drivers of autorickshaws and other commercial vehicles at Bankipore bus depot in Patna on road safety and we are also paying them Rs300 and providing food packets to compensate for their daily earnings,” he said, adding that the initiative will soon be implemented in other districts as well.

Agarwal also that officials are identifying additional space for parking facilities in the city. “The number of vehicles in Patna is increasing at the rate of around 10% every year, but there is shortage of parking space. Thus, apart from identifying additional parking slots, we are also mulling hydraulic parking facility this year. Hydraulic car parking system is a mechanical device that multiplies parking capacity at a particular slot,” Agarwal said.

He said an automated track will come up at the upcoming transport complex at Phulwarisharif for conducting driving test of those seeking driving licences,” he said.

Title: Bihar: Vehicles not allowed on Bhagalpur roads on January 19
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BHAGALPUR: Vehicular traffic will be restricted in Bhagalpur and five neighbouring districts, including Banka, Munger, Katihar, Khagaria and Madhepura, between 9.30am to 2.30pm on January 19 for the human chain event organized by the state government to create awareness about Jal-Jeevan-Hariyali mission, liquor prohibition and against dowry and child marriage.

The district administration has asked the block officials and SHOs of different police stations to check entry of heavy vehicles from the neighbouring states and districts into Bhagalpur areas. Instructions have also been issued to the officials not to allow human chain formation on or alongside the railway tracks.

Sources said more than 350km-long human chain on 26 earmarked roads in the district will be dotted by around 10 lakh people, including schoolchildren, social workers, professionals and commoners.

DM Pranav Kumar told media persons that a huge turnout is expected to form human chain on January 19. The event is aimed at all-round betterment of the human beings through Jal-Jeewan-Hariyali mission, besides welfare of the society through awareness on prohibition laws, social evils like dowry, child marriage etc. “We expect to make a record vis-à-vis largest participation of people in the human chain on January 19,” he said and added that safety and security measures were being taken for the event.

Title: Bihar: Candidates protest over delay in results
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Hundreds of candidates staged protest outside Bihar Staff Selection Commission (BSSC) office in the state capital for several hours on Friday over delay in declaring results of preliminary test (PT) for recruitment against 13,120 vacancies at Intermediate level in several departments. The advertisement for the PT was published in September 2014.

Agitating candidates also entered the commission’s office premises and damaged a door and nameplate of BSSC chairman Ravindra Kumar. Later, the security guards locked the main iron grills after chasing protesters outside the premises. None, including media persons, were allowed to enter the premises.

Police personnel from Airport police station reached the spot with reinforcement and took control of the situation.

The preliminary tests were conducted on January 6 and January 9, 2017. But after the allegations of question papers leak before the exam started, a probe was ordered. Then BSSC chairman Sudhir Kumar and secretary Parmeshwar Ram along with several others had been sent to jail on the charges of passing students after taking bribe and leaking question papers.

The entire examination was scrapped on the direction of CM Nitish Kumar on February 8 that year. Around 13 lakh candidates were scheduled to write PT that time for recruitment as panchayat sachiv, revenue employee, lower division clerk, typist and for several other positions.

Around 8.5 lakh candidates appeared in the fresh preliminary tests conducted in December 2018, but results have not been declared yet. One of the agitating candidates, Abhishek Tiwari, said, “Mains, typing, physical examinations still remain to be completed. In these years, several more retired and vacancies increased. Instead of making recruitment, government is either hiring retired employees on contract or taking work of 20 people from one employee, leading to inefficiency and corruption.” The chairman says copies are being examined, he said.

Sarvajeet Kumar Singh said the secretary attributed the delay in declaring results to lack of manpower and resources.

Another candidate Nandan Kumar said the commission kept extending the deadline to declare results since October last year.

Mukesh Kumar said a government institution like BELTRON declared its results for recruitment of data operators on Friday for which examinations were conducted hardly a month back.

When asked, Airport police station SHO Arun Kumar said students had met the chairman and only they can say what transpired in their talks.

Title: Bihar: Allies must be realistic on seat-sharing issue, says Congress
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

PATNA: Seat sharing is likely to be a bone of contention in the Mahagathbandhan in Bihar. Congress legislator party leader Sadanand Singh on Friday said allies must be “realistic” as his party will not compromise on seats in the assembly elections to be held later this year as there was great resentment in the rank and file over the issue in the Lok Sabha elections last year.

Talking to TOI a day after BJP national president Amit Shah announced at Vaishali that NDA will fight the upcoming assembly elections in Bihar under the leadership of JD(U) national president and CM Nitish Kumar, Sadanand said though incarcerated RJD chief Lalu Prasad enjoys amicable relations with the Congress high command, but it is his party which compromises to follow the gathbandhan dharma (coalition principles).

“It has mostly been seen that Congress makes compromises in terms of its share of seats in Bihar, which creates resentment among the rank and file of the party as witnessed in the last parliamentary elections. Still, it was only Congress among the opposition parties, which won a seat in Bihar,” Sadanand said, adding that Congress is making preparations in all 243 assembly constituencies in Bihar.

Sadanand, the eldest member of Bihar assembly at present, said, “It does not serve any purpose to want higher number of seats but winning none. We would like other Mahagathbandhan partners to take a cue from the last Lok Sabha elections and be realistic.”

As the Sadanand’s statements indicate, there are many ifs and buts in the Mahagathbandhan while NDA in Bihar seems to be moving ahead in terms of sorting out coalition issues. Shah’s announcement in Vaishali has at least put a lid on any speculations on the CM face and only seat sharing remains to be finalized.

But the Mahagathbandhan is still struggling over the issue of CM face as most of its constituents are not willing to accept RJD’s Tejashwi Prasad Yadav as the CM face despite the party led by Lalu making its stand clear on the issue on several occasions.

“It is true that RJD has announced Tejashwi as its CM face, but our party high command has not sent any directive on this matter so far to the state unit,” Sadanand said, adding that the party is open to forming alliance with like-minded parties.

The Mahagathbandhan constituents have also been staking claims on higher number of seats. Jitan Ram Manjhi-led HAM(S) has recently demanded 85 seats, while RJD is not ready to contest less than 150 seats out of the total 243 assembly segments in Bihar.

Lack of unity and coordination among the allies had cost the Mahagathbandhan dearly in the last Lok Sabha elections as only Congress could have won one seat of the Muslim-dominated Kishanganj out of total 40 Lok Sabha seats in Bihar.

Title: Two held in drunken state at Gaya & Motihari police lines
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An assistant sub-inspector and a civil jamadar were arrested in an inebriated state from Motihari and Gaya police lines respectively in a statewide inspection of barracks on the intervening night of Thursday and Friday following allegations of smuggled liquor supply. The raids were conducted on the directions of state police headquarters.

A retired policeman and three others in an inebriated state managed to the Gaya police lines during inspection. This was first-of-its-kind action taken since prohibition in state on April 5, 2016.

Barracks of Patna police lines were also inspected, but neither liquor was recovered nor anyone was found drunk.

Sources said the decision of simultaneous inspection was taken to induce fear in policemen living at police lines from where several of them had been arrested with liquor or in an inebriated state in the past.

Two days back, several empty liquor bottles were spotted lying inside Patna police lines. Several police personnel had been arrested from Patna police lines in the past for consuming liquor.

Gaya SSP Rajeev Mishra said three civil jamadars, one havildar and a retired police personnel at the police lines were drunk during inspection. “Civil jamadar Binda Lal Munda was arrested and sent to jail on Friday. He was also suspended,” he said, adding an empty and a partially filled liquor bottle were seized during the inspection of barracks.

He said the retired policeman was identified as Tudu Ji, who was a court subedar while others were civil jamadars Mangal Tigga and Lakhan Oraon and havildar Javed Minj. “They all escaped,” Mishra said adding all five were made named accused in an FIR lodged with Rampur police station.

Motihari SP Naveen Chandra Jha said the arrested ASI was identified as Rajendra Singh. “He is a native of Aurangabad district. He was placed under suspension with immediate effect and was sent to jail on Friday,” Jha said.

When asked, ADG (law and order) Amit Kumar said a detailed report on simultaneous inspections of all 40 police lines across state was awaited. Kumar is also handling the additional charge of ADG (headquarters).

Title: Reliance Industries posts 14% rise in Q3 profit
Content:
(Representative image)

Rel Jio’s ARPU drops by 1.2% to Rs 128.4

MUMBAI: Reliance Industries ( RIL ) reported a 13.5% rise in profit in the third quarter of fiscal 2020 to Rs 11,640 crore, benefiting from higher price realisations in its refining, retail, media and digital services businesses. The company’s revenue in the December quarter, however, fell 1.4% to Rs 1.68 lakh crore due to an 11% decline in its traditional petrochemicals and refining businesses and a 7% fall in Brent crude price.Operating profit in petrochemicals, the biggest contributor to RIL’s earnings, declined 29% to Rs 5,880 crore due to inventory overhang and global demand slowdown. On the other hand, refining, the second-largest contributor to RIL’s profit, increased 12% to Rs 5,657 crore because of better margins. RIL’s Jamnagar refinery , the world’s largest, earned $9.2 from every barrel of crude it processed, higher than $8.8 it earned in the third quarter of fiscal 2019.Retail, media and digital services ( Reliance Jio ) zoomed 58%, 309% and 63% to Rs 2,389 crore, Rs 237 crore and Rs 3,857 crore respectively.RIL chairman Mukesh Ambani said the results of the energy business reflects the weak global economic environment and volatility in the energy market. “Within our oil to chemicals chain, downstream petrochemicals profitability was impacted by weak margins across products with subdued demand in well-supplied markets. While refining’s performance improved given our focus on cost positions, high operating rates and product placement.” He added that RIL’s consumer businesses continue to establish new milestones every quarter.Ambani had said that he wants the retail and digital services businesses to contribute as much to RIL’s earnings as that of its traditional units like petrochemicals and refining. The retail and Jio divisions accounted for 37% of RIL’s operating profit in the December quarter of fiscal 2020, up from 26% a year earlier. The company said the consumer business is on track to be equal to the operating profit of the hydrocarbon business.Robust store productivity and wide product offering boosted the retail’s revenues. Growth at Reliance Retail , the country’s largest in terms of turnover, profit and store network, was driven by consumer electronics, fashion & lifestyle and grocery segments. Reliance Jio, which added 15 million subscribers in the third quarter of fiscal 2020 with its attractive handset and tariff plans, reported a profit of Rs 1,350 crore on an operating revenue of Rs 13,968 crore.RIL’s debt increased 7% to Rs 3.06 lakh crore in the third quarter of fiscal 2020 while cash on its book stood at Rs 1.53 lakh crore.Reliance Jio’s average revenue per unit (ARPU), a key performance metric, stood at Rs 128.4 in the December quarter of fiscal 2020. It is down 1.2% when compared to the Rs 130 ARPU reported a year ago, and up 7% when compared to the Rs 120 ARPU reported in the previous September quarter of fiscal 2020.ARPU is the total revenue of the telecom operator divided by the number of users on its network. Jio, which was launched in 2016, has 370 million subscribers, making it the world’s second-largest single country operator. The 7% quarter-on-quarter rise is on the back of Jio ending free voice calls on its network.

Title: Khadag Shakti war exercise in Bikaner
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

More than 40,000 soldiers of strike core number 2 of Indian army are testing their firing power and fighting skills at Mahajan firing range in Bikaner district in war exercise Khadag Shakti. The war exercise started in mid December. According to army sources, the strike core is headquartered at Ambala and is honing their war skills here. The army has put all its resources and all kinds of tanks in this exercise. Integrated battle group capacity is being tested in the war exercise.

Title: Home, finance departments asked to release Rs 22 crore for cops
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has directed the home and finance departments to release Rs 22 crore for disbursing compensatory pay for police personnel for 2019, besides paying their honorarium towards parliamentary election duty and arrears of duty allowance to home guards.

Bedi sanctioned Rs 12 crore to the department of women and child development to implement the free clothing scheme for below poverty line (BPL) families by direct benefit transfer (DBT) mode. The department provides Rs 900 to each BPL family and Rs 450 for single-member BPL families for Pongal 2020. The scheme benefits 1.4 lakh BPL families.

Bedi also sanctioned Rs 13 crore to the department of adi-dravidar and scheduled tribes’ welfare to implement free clothing scheme. The department released Rs 1,000 per adult member of adi-dravidar family (Rs 500 for Deepavali 2019 and Rs 500 for Pongal 2020) through DBT. The scheme benefits 1,31,938 adi-dravidar adults.

Bedi advised the department to include scheduled tribe adults also under the scheme.

Title: BJP rally in support of CAA today
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

BJP flag with symbol Lotus in a rally

VARANASI: Bharatiya Janata Party is going to hold a rally in support of Citizenship (Amendment) Act at Sampurnanand Sanskrit University on Saturday. Chief minister Yogi Adityanath and Union minister Smriti Irani are expected to address the rally.

In view of the CM’s visit, district magistrate Kaushal Raj Sharma inspected the rally venue to take stock of the security and other arrangements on Friday.

Meanwhile, the local BJP unit is also busy in giving final touch to the preparations for the event. The Kashi Kshetra president Mahesh Chandra Srivastava said that the party workers from 12 districts would attend the rally on Saturday.

The city had witnesses a widespread protest against the CAA on December 19 and 20, following which 63 protesters were arrested from Beniabagh and Bajardiha areas. Later, they were released on bail. AICC general secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra had also visited the city to meet the protesters on January 10.

Title: Ahmedabad: Debt-ridden ‘kidney sellers’ joined hands for ATM heists
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Two debt-ridden men came into contact with each other on social media, when they put post to sell their kidneys on a Facebook page named “Kidney Sellers”. As this advertisement did not work, and to get out of debt, they decided to try to break into an ATM to get money.

The two men — Aloksingh Rajput, 25 and Uttam Savalia, 32 — who live at Punyakoti Apartments in Vejalpur, were arrested by city police on January 15 when they were trying to cut into an SBI ATM near Polytechnic in Ambawadi.

Rajput dropped out from school after finishing his Class XII in the science stream, while Savalia failed his Class X exam.

During their interrogation, they told cops police they had met about two years ago.

“Rajput had a debt of Rs 6 lakh and Savalia had a Rs 3 lakh debt, as they had borrowed money to set up their own construction businesses. Both of them had put up a post advertising their kidney for sale. First Savalia, and then Rajput. Savalia first contacted Rajput, asking if he had got any bidders for his kidney. They gradually began talking to each other,” said a city police official.

Official said as they did not get any takers for their kidneys, and moneylenders were harassing them, they decided to make a quick buck by breaking into an ATM.

“The duo first watched videos on YouTube and decided to make their first attempt at a Union Bank ATM in Ambawadi. As they had bought gas cutters and other tools for their construction business, they used these for their first ATM breaking attempt,” said an official of Ellisbridge police, where a complaint for the ATM break-in attempt was lodged on January 15.

“On December 25, 2019, they had made a failed attempt to cut into the Union Bank ATM in Ambawadi. They later tried to break into an SBI ATM in Ambawadi, but were caught as a security systems alerted bank officials, who informed the police and cops nabbed them red handed,” the official said.

The duo were also booked for another ATM break-in attempt by Gujarat University police.

Title: 40 detained for protesting against railway privatization
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: At least 40 railway staffers associated with Western Railway Mazdoor Sangh (WRMS) were detained by cops on Friday.

Nearly 400 staffers were protesting against ‘privatization’ of high-speed Tejas Express , which made its inaugural run between Ahmedabad and Mumbai.

The railway unions were protesting at Vadodara railway station shouting slogans against the IRCTC-operated train which they said will not only add to burden of travellers but also compromise on safety of railway network.

Those detained by the cops included WRMS president Sharik Khan and divisional secretary M K Mahani. The protesters were taken to police headquarters and released after nearly two and a half hours.

“We were just holding a peaceful demonstration outside the railway station. It was a peaceful protest based on Gandhiji’s ideology. Yet, we were detained by the cops,” said Khan.

“Currently, AC chair car between Ahmedabad and Mumbai costs Rs540. But IRCTC will be charging Rs1,450 for the same duration. At the same time with the introduction of flexi-fare system, the travelling charge will further increase,” he said.

WRMS has been protesting against privatization of Indian Railways. “They will be using our own resources including drivers, trackman and all category staffers. IRCTC, which is not capable of providing proper food to passengers, is being asked to run trains. What efficiency are we talking about?” Khan asked.

The running staff including loco pilots, guards, ticket checking staff and the staff belonging to other categories joined the protest and shouted slogans against privatization, corporatization of railway colonies, production units and workshops.

Title: Serving, ex-army men held for assaulting cop
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: A serving Army subedar and a retired subedar were arrested for allegedly assaulting a police constable and kidnapping him in the early hours of Friday.

The Bhadrakali police said the constable, Deepak Patil, passed a message from his wireless radio, following which police swung into action and intercepted the car in which the two suspects were taking him towards Deolali Camp.

The retired army personnel was identified as Rohit Dapurkar (43), a resident of Hirawadi, Nashik, and the serving personnel as Manna Dey (43), a resident of School of Artillery, Deolali and native of Debnagar, Jalpaigudi, West Bengal.

The suspects have been charged under IPC sections 353 (assaulting a public servant), 363 (punishment for kidnapping), 323 (punishment for voluntarily causing hurt).

The duo were also charged under sections of the Motor Vehicle Act for dangerous driving and driving under the influence of alcohol, said police.

Senior police inspector Sajan Sonawane said the duo were produced in a city court, which remanded them in day’s police custody till Saturday.

According to police, Patil, along with another constable, was on routine duty as beat marshals between 9 pm on Thursday and 9 am on Friday. Around 1.15 am, they spotted a white car waiting near Ganjamal.

The constables stopped near the car and enquired from the two occupants of the car as to why they were waiting. The policemen realised that both the car occupants were under the influence of alcohol.

According to constable Patil, both the suspects started abusing him and his colleague. “One of them even slapped the other constable.”

When Patil asked them to come to the police station, they allegedly forced him to sit inside their car and started speeding towards Deolali Camp.

Meanwhile, Patil called the police control room from the wireless system and informed that he was being taken towards the Deolali Camp via Pathardi Phata by two unidentified men.

Police swung into action and intercepted the car near Naka Number 4 in Deolali Camp and took the suspects to the police station.

Title: Kanum Pongal celebrated with vigour
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Madurai: Hundreds of people gathered in popular tourist spots across Tamil Nadu to celebrate the fourth and final day of the Tamil festival of Pongal, ‘Kanum Pongal’.

In Kanyakumari, coastal villages celebrated the festival by holding events like boat race and swimming. Around 50 people from various villages took part in the swimming competition while 15 boats participated in the boat race. The top three winners of each event were honoured and awarded prizes. In Kesavanputhanthurai village, Christians celebrated by hoisting a ‘Pongal’ flag and honoured the farmers by holding a special prayer. On the other hand, on the banks of the Vaippar River at Sattur, around 4,000 people gathered to celebrate ‘Manalmedu Thiruvizha’ on Kanum Pongal. TNN

Title: Man sets self on fire over case against daughter
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: A man set himself on fire in Jhunjhunu Collectorate on Thursday evening, though he was saved in time. The man did so purportedly due to a cash embezzlement case registered against his daughter in 2015 by the village sarpanch. According to the girl’s father, the sarpanch was involved in the embezzlement and wanted him named as co-accused in the FIR.

Ashok Runthla, a resident of Balwantpura in Jhunjhunu district, came prepared with the raw material to set himself on fire. He was taken to the hospital where he is undergoing treatment and is said to be stable.

Gaurav Yadav, SP, Jhunjhunu, elaborating on the incident said, “Runthla had come to us claiming that the sarpanch who had lodged the case against his daughter in 2015 was involved in the embezzlement. I went through the case file and based on this allegation, have sent the cheque which was used for money transaction in 2015 to FSL. Runthla was indirectly hinting that the sarpanch was the main accused while his daughter was innocent. A chargesheet had been filed against his daughter and she is currently on bail.”TNN

Title: Mt Pirana to be history by August 2022
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

File photo of Pirana garbage dump

AHMEDABAD: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has set a target of eradicating the gargantuan Pirana garbage dump before August 15, 2022.

Municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra said on Friday that by March this year, about 5 lakh tonnes of the garbage at Pirana will be removed.

“We have set a target of processing another 20 lakh tonnes in 2020-21,” he said.

“Plan is to remove the entire mound by August 2022 and set free about 70 acres of land there,” Nehra said.

AMC, while launching the project in September last year, had announced that the garbage mound will vanish in two years. However, the pace at which the project is progressing, total eradication is not likely to happen in the next five years.

In order to quicken the pace, the civic body has decided to install machines with higher capacity to process the trash.

Title: Bharat Ratna for Bapu? He is beyond that, says SC, junks PIL
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court on Friday refused to entertain a PIL seeking conferment of Bharat Ratna on Mahatma Gandhi and said the 'Father of the Nation' was much above the highest civilian award of the country .

A bench of Chief Justice S A Bobde and justices B R Gavai and Surya Kant said: "What is Bharat Ratna for Mahatma Gandhi? People hold him in much higher esteem than Bharat Ratna. We agree with you he should be honoured but he is much higher than Bharat Ratna."

The bench asked the PIL petitioner whether there was anything higher than Bharat Ratna that could be conferred on Gandhi. The petitioner said it was for the government to decide. The bench said: "It is difficult to judicially decide who should get Bharat Ratna. It will be better if you make a representation to the government on this issue."

So far, 48 eminent persons have been conferred with Bharat Ratna, 16 of them posthumously.

Title: Min must be informed about all facts: SEC
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: The state election commission (SEC) in its reply to deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot's letter to commissioner P S Mehra, stated, "He (Pilot) was not informed about due process of conducting elections by his department (panchayati raj)" and must be informed about all the facts. It also said that it takes at least three months to complete the entire election process and raised doubts over finishing the process of ward delimitation and reservation in 7 days.

The commission secretary Shyam Singh Rajpurohit in a letter to rural development and panchayati raj department ACS Rajeshwar Singh, said, "The panchayati raj department knew it very well that after the notifications issued on December 1 and 12, it was not possible to complete the election process in time. The departments also knows that it takes at least two months to complete the process of ward delimitation and preparation of the electoral roll. "Also, even after the SC order, had the department taken the decision to conduct ward delimitation and reservation at their level, it would have taken at least 3 months to complete the preparation of voters' list and the entire election process in the panchayati raj bodies affected by the notifications. So, how would it have been possible to complete the election process by February 7, which is the deadline," the letter said.

"The SEC has also written to the department several times informing them that the election process has to be completed in time and the commission has expressed these concerns several times, but it seems the minister has not been informed about these facts. The SC's decision on the delimitation is also yet to come and if it gives a decision against the state government's SLP, then what will be the way forward?" it asked.

“It is also not clear if the department is satisfied with the Advocate General's (AG) decision or not,” it added. tnn

Title: Lover, aide arrested for Sodhan Nishad murder case in Mau
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Varanasi: The Mau police, on Friday, claimed to have worked out the Sodhan Nishad murder case and arrested two accused including lover of the deceased.

Body of Sodhan (24) was found at Pakadi Bujurg village of Ghosi area in Mau district on Thursday morning. On the complaint of Sodhan’s father the police lodged an FIR against the girl and her family members. All the accused were absconding after the incident and the police had launched a manhunt to nab them.

Mau ASP SK Srivastava said that the girl and his brother were arrested from Thanidas turning while they were waiting for a bus to board. During interrogation, the girl revealed that she had an affair with Sodhan. After their breakup Sodhan went to Mumbai for earning living. He had returned home two months back. The girl confessed that she called Sodhan to meet her on Wednesday night and when he came she shot him with the same pistol that he had gifted her three years ago. After killing Sodhan, she, with the help of her brother, dumped the body in the field. The police have recovered the pistol used in crime.

Title: Gujarat: CID books 26 in Rs 35 crore bank fraud case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Bhuj border unit of CID (crime) on Friday arrested 26 persons for an alleged fraud in the Kutch District Central Cooperative (KDCC) Bank Limited, at Bhuj in which one of the accused is Jayanti Thakkar, who was also allegedly involved in the murder of BJP leader Jayanti Bhanushali.

A CID crime official said the scam is worth about Rs 35 crore. “The accused persons formed eight cooperative societies in which they made dummy members and opened account in their names. They later obtained loans of nearly Rs 35 crore by providing forged documents,” said a CID official.

They availed of the loans in 2006-07 but they did not repay them. When the bank enquired into it, they found that eight cooperative societies had carried out irregularities to avail of the loans, which the accused spent on their personal use, the official said. Four of the societies were registered in Abdasa and the other four in Mandvi.

The inquiry into the alleged scam had begun in March 13, 2015, but a local court in Naliya had granted a stay on the probe. The investigating agency then challenged the stay in the Gujarat high court which set aside the Naliya court order on October 8, 2018.

As CID crime began another inquiry in the case, they had on May 29, 2019 arrested Jayanti Thakkar from Madhapar taluka in Bhuj.

Title: HC asks Trichy corporation to disburse benefits to relatives of deceased worker
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Trichy Corporation has been directed by the Madras high court to disburse terminal benefits to the family of a deceased sanitary worker within 12 weeks more than eight years after the civic body rejected the benefits.

R Rajeswari filed a petition at the high court Madurai bench in 2011, seeking to quash a August 5, 2011 rejection order and sought to pay the terminal and other benefits of her deceased husband. She also sought to consider her for employment under compassionate ground.

The petitioner’s counsel stated that Rajeswari’s husband Rajendran was appointed as sanitary worker in the corporation on compassionate ground in 1999 after the death of his father. He submitted that based on an anonymous petition stating that Rajendran had obtained employment by suppressing the fact that one of his family members was already working in the corporation, the authorities dismissed him from service after conducting an inquiry.

Challenging his dismissal, Rajendran filed a petition before the Madras high court, which on December 23, 2003, set aside the dismissal order and granted liberty to the authorities concerned to proceed with disciplinary proceedings.

Pursuant to the court order, the corporation commissioner reinstated the petitioner’s husband into service in 2004 and when the departmental inquiry was pending, he died due to ailment in 2007.

The counsel stated that the petitioner submitted a representation to disburse terminal benefits and to provide her employment on compassionate ground. Since, there was no reply, she filed an application under the RTI Act and the authorities passed an order on August 5, 2011, stating that since the disciplinary proceedings cannot be dropped, pensionary benefits cannot be given to the petitioner.

The government advocate submitted that Rajendran had obtained appointment under compassionate ground by suppressing the fact that his mother was employed in the same corporation.

He submitted that the petitioner was paid money under the group insurance scheme and final settlement of eligible days of earned leave and therefore the sanctioning of pensionary benefits does not arise.

On perusal of the submissions, justice J Nisha Banu observed that the authorities concerned cannot take such a stand when the disciplinary proceedings were dropped after the demise of the petitioner’s husband.

Hence, by partially allowing the petition, the judge set aside the rejection order and gave the direction to the Trichy Corporation.

The judge further directed the authorities to consider compassionate appointment to the petitioner in accordance with law.

Title: At 97, Vidya Devi becomes oldest sarpanch in Rajasthan
Content:
Vidya Devi (Centre) celebrates her victory with her supporters on Friday.

Sikar: 97 year old Vidya Devi won panchayat polls, elected Sarpanch of Puranabas village in Neem Ka Thana sub divis… https://t.co/vMcstSh5QC — ANI (@ANI) 1579328559000

JAIPUR: At 97, Vidya Devi has become the oldest sarpanch in Rajasthan but the childlike zeal in her to ensure providing pension to all the poor widows in her gram panchayat and solve water crisis, sets her apart from the other candidates. She won the panchayat election from Puranabas gram panchayat in Sikar by a margin of 207 votes on Friday."Devi, who received 843 votes defeated Aarti Meena (636 votes) by a margin of 207 votes from Puranabas gram panchayat under Neem ka Thana panchayat samiti in Sikar. Of the total 4200, 2856 votes were cast at the Puranabas gram panchayat," said returing officer of Neem ka Thana panchayat samiti, Sadhuram Jat.Asked if she expected a victory, a confident Vidya Devi, remarked, "Hohhhh". "Bahut accha lag raha hai. Mai pehli baar ladi hoon (I am very excited after the win. I have contested election for the first time)," said Devi, whose father-in-law Subedar Sedu Ram was a Sarpanch from the same gram panchayat for 20 years and was elected unopposed.Devi's husband Major Shivram Singh became a sarpanch once and her son Ram Singh Krishnia was elected sarpanch twice.Even if she is 97 years old , Devi walked two kilometres to file her nomination for the panchayat election.“Maine prachar kara chal ke. Mai ekdum durust hoon, koi dikkat nahi hai..aur har roz kaafi paidal chal sakti hoon (I even campaigned walking. I don't have any health problems. I am fully fit and can walk several kilometres a day)," she said."I will work towards ensuring that all the poor widows in the gram panchayat receive pension. The pension must also be increased," Devi told TOI."As a sarpanch, I want to ensure proper drinking water facility in Puranabas village and supply of water to every family. I wish to focus on building roads in the village, cleanliness and sanitation. The roads are very dirty here. I want to work for all," she added.Her grandson Montoo Krishnia is also a zila parshad from Neem ka Thana tehsil.

Title: NASA to help VMC keep city safe during disasters
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Vadodara: The city became the first city in SAARC nations in South Asia to be picked up for ‘open critical infrastructure exposure for disaster forecasting, mitigation and response’ programme by National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA). The project will help gather data regarding possible impact of disasters in the city and steps needed to ensure that they have minimal impact.

Experts from NASA, Centre for International Earth Science Network (CIESIN) of Columbia University and other agencies will conducted a detailed survey of the city along with Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) and officials of other institutions. The survey will include both natural disasters and possibility of a disaster in chemical industry.

A team of experts from the agencies will conduct the survey and analyse the data provided to it from Vadodara. A kick-off meeting of the officials from these agencies was held at VMC headquarters in Khanderao Market.

According to VMC officials, the initiative will help in providing VMC and others data regarding possible impact of disasters.

The survey will help in drafting policies for reducing risk of disasters in the city. In case of a disaster, immediate data regarding it will be available to VMC and other agencies. It will also provide information on how services like power and transportation can be resumed at the earliest.

Title: Acid Test For Officials; Low Awareness On Burning Issue
Content:
Acid being sold openly in an Old City market

BHOPAL: When a homemaker asks for a bottle of acid to clean her washroom and sanitary wares or kitchen tiles of her house from any grocery shop or picks a bottle at a superstore, little does she realise that she can’t do it without obtaining a permit from sub-divisional magistrate of her area. In fact, there are stringent laws in place both for sale and purchase of acid.But in the absence of proper enforcement at least a lot of buyers of acid don’t know about those laws and many shopkeepers also feign ignorance about them. “I was never told by anyone that I need a licence from no less than the district collector to sell the acid,” said a shopkeeper at Six No. market in Shivaji Nagar when TOI sought to know whether any restrictions in place for sale and purchase of acid are followed.On the other hand, an overwhelming majority of people who purchase acid for household use would assume why should there be so many restrictions on sale/purchase of something as “innocuous” as acid. But, it is that miniscule minority, who use acid as a “lethal” weapon to disfigure someone— more often a girl— that the stringent laws are in place both for the purchasers and sellers.Activist, Roli Shavhare, told TOI, “Purchasing acid is so easy that even a child could fetch it from any grocery shop. She said what does acid do to body and psyche of a survivor could only be felt when you meet a victim or see a sensitively made film or documentary and therefore, it’s absolutely necessary that acid sale is restricted.” It’s also a fact that enforcement agencies and their officials were not themselves aware of the rules applicable on sale/purchase of acid and only after CM’s order to ensure that acid is sold /purchased in accordance with the law on Friday.SDM, Huzur, who seized about 100 bottles of acid during raids, told TOI that according to rules someone selling certain types of acid which includes the acid used for cleaning of glazed tiles in households should get a license from the district magistrate and who-so-ever buys acid must obtain a permit for the purpose and the seller should maintain a record on who bought the acid, its quantity and purpose. However, there is no restriction on quantity of purchase, if one has permit from the SDM.When asked whether the rules are observed either by the seller or the buyer, he said, “It should be observed and if it was not happening till now, it would definitely be enforced now.”

Title: 4.5L children in rural areas to be administered polio tomorrow
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: Over 4.54 lakh children below the age of five years in the rural parts of the district will be administered the pulse polio vaccine on Sunday as part of the national pulse polio campaign.

Senior health officials said that as many as 3,561 booths have been set up all over the rural parts of the district to administer the polio dose to 4,54,201 children. 9,166 employees would be deployed under the supervision of 726 officials to ensure the successful implementation of the polio drive.

Meanwhile, district collector Suraj Mandhare conducted a meeting with concerned officers on January 14 to discuss the ways in which the pulse polio drive can be succesfully implemented. A decision was taken to conduct extensive awareness drives like deploying village volunteers, setting up posters, playing jingles, etc. Mandhare has appealed to everyone to co-operate to ensure the drive is implemented successfully.

Starting January 21, an intensive pulse polio immunisation drive will be implemented for three days in the rural areas and five days in the city areas. As part of this drive, health workers will be visiting every house-hold in the rural and the urban areas to check if any child has been left out of the pulse polio drive and accordingly, will be administered the dose.

Health officials said that the awareness sessions were underway in all parts of the district under the guidance of Mandhare, chief executive officer of Nashik Zilla Parishad Bhuveneswari S and district health officer Vijay Dekate.

Title: Roads made free of encroachments in Trimbak
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: The Trimbak Municipal Council removed all the encroachments on the roads and open spaces on account of Nivruttinath Yatra, for which pilgrims from across the state and the country are flocking to the temple town of Trimbakeshwar .

Chief officer of Trimbak Municipal Council Pravin Nikam said, “We removed the temporary encroachments on the streets, open spaces and gardens to ensure the safety of pilgrims.”

The action comes a day after district collector Suraj Mandhare warned of taking strict action against the officials of the municipal council, who are vested with authoritative powers under the Disaster Management Act, if they failed to remove the encroachments.

Mandhare had clearly pointed out that all the commercial establishments would have to be confined to a particular area, keeping in mind the safety of the 5 lakh-odd pilgrims who come to Trimbakeshwar, which has a population of less than 13,000.

“We made the road from the Nivruttinath temple till the bus stand and also the entry of Trimbakeshwar town free of encroachments. All this was done in the interest of the pilgrims. They will now get ample space to walk on the streets without any hindrance,” said Nikam.

The authorities brought down all the encroachments, including the pandals and the structures raised on the pavement and footpath of the roads. The belongings of 11 vendors, which included utensils, hand carts, temporary carts used for cooking and serving food for commercial purposes, were confiscated. All those who want to serve food free of cost or even otherwise have been asked to shift their stalls to specific areas.

The vendors have also been warned against drawing power illegally. The MSEDCL has been asked to keep close tabs on such people.

The district administration has warned that it would take strict action against those who are found indulging in the illegal construction of a temporary shed.

Title: Dist admin to extend RTS to 80 more services
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: The district administration has decided to extend the provisions of Right To Service Act ( RTS ) to 80 more services than those that have already been stipulated by the state in the act. The extension will be applicable from Saturday.

“We have decided to extend the RTS Act to 80 more services in the district. The services will be in addition to those that have already been prescribed by the government,” district collector Suraj Mandhare said.

The administration has decided to extend the ambit of the RTS and thus bring in more services under it so that citizens get better services. As of now, people have to wait endlessly for services and there are also chances that the file submitted to the offices goes missing.

“At times it so happens that a person applies for a permission or requests for a particular work to be done and then makes two or three visits to the collector’s office, but the task remains pending. After several attempts, the person gives up and eventually stops following up with the concerned department which leads to the file lying unattended,” Mandhare said.

In order to cut down such experiences in the district, the administration has decided to implement the RTS to 80 more services that will ensure the applicants’ get timely and prompt services.

“Currently, the services provided by us are not up to the mark. Of the total number of services sought, as many as 82% are delayed. We have now asked the officials improve their services and also include 80 more services in the RTS act. With this new addition, the total number of services under the RTS act will not go up to 200,” Collector said.

During his tenure as the chief executive officer of Pune zilla parishad, Mandhare had brought in more than 120 additional services under the ambit of the RTS and he plans to introduce the same here.

Under the RTS, citizens who submit their applications to any office will be intimated about the time frame for the completion of the task.

If the decision cannot be taken with the given time limit due to any reason, the applicant will be notified about the same well in advance.

“The office has to decide on the application in the stipulated time and deliver the service and the failure would lead to escalation of the application. If in the inquiry the personnel or the officer is found guilty, he will be slapped with Rs 5,000 fine. Also, other action may follow,” a senior officer from the collectorate said.

The services to be included in the list of RTS are getting certified copy for 7/12 extract from talathi, permission for fire crackers, getting certified copies from record room and many more, the officer added.

Title: Nagpur: Population census from next month
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: The district administration will conduct population census from February. It has already started the economic census. Government staffers will go to every house and collect data for Census 2021.

In the economic census, the name of the head of the family, names of family members, their age, occupation and income will be collected. The number of unemployed persons will also be noted, said a statistical officer.

In the population census this time around, the caste of the person and whether he or she is an OBC will also be noted. Other than this, religion, name and age of the persons will also be asked.

The officer has appealed to citizens to provide information based on facts to government officials. “It will help the government in formulating policies. This information will not be shared with anybody and hence, citizens should rest assured of confidentiality,” he said.

Census is conducted once in 10 years. It was last done in 2010-2011 and the results were made public in 2012.

Title: Madras HC seeks state response on plea to construct foot overbridge over channel
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The Madras high court has sought a response from the state government on a plea seeking to construct a foot overbridge across the surplus water channel at Sengulam village in Virudhunagar district.

S Karuppaiah, a resident of Madurai district , in his petition stated that there are nearly 50 families belonging to the scheduled caste families residing near the eastern side of the irrigation tank at the at Sengulam village in Aruppukottai taluk.

Since a surplus water channel is situated near the residential area and when the tank is full, water flows through the surplus channel. During the rainy season when the water flows across the surplus water channel, people in the area face difficulty to cross the area.

Though the residents of the area have submitted several representations to the authorities concerned to construct a foot overbridge there, no steps were taken in this regard so far.

Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench seeking for a direction. Hearing the plea, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran sought a response from the state government and adjourned the case to a further date for hearing.

Title: Vadodara: Brutal end to extramarital affair
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The trio disposed of the body in sack near Adadara village in Halol.

VADODARA: Twenty-four hours within killing a man and also burning the body, city police arrested three accused on Friday afternoon. Thanks to an alert auto-driver, cops could not only crack the case swiftly but also arrest the trio before they could escape. Cops said another suspect is yet to be nabbed.

According to the police, the accused called Rishank alias Nandu to their home in VUDA quarters at Kishanwadi on Thursday night. Accused identified as Anil Rajput, Suresh Marwadi and Nagin Gandhi killed Rishank and then packed his body in a sack. “Trio boarded an auto rickshaw asking the driver to drop them near Adadara village in Halol taluka of Panchmahals district,” said Sandip Chaudhary, DCP zone II.

“They then disposed his body by the roadside and set the sack on fire. The auto driver who had dropped them near Adadara village saw blood spots on the passenger seat on Friday morning,” Chaudhary told TOI. He got suspicious and approached the cops. The police then tracked down the trio and questioned them.

After some coaxing, they admitted killing Rishank. “They told us that Rishank was having affair with Anil’s wife which upset Anil and he decided to kill Rishank with the help of the two other accused. One more person is also involved in the crime and we are on his trail,” Chaudhary added.

The trio led the cops to the spot where they had burnt Rishank’s body. The deceased and all the accused are casual labourers.

Title: Ornaments stolen from Savitri Temple
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ornaments and other valuables were stolen from the Savitri Temple in Pushkar on Friday. Police rushed to the spot after being informed of the burglary. The temple is situated on the hills of Ratangiri, just outside Pushkar town. Police found that a silver crown weighing about 400gram and the donation box were missing. Priest of the temple, Kailash Mishra informed police on Friday morning that the locks of the temple were found broken and the valuables including donation box were missing.

Title: Govt to resolve min-babu conflict, says Pilot
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: The Rajasthan government will intervene and take immediate action if there are any issues in coordination between officers and ministers, deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot said on Friday.

Pilot's remark came after tourism minister Vishvendra Singh met him on Thursday and apprised him about an alleged rift with the top bureaucracy over a tender process for the light and sound show at the Amber Fort here.

Running the government is a collective responsibility and not of any one person, the deputy chief minister said. "If any team member faces a problem, then I think that the state government should take immediate action after taking cognisance of it. "Running the government is a collective responsibility as people have chosen the Congress party and not any one person. It is very important to resolve problems of team members in time because the accountability of the Congress government (to the people)," Pilot told reporters.

PTI

Title: One killed in Pali bike accident
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Valpoi: A person lost his life following a road accident at Pali , Sattari on Friday.

Valpoi police said the accident occured at Pali junction when Ganpat Gaonkar, 18, a Maddiwada resident, dashed his two-wheeler against Sayaji Gaonkar, 48, who was from Maddi Wada. Both were proceeding from Thane to Valpoi, police said.

Police said Ganpat was riding his two-wheeler in a rash and negligent manner. While Ganpat and the pillion riders of both vehicles sustained simple injuries, Sayaji succumbed while undergoing treatment at GMC, Bambolim.

Title: CM Yogi Adityanath likely to felicitate 500 farmers today
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CM Yogi Adityanath

GORAKHPUR: Chief minster Yogi Adityanath is likely to felicitate on Saturday over 500 farmers of Gorakhpur, Ambedkarnagar, Sant Kabir Nagar and Azamgarh whose lands have been acquired for the proposed 91-km-long Gorakhpur link expressway, which will connect Gorakhpur with Azamgarh.

For the project 90% of land has been acquired and MoU between Uttar Pradesh Expressway Industrial Development Authority and two executing firms will be signed during the program. The expressway will give pace to industrial development in the state.

“The farmers whose land has been acquired will be felicitated by the CM. Special AC buses have been arranged to bring them to the venue,” DM Vijyendra Pandian told reporters.

Title: Madurai: One dead, 37 injured in Alanganallur jallikattu
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Out of the 750 registered bulls, 740 were allowed to enter the arena

MADURAI: A 26-year-old youth from Sholavandan was gored to death when he was waiting to catch a bull belonging to his friend at the collection point at Alanganallur in Madurai district on Friday. V Sridhar, 26, was a law student and the second son of Veerapathiran, a shamiana contractor.

With injuries in his abdomen and profusely bleeding, the youth was rushed to government Rajaji hospital where he died. A total of 36 people were injured in the jallikattu games including 18 tamers, 10 owners and 8 viewers. Of them, 13 suffered grievous injuries and were referred to tertiary care centre.

The event kickstarted at 8am after the usual ceremony of releasing village bulls which are not to be caught. The court-appointed jallikattu organizing committee led by retired judge C Manickam conducted the event, which was attended by revenue minister R B Udayakumar, health minister C Vijayabaskar, Theni MP O P Ravindranath Kumar and MLAs K Manickam (Sholavandan) and P Periyapullan (Melur). Although the event was supposed to end by 4.30pm, an extension of 30 minutes was given by the organizing committee on a request from the villagers.

District collector T G Vinay, south zone IG K P Shanmuga Rajeswaran, Madurai range DIG Annie Vijaya and SP N Manivannan together conducted the event. Rajeswaran said that 1,800 police personnel, one additional SP, 10 ADSPs and 30 DSPs were deployed for security arrangements.

Out of the 750 registered bulls, 740 were allowed to enter the arena. Five were rejected due to medical reasons while the remaining five could not be released due to want of time. Officials said that no bull was injured in the event. 877 bull tamers had registered for the event, but only 688 turned up. During the prize distribution ceremony, chairman of the jallikattu organizing committee C Manickam urged the state government to announce solatium for the family of the man who was gored to death.

M Chellapandi, 35, a spectator from Checkanurani, suddenly collapsed while he was standing at a shop near the arena. He was taken to a hospital where doctors declared him dead on arrival. “A life cannot be compensated with money, but it can help the family of the victim in some way,” Manickam said.

Two hatchback cars were announced for the best bull tamer and one for the owner of the best bull. Cows were also presented for the winning bull tamer and best bull. Cash prizes of Rs 15,000 and Rs 10,000 were announced for bulls that finished second and third.

Various gifts including gold and silver coins, mobile phones, televisions, electronics items like grinder, bicycles, silver and bronze utensils, plastic furniture, steel bureau and travel bags were also disbursed as prizes to the bull tamers and owners.

Title: National counselling for NITs and IIITs at MNNIT this year
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Allahabad: MNNIT-Allahabad would play a vital role in admission in NITs and IIITs this year. Institute director Prof Rajeev Tripathi has been appointed Central Seat Allocation Board (CCAB) director and the institute would conduct admissions for all NITs and IIITs of the country.

Following the directives of HRD, the institute would soon set up a dedicated CSAB headquarters on MNNIT campus.

For admissions, MHRD sets up a Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) to manage and regulate the joint seat allocation for admissions to participating institutes for each academic year. Likewise, CSAB simultaneously undertakes counselling for admission to NITs, IIITs and other JEE participating institutes and based on this the candidates then report to allotted institutes and take admission.

However, after the first round of counselling, there are still vacant seats and for the same CSAB conducts special round of counseling. For the close work that CSAB plays along with JoSAA in counseling and admissions, chairman of CSAB is also a member of JoSAA, inform officials.

“The core committee of CSAB has representative of MHRD and directors of four NITs and a IIIT are its members,” said MNNIT director Professor Rajeev Tripathi.

Title: Girish Bapat bats for abolition of British-era cantonments, to discuss it with MoD
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Girish Bapat

PUNE: Senior BJP leader and MP Girish Bapat on Friday said the British-era cantonments across the country should be abolished.

Speaking during his maiden appearance at the general body meeting of the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) as a nominated member on account of being Pune’s MP, Bapat said the cantonments were raised by the British administration, but they were no more relevant to the prevailing situation.

“An army officer of the Brigadier rank heads the cantonment board. Why does he need to worry about civic issues like drainage work, school functioning or paucity of funds? Their (Army’s) charter of duty is different and important. Why should we involve them in these of kind of issues? I believe they should manage exclusive military areas. I shall take up this (cantonment) issue with the ministry of defence and the authorities concerned,” he said.

Both, Bapat and Pune Cantonment MLA Sunil Kamble promised Rs1 crore each from their local area development funds to the PCB.

The PCB’s chief executive officer, Amit Kumar, said, “We shall utilize the MP and the MLA funds to effectively run the newly constructed maternity ward at our general hospital.”

Bapat said the elected members of the board should have filed a petition in the court against the state government on the issue of the cantonments’ share in the Goods and Services Tax (GST).

“As people’s representatives, they should have explored the legal aspect in the past,” he said, questioning the elected board members as to why they did not do so.

A section of the elected members, representing BJP, stated that they could not have gone to the court against the state government which was, till recently, led by the BJP. Six of the eight elected members in the PCB are from BJP and two are from Congress.

Bapat urged the members to submit a copy of the proposals related to key development projects in the cantonment areas.

“My endeavour is to resolve issues related to people in the city. Once we get proposals in writing, I shall take them up with various government departments. Necessary funds and development schemes will also be implemented in the cantonment areas,” he said.

Kamble, who was also the standing committing chairman of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC), said he would take up the finance issue of the board with the city’s civic body. “In the past, the PMC had made special budgetary provision for the board. On similar lines, I shall take up the issue with the civic authorities,” he said.

Some of the board members claimed that Bapat made “irrelevant” statements instead of providing solutions to the problems of the PCB.

“We had discussed the GST share issue with him when he was Pune’s guardian minister, but he did not resolve it. He needs to understand that the PCB was one of the wealthiest cantonments in the country. As the government abolished Local Body Tax, its financial condition has taken a severe beating,” said a BJP member, who did not wish to be named.

Title: Magh Mela platform for Nirvana and learning alike
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Even as the month-long Magh Mela draws lakhs of devotees and kalpwasis seeking nirvana (salvation), the fair ... Read More

ALLAHABAD: Even as the month-long Magh Mela draws lakhs of devotees and kalpwasis seeking nirvana (salvation), the fair also attracts youngsters from across the globe who take it as a learning and research platform.

From national-level sportsperson to budding techies and aspiring computer professionals, all are camping Mela performing different duties including cleaning camps, washing utensils and serving food to devotees.

Scholars from institutions like London School of Economics are conducting various studies on the campus while experts from GB Pant Institute of Social Sciences, Jhunsi would soon come up with a dedicated centre related to various aspects of Kumbh.

The three-member delegation, comprising Prof Michael Barzelay, Prof Luciano Andrenacci and LSE Fellow Yifei Yan, from department of social policy from London School of Economics studied the public management of Kumbh and Magh Mela. The team of academicians also met eminent seers at Magh Mela area and officials of district administration and understood what all goes behind ensuring facilities for such a mass gathering like Kumbh or Magh Mela.

“The team visited various Magh Mela area and conducted a research and survey of arrangements made by us, both for kalpwasis and saints who are camping Mela area”, said Mela Adhikari, Rajnish Kumar Mishra.

Likewise, authorities at GB Pant institute have decided to set up Kumbh Study Centre in collaboration with Prayagraj Mela Pradhikaran, informed GBPSSI director Prof Badri Narayan.

“Kumbh Mela, world’s largest human congregation, remains a topic of interest and discussion among people and also open up a great area of research by scholars and this centre will act as a nodal point for all such activities”, said the director.

The centre would evolve as a “think tank” of knowledge and resource around Kumbh and Magh mela. The social, economic, cultural and religious aspects of Kumbh Mela will be focussed on by the eminent social scientists, researchers and policy makers under this centre, he explained.

The centre would organise events throughout the year including a project on Kumbh Mela, a brainstorming session, documentation of Kumbh Melas as a case study to help scholars understand the nuances of cultural site over other geographical spaces.

Besides, the facility would also document the past and future Kumbh Melas, enlisted as ‘Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity’ by UNESCO, as a case study to help scholars, said the director.

Shivam, an accounts and finance professional from New Zealand who is on a month-long leave to serve pilgrims at Magh Mela. “I am here to get peace which can be attained by serving devouts, collecting their pattal (plates made of leaves) and help other volunteers” he said.

Another volunteer Yashdeep, who is a national-level tennis player and is busy with training at Rafael Nadal Tennis Training Academy in Spain, is also serving pilgrims and performing odd jobs entrusted to him. Sanyam, pursing his engineering studies from Noida is happily serving food to pilgrims and seers. Likewise, Naman, a BCA student from Delhi’s Jagannath Institute of Management Studies helps others in the kitchen.

“Everyone is equal at this place and everyone tries to get solace and cleanse atma (soul) by performing voluntary seva (service),” said Mahant Swami Satyam.

Title: Goa: Five men accused of tiger killings in Golauli get bail
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The tigers were found dead last week

VALPOI: The Valpoi JMFC on Friday granted conditional bail to all the five accused who were allegedly involved in the deaths of four tigers at Golauli, Sattari, last week.

Bail was granted on a personal bond of Rs 15,000 each. The five accused are required to report for 10 days to the investigation officer at Mhadei Wild Sanctuary office in Maloli between 10am and 5pm.

Vitho Pavane, 60, Malo Pavane, 50, Bomo Pavane, 45, Jyotiba Pavane, 25, and Bhiro Pavane, 22, were accused of poisoning meat that was consumed by the tigers, leading to their deaths. Three were arrested on January 8 while the remaining two were arrested on January 10.

Advocate Yeshwant Gauns, who represented the accused, said he objected to the forest department’s claim that the five men would influence witnesses and tamper with evidence if they were let out on bail. He told the court there was nothing that could be tampered with as the carcasses of the tigers were already disposed of by the forest department and the evidence required had already been collected for forensic investigation.

“Among the other aspects that the court considered was the health condition of the family members of the accused in their absence,” Gauns said.

Counsel for the forest department Nikhil Vaze, said he sought an extension of remand for the accused, but the court refused it. “We had opposed bail as we still require the tigers’ claws, which are still missing. The court, however, has granted bail to the accused but has imposed certain conditions,” he said.

Title: Temperature dips below 10 degrees
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Tiger in Sayajibaug zoo

Vadodara: Cold wave gripped the city in right earnest with the mercury dipping to single digit for the first time this winter on Friday. The city registered a minimum temperature of 9.8degrees Celsius in the early hours on the day, the lowest this season.

After reaching 10degrees C on January 9, the temperature had been rising consistently and the minimum temperature had reached 19.6degrees C on January 13. After this, however, the mercury has been dipping steadily and reached 11.2degrees C on Thursday. Chill had prevailed during the day too on Friday and the maximum temperature on Friday was 24.7degrees C.

While most may feel that the winter was colder this year, in December 2018, the lowest temperature recorded in the city was 7.2degrees C. The lowest temperature for January in 2019 was 7.6degrees C. The cold wave conditions in the city are expected to continue for the next couple of days.

Title: City shivers with state’s lowest temperature of 6C
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: Woollens were out and bonfires were seen at many places as the mercury plunged to the season’s lowest of 6 degrees celsius in the city on Friday.

The minimum temperature was 4 degrees below normal and lowest in city as well as in the state, said the weather department.

The nip in the air was felt during the day time also in the city as the maximum temperature too was 4 degrees below normal at 25.1 degrees celsius.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) warned that the temperatures in Nashik region are likely to dip further in the next 48 hours.

The head of IMD (weather), Pune, Anupam Kashyapi, said that for the first time, northerly winds have penetrated in north Maharashtra which is bringing down the mercury.

Citizens were caught unawares by the sudden dip in the temperature. “We have been suddenly feeling cold for the past two days. I had kept my sweater in the cupboard around a week ago, but have again pulled it out,” said Rajesh Jadhav, a senior citizen.

“It was extremely cold in the morning. My daughter, who is studying in junior KG, woke up late and did not want to go to school. I did not send her to school due to the cold weather. I myself woke up late and wore warm clothes,” said Sonali Khairnar, housewife.

The residents are seen lighting bonfires at nights in old city areas for the last two days.

Meanwhile, Jalgaon city recorded the second lowest temperature of 7 degrees and Malegaon town 8.2 degrees.

——-box with drop letter——-

Niphad records 2.4C, grape farmers worried

Niphad taluka — the grape-growing belt in Nashik district —recorded the season’s lowest temperature of 2.4 degrees celsius on Friday, said the Mahatma Phule Krishi Vidyapeeth, Rahuri.

The record minimum temperature in Niphad had been recorded at 1.8 degrees celsius last year.

The growth of berry gets affected if the minimum temperature falls below 6 degrees and fruits develop cracks if the mercury plunges below 4 degrees.

The sharp drop in the temperature has increased the worries of the grape farmers. The vineyards, which are ready for harvesting, are most likely to be affected.

“The fruit may develop cracks. Moreover, the growth of berry that is in developing stage is affected as its size will be stunted,” said Kailas Bhosle, senior official of the Maharashtra Rajya Draksha Bagayatdar Sangh, an association of grape growers.

He said the effect of the very cold temperature on grapes will be seen after two three days.

Grape farmers have started taking measures like making bonfires in vineyards to maintain the temperature.

“Some farmers are watering the vineyards at dawn through the drip irrigation method to bring the temperature under control,” said Bhosle.

Title: Telangana: Man found dead after tiff with lover at hotel
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A 22-year-old hotel management student, who was also training to be a disc jockey (DJ), died under suspicious circumstances at a hotel in Kondapur on Friday. The deceased, H Rathna Vara Prasad Rao, son of a private teacher, H Muralidhar, was from Shivaji Nagar in Sanatnagar.

Vara Prasad along with his girlfriend, an MNC employee, and two other friends, including Madhapur pub manager Rana Pratap and his girlfriend, checked into two separate rooms of a hotel around 12.30am on Friday, police said. “The four friends went from Revolt Pub in Madhapur to the hotel. The couples checked into separate rooms. At 2am, according to Rana Pratap, Vara Prasad went to his room and borrowed a cigarette and that was the last time Rana spoke to Vara Prasad. Prior to that, Rana and his girlfriend heard Vara Prasad assaulting his girlfriend in his room and they stopped him,” Gachibowli inspector Srinivas said.

At 9am, Vara Prasad’s girlfriend woke up from sleep and saw that he was lying on the floor next to the bed. Upset that he assaulted her the previous night, she left for work without trying to wake him up, the inspector said.

Subsequently, Rana and his girlfriend went to Vara Prasad’s room and saw him lying on the floor. “Rana thought that his friend was too drunk and passed out. He took a photo of Prasad lying on the floor to make fun of him later. He did not realise that Vara Prasad might not be alive. Rana and his girlfriend lifted him and put him on the bed. Even after they sprinkled water on his face, Vara Prasad did not wake up. The couple left the hotel assuming that he might wake up later,” the inspector said.

Around 1pm, the hotel manager became suspicious as Vara Prasad did not come out of the room. “The hotel staff called us and ‘108’ staff declared him dead. There were no external injuries and, based on the victim’s father’s complaint, we registered a suspicious death case. The cause of death can only be ascertained after we get the post-mortem report,” he added.

Title: Farmers will be compensated for crop damaged by hail, assures Kamal Nath
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kamal Nath

BHOPAL: On the last day of the two-day special session of the state assembly, opposition BJP staged a walk-out dissatisfied with the state government’s answer on the fate of guest teachers who have been on an indefinite protest since December 28 demanding regularization in their jobs here at the Yaadgaar-e-Shahjahani Park. As House commenced on Friday morning, opposition raised two major issues – first, of crops affected by hailstorms in the Chambal districts and second, the protest by guest teachers.

Former minister and BJP’s chief whip Narottam Mishra said hailstorms have hit the districts of Datia and Gwalior where paddy crops have been badly damaged.

He argued that it is an issue of public interest. In reply, minister for cooperatives Dr Govind Singh said that information is being collected on the extent of damage.

LOP Gopal Bhargava said that since assembly is in session, then issues like guest teachers and rains affecting paddy crops should be discussed.

CM Kamal Nath told the House, “I am glad that attention has been drawn to the paddy crops and the hail storm. In the past four to five months there have been historic rainfall in the state in which damages were equivalent to Rs 8,000 crore. Just bridges and infrastructure damages add to Rs 2,000 crore. Even ten days ago, I spoke to the Union home minister and asked for assistance. On January 27-28, we have a meeting with the Union Home minister regarding these issues in Raipur.”

Kamal Nath further said“Survey of the hailstorm will be conducted and compensation will be paid,” he assured the House.

“Everyone cannot be made happy but overall we will try to resolve the problem,” he said. The chief minister told the House that if any MLA knows of difficulties faced by farmers in procurement of paddy, then he can call the chief minister and inform of the same.

The query on guest teachers was left to minister for higher education Jeetu Patwari to answer. The minister said, “Government is trying to resolve their problems. The challenge is that over the past 30 years there was no appointment of professors. The government’s intention is to regularize all guest teachers, not a single teacher will be left out.
