Between January 20 and 25, they will be allotted their schools.”

But BJP was not satisfied with the answer. LOP Bhargava said, “These teachers have been teaching for 15 years and 8,000 posts are vacant. This is a humanitarian issue. Guest teachers have been sitting out in the winter for days shivering in the cold. This government has become inhuman. We are walking-out against this.”

Title: PCB to construct cattle shed for stray animals
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: The general body of the Pune Cantonment Board on Friday resolved to construct a dedicated shed for stray animals.

One of the board members, Atul Gaikwad, moved the proposal for a shed for stray animals in the meeting chaired by Brigadier Kuljit Singh, the Pune Cantonment Board (PCB) president. Gaikwad said, “About 400 stray animals, mainly cows, wander in the cantonment areas. They not only create a traffic issue but also affect cleanliness of roads. A dedicated shed can help resolve this issue.”

Chief executive officer Amit Kumar said the board would construct the shed. “But the location of the facility needs to be selected in a such way that the transportation of these animals is carried out smoothly,” he said.

The board members as well as nominated representative also urged the board to appoint an agency to address the stray dogs’ problem.

Kumar said, “The board has floated a tender for catching, sterilizing and immunizing of stray dogs for six times in the past two years. But no agency has responded.”

Kumar said according to the direction received from the director-general defence estates (DGDE), the board had created five zones of the cantonment as per the land records.

“It will be submitted to the DGDE once I get suggestions and objections from the members in next 10 days,” Kumar said. TNN

Title: Unlike 2010, NPR 2020 may ask for parents’ birthplace
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

AFP photo used for representational purpose only

HYDERABAD: Respondents to the National Population Register ( NPR ), 2020 questionnaire will have to tell the government if their parents were born in India or in a foreign country, if the trial run conducted last year is any indication. If the parents were born in India, one will have to indicate the state and district. If they were born outside India, the country will have to be mentioned.

This is one of two new questions that the questionnaire had for the trial run conducted in select states between October and December. The second question was about giving Aadhaar number, PAN number, driving licence, mobile number and voter ID. Both these questions were missing in the 2010 final format NPR.

The pre-test is a mandatory exercise conducted to find out if there are any difficulties in obtaining answers. It also gives an indication of how people are responding to the questions. Sources in the government said that there can be small modifications in the final format of the questionnaire when NPR is finally rolled out.

Sources said that asking for details of country of origin of parents could become a contentious issue given the ongoing protests in different parts of the country over the Citizenship (Amendment) Act. Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and other opposition leaders have been alleging that NPR is backdoor entry for a country-wide National Register of Indian Citizens (NRIC).

TOI got a copy of the pre-test questionnaire and found that details on place of birth of parents have been asked for in Form B as question number 12. “Place of birth of father and mother. If within India, write the name of the district and state; if outside India, write the name of the country,” the question reads.

Madabhushi Sridhar, legal expert and former central information commissioner, told TOI, “In census, respondents can give answers voluntarily. In NPR, all residents are supposed to give answers to every question. Providing false information is punishable by law.”

Interestingly, pre-test questionnaire had 13 questions, one less than NPR 2010 final format. Other questions such as marital status, educational qualification, occupation and other sub-parameters remained the same in both formats.

Title: As Smart City construction work picks pace, residents choke on dust
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Smart City construction work in Madurai is resulting in heavy dust pollution

MADURAI: The ongoing Smart City construction work in the city is resulting in heavy dust pollution and causing lot of inconvenience to the public, who use important roads regularly, feel many residents.

There are four major works - the Natham flyover, Bypass road flyover, Pandikoil junction flyover on the inner ring road and Periyar bus stand - being carried out under the Smart City programme of the Madurai Corporation. All the works are being carried out on important roads connecting the city with the arterial roads and highways.

General secretary of the Madurai Consumer Protection Centre, G Muniasamy said the authorities should have given some consideration before starting these major works simultaneously, as the delayed projects are making people suffer due to high pollution. “If one work was started after the completion of another, people in one part of the city at least would have better environmental condition and lesser pollution,” he said. In the name of development, many are developing health complications, he added. Muniasamy said that the Kalavasal flyover which was not yet completed, was slated to be completed on October 12, 2019, as per an RTI, but three months have lapsed and there are no signs of the work getting completed. As many as 1.42 lakh vehicles pass this junction on a daily basis, and the pollution and roads are so bad, that it takes the vehicles 15 minutes to cross the traffic signal. “This long wait at the junction affects many most importantly those on two-wheelers, bicycles, autorickshaws and pedestrians,” he said.

At the Pandikoil junction, a vehicle which has go go towards Othakadai and return has to take a detour for about two km on an extremely bad stretch of road. “Apart from the pollution, smaller vehicles can meet with fatal accidents due to the road conditions,” said S Ganeshan, a resident of Anna Nagar.

Environmental expert A Nedunchezhian, who studies the environment of the city, says that one of the main reasons for the dust pollution is because the contractors do not spray water on the work sites as per rules, to ensure that the dust does not pollute the surrounding air.

“Rules say that dust pollution should not exceed 150mg per meter cube, at a given time but in many of the sites it is above 600mg. This dust is of two types that is 10 micrometers or less in diameter or that which is 2.5 micrometers or less. Both can enter the lungs and cause many health issues. Dust that settles on hair follicles is also a reason for hairfall,” he said.

Dr Prem Ananth P, pulmonologist, said exposure to cement-related dust can cause a range of respiratory disorders. Even healthy individuals develop allergies due to dust. Long-term exposure can cause serious chronic respiratory diseases.

Title: Kanha’s New Year surprise: 3 cubs clicked in Mukki
Content:
A dominant tigress has been sighted with her three cubs in Kanha.

Videos of a territorial fight at the tiger reserve have gone viral

BHOPAL: Even as a viral video of two tigers engaged in a territorial fight draws tourists to Kanha National Park , the state forest department on Friday released a photograph of a dominant tigress with her three cubs moving in the same region.Tiger sightings have increased in Kanha and Bandhavgarh this season, say officials. Earlier on January 7, a group of tourists had captured videos and photographs of a fight between two tigers — T67 and M3 — in Mukki area. Officials say, the two tigers are fighting over a tigress. One of the videos, that has gone viral on social media, has got over 1 lakh views, say officials.Feline population has increased manifold in Kanha over the last for years, owing to better conservation efforts — which has subsequently led to increased territorial fights. Recently, one the most famous tigers of Kanha — Munna — had to be shifted to Van Vihar to avoid man-wildlife conflict, as it was moving outside the protected area. Munna, now old, had been pushed out of his territory in the core area by other young tigers, and had settled in the buffer zone.The increasing tiger population led to MP gaining the tag of ‘Tiger State’ in 2019.

Title: Tourists have harrowing time as VIPs, kin encroach gallery
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

About 70 foreigners were brought to the venue by district tourist officer S M Sribalamurugan

MADURAI: Foreign tourists brought by tourism department officials to view Alanganallur jallikattu had to wait for over two hours to enter the gallery. Although they reached the venue well before 8am, the gallery which was specifically meant for tourists and constructed using funds from the tourism department was occupied by VIPs and their family members.

Many lost patience and returned as they were made to stand for more than two hours. Even after they got to enter the gallery, they were allowed in batches and view the action only for a few minutes.

About 70 foreigners were brought to the venue by district tourist officer S M Sribalamurugan. The tourism department usually brings tourist groups to the Alanganallur event , which is a government event, free of cost to promote tourism. The group included 10 from Israel, 12 from USA, four from Japan, three each from Denmark and France and 24 from Malaysia.

Randee and her friend Carrie from California in the US left the venue as they were exasperated by the long wait. Randee, who runs a dance company, said, “We lost patience and decided to leave. We were made to wait for three hours without access to toilet, water or food. Some of them started to faint. VIPs kept going into the gallery, pushing us aside as we waited endlessly,” she said.

Many others too left the venue as they were exhausted. Ranjini Marimuthu from Malaysia said, “We started at 7am and it is well past 10am, but we are yet to get into the gallery. We are yet to have our breakfast,” she said. Ranjini, whose roots are in Kumbakonam, said she has seen jallikattu only in movies and she came to Alanganallur so that she could see it in person for the first time.

An official from tourism department said that most of the visitors reached gallery in batches and they allowed them to witness the event for a few minutes. He said that tourists had to wait long since a large number of VIPs were seated in the gallery, the official said.

Another group consisting of 55 members from Chennai were also brought there by Tamil Nadu Tourism Development Corporation as part of a two-day jallikattu tour, which is a paid facility. They too had to wait for a long time before being taken into the gallery in batches.

Title: Sanjay Raut’s comment won’t affect Maharashtra government’s functioning: Sharad Pawar
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Sharad Pawar

NASHIK: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday criticised Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut for making statement against former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi about her association with yesteryear underworld don Karim Lala.

Addressing a press conference here on Friday, Pawar said Raut should not have spoken against Gandhi and should refrain from making such statements in future.

“This issue is closed now as Raut took back his statement. His statement will not impact the functioning of the coalition government in the state,” Pawar said.

“This is a coalition of three parties and we are working on creating jobs for youths, strengthening the industrial sector with major focus on farming. This coalition government will complete its tenure of five year,” he added.

The NCP supremo informed that the state government has decided to waive farm loan up to Rs 2 lakh and around 85% of the farmers will benefit from this scheme. “Loan waiver for the remaining 15% farmers will be considered during the state budget,” he said.

Being asked about the demand of farmers to withdraw ban on onion export, Pawar said he will meet union minister of commerce Piyush Goyal and discuss the issue.

Earlier, Pawar inaugurated the grape crushing season at Wine Park and then inaugurated a new school building of Rayat Education Society at Vinchur in Niphad tehsil of the district.

While addressing the gathering during commencement of grape crushing season, Pawar said he will take up taxation and excise related issues of farmers with the state government. “I will organise a meeting of wineries with state finance minister and excise minister shortly,” he said.

“Wineries should focus on cultivating those wine grape varieties that have demand in the global market,” he added.

Pawar also assured the wineries of providing any kind of assistance for the growth of the wine sector.

Pawar also stressed upon the need of providing new technology-based education to children. “Developing skills related to various sectors along with research to make students employable is also important,” he said.

Title: Will address land issues in Sattari: CM Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CM Pramod Sawant

VALPOI: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Friday assured Sattari Bhumiputra Sanghatna (SBS) that he would look into their grievances pertaining to land ownership.

On Friday, Sawant met SBS members who have been protesting outside the forest department premises.

“Inclusion of 56 villages under forest area has been done without proper demarcation of boundaries. Land ownership is our main issue. The recent incident of tiger deaths was due to negligence by the forest department. Man-animal conflict will occur again, so the government should act now,” said SBS member, Ranjit Rane.

SBS president Harishchandra Gawas praised Sawant for visiting the villagers, and said that none of Sattari’s elected representatives have heared their grievances.

Sawant assured them that he will invite a delegation to discuss the matter. “I will look into the issue after taking into confidence your local MLAs and find out a feasible solution to problems related to land issue and rehabilitation of settlements in the wildlife area,” he said.

Title: Engage ASI to revive Puducherry’s Sanskrit Vidyasthana: Kiran Bedi
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kiran Bedi

PUDUCHERRY: Lieutenant governor Kiran Bedi has urged Prahlad Singh Patel , Union minister of state for tourism , to engage the Archaeological Survey of India ( ASI ) to revive Sanskrit Vidyasthana at Bahour on the outskirts.

Bedi told the minister, who was on a visit to Puducherry, that the inscriptions in the ancient Moolanathar Swamy Temple in Bahour have a reference to a once-flourishing Sanskrit school in the region in the past.

Bedi said the minister has agreed to rope in ASI to renovate Moolanathar Swamy Temple on a priority with a provision for a light and sound show in association with South Zone Cultural Centre (SZCC), Thanjavur.

The lieutenant governor said the department of Hindu religious institution in association with the creative team of Raj Nivas had brought out a directory of temples in the Union territory. She added that the minister accepted to reimburse the cost of production and publicity incurred for making the directory. She requested him to link a soft copy of the directory with national portals.

Bedi sought the minister to allocate enough funds through the ASI to renovate existing museums in Puducherry and explore the possibility of establishing a new museum in Karaikal. She cited the reasons for the delay in executing some tourism projects in Puducherry and requested him to permit the Puducherry tourism department to utilize the services of additional implementation agencies like Central public works department (CPWD) and Indian tourism development corporation (ITDC) apart from the state Public works department (PWD). The minister readily gave his consent to the request, she said

She sought the approval of the minister to revise a few beach projects including Narambai and Kalapet projects following issues related to the acquisition of land. The minister promised to consider the request.

She also sought grant-in-aid for upgrading the existing libraries and establishing new libraries in the territory. A national body of librarians can oversee the project, she said.

The minister came forward to extend the services of SZCC to promote art and culture in Puducherry. SZCC director has been directed ti collaborate with the Raj Nivas and the department of art and culture, she said.

Title: Trichy Corporation posts night-watchers to tackle clandestine littering
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Workers involved in cleaning the roads in Trichy

TRICHY: Trichy Corporation has appointed night-watchers in a couple of wards to identify and penalize people dumping waste at public places during the night. The civic body has simultaneously launched night sweeping activity on arterial roads to clear garbage mounds in the city.

Ever since the corporation removed around 1,200 odd garbage bins from public places, waste mounds has been appearing on arterial roads and vacant lands in the city, which has affected the city’s reputation in cleanliness. Trichy Corporation sources said that corrective measures have been taken up by the authorities in this regard. Having identified the vulnerable roads in Ponmalai zone that are prone to public littering, a dedicated team of 20 sanitary workers, a truck and two supervisors has been constituted in Ponmalai zone to monitor and significant roads during the night hours .

The team of workers will carry out the cleaning work from 10 pm to 6 am. The time period has been identified as the vulnerable hours for mass littering by commercial establishments. “We have deputed night-watchers in ward number 44 and 46 falling under Ponmalai zone covering Cantonment localities to identify the people littering at public places. They will be penalized heavily,” an official with the corporation said. The night-watchers are equipped with smartphones and will collect evidence such as photographs. Subsequently, through the sanitary supervisors or sanitary inspectors, the people or shops or vehicles caught littering will be punished. “For now, the night-sweeping is restricted to Central bus stand and Cantonment locality. Plans are there to expand the mechanism to other parts of the city,” the official added. The night-sweeping team will also insist on the commercial establishments and night food outlets not to dump their waste on roads.

Title: Pune: Ex-paramour arrested for woman’s murder
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The Bharati Vidyapeeth police on Friday cracked the murder mystery of a woman (40) with the arrest of her 25-year-old former paramour.

The probe revealed that Deepak Sukale of Kapurhol in Bhor on Tuesday (January 14) had beaten the woman to death. He then put her body in a gunny bag and took it near Jambhulwadi tunnel on a motorcycle with the help of one of his minor relatives and a friend, Dharmendra Tadsar (28) of Dhayari. After dumping the gunny bag along the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway, they fled.

The Bharati Vidyapeeth police on Wednesday found the body. “We did not have any clues to establish the identity of the woman. From the type of the clothes she had worn, we suspected that she could be from one of the slums in the city,” sub-inspector Mahendra Patil of the Bharati Vidyapeeth police said.

He said the police team, including constables Bhushan Kote, Vinod Bhandalkar and Shridhar Patil, went to almost all the slums in the city with the woman’s photograph. “When we went to a slum in Kothrud, the woman’s son saw the photograph and identified her,” Mahendra said.

During the probe, constables Pranav Sankpal and Harshal Shinde received a tip-off that the woman was in relationship with Sukale. “We went to Kapurhol and took Sukale into custody for questioning. During the sustained questioning, he admitted to his involvement in the murder,” constable Mahendra said.

He said Sukale revealed that despite their break-up the woman was harassing him for money. On January 14, she had gone to Kapurhol to get money from Sukale.

“When Sukale refused, she created ruckus in front of his house. Furious by this, Sukale killed her,” constable Mahendra said.

Sukale is a driver. His accomplice, Tadsare, too is in the same profession. “We have detained Sukale’s minor accomplice,” the constable added.

Title: Burglars strike it rich during Sankranti
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Burglars gained entry into 10 houses in Alwal and Meerpet areas on Thursday night and escaped with property worth Rs 5 lakh.

In Alwal, burglars targeted four locked houses at Laxmi Nagar in Lothukunta when the house owners were away on Sankranti vacation. The incident came to light on Friday when the victims returned home. Balanagar DCP Padmaja said that property loss was reported in three houses. “All put together, 13 tolas gold and some cash was stolen from three houses. There was no loss of property in the fourth house,” the DCP said.

In Meerpet, burglars broke into six houses at Gurramguda and stole four tolas gold. “Loss of property was reported at one house,” Meerpet DI said. Police have launched a manhunt for the burglars.tnn

Title: Motorists irked as trains still shower waste water on them
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Two-wheeler riders waiting below Melapudur subway

TRICHY: Two-wheeler riders taking a brief halt while crossing the Melapudur subway when there is a train movement on the tracks above has become a common sight. They are waiting to take cover from the waste water often flushed out from the trains over to Madurai road below.

Motorists who have been getting a ‘sprinkling’ of it have urged the city corporation to take up the issue with Southern Railway and save them the embarrassment and inconvenience.

Melapudur subway situated beneath the Trichy-Karur railway tracks between railway junction and Palakkarai railway station is used by thousands of people to reach Trichy old city locality.

The subway situated on Madurai road has multiple stakeholders. With the road maintained by state highways, cleaning activities are overseen by the Ponmalai zone of corporation. Melapudur residents said wastewater now spills on them from the railway tracks whenever there is train movement . Though metal sheets are placed below the railway tracks to prevent such water from falling on the road, locals said the mechanism is not effective all the time. “The metal sheets beneath the tracks often fail to stop the water discharged from trains, so we wait for the trains to pass,” P Vijayasankar, a local resident said. Road users have urged the corporation to report the issue to southern railway. “We were told that bio-toilets are installed on most trains to prevent wastewater from reaching the tracks. But we will take it up with Southern Railway for a solution,” an official said.

Title: Pune: Ridership key challenge for new PMPML boss
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bus breakdowns remain a major concern for the transport body

PUNE: Reducing bus breakdowns, increasing ridership and ensuring proper maintenance of buses are some of the challenges before V N Suryavanshi, the new chairman and managing director of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited.

He replaced Nayana Gunde, a 2008 batch IAS officer. Gunde had taken over the charge of Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) in February 2018 from Tukaram Mundhe.

Mundhe, a 2005 batch IAS officer, had tried his best to bring discipline in the functioning of the transport utility and did not shy away from taking action against erring staffers.

“It was no surprise that Mundhe, who had upset many, including some corporators, was transferred in February 2018, only after 10 months of service in the transport utility. But the transfer of Gunde, who was one month short of completing two years in the PMPML, was not quite expected,” a source in the PMPML said.

Only one officer, R N Joshi, completed the full tenure of three years as the CMD of the PMPML since 2007. Joshi had been appointed the CMD in January 2011 and he remained in the post for a period of three years and nine months. “The PMPML has had 16 CMDs but apart from Joshi, no one completed their tenure. The officials are not given adequate time to settle in. And in some cases, like in case of Gunde, once they settled in and had a grip on things, they were removed,” said Sanjay Shitole, a member of the PMP Pravasi Manch.

Gunde was successful in controlling incidents of fire in buses, but breakdowns still remain a major concern.

“During her tenure, the PMPML procured many new buses, including midibuses and e-buses. She also introduced 24-hour bus service from Pune station. But things did not change much as far as breakdowns are concerned. The first eight months of this fiscal recorded around 4,800 buses breaking down each month,” another source said.

“This year is crucial as the PMPML will get more new buses and there is also the question of the last mile connectivity in connection with the Pune Metro project. The focus must be on improving the basics. The biggest question is if the new officer will be allowed to stay for a longer period,” the source said.

Title: Bull owner gored to death in Avarangadu jallikattu
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

A total of 804 bulls took part in the jallikattu organized at R T Malai in Karur district on Friday

TRICHY: A 55-year-old man was gored to death by a bull in the jallikattu arena at Avarangadu village of Manapparai in Trichy district on Friday. The deceased, N Palaniyandi, was a bull owner from Pudukottai.

He was waiting to receive his bull exiting the vadivasal when another bull charged at him from behind, police said . The bull lifted him with its horn and flung him to a distance. Seriously injured, he was rushed to the government hospital where he was declared dead.

Avarangadu hosted the second jallikattu of the season in the district after Periya Suriyur jallikattu that took place on Thursday. The event saw a total of 592 bulls and 289 bull tamers take part. Excitement peaked as one bull owner from Ponnamaravathy in Pudukottai district challenged bull tamers with Rs 1 lakh bounty to tame his bull. True to his claim, the bull remained untamed despite persistent efforts from the tamers.

A total of 804 bulls took part in the jallikattu organized at R T Malai in Karur district on Friday. R T Malai village near Thogaimalai is the only jallikattu venue in Karur district where the event was being organised for the last 58 years.

The event started with temple bulls entering the arena at 8.40 am. Bulls were brought from Trichy, Pudukottai, Perambalur, Thanjavur and Dindigul districts. Pudukottai district, known for hosting the most number of jallikattu events in the state, witnessed jallikattu at Vanniyanviduthi village on Friday. The jallikattu event had the participation of 654 bulls and 217 tamers. A total of 54 people including two police personnel were injured in the event when a portion of the stage came down during the event. A poorly erected stage using makeshift arrangement was the reason for the fall which led to the injury of the police personnel.

Title: 2 each from T, AP score 100 percentile in JEE Main 1
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

New Delhi/Hyderabad: Two from Telangana and two from AP were among nine who have scored 100 percentile in the Joint Entrance Examination ( JEE ) Main I for admission to various engineering colleges, including IITs and NITs, the results of which were announced by the National Testing Agency in a record eight days on Friday.

The 100 percentile scorers are Rongala Arun Siddardha and Chagari Koushal Kumar Reddy from Telangana; Landa Jitendra and Thadavarthi Vishnu Sai Sankar from AP; Nishant Agarwal from Delhi; Nisarg Chadha from Gujarat; Divyanshu Agarwal from Haryana; and Akhil Jain, Parth Dwivedi from Rajasthan.

The final merit list will be announced by NTA after the JEE-Main II exam in April. The ranks of candidates will be released taking into consideration the better of the two NTA scores of all candidates in the January and April examinations.

Last year there were 5 students from Telangana and AP, in 2018 again five students figured in the top 10 list. While in 2017 and 2016, the count was two and three respectively. “We are extremely proud of this achievement. This year Mains test model has been changed and it’s closer to Advanced compared to before,” said Sushma Bopanna, academic director of Sri Chaitanya Educational Institutions where all the four are studying.

This year, the test recorded the highest attendance of about 95%, including Ladakh where the temperature had touched -23°C on the day of the examination. Jammu & Kashmir, too, recorded 90% attendance with 144 candidates scoring 95 and above percentile and 366 above 90 percentile.

NTA scores or percentile is not the same as percentage of marks. NTA scores are normalised scores across multi-session papers and are based on relative performance of all those who appeared for the exam in one session. The marks obtained are converted into a scale ranging from 100 to 0 for each session.

The online application process for the April JEE-Main II will start from February 7 and continue till March 7. The uploading of images and payment of application fee will be open till March 8. The exam will be conducted between April 5 and April 11.

The Joint Seat Allocation Authority conducts a joint admission process for 23 IITs, 32 NITs, 18 Indian Institutes of Information Technology, Indian School of Mines and 19 other government-funded technical institutes based on the rank obtained by a candidate in JEE Mains and JEE Advanced. Some institutes like Indian Institutes of Science Education and Research, Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Petroleum Technology, and Indian Institute of Science use the scores obtained in JEE Advanced as the basis for admission. Around top two lakh candidates who also meet the minimum qualifying marks of 75% in Class XII become eligible to appear for JEE (Advanced) for admission to IITs. JEE (Advanced) is slated to be held on May 17.

JEE Main I was held between January 7 and 9 in two shifts per day across 233 cities in the country and abroad. A total 9,21,261 candidates were registered.

Title: Wikipedia to focus on health
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: Wikipedia India has urged medical professionals to contribute to the world’s largest encyclopaedia by writing articles from their field.

Wikipedia Swastha director Abhishek Suryawanshi said it was found that more Indians were searching for heath information on Wikipedia. “Swastha, a special Wikipedia scheme for healthcare, will help Wikipedia communities to channelize outreach efforts to enhance healthcare information on the web,” he said. Suryawanshi was in Pune earlier this week to spread awareness about Wikipedia Swastha.

Title: Mopa airport will boost Goa’s development, provide several jobs to youth: CM Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The three-day Goa Yuva Mahotsav, which was inaugurated at Margao on Friday, will see nearly 10,000 youngsters ... Read More

MARGAO: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Friday said that with the Supreme Court having lifted the suspension on the construction of the Mopa airport , the project, once complete, would hugely contribute to Goa’s development by generating a large number of employment opportunities for Goan youth.

“The Mopa airport will thus prove to be of immense benefit to the youth,” Sawant said after inaugurating the Goa Yuva Mahotsav organised by the Konkani Bhasha Mandal at Ravindra Bhavan, Margao. The three-day youth festival, which will see a congregation of nearly 10,000 youngsters from across Goa, will conclude on Sunday.

Decrying the fact that many development projects were affected due to opposition from environmentalists, Sawant stressed on the need for debates on all such controversial issues at the youth festival so that the youth get equipped about proper facts about various aspects of the issues at hand. These youth could thus further educate the people on those matters so that people are able to discern facts from falsehood, he said.

“This government is that which listens to the voice of the people. I am all for the welfare of the people. I am willing to listen to criticism and if I am convinced that a particular step would be in the interest of the state, I am willing to consider it. But don’t criticise for the sake of criticism,” Sawant said.

Further stating that protection of Goa’s identity also lay in protection of nature, Sawant called upon the youth to shoulder the responsibility of protecting the state’s forests, rivers, mountains and natural resources.

He also said that Goa lacked leadership in social, cultural and economic fields and called upon the youth to assume the mantle of leadership in all these fields.

Responding to demands for government patronage to Konkani, the chief minister said, “Konkani will get ‘rajashray’ only when people put Konkani to use widely in their official communication as well... We need to start with ourselves,” he said.

Title: 540kg banned tobacco products seized in Coimbatore
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

TIRUPUR: The city police are on the lookout for Gunasekaran, 47, of Ganapathy in Coimbatore , who fled after abandoning 540 kilograms of banned tobacco products on seeing police on Thursday.

Two police personnel on patrol had stopped a car transporting the contraband at KSR Nagar. But the driver managed to flee. Further investigations revealed that the man was Gunasekaran. “He had rented a house at KSR Nagar and was supplying the banned tobacco products to shops in Tirupur,” a police officer said.

Title: Neck-and-neck battle for best bull tamer in Madurai
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

A bull tamer is embracing a charging bull in an effort to tame it in Alanganallur jallikattu event on Friday

MADURAI: There were gritty performances at the Alanganallur jallikattu which kept spectators and event organisers guessing for the probable winners throughout the day. K Ranjithkumar, a native of Alanganallur, was one among them.

Tamers were allowed to take part in batches and Ranjithkumar got his chance only in the last round. Undeterred by the lack of time, he started taming bulls one after the other and had 10 to his name. At one point, it looked as though he tamed every other bull that came out of the vadivasal, giving jitters to M Karthik of Ayuthanpatti who was leading until then.

A tough competition ensued as the two were in a neck-and-neck competition. If Ranjithkumar tamed one, Karthik also kept his score ticking. Ranjithkumar, the local boy, was the clear favourite for the spectators who encouraged him with loud cheer and applause. Utilizing the 30 minutes time extension given by the committee, Ranjithkumar went on to tame 16 bulls while Karthik, who missed crucial chances, finished second by taming 14.

Interestingly, Ranjithkumar’s younger brother Ramkumar tamed 15 bulls last year and and walked away with a car for the first prize. “It is all because of the support of my friends, who constantly helped and motivated me. I am very happy to have won to make my village proud,” said Ranjithkumar, a diploma holder in engineering.

Karthik won a bike while Ganesan from Arittapatti tamed 13 bulls and finished third. Karuppan, a bull from Kulamangalam belonging to M Marnadu, stole the show by displaying aggression for 52 seconds. It was adjudged the best bull and selected for the car prize. The bull belonging to S I Anuradha from Avaniyapuram was adjudged second, whereas the bull belonging to G R Karthick from Avaniyapuram was adjudged third best. Cash prizes of Rs15, 000 and Rs10, 000 were handed over to the bull owners as second and third prize respectively. Cows were also handed over to Marnadu and Ranjithkumar as prize.

Title: Two held for SSI Wilson murder booked under stringent UAPA
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

KANYAKUMARI/COIMBATORE: Abdul Sameem and Thoufiq, who were arrested in connection with the murder of special sub-inspector (SSI) of police Y Wilson at Kaliyakkavilai checkpost on January 8 have been booked under sections of The Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA).

Kanyakumari district superintendent of police (SP) N Sreenath said they were booked under three Sections – 13 (punishment for unlawful activities), 18 (punishment for conspiracy, etc.) and 20 (punishment for being member of a terrorist gang or organisation) – of the UAPA for operating against the country.

Earlier, the Kaliyakkavilai police booked the duo under Sections 302 (punishment for murder) and 506(ii) (punishment for criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and Sections 7 read with 25(1A) and 25(1B) of the Arms Act for illegal possession of the weapon that was used in the murder.

Police said they were not booked under UAPA earlier as they were yet to ascertain their terror links. Following their arrest and investigation, they have been booked under UAPA also. Police said they will move the Kuzhithurai court in Kanyakumari district on Monday, seeking police custody of the duo.

Meanwhile, the national investigation agency (NIA) is all set to take over investigation from the Tamil Nadu police, as the case has been altered to UAPA. “Kanyakumari district police is continuing investigation and will be taking the accused into custody for interrogation. NIA officials will visit Kaliyakkavilai soon and will take up the case for further investigation within a month,” said a source.

“We will conduct preliminary inquiry with the arrested duo and will send a report to the ministry of home affairs (MHA). In the report, we will mention the gravity of the case. After getting order from the MHA, we would take up the case for further investigation on the role of the two Islamic State (IS) cadres in the murder of SSI Wilson,” said an NIA source.

The source added that the investigation agency has to file a chargesheet against the arrested people who were booked under UAPA, within 180 days. “We would file a chargesheet before the special court for NIA cases at Poonamallee in Chennai. The electronic gadgets seized from the arrested people will be sent to forensic laboratory for further investigation,” the source said.

Title: Hundreds throng Kodiveri dam for a splashy ‘Kaanum’ Pongal
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

ERODE: Hundreds of people thronged the Kodiveri dam on Friday to celebrate ‘Kaanum’ Pongal.

S A Sakthivel, a resident of Karungalpalayam in Erode city, said, “Every year, I come to Kodiveri dam to bathe and rejoice with friends and relatives”. He was in the company of his newly-married sister and brother-in-law, who were celebrating their ‘Thalai’ Pongal (first Pongal after the marriage).

Kodiveri dam irrigates Gobichettipalayam and surrounding villages in Erode. The dam is 20-ft high.

Currently, the dam is overflowing, thanks to the recent spell of rain. The dam has been drawing visitors since the beginning of this week. “The number of visitors almost doubled on Friday,” said a Public Works Department official, who didn’t want to be named.

Kodiveri dam is also for famous for fishing activities. There were more than 100 stalls that were selling fresh fish. “I tasted fresh fishes after bathing in the falls,” Shanthi Kumaresan, another visitor said.

Title: MGR remembered on 103rd birth anniversary
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

MADURAI: Members of the AIADMK celebrated the 103rd birth anniversary of their founder and late leader M G Ramachandran by garlanding his statues and distributing sweets on Friday.

Minister for revenue, disaster management and IT garlanded the statue of the late leader and distributed sweets at a function held in Madurai. Madurai south MLA S S Saravanan, distributed free cycles to three beneficiaries and distributed sweets at his office. Madurari North MLA V V Rajan Chellappa who participated in the birth anniversary celebrations in Thiruparankundram garlanded the statue and distributed sweets to the people there. He said they were celebrating their leader’s birth anniversary in all villages, and that his legacy would live long. He also took a dig at the DMK-Congress alliance, calling it unfit and that it would not survive for long. Meanwhile, members of the AIADMK stood in a long queue and garlanded the statue of the late leader in the K K Nagar junction. They also distributed sweets to the public.

Title: Man’s body found with throat slit
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: A 21-year-old man was found murdered in the fields in Kohdaur area of Pratapgarh district on Friday morning. Police said the victim, Suresh of Shahpur village, left home on Thursday morning but did not return. His family members searched for him but could not trace him.

On Friday morning, some villagers spotted a body with slit throat in a wheat field near Kandharpur village.

Police reached the spot and informed the family members of Suresh who identified the body.

Police said Suresh’s throat had been slit with some sharp-edged weapon and the body had injury marks too. The body has been sent for post-mortem examination.

SP, Pratapgarh, Abhishek Singh said police have started investigations and mobile call details of the victim are being scanned to get some clues.

Title: NGO works to better senior citizens’ lives
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: Altogether 515 senior residents of Kasturba Vasahat and Indira Vasahat in Aundh have benefited from the community-based programme for the ageing population launched by the NGO School for Development and Impact (SDI) about eight months ago.

The uplift model focuses on building support structures, resilience and intergenerational discourse with the youth. Chief executive officer of SDI Benazir Patil said, “We have also set up Vriddhanchi Anganwadi centres for the elderly population. We provide them with medical necessities and care. The idea is to implement the model in other slums and promote the concept of age friendliness.”

Patil added that, at the start of the initiative, they went to each home in the slums and took stock of the condition of the elderly population. “Some of them were bed ridden and there was a need for adult diapers, medicines, wheelchairs among others. We also helped them out with the paperwork to seek pension and what schemes are available, including getting hospital check-ups done,” she said.

Project manager Kalpana Kavadi said, “We tried to train them on minor activities to keep them occupied. This will also help generate income. We showed them how to make garlands and paper bags. The aim is to promote healthy living,” she said.

Title: Company director held for organising rave party with obscene dances at Hyderabad pub
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Jubilee Hills police arrested the director of an agro management company along with the firm’s manager and an event manager on Friday for organising a rave party with ‘obscene dances’ at a pub in Jubilee Hills on January 12. However, the pub’s owner and its manager are absconding.

Meanwhile, police have initiated steps for closure of the pub through the Revenue Divisional Officer (RDO).

West Zone DCP A R Srinivas said that based on information received by Banjara Hills ACP about obscene dances at TOT pub, popularly known as Affair pub, the Jubilee Hills police conducted the raid. “On seeing the police, the male customers fled from the pub. During investigation, we found out that an event manager, B Prasad Goud, hired the women to entertain the employees as per the request of Signova Agro Management’s manager Mohammed Moin,” the DCP said.

The DCP added that each woman was offered Rs 3,500.

Police took pub manager Bharat into custody and released him after issuing him a notice under section 41 of CrPC to appear for questioning later. However, Bharat went absconding.

A case was registered against Bharat, Moin, Prasad, Signova Agro Management Pvt Ltd director Srinivas Naidu and pub owner Santosh Reddy. “We have recommended for closure of two more pubs in Punjagutta where similar issues cropped up recently,” the DCP said.

Title: Heavy winter rain, winds lash Kanpur
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The rain which started from Wednesday night continued throughout the day on Thursday

KANPUR: Heavy winter showers lashed the city throughout the day on Thursday, thereby, ending the brief spell of relief from chill. The rainfall started from late Wednesday night and continued on Thursday affecting the routine life.

Till 3pm, the city recorded 57.2 mm of rainfall, a record in past 49 years on this date as the city never received 57.2 mm rainfall on January 16 since 1971. The rain gauge is expected to rise with the showers continuing after the rain gauge was recorded. On January 18, 2014 the city had received 67.2 mm of rain.

While the average rainfall for January is 10 mm, rainfall have already crossed the mark this month. The city had received 15.2 mm of average rainfall this month.

The day temperature plunged to 15.6 degree Celsius from 18.8 degrees recorded on the previous day. On January 14, day temperature was recorded at 21.6 degrees. In past few days the day hours had become warmer giving relief from the extreme cold weather conditions prevailing for over a month now.

Agrometerologist at CSA University, Prof Naushad Khan said that showers are likely to lash the city on January 17 also and gusty winds shall blow. The entire region was witnessing rain and chill due to western disturbance, said Khan adding that city sky would remain covered with dense clouds.

Though after the festival of Makar Sankranti with the transition of Sun, the winter chill subsides but this time the chilly weather conditions are unrelenting. Cold weather conditions are likely to prevail for few more days.

Meanwhile, heavy showers led to massive waterlogging in many areas of the city. Rain accompanied with winds added to troubles of destitute. People preferred to remain indoors. The schools remained closed as per the orders of the DM. Many shops were also closed due to incessant rain. In the evening when rain slowed down a bit, local shops witnessed a huge rush of people buying basic necessities.

Title: 70 structures in CRZ areas razed, NGT told
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Panaji: Less than 45% of the structures in CRZ areas that were issued demolition orders by the Goa Coastal Zone Management Authority have been demolished, the authority has informed the National Green Tribunal.

A total of 70 structures were demolished across the state while the rest have received stays from courts with some pending hearings.

Of the 90 demolitions ordered in North Goa, 10 were executed by the collector. In South Goa, out of the 76 demolitions ordered, 35 were executed by the collector and 25 were executed privately.

At the last hearing, the NGT had warned of doubling the state’s environmental compensation to Rs 2 crore and taking other punitive action even as it had directed the authorities to file a compliance report against illegal structures on the Morjim, Mandrem, Galgibaga and Agonda beaches, which are designated turtle nesting sites.

In an order dated November 2, 2017, the Delhi bench of the NGT had directed the GCZMA to initiate action against temporary structures erected without its permission in the no-development zones (NDZ) of the four beaches protected for turtles under the Coastal Regulation Zone Notification, 2011.

Taking serious cognisance, the bench sought details of demolitions and amounts recovered — as per its earlier order — and even warned of suspension of officers’ salaries and other punitive actions. Goa Paryavaran Savrakshan Sangharsh Samitee had filed an execution application alleging inaction by the GCZMA where structures in North Goa were concerned.

Title: Job fair: 364 candidates secure jobs
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: As many as 364 candidates secured job in various industries in a job fair held in the Satpur area on Friday. Twenty-four Nashik-based industries including Mahindra (EPC), Taparia Tools, Art Rubber Industries , Blue Cross, Glenmark, Indoline Industries, Datamatics Global Services, Winter Safeguard, Eureka Forbes, Winjit Tech, Sumo Soft etc interviewed 1,078 applicants for the respective job.

Title: Maharashtra: Revenue officials hopeful of nod to land titling bill in budget session
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The bill proposes to make all land records available in one office

PUNE: The land titling bill is likely to be cleared in the upcoming budget session, senior revenue officials in the state government stated.

The bill proposes to make all land records available in one office to give people easier access to information. At present, records pertaining to immovable properties are available with different agencies.

The previous state government had released a draft land titling act in June last year. But the erstwhile cabinet could not clear it because of the elections and change in government.

State settlement commissioner S Chockolingam, who has been working on the land titling bill at the state and the centre, said that that the bill will soon be circulated to all states for approval while the state government is expected to take up its clearance in the upcoming budget session at the end of next month. “The passage of the bill will help bring transparency, objectivity and easy accessibility of information on land and land transactions,’’ he said.

“Once the bill is passed, benami owners of immovable properties will be under radar,’’ said officials. A single act of transfer of property involves a minimum of four legislations and two authorities. The bill aims to improve land administration system and ensure security of title over properties with focus on those whose titles are being created and properties allotted by government and semi-government authorities.

Title: Operational charges waived for commercial flights
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: The defence PSU, Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL), has started waiving off operational charges for all civilian flights using the Ozar airport near Nashik city under the Regional Connectivity Scheme (RCS).

The instructions for the same were issued by the ministry of defence ( MoD ). Moreover, HAL has also started providing night landing facility to all commercial flights and aircraft at the Ozar airport if they inform HAL about the same at least 10 hours prior to the landing.

HAL sources said that the MoD recently issued instructions to the company to waive off operational charges at the airport including landing and parking fees for all flights operating to and from Nashik Airport under the Centre’s Udan or RCS scheme.

The ministry also asked the airlines to rope in more flights for Nashik. At present, Nashik airport facilitates air connectivity to Hyderabad, Pune and Ahmedabad.

Alliance Air, a subsidiary of Air India, is operating from Nashik to Hyderabad, Ahmedabad and Pune. In addition, private airline TruJet is also operating on the Nashik-Ahmedabad route on a daily basis.

“Following the instructions from the union ministry of defence, we have waived all operational charges at the airport for the flights operating under the RCS. The ministry had recently issued such circular directing us waive of all the charges,” said HAL sources.

The Director General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) had also given its approval to the night landing for passenger aircraft at the Ozar airport.

“Earlier, we would provide services at the airport till 7 pm. But, after the DGCA’s approval for landing for passenger aircraft, we have extended our service hours till midnight. The night landing facilities are also free for flights under the Udan scheme,” said HAL sources.

“We provide night landing facility all though the night, but the airline has to inform us about it at least 10 hours prior to the landing,” added sources.

The state government and HAL had jointly developed the new airport terminal at Ozar at a cost of Rs 84 crore in 2014.

The government spent the said amount while the land was owned by the HAL. But, it took almost four years to start operations from Nashik airport and Regional Connectivity Scheme benefited the city as many airlines expressed interest to fly on different routes from Nashik.

Title: 2-day summit on artificial intelligence
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: Possible security threats by artificial intelligence and big data firms are among the issues that will be discussed at the Pune World Summit in Kharadi on Saturday and Sunday.

The Victorious Kidss Educares will host the summit, with ‘Unearthing Reality’ its theme. “From technology to territory, students shall examine, deliberate and debate over raging global issues at the summit,” Robbin Ghosh, president of Victorious Kidss Educares, said.

The conference will also host a simulation of the Lok Sabha. “It is structured to push students’ abilities to equip themselves with leadership, public speaking and problem-solving skills,” Ghosh said.

Title: Traffic police seize 41 multi-tone air horns
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Police collected Rs 41,000 as fine from the drivers of the vehicles for using air horns

COIMBATORE: The traffic police conducted random vehicle checks and seized 41 multi-tone air horns from as many heavy vehicles (buses and trucks) in the city on Friday. Police collected Rs 41,000 as fine from the drivers of the vehicles for using air horns.

The traffic police conducted vehicle checks on Avinashi Road, Trichy Road, Sathy Road and various parts of the city and seized 41 multi-tone air horns from 41 heavy vehicles. Police booked 41 cases under Section 194 (2) of the Motor Vehicles Act and slapped a fine of Rs 1,000 each.

Title: Full-time official language director soon, says Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CM Pramod Sawant

MARGAO: Chief minister Pramod Sawant on Friday assured that a full-time director for official language would be appointed shortly. Sawant, who was speaking at the inaugural session of the 25th Goa Yuva Mahotsav , also advocated instituting new awards for youth in various disciplines by the directorate of official language. “There is a lot of criticism against the directorate of official language. But let me point out that it was former chief minister Manohar Parrikar who gave justice to the directorate by appointing a full-time director in 2012,” he said.

Title: Secunderabad: After decades of stench, drains overhaul in Sitaphalmandi soon
Content: SECUNDERABAD: Residents of Sitaphalmandi division in Secunderabad municipal area could soon see resolution of their water and sewerage problems with Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) taking up works worth over Rs 1.2 crore.Flooded with complaints about water pollution and overflowing of sewage water from residents of seven localities, GHMC officials and Sitaphalmandi GHMC corporator , Samala Hema, on Friday inspected various sites at which works will be taken up in another couple of days.Orders have already issued to the civic body’s engineering wing to take up the works on priority.Major works include laying of water supply lines (at cost of Rs 13 lakh) and sewerage lines (Rs 12 lakh) at Kindibasthi, along side sewerage network at Bapanbasthi (Rs 29 lakh), raising of nala slab (Rs 20 lakh) at Friday market, and nala wall raising (Rs 50 lakh).Areas such as Kindibasthi, Beedal Basthi, Old Kallu compound and St Albus Kindibasthi at Chilkalguda, Upper Basti near Shanthisri Apartment, Basavatarakam Nagar (next to TRS office) will get new water lines.Sewerage works will also be taken up at areas such as Bapanbasthi, Friday market, and Mahmoodguda.“With these infra works, locals will get a big relief from water pollution and sewer water overflowing from nalas,” Sitaphalmandi corporator, S Hema told TOI.“These complaints were noticed during rainy season, and moreover, sewer water also used to enter habitations near nalas. After inspection made with GHMC officials, proposals have been sent to the GHMC to resolve these issues permanently,” she said.The HMWS&SB and GHMC were given instructions to complete these works within a month, she said.“In fact, locals have to realise that they should not throw garbage and waste material in the open nala,” said Hema. “To avoid this menace, we are raising the compound walls on nalas.”Sitaphalmandi residents said that the works are a step in the right direction and will provide them with solutions to issues that have been festering for decades.“We have spent sleepless nights every monsoon due to sewer water entering into our houses for more than a decade, now we will get a huge relief,” P Raghavendra Kumar, a resident of Mahmoodguda.

Title: Rooster fight held in Erode village
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

ERODE: The residents of Umareddiyur village near Ammapet here conducted a rooster fight on Friday. The event was held under the supervision of police.

More than 500 roosters from villages such as Athani, Appakudal, Erode, Bhavani, Chithode and Andhiyur were brought for the event, which attracted a large crowd. After inspecting the roosters, police officials allowed them to participate in the fight.

“We had sought permission from the police department by assuring them to conduct the event by sticking to the rules and regulations prescribed by the central and state governments with regard to rooster fight,” a villager said.

As per the guidance, roosters should not be given alcohol, while the rooster owners are not allowed to tie sharpened objects such as blades and knives to the bird’s legs. According to the rules, event organizers and rooster owners are not allowed to indulge in gambling or any money dealings.

Title: Evening train between Coimbatore, Pollachi gets extension
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: In what could be termed as some good news for office-goers and college students, the Southern Railway has extended the evening Coimbatore-Pollachi train service till July 21.

The train leaves Coimbatore at 6.30pm every day and reaches Pollachi at 8pm. It again leaves Pollachi at 8.30pm and reaches Coimbatore at 9.50pm.

The service, which is yet to be regularized, was sanctioned last year till January 21. The Southern Railway had regularized the morning and afternoon services last year.

“The evening service is critical because it lets several people return to Pollachi after work. It also takes many Coimbatorians back to the city after work,” said T Ravindran, a businessman.

The other two trains leave Coimbatore at 5.45am and 1.45pm and reaches Pollachi at 7am and 2.55pm respectively. They leave Pollachi at 7.30am and 12.20pm and reach Coimbatore at 8.40am and 2.10pm respectively.

Title: Ill-maintained check posts to turn safer, get better facilities
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

A small structure made of hollow block bricks in which SSI was murdered on January 8

KALIYAKKAVILAI (KANYAKUMARI): The district police are working on improvising the safety features and amenities at border check posts following the murder of special sub inspector Y Wilson by two extremists on January 8.

A small structure made of hollow block bricks with an asbestos sheet and tarpaulin on top and pieces of wornout cardboard boxes acting as window was the check post on the Kaliyakkavilai Market Road where the SSI was murdered. It is one of the 36 police check posts on the inter-state border of Kanyakumari district and this is the plight of most of the check posts. Policemen said the check posts don’t have power supply and are at the mercy of residents to draw electricity for lighting or for a small fan. Without toilets, the personnel posted on 12-hour duty also find it difficult to relieve themselves.

These checks posts are under the jurisdiction of six bordering police stations – Kollam Code, Kaliyakkavilai, Palugal, Arumani, Kadayalumoodu and Arugani. They include eight major check posts such as the ones at Kaliyakkavilai, Cheriyakolla, Netta, Choozhal and four others on the main roads while the rest are on smaller roads. Most of them except Netta have structures similar to the ones in which Wilson was at work.

Initially, less than a handful of these check posts were established to man important roads and prevent smuggling of PDS goods, sand or contraband items like arrack. More were set up on smaller roads to check illegal transportation of medical and poultry waste from Kerala to Tamil Nadu. But the strength of the police stations was not increased despite drawing the station strength for the check posts too.

Field level cops at these check posts said 11 of these check posts are in Kaliyakkavilai police station. “The station has a strength of 51 that was sanctioned about 35 years ago which has not been revised yet,” said a policeman. They expressed the need for a special unit to man check posts with at least four police personnel each, focus lights and CCTVs, speed breakers or ‘Z’ barricades and basic amenities.

Kanyakumari SP N Sreenath said, “We are in the process of rationalising the check posts for better surveillance. We will be deploying at least two personnel at manned check posts and installing CCTV cameras at unmanned check posts. The cameras will be monitored from a centralised place,” he said, adding that they will work out with the highways and other departments concerned on installation of speed breakers on the roads.

Title: Women bag 80% representation in rural local bodies in Dindigul district
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: While the recently held local body elections saw women getting 50% representation in all posts across the state, Dindigul district has earned a unique distinction with about 80% women representing most of these coveted posts, including 12 of the 14 panchayat union chairpersons’ posts.

Dindigul district has 14 panchayat unions including Athoor, Reddiarchathiram, Natham, Batlagundu, Nilakottai, Palani and Kodaikanal.

The DMK, which gained majority in the local body polls in Dindigul district after nearly 40 years, contested most of the seats by giving preference to women in even general category posts. For instance, the Palani panchayat union chairman post is open to all in the general category.

The DMK fielded K Eswari and she emerged victorious. Similarly, in Thoppampatti union, R Sathiyabhuvana was elected panchayat union chairperson, while S Palaniammal was elected chairperson of Sannarpatti panchayat union. Out of the 14 panchayat union chairman posts, the DMK secured nine of which seven were allocated for women.

The party has allocated the posts of vice-chairman of many panchayat unions for women, though there was a demand from the elected male representatives. D Rajeswari, M Hemalatha and Gayathiri were elected vice-chairpersons of the Reddiarchathiram, Athoor and Oddanchathiram unions respectively. Even in the panchayat unions of Nilakottai, Vadamadurai and Vedasandur, which were won by the AIADMK, women have been elected chairpersons.

The chairperson of the Gujiliamparai union and vice-chairpersons of Vedasandur and Vadamadurai are also women. DMK deputy general secretary I Periyasamy, who was instrumental in picking the candidates for the rural local bodies , said that women had a better people connect when it came to villagers. “The fact that many of them were elected unopposed proves this,” he added.

Title: Insas theft: Fugitive Armyman held in Delhi after 3 days on run
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: Army deserter Harpreet Singh, who had escaped from Punjab police custody after being arrested for stealing two rifles from the Pachmari Cantonment, was rearrested in Delhi on Friday morning. He will be brought to MP’s Hoshangabad soon.

Harpreet was nabbed at Connaught Place around 9am, say police sources in Bhopal . During interrogation, he said that he didn’t want to be jailed and was trying to flee to Nepal.

Harpreet, a havildar, is accused of stealing two Insas rifles from sentries at Pachmarhi Cantonment in December last year after posing as an officer and sending the guards on a fake errand. After a five-day chase, he was arrested in Chautala village in Punjab’s Tanda tehsil by Madhya Pradesh ATS in coordination with Punjab Police, Intelligence Bureau and Military Intelligence. His alleged accomplices Jagtar Sing ‘Jagga’ and Sonu were arrested from Miani village in Jalandhar, about 190km from Chandigarh.

Since then, Hoshangabad police had been trying to get him on production warrant. On December 31, Harpreet was admitted to a civil hospital in Hoshiarpur, under Punjab police custody, to have his fractured arm treated. On January 14, he escaped on the pretext of going to the washroom. After a three-day manhunt, he was nabbed in Delhi.

“We tried twice to get him on production warrant but Punjab Police cited shortage of staff to escort him here. We have written again to a senior official there. Now that Harpreet has been arrested again, we are hopeful that he will be brought here,” said Hoshangabad SP M L Chari.

Investigations revealed that Harpreet Singh had undergone two months’ training at Cariappa Music Wing at Army Education Corps in Pachmarhi, and was aware of the cantonment and security set-up. Security agencies could zero in on him because he had withdrawn cash from an ATM outside Pipariya station before renting a car for Pachmarhi around midnight last Thursday. Details of the havildar’s bank account and CCTV footage from inside the ATM led to his identification, say sources.

According to sources, Harpreet told interrogators that he stole the rifles to sell them and arrange money for the bail of his brother, who was arrested while trying to enter USA illegally from Mexico.

Title: Residents of Faithfulganj urge authorities to strengthen security
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kanpur: The residents of the Faithfulganj area of the city, which is also known as Dari Bazar, and its surrounding localities were in a state of shock after the arrest of Jalees Ansari aka ‘Dr Bomb’ on Friday.

They said that they were shocked to hear that he could be involved in terrorism.

“He was looking like any other ‘namazi’,” said a youth, who lives next door to Oonchi Masjid (mosque) in Faithfulganj. We saw some sleuths putting him inside an SUV and speeding away. We thought as the person, whom they were putting inside the vehicle, was ill and they were rushing him to a hospital”.

“However, we were shocked when we saw breaking news being flashed on TV channels wherein told about the arrest of ‘Dr Bomb’— alias Jalees Ansari from the area,” the youth said and added, “People from different areas are here and we all know each other, but we had no idea that a convicted terrorist, who had jumped parole, is roaming in our locality.”

As per the STF sources, Ansari, after deboarding Mumbai-Lucknow bound Pushpak Express at Kanpur Central on Friday morning, reached Oonchi Masjid (mosque) in Faithfulganj area where he inquired locals about his two old friends--Abdul Rahman and Abdul Qayyum. “Locals, however, told him that Rahman had died in a road mishap while Qayyum shifted from there,” the STF sources further said.

The residents of the area have urged the authorities to strengthen security arrangements in the area to protect it from anti-social elements.

Ansari, the 68-year-old convict of the 1993 Mumbai serial blasts case, serving a life term, was on parole for 21 days from the Ajmer Central prison. During the parole period, he was ordered to visit the Agripada police station every day to mark his attendance. However, he did not visit the police police station on Thursday during the designated time.

Title: MSRTC launches drive to save fuel
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has launched a special drive ‘save fuel.’ Under the initiative, the entire staff would be given special training. MSRTC, which has the fleet of 18,500 buses, carry 66 lakh commuters every day.

Yedrawkar on textile problems

Minister of state for textiles Rajendra Patil Yedrawkar said that state government was positive on solving the problems of Ichalkaranji. Yedrawkar was felicitated by the Ichalkaranji Powerloom Association. He said that the government was positive on offering 5% concession in power tariff to textile units.

Samarjitsinh Ghatge condemns Raut

BJP district president Samarjitsinh Ghatge has condemned Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut for his remarks on Udayanraje Bhosale, the descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. “Raut’s statement is a sign of rudeness and also humiliating to all the people of Maharashtra,” Ghatge said.

Demand for ban on rural rickshaws entering city

Prahar Pratishthan, an organisation that works for rickshaw drivers in the city, has demanded complete ban on the entry of rural rickshaws in the city limits. In a memorandum submitted to the RTO officials, Prahar said that the entry of rural rickshaws in the city has affected business of city-based rickshaws. The memorandum also stated that plying of rural rickshaws on city roads resulted in traffic chaos and accidents in the city. The RTO had recently allotted four spots for rural rickshaws outside the city limits; however, the move has been opposed by rickshaw operators.

Title: Man arrested for raping 23-year-old woman
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

Title: 61 students from Vadodara become CA
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Successful CA at the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India.

VADODARA: A total of 61 students from the city have become chartered accountants (CA) with the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India (ICAI) declaring results of CA final examinations held in November last year.

Of the 61, 22 students cleared examinations of both the groups – 1 and 2 - in old and new syllabus of CA final on Thursday while 39 cleared their pending group examinations to become CAs.

Raj Parikh, who has scored distinction throughout his bachelor’s of commerce (BCom) studies from M S University’s Faculty of Commerce, bagged city rank first in new syllabus. A first from his family to become a CA, Raj’s father Vipul coaches students in accountancy while mother Nisha is a homemaker. Raj, who has completed master’s of commerce (MCom) from MSU, wants to continue his studies in the field of law as well.

“I want to pursue corporate law. With a combination of CA and law, I would like to make a career in corporate sector,” said Raj.

Another city ranker – Anand Karukapallil – who secured first in old syllabus – bagged All India Rank (AIR) 14 in CA final. Anand, who has finished his BCom from MSU, wants to pursue civil services. “I will take a year to work somewhere and figure out what to do,” said Anand, whose father Baby, runs a business in Makarpura GIDC while mother Mercy works with an MNC in Maneja.

BCom graduate Khushbu Shah, who secured second rank in CA final in the city in old syllabus, wants to pursue a job in corporate sector. Khushbu’s father Bhagavatiprasad runs a provision store in Manjalpur area of the city while mother Seema is a housewife.

The Baroda branch of Western India Chartered Accountants Students’ Association on Friday felicitated city toppers and all the students who cleared their examinations.

Twin sisters take turns to shine

Vadodara: They have completed schooling, graduation and even master’s in commerce stream together. And in all these years, twin sisters Pankti and Pragati Vaghela have taken turns to shine.

In class XII, the duo had passed out scoring same percentage - 87.57- and both of them had stood sixth in Vadodara.

In the first level and second levels of CA course - common proficiency test (CPT) and integrated professional competence course (IPCC), Pragati had stood first in the city while Pankti had bagged third rank. As results of CA final were declared, Pankti bagged city rank first in CA new syllabus while Pragati ended up at fourth position.

“We get inspired by each other,” said Pragati, whose father Suresh works with GETCO while mother Madhvi is a homemaker.

“We have a mantra of Lord Swaminarayan: efforts and prayers equal to success. And in our result, Lord Swaminarayan and Mahant Swami have made a huge contribution,” said Pankti.

Title: 5 Ooty students to interact with PM Narendra Modi
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

PM Narendra Modi

UDHAGAMANDALAM: In a first, five school students from the Nilgiris district have been selected to take part in the third edition of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s interaction programme Pariksha Pe Charcha 2020.

Catherine George, Saahithya Bellam, Sneha Suresh and Shyamala, Class XI students of Kendriya Vidyalaya in Ooty , and a student from the Breeks All India Secondary School will meet the PM at the event to be held on January 20 in New Delhi.

After applying online, the students passed an essay competition to qualify for the event. “This is the first time five students from the Nilgiris have been selected for Pariksha Pe Charcha. As many as 64 students from Tamil Nadu will take part in the programme,” chief education officer Nazarudheen said.

Title: Tamil Nadu: 5.5kg ganja seized from car
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

TIRUPUR: The rural police seized 5.5 kilograms of ganja while it was being transported in a rented car near Avinashi on Thursday.

A police team conducting vehicle inspection on the Avinashi-Mettupalayam Road at Nambiyampalayam on Thursday evening had stopped the car. “But two passengers, who were sitting on the back seat, managed to flee. We caught another passenger, who was their partner. Further interrogations revealed that they were transporting 5.5kg ganja in the car. The accused was identified as S Sivakumar, 49, of Coonnoor in the Nilgiris,” a police officer said.

“Preliminary investigations revealed that Sivakumar, along with his associates Veerakumar of Bodinaickanur in Theni and Jerald of Madurai, were transporting the contraband from Sempatti in Dindigul district. They had reached Tirupur in a Tnstc bus and then hired a car to reach Mettupalayam,” said the officer. “Jerald is the main accused. He knew about ganja sale.” Sivakumar was remanded in judicial custody and was lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison.

The Avinashi police have registered a case.

Title: Trichy: Man, 52, sexually assaults minor girl
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

Title: 31-year-old shooting academy head shoots himself in Trichy
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

TRICHY: A 31-year-old shooter, who was running a training academy in the city allegedly committed suicide by shooting himself at his residence on Friday.

The victim has been identified as N Sasikumar from Santhosh Nagar near the Trichy International Airport. Police said, Sasikumar, who is unmarried and running the academy for the past two years in his house, shot himself with a .22mm rifle from close range inside a room around 10am.

On Friday, he was reading a newspaper, when he suddenly went to his room and locked himself up from inside. His mother heard a gunshot and came running to his room. As her attempt to open the door failed, she called her neighbours who broke open the room and found Sasikumar lying on the ground profusely bleeding from his forehead. They rushed him to the Mahatma Gandhi memorial government hospital (MGMGH) to revive him, but doctors declared him brought dead. The airport police took up the investigation. An engineer by profession, Sasikumar had a passion for shooting and has won several competitions. As he decided to teach the shooting aspirants, he started an academy.

Police inquired with his parents to find out the reason behind the suicide. Police suspect whether he could have taken the extreme step due to debts, but they are yet to ascertain a concrete reason.

Title: Nashik boy ranks fifth in CA exam
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NASHIK: Kushal Lodha, a Nashik-based student has secured fifth rank in all India chartered accountant ( CA ) exam, the result of which was declared on Thursday.

“I am really happy that my efforts have been fruitful. My parents are very happy. I think all the sacrifices that I have made by not attending birthday parties and family functions are all worth it,” Lodha told TOI.

Kushal said that he studied for 12 hours a day. He said that he used to lock himself up in his room and shut down his mobile phone while studying.

“I had cut myself out from all the social media. From July to November, I used to get up at 5 am and study in shifts of two hours each while taking a break of just 15 minutes. My parents did not even let anyone come near my room for all these months,” said Lodha.

Title: State govt plans 4 flyovers on city’s entry points
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolhapur: District guardian minister Satej Patil said that the state government was planning atleast four flyovers at the entry points of the city to avoid a situation similar to the August floods in future.

Talking to mediapersons, Patil said that financial assistance would be sought from the Asian Development Bank and that he would also try making budgetary allocation for the four flyovers. The detailed project report of the flyovers would be ready in a month.

Recalling that the floods in August had completely marooned Kolhapur city as all the entry and exit points had been blocked, Patil said that the flyovers would be used only during emergency while existing routes would continue to remain in operation. Under normal circumstances, only light vehicles would be allowed to ply on the flyovers.

He added that the condition of roads in Kolhapur and Sangli districts, which incurred maximum damage during the floods, was in a dilapidated state. “The National Disaster Management has sanctioned Rs 956 crore for the road works in the country. I will try to get maximum funds for the two districts,” said Patil.

“The government has sanctioned road works worth Rs 1,100 crore, but has allocated only Rs 150 crore for Kolhapur district. Special efforts will be taken to ensure maximum budgetary provision for the road works in the district,” he said.

Talking about traffic congestion in Kolhapur and rural parts of the district, Patil said that he would allocate Rs 3 crore for traffic discipline. “The government is thinking of allotting the contract of traffic discipline to a private company. The contract will be for a period of five years. The company will be responsible for the installation and operation of traffic signals, traffic furniture, maintenance of black spots and other works,” said th guardian minister.
