Patil said other works like installation of CCTVs in the city, land acquisition for ring road, muti-storey parking near Mahalaxmi temple and extended limits of the municipal corporation were among the other issues that he would handle on a priority basis.

Patil added that the district administration had spent only Rs 35 crore of the Rs 270 crore sanctioned through the District and Planning Development Committee. He said Rs 25 crore allocated for providing houses to Dalits had also not been spent.

Title: Enough proof to show Pathri is Saibaba birthplace: NCP leader
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: NCP legislator Durrani Abdullah Khan has said there is enough evidence to prove that Saibaba was born at Pathri and there is a fear if the town in Parbhani district of Maharashtra is developed, the importance of Shirdi, which has a grand temple of the saint, will fade.

Devotees in large numbers throng the Shri Sai Janmasthan Temple at Pathri and during a recent visit there, chief minister Uddhav Thackeray had announced a grant of Rs 100 crore for development of the town.

“People of Shirdi, in Ahmednagar district, are afraid that if Pathri is developed, the importance of Shirdi will decline,” Khan said.

There is enough evidence to prove that Pathri is the birthplace of Saibaba and President Ramnath Kovind has also endorsed the fact earlier, the NCP leader added.

“While Shirdi is Saibaba's karmabhoomi (work place) and Pathri is janmabhoomi (birthplace) and both these places have their own importance,” he said.

Tourists from across the country and world visit Pathri in large numbers, he said, adding that the town lacks good infrastructure.

“The chief minister has agreed to grant Rs 100 crore to Pathri. People of Shirdi don't have an issue with the funds, they just don't want Pathri to be called Saibaba's birthplace,” he said.

Shirdi residents fear that if Pathari comes under the limelight, the flow of devotees to their town will come down. The Saibaba temple at Shirdi draws lakhs of devotees and is one of the most popular pilgrim destinations in the country. PTI

Title: Repair of damaged Chandpole shops remains incomplete
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: Four months have passed and shopkeepers at Chandpole market are still waiting for repair of the buildings damaged due to the construction under the Smart City Project Ltd (SCPL).

Verandahs and pillars in front of shops no. 149, 150 and 151 at Chandpole market developed cracks when the work of the duct under Smart City project was going on. Looking at the cracks, authorities put iron pillars to support the structure and prevent it from falling down, but the need of their restoration has been neglected since then.

Sundar Lal, one of the shopkeepers, said that they went to all the authorities and they are trying to shrug off their responsibilities. “Officials in Smart City Project Ltd say that it is the work of Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) and JMC officials say that as the damage was done by the Smart City department, they will repair it. We are stuck and our business is getting affected by it,” said Sundar Lal.

Senior officials of the Smart City Project Ltd were not reachable for a comment. An official of SCPL who did not wish to be named said, “The outer part of the verandah comes in the domain of Smart City but the verandahs have to be repaired by the JMC. We have asked them to do the needful and will see what will be decided finally.”

Subhash Goyal, president of Chandpole Vyapaar Mandal said that the work of smart city is delayed and now the cracked verandahs are creating problems. “We have complained to all the officials in both the departments but no step has been taken. When the construction of the duct was started, smart city department promised to finish it within 90 days, which got extended to eight months. Still, they have completed just one side and now work of another side has started. It will take another eight months to complete it. Our business has been affected but government is yet to respond.”

Title: MBC reservation: Himmat urges Bainsla to fight together
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: Gujjar leader Himmat Singh on Friday appealed to Gurjar Arakshan Sangharsh Samiti leader Kirori Singh Bainsla and all the MLAs and intellectuals from the community to participate in a dharna on Saturday at Shahid Smarak on the issue of 5% reservation to the MBC (most backward class) category in government colleges and jobs.

"I request all the MLAs of the Gujjar community and Bainsla ji to shed ideological differences and fight for the rights of the MBC youth unitedly and standing on one platform. It will definitely fetch better results," said Singh on Twitter.

"The youths of the community have become aware and have learnt to fight for its interests and rights peacefully," he added.

Rajasthan assembly had passed a bill to give a separate 5% quota in jobs and educational institutions to Gujjars and four other communities by clubbing them as "most backward class" (MBC).

Title: Sanjay Raut takes on Sambhaji Bhide after he calls for bandh
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Sanjay Raut

KOLHAPUR: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut , who caused a controversy because of his series of statements, has now taken on Sambhaji Bhide , the much respected figure among Hindu organisations.

Reactingto Sangli bandh call, by Shivpratishthan Hindustan, an outfit formed by Sambhaji Bhide, Raut said on twitter, “People will not forgive who were creating unrest in Maharashtra”.

Raut’s reaction came few hours after Sambhaji Bhide demanded his removal from the post of Shiv Sena’s spokesperson. Without mentioning anybody’s name, Raut said. “Few people, who are now politically unemployed have got work contract. Let them get benefits of it but people will not forgive them”.

Several parts of Sangli district and Miraj observed the bandh. However, the bandh disturbed Sena cadre as chief minister Uddhav Thackeray was scheduled to visit Sangli for the first time after assuming the office.

Bandh call was given by Shivprtishthan Hindustan to condemn Sanjay Raut’s demand to Udayanraje Bhosale, the 13th descendant of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj to submit evidence that he was from the family of Maratha warrior. Sambhaji Bhide is highly respected by the Satara branch of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

Addressing the workers in the morning, Sambhaji Bhide refused the request made by local Sena workers to withdraw the bandh. “Our bandh is not against Shiv Sena. I wish Shiv Sena does well in the country, but we cannot tolerate the humiliation of the family of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj” he said. . He also said that the comparison between Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj and anybody else was objectionable.

Sambhaji Bhinde said that Uddhav Thackeray should demonstrate some political sagacity and remove Sanjay Raut from his post. “Raut is bringing bad name to Shiv Sena,” Bhide said.

Raut, in his earlier comment on twitter, said, “I would have been happier if the call for bandh was given when Narendra Modi was compared to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. It’s ok. I will continue to respect you”.

Several BJP workers were present when Sambhaji Bhide demanded the removal of Sanjay Raut. A group of BJP workers held demonstrations demanding an immediate apology from Raut. BJP workers also burnt effigies of Raut at various places in Sangli district. Similar bandh was observed in Satara on Thursday.

Title: Secunderabad: Citizens flock to water board to regularise illegal connections
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: The fear of vigilance raids, criminal cases and heavy penalties over illegal water connections have compelled residents to line up at the water board to get connections regularised.

Across the city, consumers are queueing up at water board offices to apply for regularisation.

In November 2019, the Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWS&SB) had introduced voluntary disclosure scheme (VDS) and given citizens time until February 21 to regularise their illegal connections.

The scheme was introduced to bring revenue to the board that was losing out on nearly Rs 20 crore per month due to illegal connections.

Since November, the Operation and Maintenance (O&M) Division-VII (Marredpally) in Secunderabad area alone has received 400 applications from costumers.

As per the HMWS&SB records for the O&M Division-VII, there are over 65,000 registered consumers receiving potable water. The number of illegal connections in the division is touted to be around 600. “We expect another 100 to 200 applications seeking regularisation under VDS drive. We will have the final number after February 21,” general manager, O&M Division-VII, K Raghunandan Reddy told TOI.

Special teams have been constituted to popularise VDS in areas such as Sitaphalmandi, Boiguda, Marredpally, Srinivas Nagar, Prakash Nagar, Tarnaka, Lalapet and Mettuguda.

“If consumers do not utilise this scheme within the stipulated period, the water board will impose payment of three years worth of water bills, Rs 300 towards service charge and payment of double charges towards connection charges to regularise illegal water connections,” added the official.

The consumer account number (CAN) will be given during the process of regularisation and consumers will get monthly water bills as per tariff, he added.

A water board official said, “To regularise an illegal connection, the consumer has to pay connection charges and pay the current monthly bill. Consumers can also contact HMWS&SB’s customer care number: 155313 to clarify their doubts.

Title: Ugandan national held for skimming ATM in Bhopal
Content:
Police have arrested the kingpin, a 27-year-old Ugandan national studying in Bengaluru, who allegedly cloned A... Read More

BHOPAL: The cybercrime branch on Friday busted an inter-state gang of fraudsters involved in skimming and stealing at least Rs 2.5 lakh from the bank accounts of at least 12 people from city over the last three months.Police have arrested the kingpin, a 27-year-old Ugandan national studying in Bengaluru, who allegedly cloned ATM cards of around a dozen Bhopal residents. During a visit in November 2019, the accused allegedly fitted a skimming device at the ATM booth of a nationalised bank in Katara Hills and stole around 2.5 lakh from their accounts since then. This is the second major ATM skimming case reported in the city. Earlier, a Mumbai-based gang had stolen data from the ATM booth at Savoy Complex in Shahpura in July 2017 and siphoned money from 73 people’s bank accounts.The accused Mukasa Andrew alias Kim was produced before the court and taken on remand for further interrogation. Police said the accused may have committed similar crimes in other states also. Cops were investigating the details of three mobile phones recovered from him to track other gang members. He had come to visit Ugandan nationals residing in Katara Hills area in November 2019 and stole data from the ATM during that period.The most shocking part is that he fitted the skimmer at the ATM for eight days to leech data from ATM cards, but neither the guards nor the bank officials maintaining spotted his activities. DIG Irshad Wali said that the accused is also a football player and currently stays in Bengaluru, where he is pursuing BCom at a private college.DIG said in November 2019, police received complaints from around a dozen people that money was withdrawn from their bank accounts. Police found that common factor in all the complaints was that money was withdrawn from a nationalised bank ATM booth located at Amaltas, Katara Hills. Cops realised that it was part of a skimming fraud and registered a case with cybercrime branch against the accused.ASP (cybercrime branch) Sandesh Jain said that during investigations, police zeroed in on Mukasa in Bengaluru. A team was sent to nab him and he was detained on January 13. He told police that he had come to Bhopal in November to visit his friends. He fitted the skimming device in the ATM booth for over 8 days and then calmly left after stealing data.Jain said that Mukasa is a hardcore fraudster and got rid of his skimming device before police nabbed him. He, however, confessed that he stole ATM cards data by installing skimmer in ATM booth and transferred it to blank ATM cards to withdraw money. Police have found evidence that he may have been involved in similar frauds in various cities. He is being interrogated further.

Title: AIADMK functionary hacked to death, 4 arrested
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Four people were arrested on Friday on charges of murdering an AIADMK functionary from Kovilpatti in Thoothukudi district.

The victim, Balamurugan R (40), was on his way home riding his two-wheeler when he was attacked by four men with sickles. The functionary subsequently bled to death on the spot. His body was later recovered by the local police and sent to the Kovipatti Government Hospital. A case was registered at the Kovipatti East Station and an investigation is underway.

Initially, police suspected political enmity as the motive for the murder since Balamurugan was reportedly said to have had a good reputation among the locals and was even favoured to win local body polls if held. However, the police on Friday arrested Thangapandian K who lived in the same locality in connection with the murder.

There was reportedly a rift between Thangapandian’s family and Balamurugan’s family ever since Balamurugan’s family allegedly attacked Thangapandian last year, during a temple festival. According to Thangapandian, he and three of his friends, Mandiramoorthy K (20), Karuppasamy M, and Madan K, hacked Balamurugan on Thursday night since he was met with cold stares from Balamurugan and his family when he returned to Kovilpatti from Coimbatore for Pongal holidays.

Earlier on Friday, AIADMK party workers and the victim’s kin held a road roko in front of the Kovilpatti GH demanding for the arrest of the accused. However, after police intervened and gave their assurance, the protesters dispersed. Balamurugan is survived by his wife Malliga B and two children.

Title: 2 former civic chiefs face arrest warrants
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolhapur: Judicial magistrate first class S S Raul has issued arrest warrants for two former Kolhapur municipal commissioners and other civic serving and a number of former civic officials in a case involving land development and encroachment.

The warrants were issued on December 30 last year against former civic chiefs Vijayalaxmi Bidri and P Siva Sankar, along with former assistant directors of town planning Dhananjay Khot and Maruti Rathod, retired deputy city engineers S K Mane and Sajiv Deshpande and serving chief city engineer Netradip Sarnobat.

However, two of the accused have got anticipatory bail, a legal official of the KMC said on condition of anonymity on Friday. “We have obtained bail for Netradip Sarnobat and Sanjiv Deshpande. For the others, we have filed a plea before the court.”

All the accused have been charged with IPC sections 217 (Public servant disobeying direction of law with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture) and section 218 (Public servant framing incorrect record or writing with intent to save person from punishment or property from forfeiture) under Indian Penal Code (IPC).

In its order, the court asked police to arrest and produce the accused before it on January 29.

Bhushan Gandhi, city-based developer, has stated in his petition that he had sought to develop a site (623 A/4) in the Jawahar Nagar area and the layout was sanctioned by Bidri on the condition that rehabilitate the people who had encroached upon a proposed development plan road.

The builder has stated that he had been asked to rehabilitate four families and that he had agreed to do so on humanitarian grounds. However, the local leaders started forcing me to rehabilitate all the families who have encroached upon the proposed DP road.

“When I refused to rehabilitate all the families, the new commissioner, P Shiv Shankar, cancelled the layout of the development I had proposed,” Gandhi has said.

Bidri is currently posted as regional director, Staff Selection Commission, while P Shiva Sankar is now Parbhani district collector.

Title: Tamil Nadu: Disabled workers of rural job scheme yet to receive wages for last year’s work
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: More than 500 people with disabilities from various parts of Tamil Nadu have written to the government saying their wages are due for the last six months for work done under the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act ( MGNREGA ).

“There are more than three lakh disabled workers awaiting the money. We are representing all of them,” said V Christuraj, one of the workers from Perunkozhi panchayat in Uthiramerur taluk, who lost his leg a few years ago. He pointed out that it was the first time in three years that such a delay had occurred. “People like us find it hard to find employment. This is our only means to make ends meet and we are struggling without money,” he said.

Under MGNREGA, people in rural areas, including those with disabilities, get 100 days of wage employment. The daily wage is Rs 229. People with disabilities do odd jobs like looking after children of labourers in creches, distributing water and food, among others. If they are able, they are assigned tasks like digging ponds or roads. Though the rules mandate that they be given full payment within 15 days, workers allege they are yet to receive wages for the work they put in six months ago.

“We all worked for around 40 days. We are only asking for our due salaries. It is demeaning to repeatedly ask for it,” said K Arumugam of Kancheepuram.

Muthu Meena, joint director of the rural development department, said, “Our current liability is Rs 800 crore. We are expecting Rs 500 crore to be released by the Centre in a few days and the amount will be deposited in their accounts.” Muthu Meena added that all dues until October 4, 2019, have been settled and only those who had worked since October 5 were yet to be paid.

“This is a completely false claim,” said S Namburajan, general secretary of the Tamil Nadu Association for the Rights of All Differently Abled and Caregivers.

“Workers have shown their bank statements to them, which proves that most haven’t received anything for the work done before October,” he said.

“We are still not sure about the claims, but will look into it again,” said joint director Muthu Meena.

Title: Vadodara: Mother of three hangs herself at home
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: When she woke up late in the night in her room, eight-year-old Jhanvi Bhartia was shocked. She saw her mother hanging from the fan right above her head. Thirty-four-year-old Sapna committed suicide by hanging herself with a piece of cloth in her house in Darjipura area of the city on Thursday night. Harni police have registered a complaint and begun investigations in the case.

According to police, Sapna went to her room at about 10.30pm and her husband slept in a separate room. She took all her three children- Jhanvi, Rushab and Archana - in the room. Sometime during midnight, she ended her life when all the three kids were sleeping. When asked about the reasons behind the suicide, police said there was an argument between husband and wife over some thing and it had upset her.

Police will question family members to ascertain the exact reason behind Sapna taking this extreme step.

Title: Behmai massacre: Verdict likely to be pronounced today
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kanpur: A special court is likely to deliver its judgment on Saturday on the massacre of 20 people by bandit Phoolan Devi in Behmai village of Kanpur Dehat nearly four decades ago.

Earlier, the court verdict was expected on January 6 but it was deferred to January 18 after defence counsel Girish Narayan Dubey sought time to file citations of judgments of the apex court to support his case.

The court had asked him to file citations by January 16.

District government counsel Rajeev Porwal said the court could deliver its judgment on Saturday as the defense counsel had submitted rulings in support of his claim.

On February 14, 1981, Phoolan Devi, with the help of four gangs led by Ram Autar, Mustaqueem, Ram Kesh and Lalloo, raided Behmai village to avenge alleged sexual violence perpetrated on her by men of Thakur caste who dominated the village.

She was allegedly held captive by the gang of dacoit Lala Ram Sri Ram and sexually assaulted for several days.

Phoolan not only looted the village but also dragged 20 men outside the village and shot them around 5 pm.

Besides Phoolan, accused Ram Autar, Mustaqueem, Balram, Moti, Vrindavan, Ram Prakash, Ram Pal, Lallu Baghel, Balwan, Lallu Yadav, Ram Shankar, Jaggan, Prem, Nanda and Baladeen either died or were gunned down in police encounters.

The present trial is being held against four accused – Bheekha, Posa, Vishwanath alias Putani alias Krishna Swarup, and Shyam Babu.

Posa is in jail while Vishwanath alias Putani, Shyam Babu and Ram Singh were released on bail. Three dacoits, including Man Singh, Vishwanath alias Ashok and Ram Singh, are on the run.

Title: Cong MLA seeks spl House session on CAA
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: Wajib Ali, Congress MLA from Nagar on Friday, demanded a special assembly session to pass a resolution against the controversial Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ), which has invited protest and demonstrations across the country.

Ali met chief minister Ashok Gehlot at the CMO earlier in the day to press his demand. “I told Gehlot that CAA is against the basic tenets of the Constitution and it is highly divisive in nature. Like Kerala and Punjab decided to hold a special session and to pass a resolution in the assembly, I requested CM for the same in Rajasthan,” said Ali, who was elected on the BSP ticket. He along with five other BSP MLAs merged into the Congress in September.

“CM told me that he is touch with the CMs of other states who have taken a stand against CAA and will positively consider my request,” said Ali. He said the nationwide protest over the issue makes it imperative for all parties who believe in the constitution of Baba Sahab Ambedkar. Gehlot is under pressure from civil society members who wanted him to take a concrete call against the CAA. tnn

Title: Ashok Gehlot takes stock of law & order situation in Rajasthan
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ashok Gehlot

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Friday took a review meeting with senior police officials on the law and order situation in the state. During the meeting he asked that the additional director generals (ADGs) should carry out an inspection of their respective areas for at least two days every two months.

“The aim behind appointing ADGs as the range in-charges is to better the law and order situation. This will help in getting the government the actual feedback on the ground reality so that initiatives can be taken for better policing. Also we should be prepared for use of contemporary technology to control crime in the state”, said the CM while addressing the officials during the meeting. CM also directed that the District Special Teams (DST) to curb organised mafia should be trained properly and be provided all the necessary resources. According to CM’s directives, a pilot project will also be introduced Pilot in Bharatpur, Bhiwadi and Alwar to see the time taken by cops to reach a crime spot after being informed to reduce the emergency response time after a crime is reported by calling emergency numbers 100 or 102. Gehlot that to keep the police personnel motivated and to ensure this, cops posted in the districts should be promoted on time. He said the promotions should be done in three months for those in line for it. Apart from this, he asked the cops to also take necessary steps to curb the advertisements of ‘miraculous medicines’ in various media outlets.

Keeping in mind the recent cooperative societies frauds, he also approved the formation of ‘Savings and Investment Fraud Control Unit’ which will function under Special Operations Group (SOG).

The CM also expressed happiness with the fact that over four lakh women and children have been given self defence training till now from January 1 since the centres were set up in all the districts. He said more women and children should be encouraged to undergo this training. Also steps have to be taken to stop child trafficking in the state. CM has also extended minimum age cut for appearing in the constable exam by one year.

Title: HC breather for three mining scam accused
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: In major relief to the accused in the mining scam, high court on Friday quashed the order declaring the three accused fugitives and directed them to appear in ED court on February 17.

Justice Sanjeev Prakash Sharma gave this order on Friday on the petitions of the three accused Sanjay Sethi, Shyam Sunder Singhvi and Pankaj Gehlot. The high court has quashed the order dated January 3 this year, of the Special Court of ED cases against three accused Sanjay Sethi, Shyam Sunder Singhvi and Pankaj Gehlot in the mining scam bribery case of Rs 2.55 crore, in which they were declared fugitives.

At the same time, the court also cancelled the order of September 21 last year by the ED court, whereby the accused were summoned with an arrest warrant after cancelling their bail bond. They approached the high court seeking exemption from appearance in the ED court on health grounds. Sanjay Sethi said he was suffering from a neuro disorder and Shyam Sundar Singhvi from spine injury while Pankaj Gehlot had cited poor health. During the hearing, the State Government Public Prosecutor Sher Singh Mahla said accused are deliberately avoiding appearing in the court of ED cases.

Title: Gold, foreign notes seized at Chennai airport
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Customs officials at Chennai airport seized gold worth Rs 1 crore and undeclared foreign currency valued at Rs 10.8 lakh on Thursday and Friday. One passenger was arrested.

Customs said that on Thursday, four passengers — Shahul Hameedu Badhusha, 37, Yasar Arabath, 20, Azarudeen, 34, of Ramanathapuram and Usoof Moulana, 42, of Chennai — arrived from Colombo by Sri Lankan Airlines flight UL 127, and were intercepted and searched. They were found concealing 12 packs of gold paste in their rectum. On extraction, 947g of gold valued at Rs 38.8 lakh was recovered. The officers also recovered a gold chain weighing 50g and valued at Rs 2 lakh from the trousers of one of the passengers.

In another incident on Thursday night, Ramanathan, 27, of Ramanathapuram, who was bound for Bangkok by Indigo flight 6E 91 was intercepted and checked as he was proceeding towards immigration. He was found carrying 13,700 euros, 3,400 Thai bahts, 225 Malaysian ringits and $121 in various denominations, equivalent to Rs 10.8 lakh.

In two other cases on Thursday night, Kalandaar Irfan, 21, of Chennai, and Anjana Niraj Nelson, 37 of Sri Lanka, who arrived from Colombo on Indigo Airlines flight 6E 1204 were found concealing six packs of gold in paste form in their rectum. The inspection yielded 564g of gold valued at Rs 23.2 lakh. On Friday morning, Warnakulasuriya Maria Chrishanthi, 53, of Sri Lanka who arrived from Colombo on SpiceJet SG 02 and Fathima Gani, 51, of Chennai, who came from Bangkok on Indigo flight 6E 92 were intercepted. Checks yielded a gold ingot weighing 491g from Maria and a plastic pouch with gold in paste form from Fathima.

Title: 33 years on, Rajasthan woman accused of killing own child acquitted
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Prem Kanwar

JAIPUR: A woman, who was convicted for life by a lower court for allegedly killing her own baby, has been acquitted of the charge by the high court, after a long 33-year wait. When the incident took place, she was hardly 18 years old.

The then Malpura (Pachewar now) police station in Tonk district had registered an FIR on December 8, 1986, after recovering the body of the infant (sex not mentioned) from a nearby pond. It was said that somebody threw the unwanted baby in the pond. Police after investigation booked Prem Kanwar, who had given birth to a baby, but her husband sent her back home due to some domestic dispute. The police filed chargesheet against her based on the allegation by her husband and in-laws and the trial court convicted her for life in 1989 on circumstantial evidence. After the incident, her husband had abandoned her, and later he remarried.

She, with the help of her family members, appealed against her conviction in the high court and the court granted her bail. She has been out on bail all these years. After granting bail in the case, the case was pending in the high court.

The case came up for hearing in high court in 2020. But the accused could not be traced. The court then appointed lawyer Shalini Sharon, amicus curiae in the case. Sharon, with the help of district legal services authority, traced the woman. She ekes out a living by working in the agriculture fields after the death of her parents. The woman broke down when she was given the news of her acquittal, saying that now, she could sleep peacefully.

Title: Fresh scrutiny of damaged houses ordered
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolhapur: District guardian minister Satej Patil on Friday ordered Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) to complete the technical scrutiny of damages occurred to 131 houses in the city during the floods.

Earlier, the survey was carried out but compensation was denied to these families claiming that scrutiny is incomplete. A delegation led by activist Gani Ajrekar met Patil and raised the concern.

Ajrekar said, “It has been almost six months since the flood hit the city. However, these 131 families are still making frequent trips to the government offices to get the compensation. We met the minister and told him that these are genuine cases but did not receive compensation. The civic officials were called and they were told that a fresh scrutiny of damages should be carried out and accordingly the compensation amount should be fixed and released immediately. The earlier survey was carried out by the Talathi’s deployed by the state government. However, they lacked technical skills.”

“Reports made by Talathis were submitted to the tehsildar office that rejected the claims stating that there is no scrutiny by technical authorities. Around 900 houses were affected badly and around 11,000 citizens were displaced during the August floods,” he added.

The state government had assured compensation of up to Rs 50,000, however Patil then in the opposition had demanded Rs 1 lakh for houses that were completely damaged.

Meanwhile, civic officials claimed that they will consider the option of Prime Minister Awas Yojana to provide housing units to flood-affected citizens and the idea has been put forth to rehabilitate the citizens permanently.

Title: Four spl trains for festive rush
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Secunderabad: South Central Railway (SCR) will be running four Jansadharan Sankranti special trains from Secunderabad to clear extra rush of passengers during Sankranti festival.

Two train services (train no 07041) between Secunderabad-Sirpur Kagazhnaga- Hyderabad will run on Friday. Similarly, two train services, (train no 07043) between Secunderabad-Khammam- Hyderabad will run on January 19. TNN

Title: KMT delegation to visit Mumbai, Thane to study e-buses operations
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolhapur: A delegation of Kolhapur Municipal Transport (KMT) is proposed to visit the Mumbai and Thane urban transport undertakings to study the operation of electric buses.

The delegation will comprise of transport committee members and officials of the KMT. A similar study tour was conducted to Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad in June last year.

The KMT has submitted a proposal to the central government for 50 electric buses. The central government sanctions subsidy amount up to Rs 50 lakh per bus to buy the e-buses. The officials claimed that the proposal is in the final stages of the approval and before the procuring of the buses start, the corporators and the officials will gain knowledge about the operations of the e-buses.

A senior official of KMT requesting anonymity said, “We will get the details required to run the electric buses in the city. The demonstrations of the electric buses will be held at these two transport undertakings. A plan to run the electric buses will be prepared as it requires expertise. We are expecting the approval to the proposal submitted by us soon.”

The members in the delegation will travel in the electric buses to gain experience. Also, they will speak to the transport officials. The electric buses are costly and one bus can cost up to Rs 80 lakh.

The KMT does not have adequate funds to raise its share of the cost and may request the state government to sanction the funds. “Apart from the roads, the infrastructure for electric buses is different. The charging stations have to be set up and the technical expertise needs to be recruited for the maintenance of the buses. Some of the civic transport undertakings are facing challenges to run the e-buses. We will take all the challenges and difficulties into consideration before the actual operations of the e-buses. The fares of the e-buses will be different considering the huge cost required to run and maintain them. Also, the delegation will study the amount of reduction in air pollution after induction of the e-buses,” said the official.

The study tour was planned for last week, however, it has been postponed owing to several functions coming up. The study tour is expected to take place early next month.

Title: No HC relief for Kuldeep Sengar in rape case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Delhi high court on Friday refused to suspend the sentence of expelled BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar , serving a life term for raping a minor girl in 2017.

Seeking responses to Sengar’s appeal, the HC also asked the CBI and the survivor to give their stands. A bench comprising Justices Manmohan and Sangeeta Dhingra Sehgal, however, granted Sengar two months to deposit the fine of Rs 25 lakh ordered by the trial court; of this, Rs 10 lakh will be released to the rape survivor.

During the hearing, the bench indicated it wasn’t inclined to suspend the sentence or fine amount as Sengar was on trial in other cases too. His counsel then withdrew the application for suspension of sentence.

“Too much tragedy happened with the victim in this case. In the facts of the case, we are not inclined to suspend the sentence. You have to pay Rs 10 lakh to the victim. There can be no condition to it,” the bench said, adding that Sengar “can’t be released because he is an undertrial in other cases also in which trial is going on”.

Sengar’s advocate claimed his client did not have the money to deposit the fine.

Title: Body of soldier killed in avalanche to reach today
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kanpur: A pall of gloom descended Birahinpur village in Patara area of the district after news of the death of an Army jawan Dharmendra reached on Friday. Dharmendra got martyred in an avalanche in Kargil in Laddakh on Tuesday.

His mortal remains will arrive in the village on Saturday.

Dharmendra Singh, 35, was a resident of Birahinpur village in Patara of Ghatampur. Three other Army jawans also got injured in the avalanche. The family members of the deceased soldier said that his corpse would reach the village on Saturday.

While an immediate rescue operation was launched by the Army to save the jawans but Dharmendra could not be rescued, a family member said quoting Army personnel.

He said that an Army post had been hit by the avalanche and four jawans got buried underneath it. The injured jawans were admitted to the Army hospital in Kargil.

Dharmendra, who had joined the Army as havildar in 1999, is survived by his wife Sunita, two kids Utkarsh and Rajvardhan and mother Shiv Devi. His wife and children live in Chandigarh, a family member said. He came to his home during the Dussehra festival last year.

Top Army officials, including General MM Naravane, offered deepest condolences to late Dharmendra's bereaved family members.

Title: Mumbai: BEST to not ply some buses tomorrow, railways to run special trains
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BEST will not run its services on routes 105, 106, 108, 112, 123, 125, 132, 133, 136 and 155 till 1.30pm on Sunday in view of the Mumbai Marathon .

BEST chowkies will be shut too in several parts of South Mumbai in the morning hours.

On Western Railway , a special train will leave Virar at 2.20am and reach Churchgate at 4.02am and another will depart Borivli at 3.15am and reach Churchgate at 4.22am.

On Central Railway , an early morning train will leave Kalyan at 3am and arrive at CSMT at 4.30am while another train will leave from Panvel at 3.10am and arrive at CSMT at 4.30am. Trains from Kalyan will be diverted on the up fast line between Diva and Mulund stations and will not halt at Kalva and Mumbra stations due to a special block for dismantling of a foot over bridge at Thane on Saturday midnight.

Title: Kumaon receives rain, snow; more in offing in next 24 hours
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Snow and rain threw life out of gear in many areas as some roads got temporarily blocked

NAINITAL/PITHORAGARH/BAGESHWAR: Several districts of Kumaon, including Nainital, Almora and Udham Singh Nagar received heavy rainfall and snowfall since Thursday night.

The rains that started late on Thursday, continued through most of Friday in Nainital and Haldwani as well as Kichha and Mukteshwar areas of Kumaon region.

Places in the upper reaches of Nainital such as Kilbury and Mukteshwar received snowfall as well. “Though it was raining since last night there was a little snowfall on Friday morning as well,” said a resident of Nainital who works in Kilbury.

Meanwhile, Mukteshwar also received some rainfall on Friday though it kept raining most of the day. “It has been raining here since last night. Several roads are blocked due to snowfall while the hill station is also draped in snow ,” said Pradeep Dharamwal, a resident of Mukteshwar.

Snow and rain threw life out of gear in many areas as some roads got temporarily blocked. Kilbury Road as well as the road to Mukteshwar was covered in snow leading to traffic snarls. “Although the administration did not close the road, drivers refused to go that side as roads had become slippery,” Dharamwal said.

Meanwhile, the Met department has predicted more rain and snow in the Kumaon region in the next few days. “While the plains in Kumaon region are expected to receive rainfall on Saturday, the hills are expected to receive a decent amount of snowfall as well,” said a Met department official.

Rain and snowfall disturbed normal life in Pithoragarh as well. The Munsyari-Thal road, which was opened on January 15 after remaining blocked for 10 days, got closed again due to snowfall. The Pithoragarh-Tanakpur road also got blocked for two hours after landslide at Swala. The district disaster management office confirmed that the stretch from Kalamuni to Ratapani had got covered in one-foot-deep snow as well.

Incessant rain and snow spells affected traffic movements on at least three roads in Bageshwar district on Friday.

“High-altitude areas, including Vacham, Karmi, Kunwari, Humptikapari and Ratirketi received snowfall till evening and rainfall lashed other areas of the district throughout the day. Rikhari-Vachham, Shama-Leeti-Gogina, and Shama-Naukuri motorways have also been disrupted due to snowfall," Shikha Suyal, district disaster management officer, told TOI. The official added that the teams deployed to clear roads are facing challenge due to continuous rain and snowfall.

PWD officials told TOI that Bageshwar-Girechina motor road, which has repeatedly been disrupted due to landslides for a long time, has become risky and thus, the department had temporarily closed the stretch.The Bageshwar district magistrate also issued instructions to all the concerned departments to remain alert in view of the weather conditions.

Title: Tamil Nadu: In this school, cops teach students, meet their demands
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The Thirumangalam police adopted the Municipal High School in Padikuppam this week

CHENNAI: The 135 students of Municipal High School in Padikuppam near Thirumangalam are a happy lot. Police personnel teach students here, clean the premises, provide the students nutritional fruits occasionally and inculcate moral values.

The Thirumangalam police , who adopted the government school this week, take delight in fulfilling even the modest demands of the students.

The institution, which was launched as a primary school in 1966, was upgraded to a middle school in 2002 before a high school on July 18, 2017.

Maintaining a positive image of ‘khaki’ has always been challenging and police are taking serious efforts to earn the love and respect of the students in the school. Police personnel have also taken up the responsibility to revamp the dilapidated school building.

Apart from the 135 students, the school has eight teachers handling various subjects.

The innovative idea to adopt the school was mooted by Chennai police commissioner A K Viswanathan after which M S Muthusamy, deputy commissioner, Anna Nagar, and inspector M Ravi made the dream come true. “This has given us more chances to interact with students. People and children no longer fear us but willingly co-operate in maintaining law and order,” said Thirumangalam inspector Ravi. This would help police curb crime in the area in the long run, they believe.

So far, the policemen have bought tables, chairs, plates, a march-past drum for the students and a bureau to keep the certificates of the children safely. They have also taken up restoration work of the school building by raising funds so that poor students get to experience better facilities. Earlier, it was a place for anti-social elements who used the campus to consume liquor and discard the bottles on the premises, setting a bad precedent for the students, sources said.

M Maheswari, headmistress, told TOI that the police personnel were a blessing in disguise for them.

“They meet even the smallest demands made by us. With better amenities, the students are able to concentrate on studies better,” she said.

The school is set to get a new library soon.

Title: 60% road accidents last year were hit-and-run: CP
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: Commissioner of Police Vishwas Nangare-Patil said that 60% road accidents in the city last year were hit-and-run cases.

Expressing displeasure with the attitude of motorists involved in hit-and-run, he said that tracing such motorists would become easier if the CCTV cameras were set up on the city roads under the smart city project.

Nangare-Patil was speaking at the inauguration of the road safety campaign 2020 organised by Nashik First and Hero MotoCorp Ltd at the Children’s Traffic Education Park.

Besides Nangare-Patil, Nashik RTO Bharat Kalaskar, Deuty RTO Vinay Ahire, ACP (Traffic) Mangalsingh Suryawanshi and directors of Nashik First organisation which has been operating the Traffic Education Park over the past five years, were present during the function.

Expressing his view at the inauguration of the road safety campaign, the city’s police commissioner said that improving the vehicular traffic system has always been the police’s top priority and with strict action against erring motorists, there were 48 lesser road deaths last year as compared to 2018.

Nangare-Patil said that road accidents claimed 1.5 lakh lives in 2018. He said that it should be a collective responsibility of everyone to wage a war against this problem so that no one loses their life due to someone else’s mistake.

Stressing that road safety was based on three Es comprising Enforcement, Engineering and Education, the CP said that while the police and the RTO are doing their work properly, Nashik First was doing a commendable job of educating motorists about road safety.

Title: Kolhapur: Traffic diversion for inauguration of Shahu Samadhi Sthal
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The traffic diversion will be into effect from morning until afternoon.

KOLHAPUR: Citizens will have to switch from their usual routes to alternative ones on Sunday due to the inauguration ceremony of the Shahu Samadhi Sthal built in the Nursery Baug area. The traffic diversion will be into effect from morning until afternoon.

The top leaders of the state, ministers and representatives of progressive outfits are expected to attend the ceremony. After the inauguration, the dignitaries will give a speech from the dais set up at the Dasara Chowk.

The roads leading towards the Nursery Baug area located near the Chhatrapati Pramilatai Raje (CPR) Hospital and the Dasara Chowk will remain shut for vehicular traffic.

A senior traffic official, on the condition of anonymity, said, “The roads along these two points will remain shut until afternoon. We are concerned about the traffic moving from the Shivaji Bridge towards the city. The commuters will have to take a longer route to cross the city. The vehicular traffic will be diverted from Jamdar Club to Gangavesh from where it will lead towards Papachi Tickti and from there to Shivaji Chowk and futher towards Bindu Chowk and then moving towards the outskirts of the city from the Temblaiwadi Flyover. Since it is a Sunday, the entry of vehicles from outside to the city is more as compared to intra-city traffic. For the commuters of the second category, the diversions will be from collectors office, Venus Corner, Ayodhya Talkies and the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation building.”

Parking arrangements will be made at Venus Corner. The parking of the vehicles of the dignitaries will be reserved at the Panchaganga Ghat.

Title: Hyderabad: Engineering student held for posting woman’s morphed photos online
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: The Rachakonda cybercrime police arrested a 20-year-old engineering student for harassing a 20-year-old woman by posting her morphed obscene photos on a photo and video-sharing social networking platform.

N Akshay, the accused, is a student of a college in Narapally. In November 2019, the mother of the 20-year-old girl lodged a complaint with the cybercrime police, alleging that an unknown accused had posted her daughter’s morphed obscene photos on the social networking site.

Police analysed the details of the account of the accused. He was arrested from his house in Lalaguda on Friday. During interrogation, the accused confessed that he had sent a friend request to the girl from a fake ID on the social networking site to conceal his identity.

After the victim accepted his request, he saved her personal photos and morphed them with nude photos downloaded from the Internet. “The accused made one of the morphed photos of the girl as the display picture of his fake account and even sent messages to her from that account. Subsequently, the accused also posted more morphed photos of the girl from his fake account and even made video calls to her. The accused deleted the fake account as she rejected his calls,” said the police.

Based on the complaint, the accused was arrested and remanded in judicial custody.

Title: Rajasthan achievers share same score, school
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Akhil Jain and Parth Dwivedi (Right)

JAIPUR: For two years, Akhil Jain and Parth Dwivedi of Kota, have shared the common space from morning till evening with a difference of a wall, literally. They studied at a same school but sections were different in the first half and prepared for JEE in a common coaching institute but batch was different in the second half. The unusual bond resulted into a rare coincident. Both made into the super league of nine students who scored 100 percentile at JEE Main I 2020 result announced on Friday against 8.6 lakh students appeared in the exam.

“Every day we use to greet each other during morning prayers in the school, sometimes in science labs and at coaching centre. I remember at some occasions we consulted each other to clear our doubts but never had the idea that we will score the same percentile and rank one after another,” said Jain, a resident of Vigyan Nagar, Kota. His schoolmate also scored same marks.

Born and brought up in Kota, Jain has been inspired by the success stories churned out by coaching industry.

“It’s like a dream come true. I have not decided anything on the IITs and will decide after IIT-Advanced,” said Jain. Both study from Disha Delphi Public School and prepared for IITs from Allen Career Institute. Inspired from his father Vineet Dwivedi who is a general manager, Centre for Railway Information System (CRIPS) Vineet Dwivedi and mother Neeti Dwivedi additional SP of Lucknow, Parth is keen to follow the footsteps of his parents by serving the nation. “I am least interested in going abroad for studies or job. I take it as my duty to build the nation and contribute in its progress,” said Parth, who is eyeing to pursue Computer Science from IIT-Bombay.

Reacting on the ongoing protest, Parth feels that students’ primary objective has to study. “Before participating in any protest students should work with some NGOs or at the ground level for the last man standing,” said Parth.

Sharing tips on how to crack this exam, Parth says that focus should be given equally on all subjects.

Title: Korean co to set up aloe vera gel plant
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: A Korean company has decided to invest $5 million (Rs 35 crore) to produce 10,000 tonne aloe vera gel and juice. The company plans to increase the investment to $31 million for producing 40,000 tonne aloevera gel and juice after five years. Korea Beverage Manufacture’s chairman on Friday met chief minister Ashok Gehlot and informed him that they are interested to set up the plant in Jodhpur. The chief minister assured all cooperation on behalf of the government including making land available to the company.

Title: Transport dept proposes removal of BRTS corridors
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: The state road safety council at its meeting here on Friday proposed the removal of the BRTS corridors from the roads in Jaipur.

Transport minister Pratap Singh Khachariyawas said the state road safety council has found that the ill-planned BRTS corridors is one of the main reasons for accidents in the city and has recommended to the urban development and housing department to remove the BRTS corridors on city roads. The minister said this at a media briefing at the secretariat on Friday.

The minister said as per the good samaritan guidelines, all private hospitals were duty-bound to provide treatment to those injured in accidents. If they are not doing it, legal action would be initiated against them.

He said the officials in the medical and health department have been instructed to display the good samaritan guidelines in both private and government hospitals, and give wide publicity through advertisements to create awareness.

The minister expressed concern over the high rate of accidents in the state. The past year saw a spurt in accidents and casualties. Compared to 2018, 1,737 more accidents were reported in 2019 while the injured and dead were also higher by 1,432 and 243 respectively. Khachariyawas said that all the related departments have been directed to work in tandem to reduce the accident rates in the current year.

About 40% of the accidents in the state are reported at the national highways. The main reason is there are no barricades on the side of the roads which is resulting in stray cattle and animals entering the highways. He directed the NHAI officials to ensure construction of proper barricades on both sides of the roads, removing the black spots, proper maintenance of the facilities to road users, emergency services and lighting as the commuters pay toll tax for road use.

ADG Pankaj Kumar Singh, said over 31 lakh were penalized last year for traffic violations, earning a revenue of Rs 48 crore by traffic police. He said the police department had sent to the transport department over 65,000 licenses for cancellation for various periods as compared to 2018.

Title: Twin murder case: Accused sent to custody till January 28
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jaipur: The hired killer in the Pratap Nagar double murder case was on Friday sent to judicial custody till January 28. Police have revealed that the accused husband lied about his friend recommending the killer to mislead the cops and the entire conspiracy was hatched by the two accused.

The hired killer, Saurabh Chaudhary was sent to judicial custody on Friday while the accused husband Rohit Tiwari was sent to jail two days back. Saurabh had killed Shweta Tiwari and her son on January 7. He along with Rohit were arrested on January 10. During investigation, Rohit had claimed that that his friend Hari Singh who stays in Udaipur had recommended his brother-in-law Saurabh for the job. Rahul Jain, DCP East said, “We questioned Hari Singh and found that he had no role in these murders. In fact, he had a positive effect on Rohit’s family. He was like a mediator between Rohit and Shweta. He would regularly talk and try to pacify the situation. The two accused planned and executed the murder on their own.”

Cops are still trying to find Shweta’s phone which Saurabh had taken with him after the murders. He apparently broke it and threw it in a drain. Questioning revealed that Rohit and Shweta also had frequent arguments.

Title: A dogged battle for pet’s custody in Uttarakhand
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The dog's owner said Tiger has been a part of his family for the past two years and he could never make a mist... Read More

RUDRAPUR: In an unusual incident, a pet dog had to spend a night in the custody of Katoratal police in Kashipur area of Udham Singh Nagar district, after two people claimed his ownership. Police had initially sought some time from the claimants to settle the dispute as both sides were unwilling to budge. Interestingly, the dog also showed liking for both the persons.

Sub-inspector Madan Singh Bisht, in-charge of Katoratal police station, said that Nirmal Singh, a resident of Shiv Nagar colony, had registered a complaint with the police that his pet ‘Labrador’ had gone missing on December 26. “On January 12, Amit Kumar, a resident of Pant Park in Kashipur wrote a post on social media saying that he had recovered a Labrador from railway crossing in Kashipur. Nirmal’s son, Anand Verma, noticed the post and claimed to have identified his dog by the photograph. He approached Kumar and after sharing the dog’s old pictures, reached his home and returned with his pet,” Bisht said.

However, the incident took a twist when on January 16, Dr Anurag Chauhan, a resident of Shubh Vihar colony in Awas Vikas of Kashpur, reached out to Amit Kumar and claimed that the dog about whom Kumar had posted is his.

Kumar said, “When Singh approached me with his pet dog Tiger’s picture, it resembled with the dog that I found and, therefore, I handed it to him. But when Dr Anurag Chauhan reached out to me and showed me his pet dog named Broonie’s photo, I could not make any difference.”

Bisht added, “The photo brought by Dr Chauhan resembled the one that Kumar had rescued. Dr Chauhan then went to Nirmal Singh’s place and claimed ownership of the dog. The matter was then brought to us and to our surprise we found that the dog was responding well to both the parties. We then decided to keep the dog in our custody till the time the matter was sorted.”

After keeping the dog in their custody for a night, Katoratal police then came up with a unique idea. Bisht said, “On Friday, we decided that we will drop the dog at a point from where he can reach his owner’s house, while keeping an eye and then whichever house the dog chooses to go will be recognised as the owner.”

The experiment became a success when Tiger reached Singh’s house on his own.

Singh told TOI that Tiger has been a part of his family for the past two years and he could never make a mistake in identifying him.

“All’s well that ends well. It was the best possible way to reach a solution and even Dr Chauhan seems happy with the outcome,” Bisht said.

Title: Judgment in Hajipur case on Jan 27
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A fast-track will deliver its judgment in the rape and murder of three minor girls at Hajipur village in Yadadri Bhuvanagiri district on January 27. The prime accused, 28-year-old Marri Srinivas Reddy , has pleaded not guilty in court, while the public prosecutor has sought death penalty, describing the crimes as ‘rarest of the rare’.

The first additional sessions court in Nalgonda, which has been designated as the fast-track court, heard arguments on Friday and reserved its judgment.

Defence counsel Rabindranath Tagore claimed the evidence did not prove involvement of Srinivas Reddy in the crime.

The accused took the plea that on the day of the crime, he was at Kukatpally .

Title: Hyderabad: College employee beaten to death for harassing woman
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A 36-year-old accountant of a private college was bludgeoned to death by the family of a woman he was harassing at Allapur on Friday.

The victim was identified as Rajaiah, an accountant at Sri Chaitanya College in Madhapur . Four years ago, Rajaiah met the family of a woman in her twenties at Moosapet and wanted to marry her. However, she refused to marry him and married another man. “Rajaiah was upset that the woman did not marry him. He continued to harass the woman, her husband and the woman’s mother,” Balanagar ACP K Purushotham said.

Fed up with the behaviour of Rajaiah, the woman’s husband, Srisailam, his mother, Lakshmi, his mother-in-law, Chitti, and his friend Jayaram went to Rajaiah’s house on Friday and attacked him with sticks. “Rajaiah succumbed to injuries while undergoing treatment at Gandhi Hospital,” the ACP said. Police took the accused into custody and registered a murder case.

Title: Kanpur: Man battered to death in road rage in Ghatampur
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Photo used for representational purpose only

KANPUR: In an alleged incident of road rage, a 40-year-old man was battered to death after a quarrel wherein a cyclist accused him of hitting his bicycle with his motorcycle in Ghatampur area of the district on late Wednesday night. Police, after lodging an FIR on Thursday, have launched an investigation in this regard.

The deceased has been identified as Rajesh Kumar Yadav, a resident of Rehti Khalasa village of Ghatampur, who was beaten up by four people over the issue. Yadav was a dairy owner.

“During the investigation, it came to light that Rajesh was returning home around 7.30 pm on Wednesday on a motorcycle. He had a quarrel with a local, identified as Deepak, after the latter’s bicycle was allegedly hit by his two-wheeler. Deepak along with his three aides allegedly attacked Rajesh with lathis following which he sustained injuries and succumbed while on way to the hospital”, said circle officer Ghatampur Ravi Kumar Singh.

“A case under sections 302 (murder) and 34 (acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention) of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) has been registered against Deepak. He has been taken into custody and further investigation is underway,” the CO said.

Title: Uddhav Thackeray slams Centre for ‘comatose’ economy
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Uddhav Thackeray

KOLHAPUR: Chief minister Uddhav Thackeray on Friday said that the state government will not bow down before central government asking for funds when it is not willing to help in the current challenging times, adding that the economy has gone into comatose condition because of the central government.

Thackeray was in Islampur to inaugurate the new building of the tehsil office and the cattle feed testing and research centre started by Rajarambapu co-operative sugar mill run by senior minister Jayant Patil.

“The country's economy has gone into comatose state. Everyone knows that central government is behind the worsening of the economy. The central government does not provide aid to the state government. The central government did not provide any funds during the August floods last year to help those affected. Also, the responsibility of providing jobs to the youth is upon us. The agriculture and industry are two important wheels. We will not bow down before central government for any help,”” Thackeray said.

Thackeray also announced loan waiver of up to Rs 2 lakh to the farmers. The leaders from the region claimed that the loan waiver will not give respite to the farmers in Kolhapur district. “I had promised to waive the loans of farmers. Now, loans of up to Rs 2 lakh are waived. The farmers paying loan amount regularly will also be taken care of,” added Thackeray.

Title: District judge recruitment: Lawyer moves SC on cut in age limit
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Supreme Court

CHENNAI: A city-based lawyer has moved the Supreme Court challenging the notification issued by the Madras high court for direct recruitment of district judges, alleging that the upper age limit for OBC/MBC candidates had been ‘arbitrarily’ reduced to 45 from 48 years.

Advocate N S Sivakumar also wanted the Supreme Court to permit him to apply for and participate in the recruitment process, as an interim relief, pending disposal of the plea.

Sivakumar, who had originally approached the Madras high court challenging the notification dated December 12, 2019, has now approached the apex court since the high court refused to pass any interim order permitting him to participate in the recruitment, pending disposal of the petition. The plea moved as a special leave petition before the Supreme Court is scheduled to be taken up for hearing on January 24.

The primary contention of the petitioner was whether it’s legally sustainable in taking away the age relaxation granted in the January 13, 2019, notification by the authorities prescribing maximum age limit of 48 for all reserved category (BC/MBC) candidates and reducing it to 45 years without valid and proper reason in the notification dated December 12, 2019, in the same calendar year for filling vacant posts of district judges (entry level) by direct recruitment.

“About 3,562 lawyers, pleaders, assistant public prosecutors and serving judicial officers who wrote the preliminary examination for appointment as district judge in February, subsequent to the January 2019 notification failed to clear the exam. Therefore, the latest notification issued for filling same vacancies, in the same calendar year, infringes on the legitimate expectation of the petitioner in taking part in the selection process, particularly when there was no recruitment during the time the petitioner crossed the age limit,” Sivakumar said.

Title: Sisamau drain’s effluent again pours into Ganga
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kanpur: The effluent of notorious Sisamau nullah once again started pouring into Ganga following two days of heavy downpour in the city. Besides. Sisamau nullah, other nullahs too discharged their effluent into the river in the past two days.

As soon as the news reached the officials, municipal commissioner and other officials inspected the nullah. Chief engineer, Jal Nigam, AK Gupta said that Sisamau nullah had been tapped in such a way that in normal days all its effluent could pass into the sewage treatment plant (STP) but the system failed to bear the load of excess water.

He said as there are no separate channels in the city to control rain and domestic water separately, and even deep sewer line of the city was not able to balance the overflow, therefore, it was necessary to pass the rainwater in the river by opening the channels otherwise, the overflowing sewer would have inundated a large area of the city. Teams have been pressed in to control the situation, said KMC sources.

DM Brahmadev Ram Tiwari said, "The tapping was designed for normal climatic conditions. And, if the flow of the nullah increases due to rain, then channels will have to be opened so that excess water can be discharged otherwise the localities situated under the tapping point can be affected with waterlogging".

Title: ED probes role of employees and kin of MD in Leonia case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: An Enforcement Directorate investigation has discovered the role of employees of Leo Meridian Infrastructure Projects & Hotels (LMIPHL) in the loan fraud case. ED is also probing the involvement of the family members of Leonia MD G Chakravarthy Raju.

ED has so far unearthed 33 shell companies and more than 40 shell vendors/contractors. ED has identified diversion of loan funds up to Rs 250 crore. The total outstanding loan against the company is Rs 1,768 crore. ED has identified certain companies like Sri Pragna Farmsand Tech Planet Solutions, which pumped in money into LMIPHL.

ED said that the low level employees of LMIPHL were registered as the directors in most of the shell investing companies. A total bogus share premium of Rs 360 crore was pumped in and share capital of Rs 12 crore was infused. ED alleged that even the contractors and vending companies are registered in the name of low level employees of LMIPHL.

The agency is also probing into the alleged benami assets in the names of the relatives companies and other benamis.

ED has arrested Chakravarthy Raju and Prasad in the case. ED alleged, “By using bogus capital equity and bonus shares taken on fake balance sheets, Raju and his family came to own 95% of the company without investing any real personal money. The resort project, though grossly over-valued in the balance sheets, was built from a portion of the sanctioned loan. But he was not eligible to get the loan and it was illegally obtained. The rest of the loan amount was siphoned off.”

Title: Tarapur blast: Unit owners booked for negligence
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: The four owners of ANK Pharma Private Limited in Tarapur MIDC was booked for causing death by negligence after a blast in the chemical unit killed eight and injured seven people. One of the four owners, Natvarbhai Patel (55), who was also injured in the incident, was booked for negligent conduct with respect to explosives and machinery, endangering life or personal safety of others and mischief as well, by the Boisar MIDC police .

Patel sustained serious injuries and is being treated at a private hospital in Mira Road. Police said they will wait for his health to improve to record his statement. The condition of the other six injured is stable.

Title: Auto-lifting gang busted, 3 held
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: Police have busted an auto-lifter gang in Hapur on Friday and arrested three members. They also recovered 14 vehicles from them, including seven cars.

Police said that Deepak Saini, kingpin of the gang, has 19 cases registered against him. Also, two more members of the gang are on the run.

According to police, the gang used to steal vehicles from various districts and replace their engines and chassis number to sell it again using fake number plates. Apart from vehicles, several fake registration plates and two countrymade pistols were also recovered from the gang.

Hapur SP Sanjiv Suman said, "The gang used to either sell the stolen vehicles to scrap dealers or to other customers using fake registration plates."

Several such gangs thrive in western Uttar Pradesh with Meerut being the hub of auto-lifters. Sotiganj market in Meerut, famous for automobile spare parts and scrap, is always on the radar of law enforcement agencies.

Title: Locked for 10 days, banker’s house burgled in Vikasnagar
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Photo used for representational purpose only

LUCKNOW: The house of a government bank officer was burgled in Vikasnagar while he was out of town. Cash and jewellery worth lakhs was stolen from his house.

Bank employee Pradeep Mishra, who returned home after 10 days of vacation on Friday, has lodged an FIR of theft.

Vikasnagar sub-inspector Bahadur Singh said: “Pradeep owns a newly constructed three-storey house in sector 1 of Vikasnagar. He and his family had left town on January 5. When he returned on Thursday night around 10.30pm, he found that the iron grille on a window was broken. He entered the house only to find that everything was scattered and a cupboard was open. He checked and found that Rs 70,000 and gold and silver jewellery had been stolen.” A forensic investigation team scanned the house and collected fingerprints. The burglars had scaled the boundary wall to enter the house. There were at least two burglars, police said.

“We are scanning the area for CCTV camera footage. Locals say they have not spotted any suspect. The miscreants must have kept a watch on the locked house,” said Singh.

Both Mishra and his wife work in government banks. They had moved in the new house in October.

Title: Rajasthan: Farmers upset with 33% norm for compensation
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Vinod Kumar Bishnoi works at his field in 13 KND village, Sriganganagar.

SRIGANGANAGAR/BIKANER: Farmers in the locust-affected areas of Sriganganagar and Bikaner districts are not satisfied with the state government’s compensation guidelines. They alleged that Girdawari (crop assessment report) is yet to be initiated by the local administration. Farmers question the government’s norm that allows compensation only to those farmers whose 33% or more cultivated areas have been damaged in the locust attacks.

“As per norms, compensation is given to farmers who have lost at least 33% or more crops due to locust attacks. The damaged crop of entire village, hamlet or panchayat, and not for an individual farmer, is taken into account for calculating 33%. The government should, instead, check damaged areas of individual farmer’s cultivated area for compensation purposes,” says Amar Singh, a farmer and secretary at the Kisan Sangarh Samiti, Sriganganagar.

Annoyed with the alleged inaction and poor response of the authorities, the Kisan Sangarh Samiti has written a letter to the Prime Minister Narendra Modi and submitted it to the Sriganganagar district collector Shiv Prasad for further action.

“They should start the process of Girdawari. Instead, we are told that the admin does not have enough resources to initiate Girdawari and is engaging Girdawars (crop assessors) of other villages to visit the affected areas,” says Subash Sehgal, a farmer leader who was part of a delegation that met Prasad on Friday. Farmers allege that there are many farms in which more than 80% of the produce has been damaged by the locust attacks. “I was expecting a good yield of mustard this time as we received good monsoon. Now, over 80% of my crops are damaged. I am yet to find a single government officer visit me and my farm. I had taken a loan of Rs 5 lakh this season from the bank,” says Manzoor Khan, a farmer at 3KNM village near Ravla where four locust attacks were witnessed in past one fortnight. Many farmers in Ravla, Gharsana, Raisinghnagar in Sriganganagar and Khajuwala in Bikaner tehsils believe they won’t be getting any major relief from the government.

Title: Anglo-Indians protest loss of reserved Lok Sabha seats
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

On Friday evening, 200 anglo-Indians gathered near Beach Station for a candlelight protest

CHENNAI: In a unique protest , the Anglo-Indian (AI) community members will light candles in their homes on Friday nights across the country to challenge the cabinet’s decision to discontinue Constitutional provisions guaranteeing them reserved seats in the Lok Sabha .

On the ground, the community is holding protests, forming confederations and preparing memorandums seeking extension of the special reservation accorded to the community.

On Friday evening, 200 anglo-Indians gathered near Beach Station for a candlelight protest. “We are planning another protest in 15 days,” said Jennifer Herft of Perambur, who led the gathering. Last week, representatives of 10 associations from across the country, headed by former MLA Barry O ‘Brien, met in Kolkata to discuss on state and nation-wide protests along with a plan to meet the President.

Augustine Roy Rozario, founder and president, Anglo-Indian Suburban Front, said while spelling out the reason for continuing special reservation for the SC&ST community and discontinuing the same for anglo-Indians, Union minister Ravi Shankar Prasad had stated there are only 296 anglo-Indians in India as per 2011 Census. “This is not true. We are a 4 lakh strong community,” he said.

Dr Nancy Ann Cynthia Francis, member of the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly, said over the years, the community has been stripped of a lot of benefits. “We had reservation in colleges, in the railways. But all that has gone now,” said Francis, who was the last of anglo-Indians to avail a reserved medical seat in 1972.

Title: CAT nixes Punjab DGP appointment
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh bench of the Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) on Friday quashed last year’s appointment of Dinkar Gupta as the director general of police (DGP), Punjab. The two-member bench, comprising CAT chairman L Narsimha Reddy and M Jamshed, accepted the plea moved by two senior IPS officers, Mohammad Mustafa and Siddharth Chattopadhyaya, challenging Gupta’s appointment.

Gupta, a 1987 batch IPS officer, had become Punjab DGP on February 27 last year by superseding five senior officers, including Mustafa (1985 batch) and Chattopadhyaya (1986). Mustafa and Chattopadhyaya had contented in their plea that both of them were ignored by the UPSC panel for appointment as the state’s DGP.

The tribunal also ruled that the procedure adopted by the UPSC and empanelment committee, which examined the police officers empanelled by Punjab to select and appoint the next DGP, “is patently opposed to and is violative of the one stipulated by the Supreme Court in its judgment in Prakash Singh’s case (supra), apart from being otherwise illegal and arbitrary.”

Title: Stop encroachment at Pulikunta: HC
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Stop encroachment at Pulikunta: HC

Hyderbad: Telangana high court on Friday directed district collector of Nirmal to stop encroachments at Pulikunta waterbody. The bench was hearing a PIL filed by Pallikonda Syam of fishermen cooperative society. TNN

Title: Delhi resident found murdered in UP’s Bulandshahr
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: A 59-year-old Delhi resident, missing for the last 12 days, was found murdered in a canal in UP’s Bulandshahr district on Friday morning. Deepak Dua’s decomposed body with his hands tied was found dumped in the canal in Sikandarabad area, near Bilsuri outpost.

Documents found from the body suggested that Dua was a resident of Dharamkunj apartment in Rohini in the national capital, police said.

When police officers in Bulandshahr contacted their counterparts in Rohini, they were told that a missing complaint in the name of Dua was filed on January 6. The body was sealed and sent for post-mortem examination.

“Prima facie, it looks like murder. But, we will be able to ascertain the exact cause of the death only after postmortem report is available. FIR will be registered at Sikanderabad police station,” Gopal Krishna Chaudhary, additional superintendent of police (Bulandshahr) said.

Deserted stretches of western UP and its canals have long been used as “duping ground”. According to sources in police, criminals dump the bodies in the canals and in deserted pockets in hope that they will get decomposed and their identity will becomes difficult.

In May last year, a headless body of a 23-year-old woman, with her fingers missing and torso bearing several brutal injury marks, was found dumped in a cane field in Bulandshahr. Local police are yet to solve the case.

A few months later, body of a 25-year-old woman was found dumped in a sack in Bulandshahr’s Gulaothi area.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Family performs ‘terhavi’ of pet dog who brought good luck
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kalu in happier times

MUZAFFARNAGAR: When Kalu died on January 13, his bereaved family decided to perform his last rites as per traditions and no expenses were spared.

Doctor Brahmdutt Saini’s family will vouch for the adage that a dog is man’s best friend for Kalu was their pet dog. The family that resides in Almaspur village in Muzaffarnagar cremated their pet in the forest in the presence of relatives. They conducted a ‘hawan’ before the ‘terhavi’ (13 day ceremony) ceremony.

All relatives and many villagers were sent cards etched in black and invited for the ‘terhavi’. As many 1,100 relatives and friends of the Sainis took part in the ‘terhavi’ and partook the meal served to them.

Saini said, “He (Kalu) was like a family member. I found Kalu had on the streets 14 years ago and brought him home. Since then, he had been a part of my family.”

Recalling, Saini said, “I had been suffering from financial crisis at the time when I brought Kalu home. From the day, he entered my house, all the problems seemed to melt away.”

Kalu had been ill for some time, said Saini. The dog was undergoing treatment at a veterinary clinic in Muzaffarnagar for several weeks before he breathed its last, he added.

Title: Dist tops in collection from TNSTC Pongal special services
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

COIMBATORE: The Coimbatore region of Tamil Nadu State Transport Corporation ( TNSTC ) has earned Rs 3.76 crore from operating special buses during the Pongal season. The district was the highest grosser at Rs 1.38 crore followed by Erode , which accounted for Rs 1.3 crore.

TNSTC had operated a total of 1,781 special buses from Coimbatore, Erode, Tirupur and Nilgiris to various districts across the state, to clear the Pongal rush. Of them, 577 buses were operated from Coimbatore.

The special buses were operated for five days from January 11 to 15. While only 97 buses were operated on the first day, the number of buses went up to 112 on the second day and to 158 on the third day. On January 14, TNSTC introduced a total of 966 buses and the number came down to 380 on the fifth and the final day (January 15). All the special buses were ordinary, non-AC (air-conditioned) town buses.
