Based on Naveenkumar’s complaint, the Ramanathapuram police registered a case against the trio under Sections 307 (attempt to murder) and 506 (ii) (criminal intimidation) of the Indian Penal Code and Section 75 (i) (c ) of the Tamil Nadu City Police (TNCP) Act and arrested Vijayakumar on Friday. He was later lodged in the Coimbatore Central Prison under judicial custody.

“Vijayakumar is facing more than five assault and ganja peddling cases in the city. We have formed a team to nab the remaining two, who are on the run,” the officer said.

Title: Mouni Roy falls sick while in Sri Lanka; shares an Instagram post with caption, "Tears, painkillers"
Content: According to the latest reports, Rhea Chakraborty, who requested for police protection recently in her Instagram post, has been provided protection by the Mumbai Police. Reports suggest that the protection has been given on the request of the Central Bureau of Investigation.

Title: Two held for smuggling liquor worth Rs 9 lakh
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bareilly: Bareilly police arrested two persons for smuggling foreign and country-made liquors worth Rs 9.60 lakh near a toll plaza in Fatehganj under (West) Police station limits on Friday.

According to the police, they acted on a tip-off about a truck carrying foreign-made and Arunachal Pradesh made liquor, which was to be illegally smuggled into Bihar.

A truck was intercepted near toll booth located in Fatehganj (West) area. As many as 80 cartons of illicit liquor were recovered, police said.

“When we searched the truck, we found 80 boxes of liquor bottles. The bus driver, identified as Sunil Kumar, a resident of Noida, and his aide, Vikas from Haryana, have been arrested,” SHO Fatehganj (West) Chandrakiran said.

Additional superintendent of police (rural), Bareilly, Sansar Singh said, “An FIR has been lodged against two accused under section 420 (cheating and dishonesty inducing delivery of property) of Indian Penal Code (IPC) and other sections of the Excise Act.”

In September last year, Bareilly police had recovered 15,480 bottles of Haryana-made liquor worth Rs 25 lakh from Fatehganj West police station limits.

As per Bareilly District Crime Record Bureau (DCRB), as many as 1,416 cases under the Excise Act case were registered in 2019.

Title: Karimnagar municipal corporation election: TRS to see triangular contest
Content:
TRS leader and Telangana chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao

HYDERABAD: A triangular contest is on the cards in many divisions in the Karimnagar municipal corporation , which will go to the polls on January 24. Incidentally, it will be the fourth time the corporation will witness an electoral battle after its formation.With BJP and Congress fielding candidates in most wards, the heat is on TRS nominees. As the saffron party bagged the Karimnagar Lok Sabha constituency in the parliamentary elections held in 2019, the contest appears to be heading for an interesting finish.BJP’s charge is being led by Karimnagar MP Bandi Sanjay Kumar , while state minister Gangula Kamlakar is TRS’ go-to man in the civic body. Unlike the rest of the state, the filing of nominations in Karimnagar began two days late due to a court ruling. At the end of withdrawal of nominations, 363 candidates were left in the fray.Both BJP and TRS delayed giving nomination forms to aspirants till the last day as there was intense competition within the parties as well. Both Sanjay and Kamalakar were involved on war of words, with the MP strongly defending the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC).In 2014, when the civic polls were conducted for 50 divisions, TRS won 24 wards, while Congress bagged 14 wards. For the mayor post, there is stiff competition in TRS with former mayor Ravindar Singh throwing his hat in the ring, but it seems the minister has his own plans, sources said.With the mayor post becoming an open category position, there are many contenders in BJP too, but the saffron party has not named any mayoral candidate. On the other hand, Congress has already announced its mayoral candidate, P Ramesh.

Title: Allan Shuhaib and Thwaha Fasal used SFI, CPM as cover: P Jayarajan
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CPM state committee member P Jayarajan and Jamaát-e-Islami leader C Dawood during a discussion at the Kerala L... Read More

KOZHIKODE: Allan Shuhaib and Thwaha Fasal , the CPM workers who were arrested for the alleged links with Maoist’s, were using SFI and party as a cover, said CPM state committee member P Jayarajan .

Speaking at a session on ‘Maoism and Islam’ organized as part of the Kerala Literature Festival here on Friday, Jayarajan said Allan and Thwaha had tried to spread Maoist ideology in SFI.

“The Maoist document, Strategies and Tactics of Indian Revolution, asks Maoist cadres to set up party fractions in other organizations,” Jayarajan said adding that the youth were implementing the directions of the document.

The CPM leader said that the BJP government at the Centre handed over the case to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) realizing that the state government will drop UAPA charges when the case would come for scrutiny.

Jayarajan also accused that the Popular Front of India (PFI) and the Jamaát-e-Islami are functioning as cover organization for Maoists in India. Jamaát representative participated in the meeting of the Committee for the Release of the Political Prisoners (CRPP), which is also the cover organization of the Maoists.

Jamaát-e-Islami leader C Dawood said the CPM raised the issue of Maoist-Islamist nexus when two of its cadres, who are Muslims, were caught by police. “This is the same tactics the CPM adopted to deflect the attention after the murder of T P Chandrasekharan. CPM pasted ‘Masha Allah’ sticker to insinuate that Muslims were behind the murder. Being a vulnerable community it is easy to target Muslims,” Dawood said. CRPP is a legally functioning body that is working for the release of those who are jailed for their political activities, said Dawood.

Title: 2 stray dogs get trapped in cages set up by forest officials to trap ‘killer’ leopardess
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BIJNOR: Despite setting up eight cages and installing over a dozen camera traps in Mohandiya jungles of Bijnor district , forest officials have still no luck with the ‘killer’ leopardess. Believed to have killed at least three persons and injured many more, the leopardess left the foresters flummoxed when she didn’t even go near any of the cages in the past, letting alone falling for the bait.

This comes even as the forest officials are conducting awareness drives in nearby villages to spread information about the dos and don’ts while going to the jungle or when they spot a leopard.

Panic has gripped the region following surge in leopard attacks. A group of angry villagers had recently killed a leopard and dragged its carcass all the way to their village when a 16-year-old boy was attacked and killed by the big cat.

The leopardess has got her pair and their movement was captured in camera traps in Mohandiya area. Forest authorities are visiting the place and checking footages captured in the cameras regularly.

On their routine visit to check these cages, the officials jumped with joy when they saw the cages from a distance and found them shut. As they reached closer, they found two stray dogs, who fell for the bait, trapped in the cages.

In their bid to lure the leopardess into the cage, the officials frequently changed the bait from chicken to mutton to a live goat but had no luck with the elusive big cat.

Bijnor divisional forest officer M Semmaran said, “Two dogs were trapped inside cages on Thursday night. Our staff spotted them and freed them. They fell for the bait of chicken and mutton.”

Semmaran further said, “We have got tranquilizer gun from Meerut division on Friday. Moreover, we have arranged two drones also to search for big cat inside sugarcane fields.”

Notably, no picture of the leopardess was captured in camera traps in the past two days.

Title: 2-year-old child dies of burns in Tamil Nadu
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

M Shivani Shree

CHENNAI: After battling for her life for ten days, a two-year-old child on Thursday succumbed to burns suffered when she slipped and fell into a bucket full of hot water at her home in Thiruvottiyur.

M Shivani Shree, the second child of Manikandan and Janani, was playing at home on January 7 when she fell into the bucket her mother had kept outside the bathroom of their house. Janani was busy in the kitchen, Manikandan was at work and their four-year-old son had gone to play with friends in the neighbourhood when Shivani slipped and fell into the bucket. Janani was alerted on hearing her daughter’s cries.

Janani rushed the child to a private hospital in Thiruvottiyur with the help of her neighbours. As the child suffered severe burns, doctors referred her to the Kilpauk Medical College (KMC) hospital where she was admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) for burns.

Around 10.30 pm on Thursday, the child succumbed to injuries. The body was handed over to her parents on Friday. The Sathangadu police have registered a case and further investigations are on.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: It’s a wedding party without groom, says AAP
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Rajya Sabha MP and AAP’s Delhi election in charge Sanjay Singh

NEW DELHI: BJP is a team without captain and like a wedding party without a groom , AAP on Friday said after the saffron party released its first list of candidates for the upcoming Delhi election but did not name its chief ministerial candidate. Observing that the people of Delhi expected BJP to decide a chief ministerial candidate to fight against Arvind Kejriwal-led government, the city’s ruling party said it in Delhi, it has become clear that the saffron party has given a “walkover” to AAP.

“Today BJP came out with its list of candidates for the Delhi assembly election. Everyone was expecting that against the honest face and candidature of Arvind Kejriwal ji, they will reveal who their candidate, who their CM face is going to be.

“But even today, BJP stayed quiet and this makes it clear that in Delhi, BJP is a team without captain, a wedding party without a groom. It has become clear that in Delhi, BJP has given a walkover to AAP and Arvind Kejriwal,” said Rajya Sabha MP and AAP’s Delhi election in charge Sanjay Singh.

BJP has fielded sitting MLA Vijender Gupta and former mayors Ravinder Gupta and Yogender Chandolia. The list also included former AAP MLA Kapil Mishra and has 11 SC and four woman candidates.

Title: Pune: Investor ends life, blames wife and jailed developer D S Kulkarni for woes
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: A 60-year-old Ghorpadi resident on Friday ended his life, leaving behind separate notes blaming his wife and jailed developer D S Kulkarni, alias DSK, for driving him to take the extreme step.An autorickshaw driver by profession, Tanaji Korake was found hanging from a ceiling fan in his house at Bhimnagar in Ghorpadi. Senior inspector Muralidhar Khokale of the Mundhwa police said in one of the two suicide notes found at the spot, Korake had held DSK responsible for his death.“Korake had invested Rs4.5 lakh in one of DSK’s firms for meeting future requirements, including his daughter’s marriage. He was to get his money back in 2017. Korake was frustrated by the delay in securing refund of his money,” he said.DSK is in judicial custody in the case of an economic fraud registered against him and others connected with his group of firms. “We will contact our counterparts probing the fraud case to establish whether Korake had invested any amount with the DSK group and the details of such investments. We will decide the further course of action after this,” Khokale said.The DSK group landed in trouble in October 2017 for an alleged Rs2,091.11 crore economic fraud that affected 32,000 depositors from various cities of Maharashtra. DSK and eight others are since lodged in the Yerawada central jail.Khokale said, “In the other note, Korake said his wife suspected him of having an affair with a woman. He also held his wife responsible for his death.”Prima facie probe revealed that Korake was tensed for the past few days, the officer said. “After his wife and daughter went to sleep on Thursday night, Korake hanged himself from the ceiling fan in his house. On Friday morning, his kin saw him hanging from the fan. He was taken to a hospital where doctors declared him brought dead.”The police have handed Korake’s body to his relatives after post-mortem and registered a case of accidental death.

Title: Missed call facility for FASTag balance enquiry
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: FASTag users linked to the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI)’s prepaid wallet can now check their balance by giving a missed call on +91 8884333331.

Indian Highways Management Company Limited (IHMCL), promoted by NHAI, announced the introduction of the missed call alert facility for the NHAI prepaid wallet balance enquiry on Thursday.

The officials clarified that the facility was not available for all NHAI FASTags linked through various bank accounts.

According to the authorities, all FASTag customers who have registered their cellphone numbers can now get access to their NHAI prepaid wallet balance by giving a missed call from their registered numbers.

An official said, “This is a free-of-cost facility, available 24X7, and is compatible with all mobile devices and operators. If more than one vehicle is linked to the NHAI prepaid wallet, then the SMS response will show the cumulative balance of all tags assigned to each vehicle under the registered contact number. If any of the vehicle tags has a low balance, a separate message will be sent to the registered cellphone number for the particular vehicle.”

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Congress’ poll theme song a throwback to Sheila days
Content:
Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee president Subhash Chopra. (Photo: Twitter/@SChopraINC)

NEW DELHI: Congress on Friday launched a 120-second campaign song — “Congress Wali Dilli” – for the upcoming Delhi assembly election. Launching the theme song, Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee president Subhash Chopra said it would tell Delhiites how prosperous the capital was during the 15-year tenure of Sheila Dikshit Chopra alleged that AAP government had reversed Delhi’s development by at least 20 years. He said when Congress came to power in 1998, the situation on the power and water fronts was precarious. “Congress government’s primary objective was to ensure uninterrupted power and drinking supply to the citizens of Delhi and, during the party’s 15-year rule in Delhi, the situation was not only improved, but it was also ensured that Delhi became self-sufficient in both sectors,” he claimed.Chopra said Congress government built 67 flyovers and made Ring Road signal-free. All India Congress Committee’s social media and digital communications chairman Rohan Gupta said the party’s theme song sought to recall its achievements when it was in power in Delhi. He said the song would be played in every nook and corner of Delhi. Chopra said Congress not only started the Delhi Metro project, but also switched public transport to CNG fuel even as Delhi bagged the UN award for the best green city. He said it was the Congress government that made Delhi kerosene-free.Campaign committee chairman Kirti Azad said Congress was synonymous with development. “It was the Congress government that changed the face of Delhi to make it an international-standard city during its 15-year rule,” he said.Gupta said Congress party’s election campaign would be based on the achievements of the party and not on negativity.Chief spokesperson Mukesh Sharma said Congress would expose the failures and unfulfilled promises of both AAP and BJP. He said Congress workers were very active at the polling-booth level as they prepared for the assembly election. “The overwhelming support Congress is getting from the people is a clear indication that it will come back to power in Delhi with a thumping majority,” Sharma claimed.

Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Delhi Pradesh Congress Committee president Subhash Chopra. (Photo: Twitter/@SChopraINC)

Title: 'Ensure all 7 pointers under Operation Kayakalp are complete by March 31'
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: Government schools across the state must ensure that all the seven pointers under Operation Kayakalp are completed by March 31, 2020, deadline, according to the UP government.

The seven pointers listed by the government at the start of 2019-20 financial year aim at giving a facelift to the schools and provide all facilities to the students at the ground level. Some of the seven pointers are proper toilet facilities for students, ensuring proper blackboard, furniture, facilities of separate toilets for boys and girls and hand washing units, among others.

“This is in the backdrop of instructions that were given at the start of financial year 2019-20 wherein all the schools were asked to ensure that the seven pointers mentioned in phase one of Operation Kayakalp should be fulfilled by March 31, 2020,” read the order issued by Vijay Kiran Anand, state project director, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan .

Schools have been instructed to ensure that all the seven pointers under Operation Kayakalp are fulfilled. “The other pointers are renovation of floor, walls, doors and other interior works. They should make corrections wherever required during electrification. Painting of walls and kitchen shed should also be checked,” read the order.

Once the pointers, under phase one are fulfilled, work for phase two will be given to all the schools which include setting up of furniture and construction of boundary walls around the schools.

Title: ED attaches ex-BSP minister’s property worth Rs 5cr in DA case
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Lucknow: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday attached properties worth Rs 5 crore of Rangnath Mishra, former minister of secondary education and home during the BSP government (2007-12), in connection with a disproportionate assets case.

Enforcement Directorate had initiated investigations against the former minister under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act in August 2014 in pursuance of a case registered by UP police’s vigilance wing in October 2013.

During the course of investigation, it was found that Mishra’s actual income from May 13, 2007 to October 5, 2011, was about Rs 1.57 crore but he allegedly spent Rs 3.43 crore.

An ED official said the property attached included a residential plot measuring 250.83 sqm by 899.25 sqm in George Town Extension, Tagore Town of Allahabad.

Properties were acquired by the minister in 2010 in the name of his family and himself.

“Investigation into the sources of properties acquired and purchased by the former minister and his family members in the names of trust, samiti and institutes is in progress,” the officer said.

Title: Pune civic body gets a month to sortout Bhama Askhed project rows
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

After the pipeline project is ready, the city is likely to get 2.8 TMC water from the Bhama Askhed dam

PUNE: The state government has set a month’s deadline to resolve the issues delaying completion of the Bhama Askhed pipeline project.

This was decided at a meeting chaired by Pune’s guardian minister, Ajit Pawar, on Friday. Sanctioned in 2013, the Bhama Askhed pipeline project was expected to be completed by July 2017. The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) subsequently pushed the project deadline to January 26, 2020.

The PMC could not complete the project and its officials attributed the delay to the agitation by the farmers’ at the site. In December 2019, the civic administration had said it wanted to complete the pipeline and jackwell work of the pipeline project by March 2020.

After Friday’s meeting, it was decided that the PMC and the district administration have to complete the land acquisition process within a month. The work had stopped due to the agitation by farmers aggrieved over compensation.

“We have received directives to complete the compensation process within a month. We will coordinate with the district collector to get details of the beneficiaries. The disbursement of the compensation for their land will be done accordingly,” said Pravin Gedam, project-in-charge for the PMC.

A PMC estimate states that nearly 1,400 farmers have been affected by the pipeline project. The authorities have offered two options of compensation — one is in the form of cash and the other is allotment of new land. Gedam said the PMC has started disbursing cash as compensation and so far spent around Rs35 crore.

Once the project is ready, the city is expected to get 2.8 TMC water from the Bhama Askhed dam via the closed pipeline. The water is expected to meet the requirements of 14 lakh people living in areas along Ahmednagar Road.

The project will cost around Rs380 crore, of which nearly Rs280 crore have been spent. The civil work of the jackwell is complete. At present, work on power supply is on.

Title: Eight, including three sisters, held for robbery bid in exporter’s house
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: With the arrest of eight people, including three women, police have solved the robbery bid that place on January 9 at exporter Dipanshu Gupta’s house at TDI City locality in Ramganga Nagar of Moradabad .

Four armed men had barged into the house but Gupta’s mother and wife foiled the robbery bid.

During investigation, police found that Guptas’ maid and her two sisters were allegedly involved. On Friday, eight of the suspects, including the three sisters, were arrested. Two cars and three countrymade pistols were seized from them.

Superintendent of police (city) Amit Kumar Anand said, “We have arrested eight of the suspects, including three women. Two of their accomplices – Babbu and Fakira – are on the run. We are conducting raids to nab them. We seized two cars and two countrymade pistols with cartridges from them. All accused have been sent to jail.”

According to police, on January 9, as many as four armed persons had barged into the house when there were only five people there – Gupta’s mother, Lata, wife Sonal, two kids and maid Shama. As soon as they entered the house, they took Lata hostage at gunpoint. She raised an alarm and Sonal locked herself in a room and informed police and her husband over the mobile phone.

Realizing that they could be caught, the robbers left the house. One of their accomplices was waiting in a car outside the house and they fled in it.

Police had registered a case under IPC section 398 (attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon) in that matter.

During investigation, police found that maid Shama had allegedly hatched the conspiracy along with her sisters, Saniya and Sabina, after she found out that the Guptas had gold in their house. The trio met one Babbu, an absconder who arranged five goons for committing the robbery.

The five miscreants were identified as Jitendra, Gopal, Dharmveer, Arjun and Raghunandan. Police are looking for their accomplices, Babbu and Fakira.

Title: Muzaffarnagar riots: Trial against 3 BSP leaders, ex-Congress MP to start on Jan 27
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Communal clashes in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining areas in August and September 2013 had claimed 60 lives and di... Read More

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Over six years after the Muzaffarnagar riots , a local court will frame charges against ten persons, including three BSP leaders and a former Congress MP, for allegedly delivering inflammatory speeches in the buildup to the widespread communal clashes in 2013 which left at least 60 dead and scores of others injured. The court has set January 27 for the framing of charges.

On the other hand, charges against BJP leader and former Union minister Sanjeev Balyan and some other party leaders accused of making similar inflammatory speeches and violating prohibitory orders are yet to be framed. Several hearings have been adjourned as all the accused failed to appear before the court in the last two years.

But, charges have been framed in the Kawal murder case, the trigger and flashpoint of the riots. Five persons accused of killing a youth in the village were charged with murder and others section of IPC by the court last year. Soon after the death, two youths allegedly involved in the murder were caught and lynched by a mob in the same village. The three murders, coupled with vitriolic speeches made by the local leaders from almost all the political parties, set the communally-sensitive region on the fire.

Now, the ten accused, including three from BSP-- former MP Kadir Rana, former MLA Noorsalim Rana, and Maulana Jameel-- and former Congress MP Saiduzzaman, have been asked to appear before Muzaffarnagar’s additional district sessions court on January 27 for the framing of charges. In the charge-sheet, local police have accused them of delivering inflammatory speeches during a panchayat in minority-dominated Khalapar area.

According to the politicians’ lawyer Naqli Singh Tyagi, “Additional district and sessions judge Ram Shudh Singh announced January 27 for framing the charges against 10 accused on Thursday.”

Communal clashes in Muzaffarnagar and adjoining areas in August and September 2013 had claimed 60 lives and displaced over 40,000 people.

Leaders from various political parties-- BJP’s Suresh Rana, Umesh Malik, Kapil Dev Agarwal, Balyan, Kunwar Bhartendu; BSP’s Kadir Rana and Noorsalim Rana; Congress’ Saiduzzaman -- were booked for making inflammatory speeches.

Title: 392 schools pulled up for not providing internal marks for UP board exams
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: The Meerut district inspector of schools (DIOS) pulled up 392 schools for not providing internal marks for UP board exams , as instructed for a smooth conduct of the exams.

The DIOS has now instructed that all the marks should be uploaded on the government website by January 31. Action will be taken against the defaulters.

“All the schools were informed earlier that they have to upload the internal marks of the students in each subject on the government’s online portal. But despite this, as many as 392 schools are yet to upload internal marks. All the schools are instructed to upload the marks to ensure that the board exams occur smoothly,” said Meerut DIOS GK Chaudhary.

The schools identified for Class X, include 210 government schools and 10 aided schools, and for Class XII include 158 government schools and 11 aided schools.

“All the schools should upload the internal marks by January 31 or face action. The concerned school principals will be held responsible if any problem arises during the processing of results due to the absence of internal marks,” added Chaudhary.

This year, while 43,423 students will sit for Class X boards, as many as 43,242 students will sit for Class XII boards in Meerut. However, in 2019, 43,783 students took Class X exams and 40,309 students took Class XII exams.

Title: Andhra Pradesh high court raps state on prohibitory orders, police in Amaravati
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh high court on Friday found fault with the state government for huge deployment of police force and imposition of prohibitory orders under Section 30 of AP Police Act and Section 144 of Criminal Procedure Code (CrPC) in villages of capital city Amaravati .

Hearing a batch of petitions moved by capital city farmers, the high court bench comprising Justice MV Sesha Sai and Justice M Satyanarayana Murthy asked the state government why police told locals to carry identity cards.

Justice Satyanarayana Murthy said police had even troubled him when he was going in a private car. The bench observed that the police imposed too many restrictions and sought explanation from the government.

The high court questioned why policemen manhandled women protesters. The high court specifically pointed out the incident of a woman being kicked in her stomach by policemen wearing heavy boots.

Arguing on behalf of the state government, advocate-general S Sriram said promulgation of Section 30 of AP Police Act or Section 144 of CrPC in capital city villages was not new.

Both sections have been in force since 2015. The previous government extended the sections from time to time and the present government continued that in view of the prevailing law and order situation.

The advocate-general said all the photos that appeared in the media were not true. Some were morphed with images of incidents that took place in Bihar.

Title: 3.43L candidates to appear for TET tomorrow
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: As many as 3.43 lakh candidates from the state will appear for the Teacher Eligibility Test (TET) on Sunday.

The exam — to be conducted for primary and secondary schoolteachers — would be held in nine divisions of the state, including Pune. The exam, being conducted after nearly two years, would be held in 1,044 centres across the state.

The Maharashtra State Council of Examination, which conducts the test, said both Paper I and II would be on the same day. The first paper would be held from 10.30am to 1pm and the second would be from 2pm to 4.30pm.

The state education department has introduced a few changes in the exam pattern this year. The commissioner of exam council, Tukaram Supe, said, the details of the test were made available on the official website — http://mahatet.in — in December 2019. The last date to fill up the application forms was November 28. The candidates received their hall tickets online after January 4 and the link would be open till Sunday.

The state government had introduced TET in 2013 under the Right To Education Act. The government made it a mandatory qualification for those who wished to be eligible for appointment as teachers from Standard I to VIII. After July 15, 2018, no test was conducted.

The first paper qualifies a candidate to teach in Standard I to V, whereas the second paper is for those who wish to teach in Standard VI to VIII. The eligibility to appear for Paper I is diploma in education, while the eligibility to appear for paper II is bachelors in education. A candidate requires 60% marks to be eligible for the test.

The candidates would have to take their seats 20 minutes before the commencement of the exam, or else h/she would not be allowed in the hall.

Title: Pune: Teenager’s study says high speed prime reason for road accidents
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: An observational study conducted by 13-year-old student Chirayu Dhadge found that high speed collision were the most common reason for accidents in the city in 2019.Dhadge collected data related to approximately 122 accidents from newspaper reports as part of the study. The findings were shared with Pune police commissioner K Venkatesham, who stated that the department will use Dhadge’s insights to plan focused initiatives and reduce accidents in the city.According to the Dhadge’s findings, two-wheelers were the most commonly involved vehicles in road accidents. “From studying the news articles, I found that a majority of accidents occur between 6am and noon while the least number of accidents occur in the evenings. Apart from two-wheelers, trucks were found to be involved in the largest number of accidents. The greatest number of accidents in the year occurred along the Katraj-Dehu Road bypass,” Dhadge explained.Dhadge was inspired to take up the study on seeing his father, a doctor, present a research paper at a conference.Venkatesham said, “We will definitely use insights from this study. More than 60 pedestrians died in 2019. Pedestrian First will be one of the main thrust areas apart from the concern list of 610 items culled out from print and social media.”

Title: Deputy CM Ajit Pawar wants line from Swargate to Hadapsar
Content:
Ajit Pawar

‘Let other countries try out Hyperloop first’

Longer routes on the anvil

PUNE: Deputy chief minister and district guardian minister Ajit Pawar on Friday directed Pune Metropolitan Regional Development Authority (PMRDA) to explore the possibility of a new Metro line connecting Swargate and Hadapsar.Pawar held a meeting to review the Metro project in Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad. At the meeting, Pawar told PMRDA officials to study both the elevated and “underground for the new route.“The Swargate-Hadapsar route is the need of the hour for the city and a feasibility study should be done for this route,” Pawar said, instructing officials to submit a report in a fortnight.Further, the deputy chief minister directed officials to change the proposed extension of the Hinjewadi-Shivajinagar Metro route to Hadapsar — Pawar said the line should be extended to Kadamwak Vasti and said this would ease traffic woes in the city.PMRDA is executing the Hinjewadi-Shivajinagar line on the public-private partnership basis. Pawar said the same model could be used for the extension. PMRDA had proposed the extension to Hadapsar last year, adding 12km to the 23.3km elevated route.This was part of the detailed project report proposed by the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation, which the PMRDA had approved in 2016. The original route — Hinjewadi-Shivajiagar — would have 23 stations, while the extension would require an additional 12. PMRDA officials said the average cost of each kilometre of Metro was around Rs260 crore, taking the cost of the extension at Rs3,000 crore.“Now, with a further extension, the cost would increase,” an official said.Pawar, when asked about the ambitious Hyperloop project, said the concept needs to be properly tested by other countries before it goes on trial in the state. “Unless the project is tried and tested, it cannot be implemented here,” he said.Also on Friday, the District Planning and Development Council (DPDC), at a meeting chaired by Pawar, cleared funds to the tune of Rs520.78 crore for 2020-21. At the meeting held at council hall, Pawar told officials to carry out repair works to schools and toilets on their premises. He also touched upon the traffic congestion issue and told officials to consult local authorities and solve the problem.Pawar said he was keen on extending the Vanaz-Ramwadi Metro line to Wagholi via Chandni Chowk. He further backed extending the PCMCSwargate line on both ends, making it a route from Nigdi to Katraj. The deputy CM further said the government would allocate Rs200 crore for the rehabilitation of slum dwellers affected by the Civil Court Metro station.

Title: Minister calls for study of ‘Neo’ plan on HCMTR
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: Deputy chief minister and district guardian minister Ajit Pawar on Friday told civic officials to study the feasibility of introducing the ‘Metro Neo’ service on the High Capacity Mass Transit Route (HCMTR).

‘Metro Neo’ — a hybrid of Metro, tram, bus and BRTS — runs on rubber tyres and is powered by overhead electrical cables.

At a meeting to review the ongoing projects of Pune Municipal Corporation on Friday, Pawar told a technical committee to submit a detailed proposal within a fortnight. The meeting was attended by NCP legislators Chetan Tupe and Sunil Tingre.

“I have told PMC to check if the road width can be reduced to 8 metres, as it would reduce the overall cost. I have discussed the same with the municipal commissioner and will ask BJP (the ruling party in PMC) to deliberate this,” Pawar said.

PMC has already said the cost of HCMTR was too high and that it needed to to explore financing options. Under the existing proposal, the HCMTR has two dedicated lanes for the Bus Rapid Transit System (BRTS) and four lanes for private vehicles. The total width of the road has been proposed at 24 metres. PMC has not floated the tenders for the project yet.

Longer routes on the anvil

Pawar said he was keen on extending the Vanaz-Ramwadi Metro line to Wagholi via Chandni Chowk. He further backed extending the PCMC-Swargate line on both ends, making it a route from Nigdi to Katraj. The deputy CM further said the government would allocate Rs200 crore for the rehabilitation of slum dwellers affected by the Civil Court Metro station.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Manish Sisodia faces first-timer in Patparganj
Content:
Manoj Tiwari, flanked by Shyam Jaju and Prakash Javadekar, announced the list of BJP candidates and said the ... Read More

NEW DELHI: The 13 seats where BJP has yet to announce its candidates include the prestigious New Delhi assembly constituency , which saw chief minister Arvind Kejriwal winning two consecutive polls in 2013 and 2015 by huge margins. The party has, however, declared its candidates to be pittted against some other members of Kejriwal’s council of ministers.From Patparganj, which sent deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia to the assembly in 2013 and 2015, BJP has fielded Ravi Negi, a first-timer. Sources said Negi belongs to Uttarakhand and the constituency has over 15% votes of people belonging to that region. Negi was chosen to contest the 2017 municipal polls but his nomination paper was cancelled due to incomplete documents.Former legislator SC Vats has been fielded against health minister Satyendar Jain from Shakur Basti. “Vats had won the 1998 and 2003 elections on a Congress ticket and contested the 2015 poll from the same seat as a BJP candidate but lost by a small margin,” said a BJP functionary. At the age of 74, he is the oldest BJP candidate so far.In Najafgarh, former MLA Ajit Kharkhari will challenge transport minister Kailash Gahlot. A Jat, Kharkhari is said to have good influence in the rural constituency. He had won the 2013 election comfortably but lost to Gahlot in 2015.Former municipal councillor Lata Sodhi from Ballimaran is taking on food and civil supplies minister Imran Hussain. Lata’s father-in-law, Moti Lal Sodhi, was a BJP MLA. “She had won the 2012 municipal election but was denied a ticket in 2017 when the BJP changed all sitting l councillors,” said a party source.Candidates to take on social welfare minister Rajendra Pal Gautam in Seemapuri, a reserved seat, and Speaker Ram Niwas Goel from Shahdara are yet to be named.Among other prominent seats, East of Kailash municipal councillor Shikha Rai has been fielded from Greater Kailash against former minister and party spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj. In 2013, veteran Vijay Kumar Malhotra’s son, Ajay, had contested here and lost. In the neighbouring Malviya Nagar seat, councillor Shailender Singh Monty will take on lawyer Somnath Bharti.

Title: 3 booked for duping ex-cop
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: A 63-year-old retired sub-inspector of police fell prey to three conmen, who duped him of Rs36,000 on Friday.

Madhukar Pawar and his family were near a traffic signal in Hadapsar, when the conmen drove up in a car and asked him whether notes of certain denominations can be used at a hotel nearby. They then convinced him to hand over a bundle of 64 notes of Rs2,000, diverted his attention, pocketed 18 notes and fled, police said. TNN

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Manish Sisodia faces first-timer in Patparganj
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Manoj Tiwari, flanked by Shyam Jaju and Prakash Javadekar, announced the list of BJP candidates and said the ... Read More

NEW DELHI: The 13 seats where BJP has yet to announce its candidates include the prestigious New Delhi assembly constituency , which saw chief minister Arvind Kejriwal winning two consecutive polls in 2013 and 2015 by huge margins. The party has, however, declared its candidates to be pittted against some other members of Kejriwal’s council of ministers.

From Patparganj, which sent deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia to the assembly in 2013 and 2015, BJP has fielded Ravi Negi, a first-timer. Sources said Negi belongs to Uttarakhand and the constituency has over 15% votes of people belonging to that region. Negi was chosen to contest the 2017 municipal polls but his nomination paper was cancelled due to incomplete documents.

Former legislator SC Vats has been fielded against health minister Satyendar Jain from Shakur Basti. “Vats had won the 1998 and 2003 elections on a Congress ticket and contested the 2015 poll from the same seat as a BJP candidate but lost by a small margin,” said a BJP functionary. At the age of 74, he is the oldest BJP candidate so far.

In Najafgarh, former MLA Ajit Kharkhari will challenge transport minister Kailash Gahlot. A Jat, Kharkhari is said to have good influence in the rural constituency. He had won the 2013 election comfortably but lost to Gahlot in 2015.

Former municipal councillor Lata Sodhi from Ballimaran is taking on food and civil supplies minister Imran Hussain. Lata’s father-in-law, Moti Lal Sodhi, was a BJP MLA. “She had won the 2012 municipal election but was denied a ticket in 2017 when the BJP changed all sitting l councillors,” said a party source.

Candidates to take on social welfare minister Rajendra Pal Gautam in Seemapuri, a reserved seat, and Speaker Ram Niwas Goel from Shahdara are yet to be named.

Among other prominent seats, East of Kailash municipal councillor Shikha Rai has been fielded from Greater Kailash against former minister and party spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj. In 2013, veteran Vijay Kumar Malhotra’s son, Ajay, had contested here and lost. In the neighbouring Malviya Nagar seat, councillor Shailender Singh Monty will take on lawyer Somnath Bharti.

Title: Drone camera to look for big cat in sugarcane fields
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

BAREILLY: After a tiger mauled a 50-year-old man to death on Thursday in a sugarcane at Bojra village in the buffer zone of Dudhwa Tiger Reserve (DTR) in Lakhimpur Kheri district, forest officials have decided to use a drone camera to check if the big cat is hiding amid the cane stalks in the field.

Forest officials told TOI that farmers who want to harvest their cane can make a request to them to use a drone camera over their field to see if all is clear.

Deputy director, DTR (buffer zone), Anil Patel told TOI, “If any farmer wants to harvest the cane, he can inform our department. We will fly the drone camera over his field to check if any leopard or tiger is hiding there. Besides, flying a drone in the field will disturb the big cat living in cane field and it will move. The aim behind the exercise is to minimize man-animal conflict in the area. We are informing village heads that our team will help them.”

Forest department has identified 45 villages which are situated in the buffer areas of DTR as “sensitive”. Forest officials said the buffer team has one drone camera and if they need more, they will borrow from the DTR team. There are more than 20 tigers in DTR’s buffer zone.

A team of forest department officials had used the drone camera at Bojra village, under Bheera police station, on Friday to trace the tiger which had killed the farmer when he was working in the field. The forest staff also conducted an awareness programme among villagers. “Though we will use the drone if any farmer makes a request to us in this regard, we are informing the farmers that they should change the direction from which they start harvesting sugarcane to avoid conflict with big cats. For instance, they should not start cutting the crops from the side of the forest but from the opposite direction.”

Among the guidelines issued by the forest department to villagers living in proximity with the forests is to work in the fields in groups. They have been advised to sing or make noises while working in the field to scare away any big cat lurking nearby.

Title: Nine months since polls, Andhra Pradesh government yet to clear Rs 250 crore car dues
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

File photo of Andhra Pradesh chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy

VISAKHAPATNAM: Nine months after elections were held in the state, the AP government is to yet clear rentals for vehicles used by officials to oversee polling. It owes about Rs 250 crore for vehicles requisitioned during polls.

Election Commission, which utilised the vehicles, said it has released funds to state government, adding it should clear the dues.

“We have already released Rs 250 crore to the state government. The government should disburse the amount through district collectors,” K Vijayanand, chief electoral officer, Andhra Pradesh, said.

Election Commission is legally empowered to take any vehicle for election duty after serving a notice to the vehicle owner under Section 160 of the Representation of the People Act, 1951. State officials took private vehicles for official use during the state assembly and Lok Sabha polls held in April 2019.

When the issue of non-payment of rentals was brought to the notice of district officials in Visakhapatnam despite the EC clearing the dues, they refused comment. “I can only say we have already verified the bills. But funds are yet to reach us,” a senior official from collector’s office in Visakhapatnam said.

Title: Delhi elections: Will civic stars shine light on assembly path?
Content:
Jai Prakash, Shikha Rai & Ravinder

NEW DELHI: BJP has decided to bet on several old timers who fought the municipal elections in 2012 and 2017, including seven sitting councillors, for the assembly election.The party argued that municipal councillors, either sitting or former, have worked hard, possess distinct knowledge about the area and their connect with people puts them in a better position to win the assembly polls.Four of the seven sitting councillors on the list occupy key positions in the deliberative wing of the municipal corporations. They include South Delhi Municipal Corporation’s leader of House Shikha Rai and west zone ward chairman Kailash Sankla, North Delhi Municipal Corporation’s standing committee chairman Jai Prakash and Rohini zone chairman Manish Chaudhary.The other three include former north corporation deputy mayor Vijay Bhagat, who will be contesting from Badli assembly seat, former east corporation deputy mayor Kiran Vaid, who has been given a ticket for Trilokpuri constituency, and Krishan Gahlot, who will contest from Uttam Nagar. Gahlot had left BJP after being denied a ticket in the last municipal polls and won as an independent candidate from Nawada.Among the 12 former councillors in BJP’s list, there are four former mayors — Khushi Ram Chunar, Yogendra Chandolia, Ravindra Gupta and Azad Singh.The other contestants are former deputy mayors Anil Sharma and Rajkumar Dhillon, former leader of house in north corporation Mahendra Nagpal and standing committee ex-chairman Rajesh Gehlot, SDMC former standing committee chairman Shailendra Singh Monty and leader of House Ashish Sood. Former councillors Rekha Gupta, Lata Sodhi and Suman Kumar Gupta will be contesting from Shalimar Bagh, Ballimaran and Chandni Chowk, respectively.Neeldaman Khatri, who contested assembly elections in 2013 and 2015, will try his luck again this time from Narela. He is the husband of former councillor Keshrani Neeldaman. Virendra Sachdeva, co-convener of Delhi BJP’s media team, said the names were selected on the basis of the candidate’s winnability, besides caste and other factors.

Title: Pune: Speeding dumper runs over elderly woman
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: A speeding dumper ran over a 65-year-old woman sleeping under a tree near the garbage depot of the corporation in Kondhwa on Thursday evening.The identity of the deceased has yet not been established. The dumper driver, Sunil Pralhad Raibole (34) from Katraj, was arrested later the same day. He has been booked under the relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code and Motor Vehicles Act.Sub-inspector Niketan Nimbalkar from the Kondhwa police said, “The woman was sleeping under a tree and her body was covered with a bedsheet. The dumper driver took a sharp turn from the main road towards the garbage depot, lost control over the vehicle and the rear left wheel of the vehicle ran over her head.”Nimbalkar said, “On receiving information about the accident, we reached the spot and rushed the critically injured woman to Sassoon General Hospital, but the doctors pronounced her dead on arrival.”According to the hospital’s advance post-mortem report, she died of multiple head injuries.Investigation officer Pratap Doiphode said, “A tempo driver, transporting garbage, was a witness to the incident. Heintercepted the dumper driver, Raibole, and handed him over to a police team for action. During questioning, Raibole told the police that he had mistaken the woman for a heap of garbage.”He said, “The driver was arrested for negligent driving. We have seized the vehicle for conducting an inspection at the Regional Transport Office here.”Raibole is an employee of a civic body contractor. The contractor, or any person on his behalf, has not yet come forward to claim the dumper.

Title: RK Beach Road ready for R-Day
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Students take out march-past rehearsals in preparation for the state Republic Day celebrations on Beach Road i... Read More

Visakhapatnam: Rehearsals for the official celebrations of Republic Day began at the RK Beach Road on Friday. Beginning today, the rehearsals will conclude on January 25. The parade contingents will practice from 05:30am to 11:30am and again from 03:00pm to 05:30pm.

City police commissioner RK Meena visited the parade practice area and other spots on Thursday evening. Around 10 contingents including Navy, CRPF, SPF, out of state-contingent from either Telangana or Odisha, Armed Reserve Force and NCC cadets will take part in the final parade.

Governor Biswabhushan Harichandan, chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy, the chief justice of the AP high court, the chief secretary and the DGP will be among those present.

In a bid to create room for rehearsals, the police have decided to divert traffic from certain parts. Vehicles coming from Park Hotel to NTR statue will have to take a diversion from Pandurangapuram junction to All India Radio junction. Vehicles coming from Novotel to Pandurangapuram junction will have to take a diversion from NTR statue to All India Radio junction.

The police have requested walkers to walk along the beach as they will not be allowed to walk from the NTR statue to Pandurangapuram junction in the morning. Parking will not be allowed along these roads as well. People living near the beach front area will have to get residential passes from the III-Town circle inspector.

Title: Accused taken for evidence recovery
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kozhikode: Crime branch (CB-CID) team probing the double murder case at Mukkom , took the accused to the crime spot to recover evidence. Deputy superintendent of crime branch M Binoy and team took Birju to the house where the accused murdered his mother Jayavalli and hitman Ismayil.

CB team took Birju to the spot as he admitted to investigators that both crimes were committed inside the house. Meanwhile, police decided to summon Birju’s wife to the CB office. The investigators are probing if she had any involvement in the crime.

During Ismayil’s murder probe, police got clues about Jayavalli’s murder. According to officers, Jayavalli was strangulated. Her body was later hanged in the house and the incident was termed a suicide. CB-CID is now probing both cases. TNN

Title: Four-year-old girl raped in Kakinada
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kakinada: Police in Kakinada have taken a case under Section 376 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (Pocso) Act against two boys, aged eight and 14 years, for allegedly raping a four-year-old girl in Kakinada, on Thursday.

According to Karanam Kumar, deputy superintendent of police (DSP), law and order, Kakinada, the girl was playing at her house on Thursday afternoon. The boys from the nieghbouring house took her to the rooftop of the house under the pretext of flying kites and sexually assaulted her. The girl complained to her mother about the incident to her mother and sent her daughter to her mother’s home.

The girl told her grandmother about the incident. They then lodged a complaint with Two Town Police Station on Thursday night.

Title: Delhi elections: Will civic stars shine light on assembly path?
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Jai Prakash, Shikha Rai & Ravinder

NEW DELHI: BJP has decided to bet on several old timers who fought the municipal elections in 2012 and 2017, including seven sitting councillors, for the assembly election.

The party argued that municipal councillors, either sitting or former, have worked hard, possess distinct knowledge about the area and their connect with people puts them in a better position to win the assembly polls.

Four of the seven sitting councillors on the list occupy key positions in the deliberative wing of the municipal corporations. They include South Delhi Municipal Corporation’s leader of House Shikha Rai and west zone ward chairman Kailash Sankla, North Delhi Municipal Corporation’s standing committee chairman Jai Prakash and Rohini zone chairman Manish Chaudhary.

The other three include former north corporation deputy mayor Vijay Bhagat, who will be contesting from Badli assembly seat, former east corporation deputy mayor Kiran Vaid, who has been given a ticket for Trilokpuri constituency, and Krishan Gahlot, who will contest from Uttam Nagar. Gahlot had left BJP after being denied a ticket in the last municipal polls and won as an independent candidate from Nawada.

Among the 12 former councillors in BJP’s list, there are four former mayors — Khushi Ram Chunar, Yogendra Chandolia, Ravindra Gupta and Azad Singh.

The other contestants are former deputy mayors Anil Sharma and Rajkumar Dhillon, former leader of house in north corporation Mahendra Nagpal and standing committee ex-chairman Rajesh Gehlot, SDMC former standing committee chairman Shailendra Singh Monty and leader of House Ashish Sood. Former councillors Rekha Gupta, Lata Sodhi and Suman Kumar Gupta will be contesting from Shalimar Bagh, Ballimaran and Chandni Chowk, respectively.

Neeldaman Khatri, who contested assembly elections in 2013 and 2015, will try his luck again this time from Narela. He is the husband of former councillor Keshrani Neeldaman. Virendra Sachdeva, co-convener of Delhi BJP’s media team, said the names were selected on the basis of the candidate’s winnability, besides caste and other factors.

Title: Pune: Burglars steal cash, goods worth Rs 3 lakh from two flats
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Burglars made away with cash, ornaments and goods, collectively worth over Rs 3 lakh, from two locked flats at Manish Park housing society on NIBM Road between January 10 and 16.

The flats are owned by Ashok Chougle and Manoj Pardeshi, both businessman. Of the two flats, Pardeshi’s was being used as an office for selling hardware tools.

Police said the burglars used sharp objects for breaking the locks of the two flats. They stole cash and gold ornaments from Chougle’s flat located on the third floor, before targeting Pardeshi’s flat and stealing hardware tools. “The collective value of the stolen goods is Rs 3.02 lakh,” an officer of the Kondhwa police said.

The burglary came to light after Chougle found the lock of his flat broken. He registered an FIR with the Kondhwa police on Thursday.

Assistant inspector Chetan More from the Kondhwa police said, “The four-storied building does not have CCTV cameras. We are working on certain clues.”

Title: Pune: Balwant Ghatpande, one of the oldest practising physicians worldwide, passes away at 104
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ghatpande practised as a doctor for 79 years in Pune, since 1941

PUNE: Balwant Ghatpande , one of the oldest practising physicians in the world, died of cardiac arrest moments after closing his clinic in Raviwar Peth on January 9. He was to turn 105 in March.

Ghatpande was climbing the stairs of his home situated just above the clinic when he suffered the cardiac arrest, his family members said.

Born on March 15, 1915, Ghatpande had received his medical degree during the British rule in 1941 from Pune’s BJ Medical School. He was perhaps among the few living doctors with Licentiate in Medicine and Surgery that he received in 1941. The degree was replaced with Bachelor of Medicine, Bachelor of Surgery at Bhore Committee’s recommendations in 1946.

Ghatpande had been practising as a doctor in the city since 1941, spanning an exceptional 79-year-long medical service to the community. “He left this planet while actively working, just the way he always wanted,” Ishita Ghosh, his grand-daughter-in-law, said.

Reminiscing, she said, “In all these years, he had been a complete workaholic. He exercised without fail. He loved hot and spicy food, although his meals had to be blended to a mush for a while now.”

Ghatpande had reversed his highly diabetic condition through sheer discipline and lifestyle changes. “Nothing that he did really conformed to what lifestyle gurus will tell you. One thing, however, remained unchanged all these years, he had never missed going to work in spite of life throwing whatever curve balls it wished to,” Ghosh said.

“Unfazed, stoic and with tremendous will power, he would go back to his clinic after briefly attending weddings, last rites, birthdays and other celebrations. When his wife passed away, he was at the examination table at his clinic soon after returning from the crematorium. Such was his dedication and commitment,” she recalled.

Ramchandra N Gaikaiwari (70), a family friend, said, “He was my father’s friend. He had a very sharp and unfailing memory. He would narrate past incidents with vivid details to us. Many would consider him to be a serious person by nature. In reality, he was, however, intrinsically witty and would often crack jokes.”

In an interview to TOI last year, Ghatpande had said he relied more on clinical assessment for arriving at a diagnosis. “I use stethoscope, take pulse rate and make use of my palms to sense a patient’s body type. This triad forms the core of my clinical diagnosis,” he had said.

He used to charge a patient only Rs 30 for consultation and this amount had remained the same for the last many years.

Ghatpande’s eldest daughter is 78-year old. “She is a psychiatrist and lives a retired life in the US,” his aide Mangesh Darje said, adding that his two sons were also doctors. While the elder one, Swanand, is 74-year-old, the other son, Sudhir, passed away in 2018 at the age 69 following illness. His wife also passed away five years ago at the age 92.

When asked about the secret formula for keeping fit, Ghatpande had stressed on staying busy. “There is no secret formula. You have to make your own formula and follow it religiously,” he had said.

Title: Bareilly: 55-year-old man drinks four quarters of liquor in 10 minutes, wins bet, loses life
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Winning a bet of drinking liquor proved too costly for a 55-year-old man as he died an hour later after returning home in a village in Izzatnagar area of Bareilly district on Friday morning.

Deceased Rajendra Singh, a farmer from Uganpur village, had placed a bet with his nephew, Pradeep, to drink four quarters of country-made liquor within 20 minutes in presence of nine others, including Singh’s son Dharmendra.

The loser was supposed to pay for all the eight quarters bought from a nearby shop. The liquor was brought by a youth named Khayaliram.

According to Dharmendra, his father emerged winner by finishing his quota of liquor within 10 minutes without adding water to it.

After an hour, he reached home, lied on a charpoy kept outside his house and slept. Sometime later, he started vomiting blood and died before getting any medical attention, Dharmendra said.

“I am not sure exactly what happened to my father after drinking alcohol. He was forced by Pradeep to place a bet and the liquor was brought by someone else. We have given a complaint to police to identify the reason behind my father’s death and take action against the guilty,” the deceased’s son, Dharmendra, told TOI.

SHO of Izzatnagar police station AK Verma said, “Prima facie, Rajendra died due to excessive drinking. We have sent the body for autopsy. We have detained Pradeep who is extremely drunk. But, he doesn’t appear to be guilty of poisoning Rajendra. We have recorded the statement of all the people present when the bet was placed between Pradeep and Rajendra. We are waiting for the autopsy report before coming to any conclusion.”

Title: Delhi assembly elections: SAD happy to contest from 4 seats in Delhi
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Manjinder Singh Sirsa won the 2013 assembly poll on his own party symbol, but lost the 2015 election.

NEW DELHI: BJP ’s all-weather ally Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) will contest four of the 70 seats in the upcoming assembly polls .

Incumbent MLA Manjinder Singh Sirsa said he met senior BJP functionaries on Friday to seal the seat-sharing pact. While the decision that BJP will contest from 66 seats and leave four for its ally has already been taken, it is yet to be formally conveyed to the top leadership of the Sikh party. The two parties jointly contest the Punjab polls with a pre-decided seat-sharing arrangement.

Sirsa, who represents Rajouri Garden assembly constituency, said his party will contest from Rajouri Garden, Hari Nagar, Kalkaji and Shahdara seats where Sikhs and Punjabis are in a sizeable number. “We have already shortlisted our candidates. We will have a party meeting on Saturday in which the names will be finalised and announced,” he added.

SAD and BJP have been fighting the Delhi election together for quite some time now. The Sikh party always gets four candidates, though the constituencies change. While some of its candidates fight on the party’s election symbol, the weighing scale, some contest on BJP’s ticket.

Sirsa had won the 2013 assembly poll on his own party symbol, but lost the 2015 election. In the 2017 bypoll, he contested on the BJP symbol and won. He is likely to recontest from Rajouri Garden. SAD Delhi unit chief Harmeet Singh Kalka may contest from Kalkaji seat. He had won the 2013 election, but lost in 2015.

While there is no official confirmation, sources said AAP MLA Jagdeep Singh, who won both the 2013 and 2015 elections, may contest from Hari Nagar on a SAD ticket this time. He is among the 15 MLAs who were denied a ticket by AAP. From Shahdara, the party may field former MLA Jitender Singh Shunty, who had won the 2013 election. However, Sirsa said there are a couple more contenders and the final call will be taken on Saturday.

Title: Manoj Shashidhar appointed CBI joint director
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Manoj Shashidhar

AHMEDABAD: Additional DGP Manoj Shashidhar , an IPS officer of the 1994 batch, presently additional DGP CID (IB), has been sent on central deputation to the CBI as joint director (policy).

A letter from the department of personnel and training dated January 17 states that the approval of the appointments committee of the cabinet (ACC) was conveyed for the induction of Manoj Shashidhar as joint director in the CBI for a period of five years from the date of assumption of charge of till further orders.

The post of joint director (policy) is considered a very important one in the country’s premier investigation agency, sources said.

Shashidhar has earlier served as DCP, crime branch, range IG Gandhinagar and police commissioner of Vadodara.

Title: 54 visa windows at new US consulate building
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: The US Consul General in Hyderabad Joel Reifman inspected the progress of the construction of the new US consulate complex in Hyderabad.

Tweeting about the inspection, US Consulate General Hyderabad (@USAndHyderabad), said: “It will include 54 visa windows.” Currently, there are 16 visa windows. The tweet mentioned that “Reifman shared the space with visiting Director of #OfficeforIndiaAffairs Laura Stone”.

A discussion was also held about strong US-India partnership in Telangana with IT secretary Jayesh Ranjan. The complex will be located in Nanakramguda in the Financial District. The building is to meet green norms and the structure will work around boulders without destroying any.

Title: Thyroid awareness event held in city
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: With January being Thyroid Awareness Month, health experts pointed out that untreated thyroid disorder can have serious consequences on the overall well-being of affected persons.

They flagged the lack of awareness among the public and emphasised the importance of health check ups. There is a need for modifying the diet of people with thyroid disorders, which again most affected are unaware of, said the experts.

Elaborating on the symptoms of thyroid disorder, Dr RV Ravi Kanna Babu, senior consultant physician with Kims Icon Hospital said, “Symptoms of thyroid hormone deficiency or hypothyroidism include fatigue, cold intolerance, weight gain, constipation, dry skin, muscle pain, menstrual irregularities, metabolic abnormalities like hyper cholesterolemia, macrocytic anaemia and hyponatremia or low sodium concentration in blood.”

Title: Pune: Biker loses control, dies after crashing into wall
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: A 40-year-old man died on Thursday afternoon after he lost control of his motorcycle and crashed against the cement wall of a chamber near Talegaon Dabhade on Pune-Mumbai highway.

The Talegaon Dabhade police said though Yashwant Mane, a resident of Kaikadi in Talegaon taluka, was wearing a helmet, it broke into pieces under the impact of the collision.

Sub-inspector of Talegaon Dabhade police K S Gawari said when Mane reached near Talegaon Dabhade around 3pm, he lost control of the motorcycle. “The bike fell in a chamber along the highway. His headgear broke into pieces and the rear portion of his head hit the cement wall of the chamber. Mane died on the spot,” he said.

“Mane was a resident of Karjat taluka and recently shifted to Talegaon. He had given his house in Karjat on rent. The accident occurred while he was returning after collecting the rent from the tenant,” the officer said.

Title: Road safety week celebrated in city
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Road Safety Week celebrations began in the Port City.

“The staff and workers who are engaged in the underground electricity supply network cabling took part in the road safety awareness campaign at at Akkayyapalem, ” said the project manager PVV Pradeep. Four Town police station house officer Srinivasa Rao flagged off the awareness campaign.

Pradeep said that in continuation of the celebrations, their underground project team joined in to spread awareness about deaths caused by road accidents. The team distributed chocolates to people using helmets and encouraged them to keep using it while driving.

Meanwhile, the Road Transport Authority (RTA) officials said that the tourism minister Muttamsetti Srinivasa Rao would launch the week celebrations on January 18 at the Gambheeram driving track. tnn

Title: Head to Kharadi tomorrow morning for fitness, games, fun and frolic
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: As the mercury slides, the time is perfect to put on some winter wear and attend Happy Streets in Kharadi on Sunday from 6.30am to 9.30am.

With an assortment of games and activities lined up, Happy Streets is set to give residents a fun-filled morning with family and friends. A flank of the road between Reliance Smart and Swaraj Chowk at South Main Road, Kharadi, would be closed for vehicular traffic to make way for for the activities lined up participants.

So, put on your dancing shoes to indulge in a round of Zumba and Aerobics as the trainers guide participants to groove to the beats.

Take a break from the energy-high by participating in an assortment of activities like dart board game, quick bytes, waste quiz and hopscotch, among other games, organized by SWaCH outreach.

Further down the road, the fun for little ones begins. Children can enjoy tangram puzzles or fiddle with robots as Skillovate brings robot activity and paper robotics on the streets.

KDKBA will then take centre stage to guide the young and old in Taekwondo. Next up are fun games for children, including tug-of-war, windstick activity, life-size Ludo and Snakes and Ladders, tattoo-making and hula hoops.

Activities such as Fitness Mantra are sure to keep the energy running among adults.

Chaitanya School will perform a skit on “clean and green India”.

Happy Streets is incomplete without giving the little participants an opportunity to paint the streets red. Children can give colour to their imagination on the streets in the chalk art section. Those interested in music are also in for a treat as a guitar circle would ensure that you learn a trick or two with the chords, while enjoying the early morning chills.

Yoga and meditation organized by Pause and Learn will give participants the chance to cool down and enjoy the calm of an early winter morning. With the best saved for the last, enjoy pedalling around the empty vehicle-free streets at the cycle station placed at the end of Happy Streets.

Selife points placed at various locations will give participants an opportunity to click fond memories created at Happy Streets to cherish for days to come.

Happy Streets is an initiative of The Times of India, in association with the Pune police and Pune Municipal Corporation, powered by Nyati Group.

Title: North wind makes temperature across Maharashtra dip, chill to stay till Sunday
Content:
Wind chill factor brings down the actual minimum temperature depending upon the wind speed.

PUNE: After declaring the first cold day of the season on Friday, the India Meteorological Department said cold wave conditions in isolated pockets of the state, beginning with Jalgaon and Nashik, would persist for the whole of Saturday and Sunday morning.Cold day conditions are declared when the minimum temperature of a station dips to 10°C or less and the maximum temperature departure is -4.5°C to -6.4°C or more.Wind chill factor brings down the actual minimum temperature depending upon the wind speed.The actual minimum temperature of a station should be reduced to “wind chill effective minimum temperature. If WCTn is 10°C or less, conditions for cold wave are considered.Northerly winds have started penetrating north Maharashtra. These cold winds from the snowy mountains of the Himalayas blow across Rajasthan, Gujarat, and even parts of west Madhya Pradesh to Maharashtra.The chill was brought on by a sharp dip in the day temperatures across the state since Thursday and a plunging night temperature. Several locations recorded their lowest minimum temperatures on Friday and lowest maximum temperatures on Thursday. Nashik was the coldest place in the state with a minimum temperature of 6 degrees celsius.Mahabaleshwar (20.6°C) and Jalgaon (24.8°C) recorded the lowest January maximum temperatures after 2015, while Mumbai (Santacruz), at 25.3°C, recorded the lowest January day temperature in a decade on January 16.Pune's day temperature too plunged to the season's second lowest in Shivajinagar on Thursday to 26.1°C.The lowest day temperature of the season in Shivajinagar (25.7°C), Pashan (24.1°C) and Lohegaon (24.6°C) was recorded on January 4, but the minimum temperature on that day was higher than Friday’s minimum at these locations.Day temperatures in the state rose marginally on Friday, but remained below normal. On Friday, Shivajinagar, Lohegaon and Pashan recorded 27.8°C, 27.2°C and 26.4°C as their maximum temperatures, respectively.Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD Pune, told TOI that day temperatures have dropped in many locations, more so in Jalgaon, Malegaon and Nashik.“These three locations recorded high negative departures. Maximum or day temperatures have also dropped in other locations like Pune, Mumbai and Kolhapur due to the reduction in heat load during the day. When minimum or night temperatures fall significantly, day temperatures tend to reduce automatically, though marginally, due to a reduction in heat load over a region,” he said.The chilly conditions in the state are likely to last till January 19 morning, Kashyapi said. “After that, night temperatures may start increasing for the subsequent 48 hours,” he said.

Title: Gujarat high court notice over denial of nod for CAA protest
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court on Friday issued notice to the state government in response to a petition filed by two activists, after city police denied them permission to them to hold a peaceful protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at Khamasa Crossroads on Sunday.

Justice A Y Kogje sought a reply from the authority and posted a further hearing for Thursday. This led the petitioners to wait for the outcome of the litigation and postpone their programme from Sunday.

The petitioners – Mudita Vidrohi and Mujahid Nafees – approached the high court after city police did not take a decision on their application for permission to hold a protest against the CAA. The HC had ordered police to take a decision before Sunday so their application did not become infructuous.

On Wednesday evening, Gaekwad Haveli police station refused permission, saying that Khamasa is a congested area and people gathering there could create a law and order issue. The petitioners moved the HC again against this rejection, and claimed that it is their fundamental right to protest peacefully in this democratic country.

The petitioners’ advocate K R Koshti contended that the Lord Jagannath rath yatra has been passing through Khamasa every year for the last 130 years. More than one lakh devotees participate in the procession. Similarly, nearly 30,000 people participate in the procession of Eid-e-Milad every year, and this procession also passes through Khamasa. This area has never witnessed a law and order problem in the past.

In this petition too, the petitioners reiterated that the state administration immediately grants permission to the Bhartiya Janata Party (BJP) to hold demonstrations in support of CAA. There have been 62 such permissions granted to the ruling party, but the administration has been denying other people the permission to protest.

Title: Thiruvananthapuram: ‘Malicious campaign by communal forces’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kadakampally Surendran

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Kerala tourism minister Kadakampally Surendran defended the tweet on the official Kerala Tourism handle promoting a beef recipe, which triggered sharp reactions from several social-media users. The minister asserted that communally inclined people were behind this ‘malicious campaign’.

“Here in Kerala we don’t mix up food with religion. Kerala tourism has been promoting all kinds of Kerala delicacies including beef and pork. We don’t give any communal perspective to such promotions,” the minister told reporters here on Friday.

Pointing out that Kerala tourism was far ahead of tourism departments in other states in terms of its visibility on social-media platforms ‘thanks to its efficient marketing strategies’, the minister said tourists visiting the state ask particularly for dishes which are promoted on the internet. “Our marketing is a model for the whole world. Kerala Tourism has 18 lakh followers on Twitter, 35 lakh followers on Facebook and 2 lakh followers on Instagram,”’ he said.

Kerala Tourism’s Twitter handle on Wednesday had posted a photo of a ‘Beef Ularthiyathu’ dish with a link to the recipe. The tweet went viral and several people maintained that it was an insult to Hindus.

“Communal forces are trying to project that beef delicacies are made from cow meat, which is not true. Someone was asking if we promote pork dishes, which we have already done. We do such promotions, including those on art, culture, festivals and heritage of Kerala, besides our cuisine, on a regular basis,” the minister said, urging people to discard such false campaigns.

Title: Just when it should get warmer, cold wind lowers mercury to 8.2 degree Celsius in Pune
Content:
The chill came on suddenly on Friday, though Thursday morning was a cool 12.1°C in Shivajinagar.

Just when it should be warmer, mercury dips to 8.2°C in Pune

PUNE: After 47 days that were warmer than the normal winter days, it felt like winter in Pune on Friday.Shops selling winter wear in the Peth areas finally hoped for some business as it was the coldest this winter with the mercury plunging to a singledigit figure — 8.2°C — for the first time this season.The chill came on suddenly on Friday, though Thursday morning was a cool 12.1°C in Shivajinagar. From Thursday to Friday, it was a straight fourdegree plunge.The minimum temperature on Friday was lower than some locations in North India which has been in the grip of icy northerly winds blowing from the Himalayas.Locations like Delhi, Dehradun, Chandigarh, Ludhiana, Mohali and Pathankot on Friday recorded higher minimum temperatures than Pune and other locations in Maharashtra like Nashik, where the mercury plunged to 6°C. But very low day temperatures in these locations in North India made them feel much colder than Pune.The chill factor in Pune did peak as well with the day temperature dipping to the season’s second lowest at 26.1°C on Thursday, causing both the day and night to be nippy.“It usually gets warmer after Makar Sankranti, but that concept came to naught on Friday. It was so chilly that I had to slip into two sweaters to keep warm,” a city-based working professional said.Shivaji Mutkule, manager of Meher Woollens on Karve Road, said, “We expect the rush to increase at our stores till Saturday.”Suresh Dusad, owner of Prashant Woollens on Laxmi Road, hoped Friday’s chill would persist a little longer. “Sales plunged 25-30% this winter since it was not cold,” he said.Morning walkers and school children felt the nip in the air on Friday morning. Aniket Salve, who walks every morning from Senapati Bapat Road to FC Road, said, “Friday morning was so chilly that I had to kickstart my walk with a quick cup of hot tea from a roadside ‘tapri’.”Anupam Kashyapi, head of weather, IMD Pune, told TOI that the weather department on Thursday had expected a significant dip in minimum temperature (to 10°C), but it had not seemed like it would plunge below 10°C.While Pashan recorded 8.9°C as its minimum temperature on Friday, Shivajinagar recorded the lowest at 8.2°C. Lohegaon recorded a minimum of 10.2°C.“This was the first time this winter when the cold northerly winds penetrated northern parts of western and central Maharashtra, including Konkan, northcentral Madhya Maharashtra, northwestern Marathwada. Consecutive western disturbances are passing over northwest India, causing snowfall and rains over parts of Jammu & Kashmir, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh among others.
