These winds are coming from those chilly locations via east Rajasthan, west MP and entering into Maharashtra,” Kashyapi said.

Title: Gujarat high court paves way for woman to join husband in Germany
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Gujarat high court

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court has invoked its special powers to clear the way for Nidhi Bhatt of Junagadh to travel to Germany to join her husband, who is a permanent resident of the European country.

Bhatt was facing a hurdle in joining her husband, Milind, because of their marriage certificate. The discrepancy in the date of the issuance of the marriage certificate and the actual date of the wedding was holding her back in India. She was denied visa on this ground. The high court has quashed the marriage certificate and has ordered the authority concerned to issue a new certificate with the date changed on her application for the certificate.

In this case, Bhatt and Milind were to marry on December 11, 2017, upon Milind’s arrival in India. Milind’s grandfather’s health deteriorated on the day and the wedding rituals were postponed. Milind’s grandfather passed away on December 17, 2017, and the wedding took place on January 27, 2018.

Since the couple had applied for the marriage certificate on December 11, 2017, anticipating that the ritual would take place on the same day, the registrar of births, deaths, and marriages issued the marriage certificate on December 18, 2017.

After the marriage, when Bhatt applied for visa, the German authorities rejected her application on the grounds that the couple’s wedding had taken place on January 27, 2018, but the marriage certificate had been issued by the Indian authority 40 days earlier.

Bhatt applied to the registrar to rectify the marriage certificate. The request was rejected by the authority in September 2019 stating that the certificate was issued upon their declaration and they cannot ask for a correction at a belated stage.

This led Bhatt to approach the high court. Justice A Y Kogje observed, “The petitioner (Bhatt) is left without a remedy as on the one hand it cannot be said that Respondent No. 2 (registrar) has fallen in error, on the other hand, the date of marriage in the marriage certificate does not reflect the date of marriage accordingly. This is attributable to the factual prevalent circumstances in which petitioner has no role to play.”

The HC considered this a fit case to interfere. It quashed the registrar’s decision not to make changes in the marriage certificate, quashed the existing marriage certificate, and ordered the registrar to issue a new certificate with changed date upon Bhatt making a fresh application.

Title: Stage set for RCNV Kidathon on Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Rotary Club of Nagpur Vision will conduct its flagship project ‘RCNV Kidathon ’ on Sunday at 6am at Tirpude College Ground, Civil Lines.

The event is open for children in the age group 8 to 15 years, who will participate in 3km and 5km walking races for fun. There will be no winners and no losers in the event which is being held to promote the idea and culture of healthy living and fitness among young kids so that it benefits them throughout their life.

The 3km path for 8 to 11-year-olds will start at 6am from Tirpude College and traverse through Walkers’ Road Square, Shah Baba Darbar, Ladies Club Square, Japanese Garden Square and back to Tirpude College.

The 5km path for 11 to 15-year-olds will start from Tirpude College and pass via Walkers Road, Government Milk Scheme, Hanuman Mandir, Shah Baba Darbar, Ladies Club, Japanese Garden and back to Tirpude College.

This year is the third consecutive year of RCNV Kidathon. The organizers are expecting around 5,000 participants in this edition. In 2018 around 3,500 children had participated. Participants will get goody bags and ice cream free at the venue and there will also be a free T-shirt with every registration. Each finisher will also get a certificate.

It is generally seen that parents accompany young children at such events hence a huge area has been demarcated for the comfort of the parents while their children are participating in the walk. There will be several interesting and useful stalls at the venue where the parents can browse till the event is over.

Rotary Club of Nagpur Vision is taking adequate precautions and preparations to ensure smooth functioning of the event with all permissions, licences, safety measures, etc with its 150 strong force of volunteers and workers.

Title: Gujarat: Vishal Goswami invoked dons’ names
Content:
Vishal Goswami

AHMEDABAD: The investigation of the activities of the Vishal Goswami gang has revealed that it tried to extort money from a businessman and some bookies by using the names of underworld dons Chhota Shakeel and Ravi Pujari .Gujarat Police have invoked the Gujarat Control of Terrorism and Organised Crime (GujCTOC) Act against Goswami, his brother Ajay, and his nephew Rinku. This is the first time that the Act has been used. The three are lodged in the Ahmedabad Central Jail and the crime branch has applied for their transfer warrant.A senior crime branch official said Goswami’s men demanded Rs 5 crore each from the businessman and the bookies. “The gang had even recced sites related to their targets and told them that they would be shot unless they paid up,” a crime branch official said.Sources said that during the extortion calls, the gang slightly altered the dons’ names. “They referred to Shakeel as ‘Chotee Shakeel’ and Pujari as ‘Pijari’,” the official said.Additional director general of police (prisons) K L N Rao said that an inquiry has begun to determine how the gang managed to get the phones into the jail. He said jailer Group-2 B R Vaghela has been suspended and senior jailer H L Vaghela has been transferred.“Now deputy superintendent of police T N Rana has been made in charge of undertrial prisoners and we have deployed 100 jail sahayaks for security and search operations in the jail,” Rao said. When asked about jammers, he said it was a question of technology upgrade.

Title: Switch-hit: Kapil Mishra rewarded with ticket
Content:
Kapil Mishra has become a vociferous critic of AAP. (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Kapil Mishra, a former minister in Arvind Kejriwal’s cabinet and now a trenchant critic of the Delhi chief minister, is the BJP nominee in the Model Town assembly constituency. Even before he joined the saffron party a few months ago, Mishra had been vociferously criticising the Aam Aadmi Party since his sacking from the cabinet in May 2017. Once Kerjiwal’s blue-eyed boy, the former water minister was booted out after making allegations of corruption against the CM and health minister Satyendar Jain.Mishra had lodged complaints with the Central Bureau of Investigation and the Lokayukta claiming that he had seen Kejriwal accepting Rs 2 crore in cash from Jain. A little more than a year after these accusations, both CBI and the Lokayukta gave Kejriwal a clean chit. CBI conducted a preliminary inquiry against Kejriwal based on Mishra’s complaint but found no merit in it and did not launch a formal probe. Then, on the basis of CBI’s inquiry findings, the Lokayukta too closed the case against the Delhi CM.Mishra's staunch opposition to Kejriwal and his hardline Hindutva endeared him to BJP. Son of former east Delhi mayor and BJP leader Annapurna Mishra, Kapil Mishra developed a nuisance value for the saffron party as he took on Kejriwal and AAP on numerous occasions. Even as he remained an AAP MLA, he started getting closer to BJP and later started sharing the stage at various events with BJP leaders. In the 2019 Lok Sabha election, he planned a campaign in support of PM Narendra Modi.The anti-party activities of Mishra were brought to the notice of Delhi assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel and led to his disqualification as MLA in August 2019 under the anti-defection law. But even after disbarment, Mishra was active in Karawal Nagar, obviously seeing his constituency as a contest ground this year.In the event, BJP fielded Mishra from Model Town rather than Karawal Nagar. “I am happy with the change of seat,” Mishra said on Friday. “This is also a favourable seat for me. I will leave no stone unturned in winning the poll.”While thanking Delhi election in-charge Prakash Javadekar, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and others for giving him the opportunity to contest the election, Mishra said, “Together with the workers of the constituency, we will win the Model Town seat for PM Narendra Modi.”BJP has fielded another AAP rebel, Anil Bajpai, from Gandhi Nagar, while two more AAP turncoats — Gugan Singh, who was eyeing the Bawana constituency, and Devinder Sehrawat, who was eyeing the Bijwasan nomination — weren’t lucky. Bajpai was elected MLA from Gandhi Nagar in 2015, but was disqualified last year for joining the saffron party. Sehrawat was disqualified as Bijwasan MLA for the same reason.

Title: Switch-hit: Kapil Mishra rewarded with ticket
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kapil Mishra has become a vociferous critic of AAP. (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Kapil Mishra, a former minister in Arvind Kejriwal’s cabinet and now a trenchant critic of the Delhi chief minister, is the BJP nominee in the Model Town assembly constituency. Even before he joined the saffron party a few months ago, Mishra had been vociferously criticising the Aam Aadmi Party since his sacking from the cabinet in May 2017. Once Kerjiwal’s blue-eyed boy, the former water minister was booted out after making allegations of corruption against the CM and health minister Satyendar Jain.

Mishra had lodged complaints with the Central Bureau of Investigation and the Lokayukta claiming that he had seen Kejriwal accepting Rs 2 crore in cash from Jain. A little more than a year after these accusations, both CBI and the Lokayukta gave Kejriwal a clean chit. CBI conducted a preliminary inquiry against Kejriwal based on Mishra’s complaint but found no merit in it and did not launch a formal probe. Then, on the basis of CBI’s inquiry findings, the Lokayukta too closed the case against the Delhi CM.

Mishra's staunch opposition to Kejriwal and his hardline Hindutva endeared him to BJP. Son of former east Delhi mayor and BJP leader Annapurna Mishra, Kapil Mishra developed a nuisance value for the saffron party as he took on Kejriwal and AAP on numerous occasions. Even as he remained an AAP MLA, he started getting closer to BJP and later started sharing the stage at various events with BJP leaders. In the 2019 Lok Sabha election, he planned a campaign in support of PM Narendra Modi.

The anti-party activities of Mishra were brought to the notice of Delhi assembly Speaker Ram Niwas Goel and led to his disqualification as MLA in August 2019 under the anti-defection law. But even after disbarment, Mishra was active in Karawal Nagar, obviously seeing his constituency as a contest ground this year.

In the event, BJP fielded Mishra from Model Town rather than Karawal Nagar. “I am happy with the change of seat,” Mishra said on Friday. “This is also a favourable seat for me. I will leave no stone unturned in winning the poll.”

While thanking Delhi election in-charge Prakash Javadekar, Delhi BJP chief Manoj Tiwari and others for giving him the opportunity to contest the election, Mishra said, “Together with the workers of the constituency, we will win the Model Town seat for PM Narendra Modi.”

BJP has fielded another AAP rebel, Anil Bajpai, from Gandhi Nagar, while two more AAP turncoats — Gugan Singh, who was eyeing the Bawana constituency, and Devinder Sehrawat, who was eyeing the Bijwasan nomination — weren’t lucky. Bajpai was elected MLA from Gandhi Nagar in 2015, but was disqualified last year for joining the saffron party. Sehrawat was disqualified as Bijwasan MLA for the same reason.

Title: Farmers from capital region seek more time to file grievances with CRDA
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

People participate in bike rally organised by Amaravati Parirakshna Samithi JAC in Vijayawada on Friday

Vijayawada: Farmers from the capital region moved the high court with a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) petition seeking an extension to submit their grievances to the Capital Region Development Authority (CRDA) over the proposed shifting of the capital from Amaravati. In their petition, the farmers argued that the CRDA has given them very little window of opportunity to submit their grievances.

The state government on January 14 told the farmers to submit their grievances to CRDA by Friday evening. However, the farmers argued that the time given to them was very little as three of the alloted days were holidays and on Friday—the last day to submit their grievances—they faced technical issues with the CRDA website.

The high court bench comprising Justice M V Sesha Sai and Justice M Satyanarayana Murthy observed that sufficient time needed to be given to the farmers to respond to the notice issued to express grievances. Responding on behalf of the state government, advocate general S Sriram told the court that there was no issue with the CRDA website.

The advocate general further said that the CRDA had received more than 7000 grievances through various means. He said farmers had queued up at Thullur CRDA office to submit their grievances to CRDA officials. He told the high court that they do not have any problem to extend the time till Monday afternoon.

The farmers further argued in their petition that the CRDA had not given notices properly. “The notices should be given on what the government intends to do with the capital,” they said.

Taking the arguments of both sides, the high court directed the state government to extend the time till 2:30 pm on Monday to submit the grievances and posted the matter for further hearing on the same day.

Title: Make a BC TPCC chief, says VHR
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: All India Congress Committee secretary V Hanumanth Rao on Friday reiterated his demand that a candidate from Backward Classes (BCs) community should be appointed as Telangana Congress president.

“ BCs comprise over 52% of the population in Telangana. A BC leader should be made PCC president with an eye on BC vote bank,” Rao said.

Rao demanded that AICC leadership take an opinion poll to select a candidate for TPCC chief post. TNN

Title: ‘Centre can’t remain silent on state capital tussle’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Guntur: TDP MLC and Public Accounts Committee (PAC) chairman Payyavula Kesava has urged the Centre to intervene and address concerns about AP’s capital. He asserted that the Centre was duty-bound to protect the interests of the people.

Speaking to reporters here on Friday, Kesava said Amaravati may be a big issue for the state, but not for the Centre. “We request the Centre to play the elder brother’s role in resolving the issue of the capital city. The Centre is a stakeholder in the capital city and it can’t remain silent,” Kesava said.

He added that the BJP’s growth in the state depend, among other things, on how the party would tackle the issue. The Centre has taken bold decisions on many sensitive issues including Jammu and Kashmir, and so Amaravati was not a big issue for them, he said.

“BJP leaders have been speaking in different tones about the capital city issue. We expect them to jump into action at least after joining hands with Pawan Kalyan,” said Kesava. He said that BJP had failed to fulfil the promises on SCS and special package in the past and people were keenly watching for the Centre’s support at least on capital city issue.

He said that shifting of High Court was not possible without the Centre’s support and people were puzzled to know as to how YSRC leadership moved the proposal without having backing from the Centre.

Title: Sare offered to folk goddess Moolasthana Ellamma
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Tirupati: State government whip and ex-officio member of the Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams trust board Dr Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy presented ‘ sare ’ which included gifts, saree, and the like, to Moolasthana Ellamma, a local folk goddess who is believed to be the sister of Lord Venkateswara.

In connection with the annual Sankranthi Kondachutu festival, TUDA chief Dr Chevireddy Bhaskar Reddy ceremoniously carried the ‘sare’ on his head in a procession and presented it at the local temple on behalf of the TTD at Chandragiri on Friday.

Speaking to reporters, Dr Reddy said that immense importance is attached to the Sankranthi Kondachuttu festival. tnn

Title: Delhi assembly elections: CM Arvind Kejriwal to hold eight town halls in final leg of poll campaign
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CM Arvind Kejriwal inaugurates the election office of Shakur Basti candidate Satyendar Jain on Friday.

NEW DELHI: To maintain momentum, Aam Aadmi Party has decided to launch the final leg of its election campaign in the last week of January and complete it before voting starts on February 8. The campaign will begin on January 23 with the launch of “Kejriwal ka Guarantee Card” listing the major promises to be fulfilled in the next five years.

On Friday, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal inaugurated the election office of Shakur Basti candidate Satyendar Jain. “For the first time, people are appreciating and lauding a government after its tenure of five years, instead of criticising it. BJP is claiming that all subsidies will be waived off by March 31, but I assure you that till Arvind Kejriwal is in Delhi, all the free provisions will continue. It can be revoked if you vote for the opposition,” the CM said.

“In the last election, people voted for AAP because of its honesty. This time they will vote for AAP government’s work. No party has ever asked for votes on the basis of work done by its government. Vote for us only if you believe that we have worked for you, otherwise don’t,” said Kejriwal.

Kejriwal will be holding eight town halls between January 23 and 30. This will be his second round of public meetings during which he interacts with people, elaborates on the achievements of the AAP government and presents the roadmap for the next five years. The second round will witness Kejriwal briefing people on guarantee cards.

AAP is planning to release its election manifesto by January 26. The guarantee card will be taken to people through a door-to-door campaign, which will continue till February 2. “We will be knocking on the doors of 35 lakh households with the good news of the key promises that the Kejriwal government will guarantee to fulfill in the next five years,” said AAP Delhi convener Gopal Rai.

The party has also planned extensive padyatras and indoor public meetings Since the announcement of elections. AAP has been forging ahead on all fronts, including announcement of candidates in all assembly segments.

Title: Nirbhaya’s mother denies report of fighting Delhi election
Content:
Asha Devi

NEW DELHI: Rubbishing reports that she might be the Congress candidate against chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the New Delhi seat, Nirbhaya ’s mother Asha Devi on Friday said she had no interest in joining politics.Delhi Congress campaign committee chairman Kirti Azad had earlier hinted in a Tweet that Asha Devi may join the grand old party. “Ae Ma tujhe salaam! Asha Devi ji aapka swagat hai (Hey Mother, I salute you! You are welcome Asha Devi),” the tweet said.Asha Devi said she only wants the Nirbhaya case convicts to be hanged. “I have no interest in politics. I have not spoken to anyone in Congress. I only want justice for my daughter and execution of the convicts. Mera politics se door door tak koi naata nahi hai (I have no connection with politics),” she told reporters.Nirbhaya’s father Badrinath said that the news reports were wrong and that the family had no interest in politics.Azad told TOI that he quoted a tweet of a journalist that said that Nirbhaya’s mother could be Congress’ candidate from New Delhi. “I just trusted the information put out on Twitter and retweeted it with my comment,” he said, adding that there was no discussion in the party on the issue.Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra tweeted in Hindi: “Everybody is welcome in Congress. But in an environment, if there is any unconfirmed news related to the distribution of tickets, I want to make it clear that I did not have any talk with anyone in this regard.”Nirbhaya, a 23-year-old paramedic, was gang-raped and killed in December 2012. Delhi Police later arrested six people, including a juvenile, for the crime. While one accused committed suicide in jail, four were awarded death sentence.

Title: Rs 1,000cr from Nabard for better school infra
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Vijayawada: National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) has come forward to extend financial assistance to take up renovation work in schools and hospitals under Naadu Nedu programme. Nabard sanctioned Rs 1,048 crore for Naadu Nedu project in the state focusing on improving infrastructure in 615 primary schools and augmentation of rural public health institutions including primary health centres (PHCs) and community health centres (CHCs), a prioritised project under chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy’s Navaratnalu.

Nabard chief general manager (CGM) of AP region, S Selvaraj said in a press release on Friday that Rs 515.07 crore was sanctioned towards He explained that Nabard funding would be spent on 250 schools located in Vishakhapatnam, Vizianagaram, Srikakulam, East Godavari, West Godavari and Guntur.

Title: Nirbhaya’s mother denies report of fighting Delhi election
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Asha Devi

NEW DELHI: Rubbishing reports that she might be the Congress candidate against chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the New Delhi seat, Nirbhaya ’s mother Asha Devi on Friday said she had no interest in joining politics.

Delhi Congress campaign committee chairman Kirti Azad had earlier hinted in a Tweet that Asha Devi may join the grand old party. “Ae Ma tujhe salaam! Asha Devi ji aapka swagat hai (Hey Mother, I salute you! You are welcome Asha Devi),” the tweet said.

Asha Devi said she only wants the Nirbhaya case convicts to be hanged. “I have no interest in politics. I have not spoken to anyone in Congress. I only want justice for my daughter and execution of the convicts. Mera politics se door door tak koi naata nahi hai (I have no connection with politics),” she told reporters.

Nirbhaya’s father Badrinath said that the news reports were wrong and that the family had no interest in politics.

Azad told TOI that he quoted a tweet of a journalist that said that Nirbhaya’s mother could be Congress’ candidate from New Delhi. “I just trusted the information put out on Twitter and retweeted it with my comment,” he said, adding that there was no discussion in the party on the issue.

Delhi Congress chief Subhash Chopra tweeted in Hindi: “Everybody is welcome in Congress. But in an environment, if there is any unconfirmed news related to the distribution of tickets, I want to make it clear that I did not have any talk with anyone in this regard.”

Nirbhaya, a 23-year-old paramedic, was gang-raped and killed in December 2012. Delhi Police later arrested six people, including a juvenile, for the crime. While one accused committed suicide in jail, four were awarded death sentence.

Title: Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation steps up efforts to meet Swachhata app download target
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Swachhata app is a citizen grievance platform to get feedback from people regarding the city's sanitation

BHUBANESWAR: Just about 7,500 people have downloaded the Swachhata app in the city this financial year, indicating a poor response from the public to the Centre’s cleanliness initiative. A city can earn 440 marks in Swachh Sarvekshan (cleanliness survey) if more people download the app.

The 440 marks for downloading the app is out of 1500 that has been set aside for citizen feedback under the survey. Swachhata app is a citizen grievance platform to get feedback from people regarding the city’s sanitation.

BMC sources said at least 15 per cent of the city’s population should download the app to fetch 440 marks. So far, 4.5 per cent people of the total 10 lakh population of the city have the app available on their smartphones. The app was launched by the Centre in 2016, but the evaluation as to how many people use it is done every year afresh.

Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) deputy commissioner (sanitation) Subhendu Sahu said to generate awareness among the people, the Swachh team from the BMC visit schools and colleges on a daily basis. “We have intensified the awareness drive so that more people use the app. The team helps the students download the app on their smartphones by giving them demonstration,” Sahu said. But he claimed they are hopeful that very soon they would achieve the target.

Bhubaneswar is one of the 4,830 cities participating in Swachh Sarvekshan (cleanliness survey) contest. In 2019, the city had slipped to 288 rank from 245 in 2018. It had lost considerable marks under the citizen feedback category as it couldn’t achieve the target of getting people to download the Swachhata app.

From 94th rank in 2017, when 500 cities were surveyed, the city had slipped to 288 last year as it lost around 1,000 marks due to poor solid waste management. There were several parameters and solid waste collection, disposal and processing plant were significant among them.

Recently, the BMC declared the city open defecation free (ODF++) for ensuring zero open defecation. A city can be declared as ODF++ on the basis of several parameters such as feedback from resident welfare associations, citizens, voluntary organisations, schools and college principals and other bodies. The city also has to ensure that it has enough public and community toilets to meet the requirement apart from effective feacal sludge management system.

The ODF ++ status is basically a self-declaration by BMC, which will later be validated by a central team from the ministry of urban and housing affairs (MoHUA) for according the status by a certification.

Title: Kerala: Protest against SFI leads to lathicharge at CMS College
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Police resorted to mild lathicharge to disperse the crowd outside the entrance of CMS College in Kottayam on F... Read More

KOTTAYAM: Students of CMS College organized and protested against the unit committee of the SFI leading to a tense situation in the campus on Friday. Police were deployed in large numbers and the cops resorted to mild lathicharge to disperse the crowd outside the entrance of the college.

The students got together in the morning to protest against the attack on two second-year graduation students by SFI college unit leaders. The college management as well as teachers too came in support of the students. The students did not allow the SFI leaders who allegedly orchestrated the attack to enter the campus. Students in large numbers stood at the entrance gate shouting slogans and blocking the way for the SFI leaders.

The situation became tense as more and more SFI activists from other city colleges arrived at the scene and waited at the entrance. Following the intervention of police, holiday was declared for the college in the afternoon and students were asked to leave the campus. SFI unit office bearers who were waiting outside the gate were taken into custody and shifted into police bus. CPM district leadership held talks with police and the protesters were removed from the scene. SFI leaders who were taken into custody were later let off.

SFI leaders alleged that a ganja mafia is operating inside the campus. “They are attacking the students and the SFI will put an end to this,” they said.

The controversy that lead to the incident began during a recent college tour. Two students were suspended for allegedly attacking a SFI student during the tour. The suspended students were attacked by armed men allegedly under the direction of SFI leaders.

Title: Will Sahebrao walk with a prosthetic limb today?
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Even as the stage is set to for tiger Sahebrao to get a prosthetic limb, wildlife veterinarians, orthopaedic surgeons and forest officials are keeping their fingers crossed hoping for the experiment to be successful. The animal is now housed at the Gorewada rescue centre here.

Sahebrao, a 9-year-old male, will be fitted with an artificial limb on its left paw on Saturday by experts from MAFSU’s Wildlife Research & Training Centre (WRTC), city orthopedician Dr Sushrut Babhulkar and professor of orthopaedics in University of Leeds Dr Peter Giannoudis. Officials of Forest Development Corporation of Maharashtra (FDCM) too will be present.

As reported by TOI earlier, Sahebrao will be the first tiger in the world to get an artificial limb. Earlier, it has been done for dogs and elephants. Sahebrao lost its paw on April 26, 2012 in a trap set by hunters outside Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve in Chandrapur district.

On Friday, experts and officials discussed the arrangements. “This being the first case on a tiger, we don’t know how the animal will react. The chances are 50:50,” said wildlife veterinarians.

“Tigers don’t even tolerate ticks on their body. Will Sahebrao adjust to the prosthetic? The first 10 minutes post recovery will be very crucial to see whether the tiger feels comfortable or not,” they said.

“The artificial limb should reduce pressure on its other three legs. If the tiger does not respond well to the prosthetic, we may have to take it into a trap cage and then remove it,” said experts.

Sources said designing a prosthetic limb is a complex process. Sahebrao’s limb has been prepared under the guidance of Dr Babhulkar with technical know-how from Germany’s AO Foundation, well-known name in fracture fixation of humans and animals.

The carbon fibre limb made for Sahebrao is strong and durable, and weighs only 1.5kg. It is covered with foam padding for comfort and is skin-coloured. It will be fitted with screws so that the tiger is unable to remove it.

The operation will start by administering anaesthesia to the tiger at 8am and will last or over two hours. In case the tiger removes or damages the prosthetic while attempting to walk, it will have to be tranquillized again.

The decision to fit Sahebrao an artificial limb was taken on February 3, 2018 when Dr Babhulkar adopted the tiger. The first step to fit an artificial limb started in August 2018 by taking 12 X-rays and blood samples of the limb.

After clinical examination it was found that the fracture had caused non-union of bones in three places. There was a painful scar formation and its fifth toe was damaged and was affecting the 200kg tiger’s walking.

Based on the radiology reports, a team of WRTC experts operated on Sahebrao on October 9 for neuroma and arthritis, and took measurement for prosthesis. Post-surgery, Sahebrao’s surgery wounds have healed and pain has apparently reduced drastically.

“After fitting the artificial limb, vets will be monitoring Sahebrao regularly. Gorewada officials will have to ensure that the tiger doesn’t gain weight or else it will make the prosthesis ineffective,” say wildlife vets.

SATURDAY PLAN

* Sahebrao will be tranquillized around 8am

* It will be fitted with the artificial limb by WRTC experts and orthopedicians

* The experts will watch the movement of tiger post revival whether it is walking normally

* If the tiger feels uncomfortable and removes the prosthetics than it will have to be again tranquillized to remove the limb

* Entire process from giving anaesthesia to reversing it and observing the tiger respond will take more than 2 hours

Title: After SC nudge, state to broadcast road rules as fillers in movie halls and on radio channels
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The state government has decided to broadcast messages related to the amended Motor Vehicles Act as fillers and through radio jingles for the next six months.

The move aims to create awareness about the consequences of violating the new traffic rules.

“The M/S UFO movies has already submitted a proposal for the screening of fillers related to road safety in cinema halls following a Supreme Court directive. We have decided to implement it not only in cinema halls, but also in radio channels,” a transport department official said.

Apart from this, the state government has also decided to make a video on road safety and broadcast it near educational institutions. The objective is to make students aware about under-age driving and other traffic violations.

Meanwhile, the state government will also set up a control and command centre where people can call and get answers to queries about the amended road safety rules.

“The command centre will not only address the queries of the general public, but also help enforce the new rules through a camera surveillance system. We have already initiated the process of setting up the command centre,” the official said.

Title: Laxmi Nagar: Even residents say growth can’t come overnight here
Content:
Locals say encroachment, parking, congestion, sanitation, road infrastructure and water availability are key ... Read More

NEW DELHI: Laxmi Nagar has an unenviable image. It not only has perhaps the highest population density in Delhi, but it also struggles with a multiplicity of urban woes — unregulated constructions, massive encroachment, unchecked commercialisation, deplorable sanitation and inadequate infrastructure. Walk around in Ganesh Nagar, Pandav Nagar, Laxmi Nagar or Shakarpur and you will find electricity wires dangling dangerously overhead, a sight that sends a chilling warning of the disaster that could overtake the overcrowded, ill-appointed localities crammed with humanity.While some voters in the Laxmi Nagar assembly constituency argue that little has been done to improve conditions in the past 5-7 years, others reason that the region is so overcrowded so to render any overhauling of infrastructure in a single legislative term impossible. Satish Gupta, a Laxmi Nagar resident, said with conviction that it would be unfair to expect the MLA to widen roads, lay sewer lines or remove encroachments in five years.“AAP has worked hard regarding education, water supply, electricity and roads and I have seen major change in the state of the school building where my son studies,” Gupta said. “The government has also impartially considered residents’ issues. Last November, when we complained about the poor water supply, a DJB official immediately turned up to look at the problem.”Asar Ali of Mandawali had a similar story. “In our locality, roads have been re-laid, the drainage revamped and the place looks much better than it did 7-8 years ago,” he said. “This government is also helping the poor people by giving subsidies in power and water.”It’s not a total fairy tale, however. At Lalita Park, K C Garg fumed, “From the time our MLA A K Walia became health minister (2008, under Sheila Dikshit), we have been requesting a change of sewer lines. They are small, just 8-10 inches in diameter, and were laid a long time ago. Since then, the population has grown many time and there is great burden on the sewerage.”Lalita Park is the same neighbourhood where a building collapse killed 70 people in 2010. Though the government had promised to retrofit the numerous unsafe buildings, little has been done to address the problem, said a resident. Aniruddh Kumar, who lives in Shakarpur, added, “It is not just Lalita Park, the entire Laxmi Nagar constituency suffers the bane of illegal construction. Some demolitions were carried last year on Mangal Bazaar Road, but things remain the same elsewhere.” Lack of parking space is an additional problem. The colony roads are too narrow for parking, so people leave their vehicles on the main or service roads.

Title: Kolkata: Romanian gang’s Gaya aides held
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Cloned ATM cards seized from the accused.

KOLKATA: The second Romanian skimming gang members may be behind the bars but their Indian counterparts — Gaya gang members — are still in operation across the city. Kolkata Police arrested two Gaya residents, Mudassar Khan and Irfanuddin, on Thursday night for allegedly duping senior citizens on the pretext of helping them withdraw money from the ATM kiosks where security guards were not present.

The duo landed in the police net from Sealdah station where they had come to catch Darjeeling Mail.

The second modus operandi of the Gaya gang left the police more worried.

The accused took the help of restaurant staff and tipped them a fixed amount every time they accepted a card and swiped it on behalf of diners. “The duo used skimming machine that they had bought online for around Rs 6,000. Using the machine, they copied the diner’s personal data from the ATM card and uploaded it in a computer,” said joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma.

According to the police, the duo used to operate in several restaurants situated at Jadavpur, Garfa, Kasba and Tiljala. Sources said that nearly 38 cloned cards had been recovered from the possession of the accused.

Cops seized a laptop from them and found that more than 300 customers’ data had been stored in it.

Besides, cops recovered a skimming device and a magnetic stripe reader writer used to copy data on the duplicate card. This is the second time Gaya-based skimming racketeers were nabbed in the city.

The accused had prepared cloned cards with the stolen data and withdrew money, using the PIN numbers from other ATM booths in far off places. “They were staying in the city with their families at rented houses in Jadavpur and Tiljala. But they would travel to Siliguri, Darjeeling, Kurseong and Shillong to withdraw the money,” said Sharma.

After the skimming the accused would make two transactions — one before midnight and the other after 12am. This allowed them to make maximum withdrawals for two consecutive days, according to a police officer. The police are trying to establish the money trail to ensure that a stronger chargesheet can be made against the accused.

“Establishing the money trail will help us know how the accused had parked their money. It will also help us reach the gang leader who is probably operating outside the state,” added the officer.

Title: MDDA offers discounts on flats for low income groups
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

DEHRADUN: The Mussoorie and Dehradun Development Authority ( MDDA ) has come up with a new offer as part of its existing scheme, Transport Area Residential Scheme, in which flats will be provided at a discounted rate to people belonging to the lower income groups.

The original rate of a 1BHK MDDA flat is Rs 19.9 lakh on which a Rs 1 lakh discount will be given, MDDA officials said.

On group bookings, a discount of 4-5% apart from the Rs 1 lakh will also be given, they added. "In the group booking, if some people have made a group of eight people, then they will have to book at least eight flats in order to avail the 4-5% discount apart from the Rs 1 lakh discount which is being given to everybody," an official said.

Women, senior citizens and disabled are being provided with an additional discount of 1% in the scheme.

People from the lower income group working in government departments and public sector units will also be provided with an additional discount of Rs 50,000.

A resident can claim a maximum discount of Rs 1.5 lakh per flat, MDDA officials further said.

Ashish Srivastava, vice-chairman of MDDA, told TOI that he is hopeful of a good response. “We have come up with this scheme for residents to fulfil their dreams of owning a house in Dehradun. I am sure the discounts will motivate them towards this end."

Title: Remembering Rohith Vemula: Students stage silent stir at Freedom Park
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Students gather at Freedom Park on Friday

BENGALURU: A 48-hour hunger strike, organised at Freedom Park on Friday evening in memory of Hyderabad Central University student Rohith Vemula, who committed suicide four years ago alleging discrimination, threatened to snowball into a confrontation between students and police. The students, however, vacated the venue later in the night after much cajoling and pressuring by police.

Over 100 protesting students left the venue around 9.30pm, calling off the two-day strike.

The silent stir began around 7pm, with students paying tribute to Vemula by lighting candles. They sat in groups, with some of them singing shayaris. Slogans hailing azadi and crticising BJP and the RSS rent the air.

The number of participants kept growing through the evening. Though they had no police permission, the organisers had told the students that they be prepared to get detained and that legal aid would be provided.

Though there was no permission, west division police said students could stay at the venue till 9.30pm but not beyond. However, the youths said they were ready to be detained and insisted on continuing with the strike for the next 48 hours.

Though the organisers agreed to the condition laid down by police, the youngsters appeared restive and determined. However, the organisers were able to convince them to leave the place.

Title: FASTag fraud: Cybersecurity expert from Bengaluru shares PIN, OTP, loses Rs 50,000 in eight minutes
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: If you thought ranting about poor customer service on social media could get you a quick response, think again: you could even fall prey to online fraudsters.

A city-based cybersecurity specialist lost Rs 50,000 when he took to Twitter to complain about a bank after multiple attempts to recharge his FASTag wallet failed. A complaint to this effect was lodged with Hennur police on Wednesday. This is the first online fraud being reported in the city with FASTag as the bait.

The victim, Nikhil (name changed on request) of Banaswadi, told TOI: “On January 11, I raised a complaint on Twitter about problems with recharging FASTag issued by Axis Bank. The bank staff responded and sought the registered number and contact details. In my response, I provided my contact details. On January 13, I got a call from a person who claimed to be from Axis Bank’s customer helpdesk.”

Nikhil took it to be a genuine response. “The caller sent me a link through SMS which said, ‘Axis Bank — FASTag form’ and asked me to provide a few details in order to activate my FASTag wallet. In the form, I provided details like my full name, registered mobile number and Unified Payment Interface (UPI) PIN. I thought the application itself served as a point of recharge. I typed the PIN and submitted it. Subsequently, I was told that the helpdesk had generated a one-time pass (OTP) which was sent to my phone. The caller told me to send the OTP to a different number and I did accordingly.”

The moment Nikhil shared the OPT, he got a notification stating Rs 5,000 had been debited from his account. “I realised someone had hacked my UPI and was transferring the money. I quickly logged into my account and tried to block it, but it was too late. They had already withdrawn Rs 50,000 from my HDFC account and Rs 750 from my ICICI Bank. The UPI was linked to both the accounts.”

Nikhil said he should have been more cautious and not shared the UPI PIN. “They withdrew money in less than eight minutes. I was able to save Rs 30,000 by transferring the amount to a different account before they could lay their hands on it,” he added.

Nikhil started probing on his own and collected details pertaining to the fraud before approaching police. “Miscreants were sending these forms sitting in West Bengal and siphoning off money,” Nikhil said and added: “I have learnt a lesson. I appeal to others not to fall prey to scamsters.”

Title: Kolkata: Bikers snatch bag of Salt Lake businessman’s wife
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The spot at CB Block where the woman’s bag was snatched.

KOLKATA: Bike-borne youths snatched a handbag from a 57-year-old woman at Salt Lake ’s CB Block on Friday evening when she was about to get into her car after coming out of a beauty parlour on the other side of the road.

The incident happened around 5.30pm when Bimla Todi, wife of a leading industrialist in Salt Lake, was coming back home from a session at the beauty parlour. The man riding pillion snatched her leather bag as she fell on the road and screamed for help.

However, the bike sped away towards the CA Market area, the complainant told cops. “The youths had worn denim jackets and trousers and the one riding pillion wasn’t wearing a helmet. His hair had golden streaks but in the melee my wife couldn’t note down the registration number of the bike. My wife has also suffered injuries on her hand,” said the industrialist who requested not to be named. He added the bag contained cash, house keys and multiple credit cards.

Cops said they have started an FIR and already spoken to witnesses in the area. They are checking CCTV footage of the neighbourhood to find out the culprits. “We are working on some leads,” said cops.

Title: Delhi assembly elections: Atishi, Gahlot among AAP bigwigs to file papers
Content:
Atishi

NEW DELHI: Several Aam Aadmi Party ( AAP ) candidates, including transport minister Kailash Gahlot, key functionary Atishi and the contender from Dwarka Vinay Mishra, filed their nomination papers on Friday. Earlier, they took part in roadshows and processions in their respective assembly constituencies.In her roadshow held on Friday morning, Atishi was accompanied by deputy chief minister Manish Sisodia. She sought blessings at Giri Nagar Gurdwara before submitting her nomination papers at the SDM office. “We have worked hard in the past five years. Now, people want Arvind Kejriwal to become their CM again,” said Atishi, who is contesting from Kalkaji assembly constituency.With hundreds of supporters, Gahlot went to the SDM office for filing his nomination in a procession. Wearing AAP’s signature white caps, the roadshow participants chanted “lage raho Kejriwal” even as the party’s election song played repeatedly on the audio system.Among other AAP candidates who filed their nominations on Friday were Rakhi Bidlan from Mangolpuri, Som Dutt from Sadar Bazar, Pramila Tokas from RK Puram and Naresh Yadav from Mehrauli.The affidavits filed by the candidates provide a glimpse of diversity in terms of assets, educational backgrounds and other details.Atishi has declared family assets worth Rs 1.4 crore—a marginal increase from Lok Sabha election declaration of Rs 1.2 crore. She holds a master’s degree from the University of Oxford. Both Atishi and her husband are social workers. She claims to have source of income as interests from saving accounts, fixed deposits and postal savings.Gahlot, on the other hand, has declared family assets worth over Rs 45 crore with liabilities up to Rs 6.6 crore. Among other vehicles, the family owns a Mercedes and a Fortuner. He pursued LLM from Delhi University’s Faculty of Law after finishing BA degree from Sri Venkateswara College. A large chunk of family assets exists in the form of immovable assets and properties with cumulative value of more than Rs 30 crore. In 2015 assembly elections , Gahlot had declared total assets worth over 37 crore and liabilities of Rs 8.5 crore. His family also owns half kg gold.The MLA from Mangolpuri, Rakhi Bidlan, is one of the candidates with humble background. The youngest ever cabinet minister of AAP government has declared assets worth Rs 76, 421 out of which she holds Rs 40,000 in cash and rest in three bank accounts. In 2015, Bidlan had assets worth Rs 18,000 and liabilities in the form of education loan of Rs 2.9 lakh.Vinay Mishra, son of Mahabal Mishra, has declared total assets of over Rs 7.8 crore and loans/liabilities worth Rs 78 lakh.He claims to hold an MBA degree from IIPM, Delhi. He will be fighting for Dwarka assembly seat, which his father had won in 2008 as a Congress candidate.Mehrauli’s AAP candidate Naresh Yadav has assets worth Rs 26.5 crore with liability of Rs 1crore. In his 2015 self-declaration, Yadav had declared almost similar assets worth Rs 26.78 crore and liabilities of Rs 2.73 crore. He owns many residential properties as well. Yadav holds a LLB degree from Chaudhary Charan Singh University, Meerut.

Title: Ex-IBM officer fulfils 58-yr-old dream, completes his PhD at 78
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Shrichandra Srivastava (78), who retired as a class one officer from the Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM) in 2001, never made a nameplate in his career spanning 39 years. Though it was a matter of pride for people working in government departments between the 1960s and the 1990s, Srivastava kept himself away from the honour for want of the title ‘Dr’.

On January 18, the Srivastava family’s 58-year-old wait will end when Nagpur University (NU) formally confers the doctorate of philosophy (PhD) on him during its 107th convocation at Suresh Bhat Auditorium at 10.30am on Saturday.

Srivastava is probably the oldest student in the history of the university to get a PhD, which will fulfil his long-cherished dream of using ‘Dr’ before his name.

“We have ordered the nameplate and it will be a surprise for papa when we return from the ceremony on Saturday afternoon,” said Ashish, Srivastava’s eldest of the three sons.

Srivastava’s first attempt to pursue PhD under the then Laxminarayan Institute of Technology (LIT) professor SP Sangal came undone in 1982 when he had to give it up within a year because of his busy work schedule and frequent foreign tours.

With the passage of time, Srivastava got promoted and became busier due to the new challenges in mining and exploration. He was hard up for time to do his PhD research.

“I spent two months on the high seas of the Indian Ocean for manganese exploration. IBM had nominated me for this assignment in the 1980s. In 1985, I was sent to The Netherlands and later, to France for training. Very often I had to travel to Bangalore to analyse samples,” Srivastava said.

After retirement, Srivastava dropped his PhD plans and started teaching at NU’s department of geology as a visiting faculty. Till 2014, he taught students techniques to analyse ores and minerals.

“One of my students, Alka Humne, who now teaches in the same department, prodded me to register for PhD. We went to the department of chemistry and started the process under professor LJ Paliwal who guided me,” he said.

A determined and resilient Srivastava overcame every hurdle that came his way. While researching, writing thesis and attending the viva-voce, Srivastava battled ill health, exertion and a minor heart attack with a lot of guts and gumption.

Despite wanting to pursue further studies, Srivastava had to migrate to the city in 1961 after completing his BSc (chemistry, geology and geography) from Banaras Hindu University. “In 1962, on the basis of my geology background, I got a job with IBM as a core inspector. Later, I did my diploma from the Institution of Chemists in analytical chemistry,” he said.

As his diploma was not recognized by NU, Srivastava took leave without pay and did his MSc in Chemistry. His wife Nilu is also an NU student. She did her MA in Sanskrit from the campus.

Srivastava’s study is about preventing soil and water pollution and also winning the values. “The developed terpolymers can uptake the metal ions through chelation (bonding of ions) and adsorption. I have suggested that treating effluents with synthesized terpolymer will help prevent water and soil pollution,” he said.

NU plays spoilsport

Shrichandra Srivastava’s accomplishment of completing PhD at the age of 78 has been marred by Nagpur University’s apathy. The NU’s exam section has failed to recognize him as the rightful claimant for the Vitthalraoji Jibhkate Award which is conferred on those completing PhD after the age of 65. Though the NU has no specific guidelines for the award, it has announced another candidate, aged about 66 years, as the recipient. Srivastava said he wasn’t aware of such an award which called for an application. TOI has been consistently highlighting the fact that NU does not have a method in place to identify real toppers or award winners.

Atishi
