Title: Arguing own case, 25-year-old woman thief avoids custody
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: A 25-year-old alleged woman thief, Purnima Kamde alias Pinky, a MEd degree holder, argued her own case before the magistrate and outdid the lawyers arguing for the cops in court on Thursday. Suspecting Purnima’s involvement in more offences than the 15 already detected, the cops had applied to obtain her remand custody for the third time. However, the educated thief managed to convince the magistrate that the investigating agency does not deserve any further opportunity.

Purnima was sent to jail by the magistrate after the Tehsil police team was denied remand custody following her cunning arguments in court.

The police had arrested Purnima on January 7 and recovered stolen properties worth more than Rs21.01 lakh from her residence at Palora in Parseoni tehsil. They said she was to get married soon to a suitor from Ramtek, and was keeping the stolen booty for the expenses. After the Tehsil police exposed Purnima’s crimes, the suitor has backed out of the marriage.

She had been arrested in 2016 too by Sitabuldi police after being caught red-handed. She nabbed red-handed by citizens recently while trying to steal valuables from a woman at Sarafa Market, Itwari, but she had managed to flee by pretending to be an educated and respectable citizen.

However, Tehsil police team had been alerted and managed to nab her. The Tehsil police team under PI Ajaykumar Malviya had unearthed 52 tola gold worth Rs17.80 lakh, kept in a tin container in Purnima’s kitchen.

Police feel Purnima may be a kleptomaniac as she said during interrogation that she feels a strong urge frequently to steal things.

The third among five siblings, Purnima belongs to a family of farmers. Purnima owned a tailoring unit and under its garb she used to steal purses in busy market localities like Sitabuldi, Itwari, Khaparkheda, Ramtek, Parseoni etc. She can speak English and keeps receipts of some jewellery shop ready in her purse to show in case she is caught with some stolen jewellery.

Senior PI Malviya said she had tried to hoodwink police but her lies were exposed during a search of her place. Police recovered 15 mobile phones, a dozen wrist watches and cash Rs52,387 from her residence. “She would steal purses from inside bags in busy streets or shops. She kept all the valuables at home and had not gone to dispose them for money,” he said.

The investigation team comprised Second PI Dilip Sagar, PSI Swapnil Wagh, head constables Laxman Shende, Pramod Ghate, Pravin Manapure and others under the supervision of Zonal DCP Rahul Maknikar.

Title: Women will bear the brunt of CAA and NRC: M K Kanimozhi
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

M K Kanimozhi

KOCHI: DMK leader and MP from Tuticorin, M K Kanimozhi said it is women who have to bear the brunt of the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) and the National Register of Citizens (NRC).

Inaugurating a women’s meet against CAA organized by the Muslim Educational Society (MES) at Ernakulam Town Hall on Friday, Kanimozhi said land title deeds would be the most important proof that they would take into consideration. “I want to ask you how many women in India have title deeds of land in their name?” she said.

Criticizing the RSS, Kanimozhi said it is not an organization just against Muslims. “It is an organization against anybody who thinks India is a secular country,” she said.

The Act which provides citizenship to persecuted communities like Hindus, Christians and Parsis left out Muslims and atheists, she said. “I am an atheist, I would be affected as much as you are. I don’t have God, I don’t have religion. I would be affected as much as you are,” she said.

She also flayed the AIADMK for supporting CAA in Parliament. “If AIADMK had voted against this bill in Rajya Sabha, it would not have passed. I am upset, annoyed and hurt that a so-called Dravidian party supported this discriminatory bill. If they had not supported this bill, we would not have met here to protest it,” she said.

Kanimozhi also had words of praise for the Pinarayi Vijayan government. “You cannot protest in Tamil Nadu because it is not the AIADMK government which rules but the shadow of BJP government. But people of Kerala , you chose well, you made a sensible decision. Today one of the strongest voices against CAA comes from your CM,” she said.

Title: Cuttack: Probe begins, senior railway officer visits site
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

People gather at the accident site

BHUBANESWAR: A day after the Mumbai (LTT)-Bhubaneswar Lokmanya Tilak Express derailed in Cuttack district, Abhai Kumar Rai, commissioner of railway safety (CRS), south-eastern circle, Kolkata, visited the accident site on Friday before starting his inquiry into the incident.

At least 24 passengers, including five women and two children, were injured when the train derailed after hitting a stationary goods train between Salagaon and Nergundi stations on Thursday morning.

Rai discussed with railway officials about the accident. He also met the injured passengers undergoing treatment at SCB Medical College and Hospital, Cuttack. As many as 21 passengers were admitted to the hospital on Thursday.

Out of which, 11 of the injured persons are getting treatment in the hospital on Friday. Their health condition is stable, hospital sources said.

The CRS will formally start his inquiry into the train accident case at Cuttack from Saturday. Any person having knowledge of the accident can give evidence to the commission on the date of inquiry, said JP Mishra, chief public relations officer of East Coast Railway (ECoR).

The affected railway line due to the derailment was cleared late on Thursday night. Train services were normal on the route on Friday, said ECoR official sources.

The ECoR has already issued a standard operating procedure (SOP) for field staff to tackle fog condition during winter. Sources said the staff concerned had not followed this SOP on Thursday.

According to the SOP, the train driver should have reduced the speed limit to around 8 km per hour to tackle the dense fog condition in the morning. But the speed of the Lokmanya Tilak was high, said a senior railway officer. “However, the speedometer of the train can reveal the answer about the speed,” said the officer.

Another railway officer said the Lokmanya Tilak train is equipped with Linke Hofmann Busch (LHB) coaches. These coaches are designed to prevent coaches from crumpling and piling on top of each other in case of accident. It ensures safety of passengers in accidents. Had these been conventional coaches, scale of the tragedy would have been bigger, said the officer.

Title: Chennai: By year-end, these metro stations will get lawns, lounges, parking lots
Content:
Three infrastructure projects being built by CMRL are taking shape at Central, Shenoy Nagar and Guindy

CHENNAI: A year down the line, you could grab a coffee, lounge on a lawn watching cars zip past some of the busiest stretches and then board a metro train or drive away in your car parked in an underground lot.Three infrastructure projects being built by Chennai Metro Rail Limited ( CMRL ) are taking shape at Central, Shenoy Nagar and Guindy. These complexes — which will have parking, food courts, entertainment options and integrate multiple modes of transport — will be complete by the end of this year.If Central Square will boast of a 30-storey plaza, there will be an underground passenger amenities centre with a mini-mall in west Chennai at Shenoy Nagar and an urban square for south Chennai at Guindy. The facilities are being developed to generate additional non-ticketing revenue for CMRL.“The landscaping on street level above Central metro will begin after Pongal holidays. In six months, there will be lawns and greenery. The underground parking at Central will be ready in a year and the one at Shenoy Nagar by March 2021. The Kathipara project will be completed this year,” said a metro rail official.Amid public outrage, the underground centre below Shenoy Nagar’s Thiru Vi Ka park, which lost more than 138 trees to make way for the station, is taking shape. Construction slowed down when residents, concerned over losing their only green space, moved court to stop work. Officials said work has picked up pace after the court ruled in CMRL’s favour.“Shenoy Nagar will become like Anna Nagar in a few years and we want to have a facility which people can utilise. We will begin restoration of the park after construction is complete,” an official said.Laying the foundation for the 30-storey central plaza is underway. It will double up as an underground parking facility. The square will be a multi-modal hub for commuters who can park vehicles and board buses, trains or metro trains. Work is on to build two new pedestrian subways that will link the government hospital with Central station and Evening Bazaar Road. “Central Square will be an identity for the city. It will decongest the road by taking the pedestrian crowd underground and by providing space for vehicles parked on the road,” an official said. Kathipara will become a multi-modal hub linking Alandur and Guindy metro stations , Guindy suburban railway station, and Alandur and Guindy bus stops.But experts said CMRL should invest more on last-mile connectivity that will encourage people to use public transport. “Central Square is a great opportunity to seamlessly integrate long-distance trains, metro and sub-urban rail, and buses. But destroying a park to build off-street parking is outdated. Paris followed such old-school principles in the 1960s, but today it is reducing parking requirements. Parking is a magnet that attracts more vehicles,” said Aswathy Dilip, senior programme manager, ITDP.

Title: People are masters: CM Naveen Patnaik to IAS officers
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

CM Naveen Patnaik

BHUBANESWAR: Chief minister Naveen Patnaik on Friday asked each bureaucrat to share one transformational game-changing idea with him directly to improve the governance and delivery of public services.

Addressing the bureaucrats at the senior officers’ conference, the first of its kind meet, that was attended by all secretaries, all collectors and all IAS officers , Naveen also administered the pledge to the officers with the message that people are the masters. The pledge was in accordance with his government’s new governance model — Mo Sarkar.

“I have a family of 4.5 crore people of Odisha. With their blessings, I am serving them for the last 20 years. I want our children to have quality education. Our brothers and sisters to have good jobs. Our elders to have good healthcare facilities,” said Naveen, while hailing the bureaucrats as the drivers of this transformation agenda.

Though the state government generally holds annual conference of district collectors, the first conference in Naveen’s fifth term was held in a different and inclusive manner. Instead of only collectors, officers right from the rank of chief secretary to junior IAS officers (sub-collectors) attended to brainstorm on emerging issues pertaining to governance.

“It was conceptualised as a platform for all officers to discuss challenges of public service delivery in the next five years,” said an officer in the know.

“Though a lot of development has taken place in various sectors in the past two decades there are emerging challenges before us like urbanisation, rapid industrialisation, mobility and climate change. We need new technologies and new professionalism to tackle these issues. The young officers, who have joined services recently, will be in lead positions in the next few years,” said chief secretary Asit Tripathy.

Though senior officers used to speak on governance issues in the previous conferences, the district collectors, divided in groups, spoke in length on different subjects like livelihood issues and governance options, healthcare, school education, women empowerment and challenges in service delivery on the ground.

Issues on which the group of secretaries brainstormed earlier on the day include new-age technology and innovation. Experts were also part of the discussions.

Good ideas generated during the discussions by group of secretaries and group of collectors will be compiled by the general administration department. A report in this regard will be submitted to the chief minister by January 22, said the chief secretary.

Ganjam collector Vijay Amrut Kulange, a young officer, said it was a good platform for idea sharing. “We got some good inputs from senior officers during the presentations. From our side also, some of the senior collectors deliberated on key issues. We got a lot of guidance,” Kulange told TOI.

After a day-long deliberation, the officers headed for an off-site session at the ongoing Konark Eco-Retreat. On Saturday, the officers would attend the Odisha Knowledge Hub lecture series to be delivered by Ramesh Ramanathan, co-founder, Jana Group.

Title: IBM to become AI, multi-cloud player globally
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kolkata: Over a century-old IBM has kick-started the process to transform itself into a major artificial intelligence ( AI ) player in consonance with the rising demands from international business giants. The computer hardware major is eager to gain a foothold in the Indian market by reaching out to leading companies here with a new business model based on data strategy.

Inderpal Bhandari, global chief data officer of IBM, told TOI that currently, IBM’s clientele in the data business sector stems from about 19 business sectors, including banking, finance, supply chain and retail. The internal business assessment shows growth of revenues in cloud and cognitive software segment and global business services provided by IBM, which has been on a “digital reinvention mode”.

“The ladder to AI enterprise is our prescriptive approach to enable clients to link data with AI in a unified platform. This also helps them understand where to put more focus on their business,” said Bhandari, who flew down to the city on Monday for the Indo-French workshop on data science (statics and AI) at Indian Statistical Institute (ISI).

On IBM’s future business plans pertaining to data strategy, Bhandari added, “In the changing business world, data can fetch revenues to any technology giant like IBM when it is monetised. With the new concept of data strategy, new products can be rolled out. We are placing our bets on being the world class leader in AI and hybrid multi-cloud business.”

However, Bhandari called for a change in the workflow of leading business firms across India. “There is no denying the fact that the concept of AI is not clear to many people. But it is time for all to realize that the new system can simplify a business process by saving time and resources,” said Bhandari.

As for the Personal Data Protection Bill introduced in Parliament in December, last year, Bhandari said, “We welcome the decision and look forward to a progressive bill that strikes a balance and protecting privacy and harnessing data and technology to expand the economic opportunity for the people of India.”

Title: Delhi: Youth fakes DMRC letter, dupes scores to fund music dream
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pachauri’s music videos, uploaded on YouTube, are sponsored by a well-known music company.

NEW DELHI: This 22-year-old not only faked a job proposal from Delhi Metro Rail Corporation and a certification from Indian Engineering Services, but also used them as a means to arrange for funds for his music album. He went around telling people that he could help them get “secure jobs” with DMRC. Instead, he pocketed the money thus accumulated to further his music dreams.

The accused, Prafull Pachauri aka Honey, was arrested by Delhi Police recently. Pachauri had even got an article published in a local newspaper in Uttar Pradesh to gain publicity. His music videos, uploaded on YouTube , are sponsored by a well-known music company.

Police said Pachauri belonged to Hathras in Uttar Pradesh. DMRC had approached the cyber unit of Delhi Police about the fraud. As police started investigations, they got on the trail of mails being sent through a spoofing application, the developer of which they had arrested in the last week of December.

As the probe progressed, it was found that Pachauri had got a profile of himself published in a local Hindi newspaper, wherein he claimed to have cleared Indian Engineering Services. He also boasted about his songs that had been uploaded on YouTube.

“After the article was published, he used an email spoofer application to send a message to a well-known music company claiming that the newspaper would be the official sponsor for his album. He also showed emails ostensibly received from DMRC and UPSC to claim that he had been selected for the post of a junior engineer with DMRC and also cleared IES,” a police officer said.

To earn a quick buck, Pachauri duped people by promising them jobs in DMRC. He sent them mails using the spoofing application to claim that their jobs had been confirmed. He duped at least four people of Rs 70,000, police said. The only child of his parents, Pachauri had indeed completed his electronic engineering from a university in Greater Noida, an officer revealed.

In December, police had arrested Rupesh Bhandari, the developer of the spoofing application from Bengaluru. Even though the application has been disabled, it can still be viewed on Google Play Store.

Title: Book covers are no less than content
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Publishers said they put extra effort to make covers of children’s books interesting

CHENNAI: ‘Don’t judge a book by its cover’ is a cliché and passé. Gone are the days of bland book covers . With the modern reader spoilt for choice, publishers are going the extra mile to bring out books whose crisp pages are bound by sharply designed covers.

Thousands of titles at the book fair at YMCA, Nandanam, highlight the trend.

Publishers said covers played a significant role in attracting readers. G Dasarathan, a publisher, said design components are given equal mileage. “People expect white pages over dull yellow book prints. We give attention to a cover because it is one of the most important elements and adds value to the book,” he said.

Tamil titles are printed on book print quality paper ranging from 70 to 100 grams per square metre (GSM) depending on the content. As higher GSM increases the price of a book, several publishers attempt to stick to lesser GSM. While maplitho paper is used for print, book covers get glossy and matte lamination. Publishers also spend about 15% of the total expenses on design elements.

A Hendry, employed at a publishing house and associated with printing books for 15 years, said several elements, including colours, make a good book cover. “This is essential in kids’ books. Design is important to attract readers,” he said.

The impact is such that a biography publisher has replaced the portrait of the subject on the cover after observing that a graphic design will appeal more. Light weight paper is preferred as it reduces a book’s volume.

Vellore resident P Vijayan, who visited the fair, said attractive covers influence his purchase. “When I buy books for my children, I am drawn by the cover and then skim through it to have an idea on content,” he said.

Title: Jitender Singh Tomar’s election set aside over false info
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

File photo of former Delhi law minister Jitender Singh Tomar

NEW DELHI: Terming it a “corrupt practice”, Delhi high court on Friday set aside the of former state law minister Jitender Singh Tomar as an MLA in 2015 for furnishing false information of his educational qualification.

The court held as “void” the election of the AAP member since he had made a false declaration that he had an LLB degree. Later, a probe found the degree was a fake one.

The bench said that Tomar — who has again been declared an AAP candidate from the same Tri Nagar constituency — “lied qua his/her educational qualification and vocation”, which resulted in “inducement and thwarted free exercise of electoral right of the voter.”

Justice Rajiv Sahai Endlaw noted that as a citizen and elector, “I would want the election of the candidate who had lied qua his/ her educational qualification and vocation, to be set aside.”

Since Tomar was not a graduate and ineligible for the three-year LLB programme, his law degree cannot exist, the court pointed out in a 40-page judgement, allowing the plea of BJP member and rival candidate Nand Kishore Garg, who had challenged the election.

HC further observed that Tomar “published statements of fact that were false to unduly influence the voters, which amounts to a corrupt practice.” It noted that the AAP politician didn’t obtain a valid law degree nor was he properly enrolled as an advocate at the time of filing his nomination, adding that his nomination was improperly accepted.

“On first principles, without adverting to law, I, as an elector, would feel cheated if the candidate I vote for and who is elected, is ultimately found to have made a false representation while canvassing his candidature and particularly qua his/her educational qualification and profession/vocation,” Justice Endlaw noted.

The court said Tomar’s graduation — BSc programme from Avadh University — was also fabricated and Garg was successful in disproving Tomar’s claim, observing “educational qualification and vocation/profession is a significant part of one’s persona. A person is assessed by others, in the initial interaction, by his/her educational qualification and vocation and only after making an initial breakthrough, may in the course of subsequent interactions, be assessed by other facets of his/her persona.”

It said election is purely and simply a statutory right and once Tomar is found to have been elected in violation of the statute, he cannot be permitted to remain elected.

“Moreover, need to maintain the purity of the stream of elections is the need/right, not only of the petitioner, but of the other citizens as well and once it is found that the respondent has secured his election by violating the statute, the election cannot be permitted to stand, irrespective of whether the petitioner who has challenged the election is estopped from doing so,” the court held.

It said unless Tomar felt that he would be able to influence the electors to vote in his favour by representing himself to be an advocate, there was no need for him to say so and he could have claimed to be having the qualification of senior secondary school certificate, which he alone held.

Title: CAA protest: BJP leaders from Kerala rally behind governor
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: As Kerala turns out to be the political epicentre of protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act, BJP leaders from Kerala have rallied behind state governor Arif Mohammad Khan who has proved himself to be the most vocal advocate of CAA in the state.

Putting his weight behind the governor, Union cabinet minister V Muraleedharan said the governor did nothing wrong by going public about his difference of opinion with the state government. “Nobody is above law. The governor has only reminded the same. Chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan who chose to lock horns with governor, an expert in law and constitution, must be penitent now. He must now be aware about the futility of having so many advisers. The governor needs no support of the Centre. He has the support of the President of India,” Muraleedharan said. Mizoram governor and former BJP state president P S Sreedharan Pillai too expressed support to his Kerala counter part by saying that the governor was only talking sense.

Kummanam moves Supreme Court

Meanwhile, BJP former state president Kummanam Rajasekharan approached the Supreme Court on Friday, urging the apex court to direct the Kerala government against utilising public money for challenging a central act. The governor, who is constitutional head in the state, was in favour of the CAA and the state government had kept the governor in dark while filing a suit against the Centre, Kummam told the court. He wanted the SC to direct Kerala government to recoup the expenses for suit from the chief minister and his cabinet colleagues.

“There is no legal dispute between Centre and Kerala government with regard to CAA. The difference is only political. The state government has not clarified how the amendment would affect Kerala. The state government also failed to justify its claim that Rohingyan Muslims faced religious persecution”, he said.

Title: Many transplant patients to run tomorrow in Mumbai Marathon
Content:
Shreya Siddanagowda has had a bilateral upper hand transplant

Shibani Gulati, who underwent a

kidney transplant

a decade ago

MUMBAI: Two years after Pune youngster Shreya Siddanagowda became the country’s first patient to undergo a bilateral upper hand transplant , she will attempt the Dream Run at Sunday’s Mumbai Marathon to help get new hands for Monica More—the Kurla resident who as a 16-year-old lost both her arms in a 2014 railway accident.“Shreya wants people to know that hand transplants are a reality. Even transplant coordinators working in hospitals don’t know about hand transplants and hence fail to ask donor families to donate hands,” said Shreya’s mother Suma. Shreya lost her arms in a bus accident while travelling from Pune to her engineering college in Manipal and Monica has registered for hand transplant with Global Hospital in Parel.Shreya, though, is only one among the many transplant patients who will run on Sunday along with 300-odd runners to create awareness about transplants.Forty-year-old Shibani Gulati , who underwent a kidney transplant a decade ago, will run the half marathon for the seventh year in a row. “I have been running in a bid to take my health to the ‘next level’ and to let people know that being a transplant patient doesn’t mean one has to sit indoors,” said Gulati, who had initially planned to run the 42km marathon but changed her mind in order to run alongside her husband Gautam on his first half-marathon.Considering that Mumbai registered 79 deceased donors in 2019 and is way ahead of other cities in transplants, several doctors and NGOs said this is the right time to create more awareness about this branch of medicine. “Around 100 people will run as ambassadors for the Zonal Transplant Coordination Centre,” said ZTCC Mumbai’s president Dr S Mathur.Mohan Foundation, an NGO working in the sphere of organ donation, has another 100 runners. “What is unique about this group is that it includes kidney recipients, liver recipients, heart recipients and hand transplant recipients. They want to demonstrate to the world that transplant recipients enjoy a great quality of life simply because someone gifted them with a life-saving organ,” said Mohan Foundation’s Jaya Jairam, herself a kidney recipient who will run the Dream run.The foundation team will also have Kishor Suryavanshi, a kidney recipient who features in the Limca Book of Records for being was the first to marry another kidney recipient, as well as the parents of heart transplant recipient Hvovi Minocherhomji doing the Dream Run.

Title: No ‘love jihad’ case in last 2 years: Kerala DGP Behera
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Loknath Behera

KOZHIKODE: Maintaining that there is no ‘ love jihad ’ in Kerala, state police chief Loknath Behera said not a single case has been reported in the last two years. Behera told reporters on Friday that Kerala Police would submit a report in this regard to the National Commission for Minorities. He added that the allegation of the Syro-Malabar Church in this regard would also be probed.

The controversy resurfaced when the Church synod alleged that many Christian girls were being converted to Islam through ‘love jihad’. The minorities panel has sought a report from the state police on the allegations.

Meanwhile, Fr Kuriakose Mundadan’s article in Sathyadeepam, published by the Ernakulam-Angamaly archdiocese of the Syro-Malabar Church, criticizing the timing of the church’s stand on ‘love jihad’ has created ripples with a section of the laity coming out in support of the priest and others protesting the article.

The Kerala Catholic Youth Movement (KCYM) burned a copy of Sathyadeepam in Kanjirapally while ‘Almaya Munnettam’ — a laity group — in Kochi threatened dire consequences if the campaign against the weekly was not stopped.

Title: Role of RSS in Ram temple ended with SC verdict: Mohan Bhagwat
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

File photo. (ANI)

AGRA: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Thursday said that the Sangh's role in creating public opinion and awareness about the importance of construction of the Ram temple has ended after the Supreme Court's judgement in the matter. The Sangh supremo also said that shrines of Kashi and Mathura were not its agenda.

Answering queries from RSS volunteers during a question-answer session on the first day of his four-day visit to Moradabad , he said that it is now up to the government and the trust to start the temple's construction. He further said that Vishwa Hindu Parishad's role, however, will continue till the construction of the temple is started.

According to sources, Bhagwat, who interacted with province (prant) and area (chhetra) office-bearers of Braj, Meerut and Uttrakhand regions, said that Sangh's interest was limited only to the Ram temple and they did not have the reclamation of disputed religious sites at Mathura and Kashi on its agenda. Around 90 volunteers were present in the session.

Replying to the queries of volunteers over the ongoing protests and nationwide unrest over Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), Bhagwat reiterated the Sangh's support to Modi government on the issue, saying that the organisation would not step back on the issue as it is beneficial for people. He also exhorted the volunteers to sensitize people on the Citizenship Act.

Sources told TOI that Sangh volunteers will participate in a rally which is being organised by the BJP in Agra on January 23 to spread awareness about CAA. They said that around 1.5 lakh people will be gathered at Kothi Meena Bazar for the rappy to spread the message that CAA was beneficial for everyone.

Talking to TOI, a senior RSS functionary said that Bhagwat emphasised on expansion of the organisation to the basti and mandal level to reach out to every section of the society. He said that Bhagwat wanted to add more good people in the organsation.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Prison rule stands in way of quick hanging
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

File photo of four Nirbhaya convicts. (Photo: PTI)

NEW DELHI: A proviso in the revised 2018 Delhi Prison Manual now stands between the timely execution of the four Nirbhaya convicts on February 1 and the possibility of a further delay.

Rule 854 of the manual, which governs the administration of prisoners in Delhi’s jails, says that in case of multiple death-row inmates, the sentence will not be executed until the Supreme Court dismisses the appeals of all convicts.

It adds that if the death sentence has been awarded to more than one person in a case and if only one of them moves a mercy plea, the execution of the others, too, has to be postponed till it is decided.

With three of the convicts — Askhay Thakur, Pawan Gupta and Vinay Sharma — yet to file a mercy plea, the new deadline fixed by a trial court on Friday runs the risk of being reduced to one of “academic” significance.

The AAP government on Wednesday described in Delhi high court the January 22 execution date as academic, citing Delhi Prison Manual that mandates a 14-day window between the rejection of the mercy plea of a death-row convict and the actual hanging .

Delhi government had also expressed apprehensions that the convicts might try to “frustrate” and “defeat” the judicial process by filing a mercy plea before the President one by one, each earning them a 14-day breather even if it was rejected.

A bench of Justices Manmohan and Sangita Dhingra Sehgal had taken a dim view of the AAP government stand. “Then your rule is bad, if you cannot take action till all the co-convicts have moved a mercy plea. It seems there has been total non-application of mind (while framing the rules). Every mercy plea is on different grounds, you can’t frustrate the judicial finding that has attained finality.”

The court pulled up Delhi government and the prison authorities for creating a system that was “suffering from cancer” and “capable of being exploited” by death-row convicts who wanted to “strategically” delay their execution.

Apprehensions along the same lines were also expressed by Nirbhaya’s parents. “In this country, justice for women seems to be difficult to get,” said the mother.

Title: AIFF to begin from Feb 5 with focus on Marathi cinema
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: The 7th Aurangabad International Film Festival (AIFF) will be held at Inox multiplex in Prozone Mall from February 5 to 9.

Organisers of the festival said they will project Marathwada and Aurangabad as a cultural hub on international-level. The festival was announced at a press conference on Tuesday.

Ashok Rane, the festival director “This festival is a platform for aspiring filmmakers, technicians, artists and film enthusiasts to learn and understand artistic as well as technical aspects of cinema. We want to promote the region as a film production hub, cultural centre in the state.”

Artistic director Chandrakant Kulkarni said that AIFF aspires to promote tourism of the region and create a networking centre for local talents from Marathwada to connect with filmmakers, film scholars, technicians from across the world. Promotion of Marathi cinema nationally and globally is one of the key objectives of the festival, he said.

The festival includes regional, national and international movie screenings, Indian film competition, international federation of film critics, India jury award, the lifetime achievement award, short film competition, a master class by filmmaker Sriram Raghavan, seminars, poster exhibition on Mrinal Sen, Shriram Lagu, Girish Karnad and film appreciation workshops.

The film festival is organised by Nath Group and Mahatma Gandhi Mission and supported by the department of cultural affairs, government of Maharashtra.

Title: Sick leave: BMTC staffers fake medical certificates
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bengaluru: BMTC filed a complaint against 18 employees for allegedly producing fake medical certificates for availing leave for more than two months.

In the complaint, Smitha CA, security and vigilance officer of BMTC, said 18 staff, including drivers and conductors, were absent from work for 60 to 120 days between January 1, 2018 and October 31, 2019. When they came back, they produced medical certificates which had the stamp of Bowring and Lady Curzon Hospital.

Probe revealed that one conductor, Biradar, created a fake letterhead in the hospital’s name and distributed the certificates to 17 BMTC employees.

Title: Mandrem boy is JEE topper from state
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Panaji: Mandrem boy Siddhant Govekar was declared the Goa topper, at the Joint Entrance Exam ( JEE ) Main for admissions to the Indian Institutes of Technology, by the National Testing Agency (NTA), on Friday.

The student of Mushtifund Aryaan Higher Secondary School of Cujira scored an impressive 99.91 percentile.

Siddhant is the son of physics lecturer Uday and assistant manager in a pharmaceutical company Rajashri.

“Siddhant is a brilliant boy. Equally strong in physics, chemistry, math and biology. He is attempting entrance to IIT as well as AIIMS and other medical colleges through NEET. As of now, he wants to pursue medicine and join AIIMS, Delhi,” Mushtifund Aryaan Higher Secondary School diector Vyankatesh Prabhudesai said.

Govekar’s hobbies include quizzing and debating.

Title: 30,000-acre land bank to lure global investors in Karnataka
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The government is in the process of creating a land bank of 30,000 acres across the state to woo investors during ‘Invest Karnataka ’, the global investors meet, to be held between November 3 and 5 in Bengaluru, industries minister Jagadish Shettar said on Friday.

“We are in the process of acquiring land and we hope to complete it well before the investors meet,” Shettar said. “The idea is to offer it to investors.”

Gunjan Krishna, commissioner of industries department, said final notification to acquire 12,000 acres of land has already been issued and the process to acquire another 18,000 acres is in various stages of completion. Shettar said land has also been identified in and around Hubballi-Dharwad to offer interested investors participating in an meet in Hubballi next month.

Shettar said the government is aggressively promoting Tier 2 cities by highlighting facilities there. “Not many investors are aware of cities like Hubballi, Belagavi and Kalaburagi and that they have good air connectivity. Our immediate task is to introduce these cities to investors,” Shettar said.

He said a new industrial policy will be unveiled soon. “It will offer more incentives besides listing the government’s industry-friendly measures. The draft of the new policy is ready and it will soon be placed before the cabinet for approval,” Shettar said.

He said a roadshow for the Hubballi meet has already been conducted in Mumbai and another one will be held in Hyderabad on January 29. “During the Mumbai roadshow, we met industry leaders like Ratan Tata, Adi Godrej and Anand Mahindra and they were all keen on participating in the Hubballi meet,” he said, while adding that the government is expecting big-ticket investments in sectors like automobile and textile.

Title: Danve called Aurangbad MP in AAI official letter
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: A letter issued by Airport Authority of India’s (AAI) Aurangab director DG Salve, informing about the agenda of January 18 meeting of Airport Advisory Committee, addressed Jalna MP and union minister Raosaheb Danve as Aurangabad MP.

Danve is the chairman of the advisory committee.

A meeting of the committee will be held at 11 am on Saturday in the CIP lounge terminal building of Aurangabad airport.

Salve, in the letter, said that the meeting will be chaired by Danve and addressed him as the MP of Aurangabad.

The mistake got repeated twice in the letter, once in the recipient’s name and second in the body of the letter.

The letter was written to Danve and copied to the district collector of Aurangabad, police commissioner of Aurangabad, Aurangabad Municipal Corporation and other officials.

The letter further listed the agenda of the meeting that included 20 points. Development of the domestic and international air traffic in the city, international cargo and civil infrastructure, supply of drinking water from AMC, mutation of airport land, waiving of agriculture tax to the airport, pruning of trees and removal of obstruction outside of aerodrome, road connectivity from Aurangabad to Shirdi, Ajanta Caves and Ellora caves will be discussed in the meeting.

When asked, Salve, who is the convener of the meeting, said that referring Danve as Aurangabad MP was a mistake and will be corrected.

The Aurangabad airport is in Aurangabad city but falls under the Jalna Lok Sabha constituency. Minister of state for consumer affairs, food and public distribution in central government Raosaheb Danve of BJP is the Airport Advisory Committee, Aurangabad, civil aerodrome.

Phulambri MLA Haribhau Bagade, the district collector, the police commissioner, the AMC commissioner and other stakeholders including tour operators, local industrialists are part of the committee.

Title: 30,000-acre land bank to lure global investors in Karnataka
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

Title: Pankaja Munde, Dhananjay Munde share stage at function in Beed
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pankaja Munde

AURANGABAD: A religious function at Patoda Taluka of Beed district saw political rivals and cousins Dhananjay Munde and Pankaja Munde sharing a stage on Friday.

This was the first time the two came on stage after the assembly elections, in which Pankaja lost to Dhananjay in Parli.

The programme was organised to mark the 43th death anniversary of Saint Vamanbhau Maharaj at Gahininath Gad of Chincholi in Patoda taluka.

Usually Pankaja would take the stage during the annual event, while Dhananjay offers prayers in the morning and leaves. This time, Dhanjanay — the state social justice minister — took the stage alongside Pankaja and her MP sister Pritam. The two also addressed the devotees, but didn’t exchange a word.

Pankaja and Dhananjay had developed a rift after she was given a ticket to contest from Parli in the 2009 assembly election. The 2019 contest between the two cousins had turned acrimonious.

Title: RTI seeks information on documents proving PM Narendra Modi’s citizenship
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

By: Sandeep Thomas

THRISSUR: A Chalakkudy resident has filed an application under the Right to Information (RTI) Act, seeking the details of documents proving Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Indian citizenship.

Applicant Joshy Kalluveettil said he filed the application before the information officer of Chalakkudy municipality on January 13 to clear the confusion regarding the documents proving one’s citizenship. “The central government is saying that documents such as Aadhaar card, Pan card, ration card, driving licence and SSLC book could not be used to prove citizenship. People do not know which document to submit,” Kalluveettil said. “I submitted the RTI application to know the documents the prime minister had used to prove his citizenship. If I get the details, the people of this country could use the same documents. I hope to receive a reply soon,” headded aid.

Municipality secretary Akash M S confirmed receiving the application. “Since we do not have the information sought, the application was forwarded to the Prime Minister’s Office for further action,” he said.

Title: Police book man for defacing public property
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: Pundaliknagar police have booked a man under the Maharashtra Prevention of Defacement of Property Act, 1995, for allegedly defacing public property by pasting around 100 handbills on the divider besides the Aurangabad bench of the Bombay high court on Thursday.

A complaint in this regard was lodged by the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC).

The suspect identified as Mayur Kasliwal is accused of pasting around 100 handbills on the divider near the traffic signal along the Jalna Road leading towards Sainath Temple in the Cidco N-3 area.

The handbills were printed on an A4 size sheet and advertised a service provided by Kasliwal. The AMC control room received a complaint about the handbills from a resident. Following the complaint, municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey directed Zone 6 ward officer Meera Chavan to take action against the person defacing the public property.

Chavan inspected the spot, called Kasliwal and asked him whether he acquired permission to paste the handbills on the divider, to which he received a negative response. Subsequently, Chavan lodged a police complaint against Kasliwal.

Pundaliknagar police station in-charge assistant inspector Ghanshyam Sonawne told TOI, “We have issued a notice to the concerned person under section 41 of the CrPC. He will have to obtain bail from the court and co-operate with the investigation.”

The development comes in the wake of the ongoing Swachh Survekshan 2020. Municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey has set a target for the city to get featured in top 100 cleanest cities of the country.

Title: Nirbhaya case: Tihar rejigs preparations after new death warrants
Content:
File photo of Tihar jail

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

NEW DELHI: With Mukesh Singh’s plea for a mercy petition getting dismissed by the President, Tihar authorities have started making fresh preparations for hanging the four Nirbhaya convicts on February 1.Their diet will be fixed again to maintain a standard weight parameter required for executing the death penalty, said jail sources.Sources added that special attention was being paid to maintaining the health of the four convicts ever since Vinay Sharma fell unconscious inside his cell on Wednesday. Sharma has been behaving restlessly and aggressively, and also refuses to eat the food served to him in his cell. All the four convicts would now be kept on suicide watch through the day, said sources.Jail officers, however, rubbished the rumour about a suicide attempt by Sharma, that was doing the rounds on social media.The jail staffers and security guards have been asked to carefully monitor the activities of the four men, especially when they are in the bathroom and during night hours. A new set of ropes from Buxar might also be procured days before the hanging. The ones that were to be used on January 22 have already been softened with ripe bananas and soap, and they could decompose till the next date.Jail sources said that the prisoners would now be allowed to meet their family members and lawyers twice a week. On Friday, Pawan Gupta was allowed to meet his father.While the curative petitions of two of the convicts are pending with a court, Gupta has filed a petition in the Supreme Court to review the high court order, which earlier dismissed his plea to declare him a juvenile. Gupta, Sharma and Akshay Thakur can still lodge a mercy petition before the President before February 1. Tihar authorities will again issue a notice to the three prisoners giving them an ultimatum to file the mercy plea.Jail officials added that the cells in which the four men have been moved now are well lit so that their activities can be monitored even at night. Their health would be monitored regularly and they would only be allowed medicines that are prescribed by the jail doctors.

Title: 4 murder convicts get HC relief
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: Citing that ‘truthfulness is withheld by the prosecution,’ the Aurangabad bench of the Bombay high court has quashed and set aside the conviction slapped by the lower court in the murder case of a woman who died of burn injuries.

The deceased woman’s husband and three members of his family were convicted.

The divisional bench of the HC comprising Justice TV Nalawade and Justice MG Sewlikar observed that the “Discussion shows that the evidence which could have said important things about the truthfulness is withheld by the prosecution by not examining the witnesses who were available. The benefit of this circumstance needs to be given to the accused.”

“As the rule in respect of the dying declaration is based on the principle of necessity, if there is a possibility of an eye witness, it is the duty of the prosecution to see that witnesses like neighbours are examined. In the present matter, the dying declaration itself shows that the neighbours had rushed to the spot and had witnessed at least some portion of the incident and that they had extinguished the fire. When dying declaration is available and when the version of eye witness is available, ordinarily more weight needs to be given to the evidence of eye witness as he is available for cross examination and Court can ascertain the truth from his version,” it was ruled.

Following the conviction, additional sessions judge of Shrirampur, Ahmednagar, slapped the convicts with life imprisonment on the charges of murder and domestic violence.

Pallavi Gaikwad was married to Vijay, a resident of Shindewadi, Padhegaon of Shrirampur taluka in Ahmednagar sometime in 2011. The woman suffered serious burn injuries on October 1, 2012, at her in-laws’ house. She succumbed to the injuries on October 8, 2012.

Lawyers NV Gaware and NR Avhad contested that the records at the hospital where the woman was admitted soon after the incident stated that she suffered burn injuries due to the bursting of stove while the deceased woman gave two dying declarations blaming her husband and three in-laws. Both the statements had some contradictions.

The HC, citing one of the dying declarations, questioned the prosecution as to why the statements of neighbours, who reportedly helped Pallavi’s husband to rush her to hospital, were not taken on record.

The HC observed that when the two dying declarations are compared with each other, it can be said that in the dying declaration recorded before the executive magistrate, the victim did not disclose about the money demand from her in-laws and that she did not give any particulars of the ill treatment or reason for the ill treatment.

“The absence of such evidence is a serious lacuna in the present case and that lacuna cannot be ignored as the accused people can be convicted for the offence of murder if the dying declaration is taken as the base for conviction. Thus, the scrutiny of the entire evidence is necessary and the corroboration of surrounding circumstances is also necessary in the present matter for proving the incident disclosed in the dying declaration” observed the HC.

Title: Karnataka government seeks help from corporates, NGOs to build smart classrooms

Title: Man caught driving with 530kg marijuana gets conditional bail
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: The Aurangabad bench of Bombay high court has granted bail to an accused driver who was intercepted by police while transporting 530kg of marijuana in an SUV.

HC justice RG Avachat citing that “there is no independent evidence to indicate the applicant to have had knowledge that the packets contained marijuana”, granted conditional bail to the accused who had been languishing behind bars for the last 18 months.

As per police, Tushar Suresh Pimple, after being intercepted by Islapur police in Nanded on July 21, 2018, along with one Shaikh Riyaz, informed police that he was carrying marijuana.

Soon a panchanama was carried out and police booked them on charges of rash and negligent driving, apart from relevant sections of Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

Representing Pimple, lawyer Joydeep Chatterji contested that co-accused offered the applicant a good sum of money for driving the car in which the drug was found. The alleged oral statement of the applicant to the police, informing the packets in the car contained marijuana is inadmissible. The applicant is behind bars for a little over one-and-a-half year and it would take a considerable time for the trial to get initiated.

After hearing the contentions from both the sides, justice Avachat observed: “It is not the case of the prosecution that the contraband article belonged to the applicant. He was engaged as a driver. True, the applicant informed the police officials that the packets in the car contained ganja. Whether this statement amounts to confession or is inadmissible admission needs to be appreciated during trial. It will take time for the trial to commence and there is no independent evidence to indicate that the applicant had knowledge that the packets contained marijuana.”

Title: Smriti Irani blames AAP, Arvind Kejriwal says let’s not politicise matter
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Union women and child development minister Smriti Irani

NEW DELHI: Union women and child development minister Smriti Irani blamed the Aam Aadmi Party government on Friday for the delay in the hanging of the four men convicted in the Nirbhaya case . She accused Delhi government of slowing the process after the Supreme Court had rejected the convicts’ review petition in July 2018. In response, chief minister Arvind Kejriwal urged BJP not to politicise the case but to work together in ensuring that the sentencing in such incidents was carried out quickly.

Kejriwal tweeted, “I feel sad politics being done on such issue. Shudn’t v be working together to ensure guilty r hanged soonest? Shudn’t v join hands to ensure a system so that such beasts get hanged within 6 months? Pl don’t do politics on this. Let’s together create a safe city for our women (sic).”

The CM later asserted that his government had completed all its responsibilities with regard to the case “within a few hours”. He told reporters, “Delhi government has no role in delaying the hanging.”

In a video message released on Twitter, Kejriwal added, “The postponement of hanging of convicts has disappointed everyone. We all want them to be hanged as soon as possible. It is sad that such a sensitive issue has become the subject of politics.”

Vinay Sharma, Akshay Kumar, Pawan Gupta and Mukesh Singh were sentenced to death for raping a 23-year-old woman in a moving bus in Delhi in December 2012. The brutalised victim, who was later given the name Nirbhaya, had died in a Singapore hospital while undergoing treatment.

Irani claimed that when the entire country was united in seeking expeditious justice for Nirbhaya, Kejriwal had delayed the process of justice. She said the Supreme Court had rejected the review petitions of the convicts in July 2018, but the jail administration and Delhi government had suppressed the case. She asked the AAP government why the convicts hadn’t yet been hanged in the year and a half since their review petition was rejected.

The Union minister also noted that Delhi government had granted Rs 10,000 and a sewing kit on the release of the juvenile accused, who she described as the cruellest among the rapists. She welcomed Friday’s rejection of Singh’s mercy petition by President Ram Nath Kovind.

Title: Kerala: Governor who speaks like a BJP state leader is a disgrace, says Congress
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala at the Kannur leg of the Rashtra Raksha March led by MP K Sudhakaran

KANNUR: The Congress on Friday came down heavily on governor Arif Mohammad Khan while defending the state assembly for passing a resolution against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ).

“The governor, who speaks like a BJP state leader, is a disgrace,” Opposition leader Ramesh Chennithala said while addressing the Kannur leg of the Rashtra Raksha March led by K Sudhakaran, MP.

“The resolution (against CAA) was passed according to the rules and procedures,” he said, adding that the assembly had the right to do so since the legislators were elected by the people. Chennithala, however, did not spare the chief minister, Pinarayi Vijayan, either. The opposition leader said Vijayan remained silent when the governor spoke against the resolution.

“It was me who opposed the governor. Pinarayi Vijayan, who is not ready to respond against the governor protecting the BJP and RSS’s interests, is cheating the people,” he alleged. He alleged that the agenda behind CAA was to create a communal divide in the country, “thereby damaging its secular fabric.”

Already several cases have been filed against the CAA, as it was against Article 5 to 11 of the Constitution. The Supreme Court, after examining these clauses, would throw the CAA into the dustbin, he said.

Following the CAA, huge protests have emerged in the nation as Narendra Modi and Amit Shah have converted India into a battlefield, he said.

Earlier, Kannur Bishop Alex Vadakkumthala flagged off the march from Mundayad Indoor Stadium around 4 pm.

Title: Panel to probe misuse of election funds
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: Acting on a complaint lodged by an anti-corruption activist, Aurangabad revenue divisional commissioner has formed a five-member committee to probe allegations into misappropriation of election funds running in to crores.

The committee has been formed on directives issued by state election commission after taking cognizance of the complaint lodged by regional president of Bhrashtrachar Nirmulan Samiti Engineer Sadiq Inamdar.

Soon after conclusion of the elections, allegations against revenue officials clearing exorbitant bills were being made by a section of activists.

As per allegations made, an amount to the tune of Rs 9 crore was allegedly spent on installing pandals for training of election staffers as well as during the polling day in Beed district. There were also allegations that Rs 60 lakh was spent on printing of flexes and banners meant for raising awareness.

In addition to this, allegations were also made that around Rs 50 lakh was spent on buying stationery.

As per directives of divisional commissioner Sunil Kendrekar, Hingoli additional collector Jagdish Maniyar has been appointed as the head of five-member inquiry committee with directives to carry out an inquiry and submit the report by January 24.

Title: Kalindi Kunj stretch: Another side of the protest
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

A huge metallic map of India has been erected in the middle of the road on Kalindi Kunj Road. Street furniture... Read More

NEW DELHI: The Kalindi Kunj stretch, which has been under lockdown for the past one month owing to anti-CAA protests, is now strewn with vandalised street furniture.

Protesters occupying both carriageways of the road have uprooted the grilles and cobbled stones of the central median, spray painted bus stops and pasted posters on the foot overbridge. Some of the bus stops now resemble dirty restrooms.

The grilles from the central median are being used for blocking the road and creating a perimeter around street art, including a huge metallic map of India erected in the middle of the road.

While locals blame miscreants for the vandalism, no legal action has been taken by the civic bodies in charge of maintaining the street furniture. RWA of Sarita Vihar and Jasola said it would take days for the civic bodies to re-install the street furniture to make the stretch usable once it opens to the public.

“This is not the way to protest. Damaging public property will eventually result in further problems when traffic starts moving on the stretch. We have appealed to police and civic bodies to take note of this,” said SK Awana, a resident of Sarita Vihar, who had moved a public interest litigation in court demanding removal of the protesters.

When TOI visited the stretch on Friday, it found that apart from the spot where the protests were taking place, the remaining portion of the stretch was occupied by residents of nearby colonies. There were temporary shops set up by the locals, while the empty stretch was being used by stunt bikers. Embers from bonfires were strewn along the road and under the foot overbridge. Even the walls of the Delhi Metro depot in Sarita Vihar were spray painted. Residents were unaware of who had damaged the public property.

Ashok Bidhuri, a resident of Sarita Vihar, said there are at least 10 colonies next to Kalindi Kunj road and commuting for them has become a nightmare. “In order to make the road usable again, the civic bodies will have to spend days conducting repairs. It has been a nightmarish experience for people using the canal road, especially children who have to go to school and tuitions,” he added.

“We have appealed to the protesters to end the agitation since it is not only affecting us, but the entire south Delhi. There are other venues where they can protest,” Bidhuri said.

Title: Burglar on run deposits Rs 14L in wife’s bank account
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Aurangabad: A suspected burglar, who the city police have been looking for, has deposited Rs 14 lakh in his wife’s bank account

The city police have made multiple teams to zero down the suspect, whose last location was Pune.

The suspect, who is in his 30s, has 42 offences registered against him for committing thefts, house break-ins in Aurangabad, Nashik, Pune, Ahmednagar, Nanded, Solapur and others.

To bring keep on his activities, earlier he was arrested under the stringent Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act and other relevant acts. Authorities maintained that the preventive measures initiated against him from time to time have failed to deter him from committing property offences. But currently, his is on the run.

The suspect along with other burglars and thieves carry out property offences in an organised manner.

When contacted, deputy commissioner of police (Zone-II) Rahul Khade said, “We have sent a letter to the bank authorities asking them to freeze the bank account of the suspect’s wife.” An officer privy to the probe informed that it was while working on some of the major house burglaries in the city, that the name of this suspect and his two accomplices cropped up.

During the probe, more details including the suspect recently gifting imported perfumes and make-up articles to his wife came up. “One of the women, rounded up for questioning has revealed that the suspect has at least four wives, with more inclination towards one of them,” said an officer who recently questioned one of the women.

While scanning records of the woman, towards whom the accused has more inclination, the police found that in the first week of this month, he deposited about Rs 14 lakh in her bank account through RTGS.

On questioning her about the source of the money, she revealed that the suspect has deposited the money in her bank account. Police said that as the suspect has no legitimate source of income, the said amount is most likely to have come from the recent major property offences he is suspected of c ommitting in the city.

Title: Only one lottery round for RTE admissions this year
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Pune: From this year onwards, the 25% quota admission under the Right to Education (RTE) Act will witness a number of changes from the number of rounds to an early conclusion of the entire process.

There will be just one lottery round instead of four conducted earlier and the process would be over by May-end so that students are able to join the schools on the first day of the academic year in June. The online application process would begin in mid-February.

Dinkar Temkar, joint director of education and in-charge of the RTE in Maharashtra, said that the new changes will be incorporated from this year based on the suggestions by parents and educationists. "We will have just one round of allotment. For schools having more applications than intake, we will announce a waiting list. If seats remain vacant, the names from the waiting list will be given opportunity," he said.

Temkar said that once the application link is opened, aspirants can fill the forms for the next three to four weeks. After scrutiny of documents and verification, the lottery will be announced by March and admission confirmed by May-end.

The exact schedule will be announced by the education department soon. Every year, at least three lotteries take place, which delay the process, leading to some students joining schools in September.

"We have already informed parents and publicised on the RTE admissions portal regarding the documents required for admissions. The parents have to keep these documents ready so that no time is wasted after the application link is opened," said Temkar.

In Maharashtra, nearly 1.15 lakh seats under the 25% quota scheme of RTE in private English medium schools are reserved for students from the economically weaker sections of the society.

Title: ‘...Par tu maan gyi’: Kolkata reacts with horror
Content:
The meme that is being circulated on different social media platforms.

KOLKATA: A meme that reads ‘This could be you – Par tu maan gyi’ with actor Deepika Padukone’s ‘Chhapaak’ look has led to several netizens reporting the matter to Kolkata Police . The poster means that anyone could be an acid attack victim if she does not agree to her pursuer’s proposal. The toxic masculinity and criminality that almost goes on to justify acid attacks has also led the cyber cell of the detective department to urge social media platforms to block accounts of anyone sharing it.A probe is on to trace the origin of the meme. Several Twitter and Facebook users have called for an online campaign against the meme. Incidentally, Kolkata happens to be one of the three cities — along with Delhi and Chennai — where acid attacks are frequent, the 2018 NCRB data had revealed. By Friday evening, several politicians and celebrities took to social media and asked cops to take action. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor wrote: “Disgraceful that there are people who think like this, let alone post it on social media.”Subhanil Basu Roy, a Twitter user, was the first of the three who tagged the meme to Kolkata Police. “@KPDetectiveDept sir, such a disgraceful and dangerous meme has been made and spread on facebook and internet. Please look in to this and take all necessary action against such meme developers. Sharing the screenshot,” he wrote, tagging joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma. The response was prompt: “We have taken a note of the same and it is being forwarded to the concerned section (read cyber cell) for necessary action.” Talking to TOI, Sharma said: “The complaint is serious. Our cyber cell is handling it.” Sources said DCP (cyber cell) Aparajita Rai is leading a crack team to probe the complaint. “We have identified several sources from where this meme was shared,” said an officer.Saraswati, an acid attack survivor who now stays in Mumbai, took to the internet to write two powerful lines: “This is exactly the mindset that makes acid attackers. Those sharing share the same mindset.” Facebook user Krandasi Dutta Chowdhury wrote: “Is this even funny??? I can’t believe someone can make such meme on a serious issue like acid attack... I have reread it tens of times still can’t digest it. Such shame.”“The accounts responsible for creating such content are mostly anonymous meme pages or under fake names. However, wide circulation of these on social media is alarming,” said an investigating officer.

Title: PIL: Table panel report on Odisha HC bench in House
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

CUTTACK: A PIL filed in Orissa high court has sought direction to the state government to place the Justice C R Pal Commission report on setting up of high court benches, before the assembly without delay.

The PIL assumes significance as the report has been gathering dust for nearly five years and eight months as the government is yet to table it in the assembly. According to Commission of Inquiry Act, 1952, a report must be placed in the assembly along with government’s action-taken report, within six months of the commission submitting it.

High court lawyer Shivsankar Mohanty filed the PIL petition on Tuesday. According to the petition, the government had set up a judicial commission, headed by Justice (retired) C R Pal on March 11, 2008, to study the feasibility of setting up high court benches other than the principal bench in Cuttack . The panel took more than six years to submit the report. In all these years the government spent Rs 1.52 crore on the commission. It was submitted on May 31, 2014, said the petition.

In his petition, Mohanty said the inordinate delay is significant given that there has been growing clamour for high court benches in different parts of the state, resulting in agitations by lawyers.

Mohanty said he had on August 30, 2019, submitted a representation to the state law department’s principal secretary to take immediate steps to place the commission report before the legislature. But the law department passed on the representation to the state home department on October 1, 2019 “to take necessary action as the matter relates to their (home) department”.

In a related development, the high court had over a month ago admitted a PIL challenging the legal validity of the panel formed by the state government for consideration of permanent high court bench at places other than the principal seat in Cuttack while keeping the commission report under the carpet.

The state home department had first constituted the committee on March 8, 2019, for consideration of various aspects for establishment of permanent bench of Orissa high court in western and southern regions of the state.

The five-member committee was constituted with additional chief secretary in home department as chairman. On August 28, 2019, another member was added to the panel.

Title: Sai Baba’s birthplace row: Indefinite bandh in Shirdi from Sunday
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Inside the Sai Baba temple in Shirdi (File photo)

NASHIK: Upset with chief minister Uddhav Thackeray’s announcement to allot Rs 100 crore for development of Pathri in Parbhani, which is Sai Baba’s birthplace, the locals in Shirdi have announced to stage an indefinite bandh in the temple town from Sunday.

The chief minister announced allotment of the funds during his review meeting of Parbhani district in Aurangabad on January 9.

“The locals are unhappy with Thackeray for describing Pathri as the birthplace of Sai Baba. We came to know about Thackeray’s statement from the media. There is no document available about Sai Baba’s birthplace. Sai Baba himself never shared any information about his birthplace or religion during his stay in Shirdi,” Kailasbapu Kote, former trustee of Shri Saibaba Sansthan Trust, said.

Nitin Kote, a local resident who is spearheading the stir, said the peaceful agitation would continue till the CM clears his stand on the issue. “It could be possible that Thackeray was briefed wrongly on the issue,” he said.

According to Kote, the decision by the locals to organise the bandh is to send out a stern message to all VIPs to refrain from making any comments about the birthplace of the saint.

Shirdi temple and all its units like the Sai Prasadalaya, Sai Hospital, Sai Bhaktaniwas and the local medical shops have been kept outside the purview of the bandh. Maharashtra State Regional Transport Corporation (MSRTC) buses and hotels will also be allowed to function as usual.

However, public transport vehicles like autos and taxis operated by locals would remain off road. This could pose problems for devotees visiting the temple town by air or by train.

Shirdi airport is around 15-km from the temple town and railway station is about 2-km away. Moreover, the innumerable eateries and the vendors selling religious items like flowers outside the temple premises would remain closed during the bandh.

“We do not want to cause any inconvenience to the devotees. Our stir would be peaceful. The sentiments of the locals have been hurt since Sai Baba himself never disclosed his birthplace. Our stir is apolitical,” Kote said.

Over 50 sarpanchs around the temple town had a meeting on Friday afternoon and assured to back the stir.

Title: Rotten eggs hurled at Muthoot employees, threatened
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kottayam: Rotten eggs were hurled at nine women employed at different branches of Muthoot Finance allegedly by those supporting the agitators on Friday as police remained mere spectators.

Later in the day, the employees lodged a complaint at West Police station. In their complaint, the women alleged that a former staff of the company and striking CITU members planned the attack.

The first incident happened around 8.30am at Baker Junction branch. Around 25 strike supporters hurled rotten eggs at two women employees. They were also threatened not to report for work.

The second incident happened at the branch on TB Road around 9am. Six women staffers were forced to back away as rotten eggs were hurled in their direction.

Meanwhile, the staff of Baker Junction branch returned with the police after filing a complaint. However, the lock on the shutters could not be opened as the key holes were sealed with gum. The lock was then broken. As the staff and police tried to lift the shutters, bottles and stones kept in between the shutters fell on them. They had a narrow escape.

Meanwhile, CITU district president T R Raghunath said that his union was not responsible for the incident and sought a probe. TNN

Title: Bus shelters must not obstruct road users: Kerala high court
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

KOCHI: Bus shelters and similar constructions obstructing road users, including pedestrians , are legally impermissible, the Kerala high court ruled. Footpaths are not for parking vehicles or for use by vendors, it added.

Justice Anil K Narendran issued the order after considering a petition regarding a bus shelter constructed by the DYFI at Uduma Junction, on the Kanhangad-Kasaragod KSTP Road, that protrudes onto the road. The court has now asked the state government to inform, within two weeks, why the bus shelter has not been demolished, especially since two new bus shelters have been built by KSTP nearby.

In the order, the court said, “The pleadings and materials on record would show that the bus shelter in question at Uduma Junction poses serious safety concerns to bus passengers and also to pedestrians, including those with disabilities and reduced mobility. In view of the provisions referred to hereinbefore, and also the law laid down in the decisions referred to supra, constructions in or upon the public streets including ‘footpaths’ (which is the portion of right of way of road used for the movement of pedestrians) causing obstruction to the users of the street including pedestrians is legally impermissible. Once public roads are constructed as per the required standards and guidelines, it has to be maintained as such without encroachment of any nature, in any form, either temporary or permanent, on the right of way or on the pedestrian facilities provided as per such standards and guidelines. Footpaths and other pedestrian facilities on public roads are not intended for parking of vehicles or for the traders or shop owners to keep their articles.”

Asking the government to take action, the court said, “Any obstruction on footpaths and other pedestrian facilities on public roads will force pedestrians to walk in unsafe circumstances, which will adversely affect the mobility and safety of all pedestrians including those with disabilities and reduced mobility. Therefore, the first respondent state, the local authorities, the enforcement wing of the police and motor vehicle Department are required to ensure strict enforcement of the relevant statutory provisions and also the standards and guidelines in order to prevent encroachment of any nature, in any form, either temporary or permanent, on the right of way or on the pedestrian facilities on public roads.”

Title: Auto drivers planning protest against e-autos
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Kozhikode: Auto rickshaw drivers in the city are planning widespread protest against the decision to permit electric auto rickshaws to carry out service across Kerala without any district or city permit.

The trade unions of the auto rickshaw drivers are planning a 24-hour-strike from Sunday night demanding to restrict the electric autos with permit.

They also oppose the move to increase the number of auto rickshaws carrying out service in the city limit. At present 4 ,337 auto rickshaws have Calicut city permit and the auto drivers’ trade unions demand the authorities not to exceed the number of vehicles in the city limit. The government had decided to allow 2,000 electric autos and 1,000 CNG autos to start service in the city. It was also decided that fresh permit would be issued to green autos only.

With demonetization and other issues, auto rickshaw drivers are already struggling to earn a living, said V T Noushad, auto rickshaw driver and trade union leader. Any move to increase the number of city autos would only worsen the situation and auto rickshaw drivers are all set to start a protest to stop the move, he said. At present, over 50 electric auto rickshaws are carrying out service in Kozhikode city. These vehicles do not require any permit but only registration. The drivers of the auto rickshaws with city permit are now allowing the drivers of e-autos to park at the auto stands in the city. Besides, minor verbal clashes were also reported at some places between the trade union members and e-auto drivers.

On January 7, the collector had convened a meeting of trade union leaders to settle the protest against electric autos. During the meeting, the collector directed the trade union leaders to allow the existing e-autos to use the auto stands and carry out service. However, the trade union leaders, walked out from the meeting.

Title: Koodathayi murders: 2nd chargesheet filed
Content:
Representative image

KOZHIKODE: The district crime branch probing the Koodathayi multiple murder case , on Friday, filed the second chargesheet in the case. Investigating officer B K Siju submitted the chargesheet, after probing Sily Sebastian’s murder, before the Thamarassery Judicial First Class Magistrate Court I.Jolly Joseph is the first accused as per the chargesheet. M S Mathew, who supplied cyanide to Jolly to murder Sily is the second accused in the case and Praji Kumar, a goldsmith, who sold cyanide to Mathew is the third accused in the case.The witnesses as per the chargesheet are Sijo Sebastian, brother of Sili, Shali Francis, Sister of Sily and Shaju Zachariah, her husband.Sily was murdered in 2016. Her two year old daughter Alphine also had died in 2014 under suspicious circumstances.Meanwhile, district police chief (Kozhikode rural) K G Simon who led the investigation team told reporters that the statements given by Sily’s son and other relatives were crucial in collecting evidences to prove involvement of the accused in the crime.Sily, who was the first wife of Jolly’s husband Shaju. She was the last victim in the Koodathayi multiple murder case.According to the district police chief, Sily’s son had witnessed her collapsing in a private clinic at Mukkom where she was admitted with symptoms of epilepsy.Simon told that Jolly murdered Sily in her second attempt. He said that Jolly murdered Sily as she wanted to marry Shaju.The police also confirmed that Sily’s son had turned doubtful about Jolly’s behaviour at the time of Sily’s death and had witnessed her serving water and tablets to Sily.Sily was murdered by serving cyanide mixed water along with mushroom tablets according to police.“In the first attempt itself the presence of poison was detected in the body of Sily and her life could have been saved if her family members had taken the cue seriously,” the official said.K G Simon also cleared that Sily’s husband Shaju was ignorant of the plots of Jolly. He was interrogated by the police several times but they later ruled out the chances for his involvement in the case.In Video: Kerala cyanide murders case: Jolly Joseph, 2 others named in second chargesheet

Title: Defunct Circular Rail track dismantled
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020
