DEHRADUN: To better forest quality, enhance quantity of forest produce, and ensure sustainable forest management, Dehradun-based Forest Research Institute ( FRI ) organised a two-day training programme for IFS officers of all the states to acquaint them with the process of forest certification.

The training programme, which began on January 16, concluded on Friday. It was organised by the silviculture and forest management division of FRI.

The move aims at utilising forests of the nation to provide financial benefits to respective states and replantation of new plant species that would tap carbon dioxide more efficiently than older trees.

The training programme, titled “Forest Certification in Indian Context”, was inaugurated by Dr SC Gairola, director general of Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education (ICFRE). "Forest Certification refers to two separate processes — Forest Management Unit Certification (FMU) and Chain of Custody Certification (COC). Forest management certification is a process which verifies that an area of forest /plantations from where the wood, fibre and other non-timber forest products are extracted is managed to a defined standard. COC certification is a process of tracking forest products from the certified forest to the point of sale to ensure that product originated from a certified forest. Forest certification is a rapidly developing subject under sustainable forest management, and most of the forest officials do not have adequate knowledge and experience about it, and are thus not able to apply it in their area," he said.

Lectures and interactive discussions were conducted by experts from Bhopal’s Indian Institute of Management, New Delhi’s Indian Export Promotional Council on Handicraft, Noida’s Green Initiatives Certification & Inspection Agency, and state forest departments of Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh. A half-day field visit to Timber Depot of State Forest Depot at Saharanpur was also arranged for the participants.

Dr MD Omprakash, Indian Institute of Management, Bhopal explained the process of forest certification based on Criteria and Indicators. He also stated, "Timber importing countries, such as India, should ensure that they import raw material derived from sustainably managed forests; only then their finished products would be saleable in the international market."

Experts said that there is a 'need to focus on certification of non-wood forest products (NWFP)' as India is a major exporter of NWFP. Dr. S.D. Sharma, Deputy Director General (Research), ICFRE highlighted on the need to address forest certification in the new forest policy of India which is in draft stage.

He said, "Many developed countries and few developing countries have well established system of forest certification and they export legally extracted timbers which have economic, environmental and social values."

Title: World watching ‘ugly show’ on Wadia hospitals: Bombay high court
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Bombay high court

MUMBAI: Reminding the state government that the world was watching the “ugly show’’ on the twin Wadia hospitals in Parel, Bombay high court on Friday said no international agency will come forward to share its public health burden.

“Who will partner you here on? Nobody will come forward for philanthropic activities in this state,’’ said a bench of Justices Satyaranjan Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla. It heard a plea to release grants by the state and BMC to Nowrosjee Wadia Maternity Hospital and Bai Jerbai Wadia Hospital for Children. Both were rapped over non-release of grants on Thursday.

Advocates Girish Godbole, for the government, and Suresh Pakale, for BMC, said they released Rs 24 crore and Rs 14 crore each. “When you want to release overnight, you do it,’’ said Justice Dharmadhikari. With regard to the remaining amount, Pakale said BMC had to verify the Wadia Trust’s “exorbitant” claims. This was when the judges called for an end to the “royal battle”. “The ugly show in court is communicated to the world. If locals are treated like this, why should strategic partners walk in?’’ asked Justice Dharmadhikari.

Pakale said a competent authority investigated a complaint by Shrikant Hatkar on irregularities and its report confirmed dual salaries were paid. “CEO Dr Minnie Bodhanwalla took salaries from both hospitals,’’ he said. The judges asked if BMC did not know of irregularities. “How many years you allowed it? Why did you not withdraw from the partnership?’’ asked Justice Dharmadhikari. Senior advocate Rafiq Dada, for the trust, said all accounts were audited and signed by BMC members. He also said Hatkar’s complaint was withdrawn. When Pakale said an independent inquiry may verify it, Justice Dharmadhikari said, “…it will also be against your officers.”

Godbole said following a March 2019 meeting the chief trustee had with the then chief minister, it was agreed to hold talks on modification of the trust deed. The judges suggested that the trust’s board meeting be advanced to resolve issues and will be attended by the additional municipal commissioner (health) and a secretary. A formal order will be passed on Tuesday.

Title: Travel on Panaji-Betim ferry route not to be charged
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ferry route in Goa. (Photo: Goa river navigation department website/@rnd.goa.gov.in)

PANAJI: The river navigation department’s ( RND ) plans to commercialise the Panaji-Betim ferry route may never see light of the day as the department has not received a thumps-up from the government to impose a fee on commuters travelling on foot and on two-wheelers on this route.

“The file had gone to the government for approval for commercialisation of the Panaji-Betim route after former chief minister Manohar Parrikar had initiated the proposal. The government, however, has asked us not to implement the same,” an RND official said.

The RND wanted to impose a fee of Rs 5 for pedestrian passengers and Rs 10 for two-wheeler vehicles on this route. The fare for the four-wheeler vehicles was to be doubled from the existing fee on all ferry routes.

“We would’ve collected a revenue of at least Rs 1,00,000 per month from the fees if the proposal was accepted,” the official said. On an average day, there are about 11,000 commuters and more than 5000 two-wheelers travelling on the Panaji-Betim ferry route.

The department however has received a green signal for increasing the charges of special trips and hourly charges of hiring ferry boats.

The vessels are usually hired for special trips by commuters to avail the ferry services beyond regular operating hours. The hour-basis hire is for film shootings, weddings or to execute PWD contract works.

Title: Good Samaritan rescues food delivery exec getting mugged
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: A 40-year-old food delivery executive had a lucky escape after a passer-by helped him nab a dreaded goon, who was trying to rob him at knifepoint, on Thursday night near Reshimbagh. Sakkardara police have arrested the accused, Mahendra Jambhulkar, 28.

The incident has also raised concerns about the safety of food delivery boys, who have to deliver orders till late night and at several locations across the city.

Police said Manoj Pardhi, a resident of Parvati Nagar, works as a food delivery executive for an app. On Thursday night, Pardhi picked up an order from a restaurant and was on his way to deliver it when his bike was stopped by Jambhulkar.

The accused, who was carrying a big knife, was roaming in the area. He stopped Pardhi and put his knife on his chest and asked him to hand over his money. Pardhi got off the bike and was trying to reason with him when a passer-by on a bike spotted the incident. The passer-by stopped his bike and rushed to help Pardhi. The duo tried to control Jambhulkar but he got violent and tried to attack them.

During the scuffle, both Pardhi and the passer-by sustained minor injuries, but they managed to nab Jambhulkar.

The passer-by then called police control room and the incident was reported to Sakkardara police station. The cops rushed to the spot and arrested Jambhulkar.

Police registered a case of extortion against the accused under sections of Indian Penal Code (IPC) and Arms Act. He was later formally arrested and produced before the court on Friday, and remanded to magisterial custody. Cops have also seized the big knife from the accused.

It is learnt that Jambhulkar has several body offences registered against him, including assault.

Title: Ahmedabad: Hefty hike in property tax on flats and bungalows
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Even pol residents in the Walled City will pay Rs 307 extra

AHMEDABAD: Those living in bungalows and flats in posh areas should expect a steep rise in their property tax bill this municipal election year. After almost six years, municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra in his Rs 8,907 cr budget proposed a 93% to 64% increase in property tax for owners of bungalows with a carpet area more than 100 sq m depending on the neighbourhood, and a 48% increase for owners of flats with a carpet area greater than 750 sq ft. Even pol residents in the Walled City will pay Rs 307 extra.

Nehra’s budget proposal has to be ratified by the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) standing committee and general body before it comes into effect.

Elaborating on the increase in tax, Nehra said the base rate was raised for residential clusters from Rs 16 to Rs 22 and values of factors for properties in posh location and leased properties were also increased from 1.62 to 1.92.

If you are the owner of an independent bungalow, the ownership factor in the tax formula has been increased from 1.5 to 1.8. In case of commercial properties, the base rate has been increased from 28 to 34.

In all, an additional tax burden of Rs 244 crore will be levied on Amdavadis, of which Rs 218 cr will be additional property tax on 16 lakh properties and Rs 26 cr will be derived increased vehicle tax.

“We have withdrawn the 1% relief in vehicle tax for autorickshaws and in case of private vehicles in the luxury segment, which cost more than Rs 15 lakh, we have raised the tax rate to 3% from 2.5%,” says Nehra.

The budget plans to invest Rs 968 cr in 20 flyovers, Rs 152 cr on 15 rail bridges, Rs 600 cr for road modernisation, Rs 500 crore for new multi-level parking complexes in the city and two biodiversity parks worth Rs 200 cr.

Nehra said a special recreation zone like Law Garden will be made in every ward, and one major arterial road in each ward will be modelled on the new CG Road design. He added that Ahmedabad pays the lowest tax among major cities at Rs 744 per capita while the AMC in turn spends Rs 10,727.14 on every citizen. Surat collects an average of Rs 2,302.76 from every citizen while its civic body spends Rs 12,442 on every citizen.

Nehra claimed that the major thrust will be on creating quality sports and social infrastructure. “We will begin work on the Rs 200 cr world-class sports complex and by the end of this budget year we are planning a gymnasium, swimming pool and mini sports complex in every ward.”

After announcing budget provisions for the 600 new electric buses, Nehra said that these buses will have overhead electric charging.

Title: Missing Apple techie located in Pune, brought back to city
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: After nearly 20-day intensive search by eight teams of Cyberabad police, a 35-year-old missing Apple India employee was traced in Pune on Tuesday. Police brought her to the city and handed her over to her family members. K Rohita, an employee of Apple India Pvt Ltd, left her flat at Mantri Celestia apartment, Gachibowli, around 3pm on December 26. While leaving, Rohita left her phone, passport and debit/credit cards at the flat. She did not inform neither her colleagues nor family.

After failing to locate her, the family lodged a complaint with Gachibowli police on December 29 and a missing case was registered. Apart from analysing CCTV camera footage at Gachibowli, the special teams, comprising law and order and Special Operations Team (SOT) sleuths, analysed CCTV camera footage at bus stands, railway stations, airport and Metro stations to locate the missing woman.

“We searched in Secunderabad and at Chandrayangutta after pursuing some leads. Shared her photo with police of neighbouring states. Later, we noticed that a call was received from an unknown number on the landline phone at Rohita’s parent’s house. We found out that the call came from Karnataka and the SIM card from which the call originated was issued in Rohita’s name in Karnataka. Later, the number was located in Bengaluru and subsequently in Pune,” Cyberabad police said.

A four member police team, led by Gachibowli SI Surender Reddy, went to Pune in search of Rohita and searched some hostels. They could not locate her. The police team then went to a job consultancy service office in Vishram Bagh area where Rohita made some calls. “The consultancy staff identified her. On Wednesday when she came to the office to enquire about a job, we identified her. With the assistance of her relatives in Pune and cops of Vishram Bagh police station, we convinced Rohita to return to Hyderabad. In the early hours of Thursday, Rohita was handed over to her family at Gachibowli station,” Srinivas said.

In a video statement, Rohita said that she left Hyderabad on her own and reached Bengaluru in a bus. “From IIIT Junction, I got into a bus and reached Aramgarh. I boarded a bus to Bengaluru and stayed in a PG accommodation for a few days while searching for jobs. From there, I went to Hubli. On January 13, I reached Pune. While I was searching for jobs through a consultancy, a police team reached here and informed me about the missing case. I left Hyderabad on my own and no one kidnapped me,” Rohita said.

Rohita’s brother Parikshit said Surender Reddy’s team worked very hard to locate her and thanked them.

Title: Girl drowns in bid to escape wild boars
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: A 20 year-old girl from Ramtek, identified as Divya Sangode, drowned after she fell into a well following an alleged attack by a herd of wild boars at her farm on Thursday.

The police are investigating the matter to ascertain the actual cause of death. If proven that the girl jumped in the well to avoid being attacked by wild boars, her family will be entitled for compensation from the forest department.

Santosh Thakur, police inspector in-charge of the investigation, said that they are awaiting the post mortem report. “We have registered a case and her body was sent for post mortem. It is only after the report comes that we can reach any conclusion,” said Thakur.

In the meantime, police are speaking with the eyewitnesses and will also get in touch with forest officials. Thakur said, “It is a very unique case but we do get similar instances reported. Injuries and sometimes death are caused by animals, following which the forest department too gets involved.”

It is learnt, the Sangode family was working at their farm when a herd of wild boars appeared there. The family took evasive actions to avoid the wild boars. During the melee, Divya seems to have jumped in an open well on the farm. A final report by the police is awaited.

Deputy forest conservator Prabhunath Shukla could not be reached for a comment on the incident.

Title: ED finds shell firms floated by Leonia MD to divert funds
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: Enforcement directorate probe revealed that managing director and other functionaries of Leonia Resorts created 33 shell companies in name of employees and diverted funds in loan fraud case . ED arrested accused MD GS Chakravarthy Raju and senior employee AV Prasad under Prevention of Money Laundering Act.

The total outstanding loan amount defaulted is Rs 1,768 crore. ED said that the accused siphoned off hundreds of crores of loan amount from Leo Meridian Infrastructure Projects & Hotels Limited (LMIPHL) to shell companies.

In December 2019, ED had attached assets worth Rs 250 crore of the accused after a probe based on a FIR filed by the CBI. The CBI had alleged that the accused took loan of Rs 700 crore from a consortium of banks-led Bank of Baroda and defaulted on the same. The accused, in an illegal layout, sold plots to 315 persons and mortgaged the same to banks to get loan for resort project. Funds up to Rs 250 crore were diverted using contractors. ED has so far identified and attached 3,43,17,948 shares of promoters, 76,62,434 benami shares, 11 immovable properties of Raju and his family and 38 immovable properties in names of benamis.

ED, in its arrest report, said the accused floated 40 contractor firms in names of LMIPHL employees. Part of diverted funds was channelled back into LMIPHL as investments using Kolkata based jama-kharch companies. “Accused created large number of bogus invoices and bogus provision of material and services and diverted to contractors. In fund trail it was found that large portions of these diverted loan funds were cyclically rotated back into LMIPHL to create bogus exaggerated capital works in progress and in turn bogus fixed assets. This was done to cheat the banks into giving more loans and to match the asset side of the balance sheets with the liability side,” ED said.

ED also added that by using bogus capital equity and bonus shares taken on fake balance sheets, Raju and his family came to own 95% of the company without investing any real personal money.

LMIPHL never maintained cash ledger, invoices for construction activities, fixed asset registers and did not provide the same for probe. “Over the years many lands were transferred to benami names and suspect tenancy rights were created by accused persons using local influence,” ED said.

Title: Bird festival will give wings to hinterland tourism: CM Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Participants at the festival will be able to engage in bird walks and field trips in the forests of Valpoi, Bo... Read More

PANAJI/VALPOI: Eco tourism in the state’s hinterland will get a boost owing to the bird festival , chief minister Pramod Sawant said on Friday.

“Goa has good road connectivity and so also good birding sites. The forest department will provide a platform for naturalists, experts, forest officers and bird photographers to meet and share their insights. This will open new vistas for ecotourism in Goa’s hinterland,” the chief minister said during the inauguration of the third edition of the festival at Valpoi .

Sawant said that Goa’s Western Ghats has an exceptionally rich biodiversity and the area is emerging as an eco- and hinterland tourism destination. “Coupled with the rich 450-species strong bird diversity, it is a perfect destination for birders and bird tourism,” Sawant said.

A total of 52 delegates from India and abroad, including students are participating in the festival, which is being held in the Sattari taluka from January 17 to 19.

Sawant had previously launched a website — birdfestival.goa.gov.in — carrying details of the festival.

The state forest department has also released a special postal cover on Goa’s State Bird, the Flame-throated bulbul (Pycnonotus gularis) to mark this edition of the bird festival. Limited numbers of the postal cover will be available at post offices across the state for philately enthusiasts to purchase.

Participants at the festival will be able to engage in bird walks and field trips in the forests of Valpoi, Bondla, Molem and Mhadei which harbour rich bird diversity. The festival will also feature day trips to forests, besides treks and bird walks.

Besides birding, experts and renowned birders will also be sharing their knowledge and experiences on birds and wildlife conservation.

Title: Crowds throng tourist spots on ‘Kaanum Pongal’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

People at Vellore Fort on Friday

VELLORE: Hundreds of people gathered in public places here to celebrate ‘ Kaanum Pongal ’ on Friday.

The revellers congregated at key tourist spots such as Vellore Fort , Periyar Park, Amirthi Zoological Park, Balamathi Hills, Valli Malai, Mourdhana Dam and Panamadangi Rajathoppu Dam.

To ensure an incident-free Pongal celebration, the Vellore district police had deployed more than 1,000 personnel on bandobust duty.

Meanwhile, residents organised traditional games such as kabaddi, uriyadi, silambam and vazhukku maram in various parts of the city and suburbs.

Similarly, as part of the Pongal festival, bull race was held at Munjurpattu in which more than 25 varieties of native breeds took part. Attired in local traditional clothing, Vellore SP K Pravesh Kumar celebrated Kaanum Pongal by preparing the dish in a pot at Nethaji Stadium in the evening.

Speaking to TOI, Pravesh Kumar said, “Barring some scuffles, no major untoward incidents were reported in the district. Kaanum Pongal was celebrated with traditional fervour.”

Title: Work to begin on 35 flyovers in Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: If the Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) begins work on all 35 flyovers and railway under-bridges planned for the coming financial year, prepare to face traffic jams for at least the next couple of years.

In its budget for 2020-21, the AMC proposed 20 flyovers and 15 railways under-bridges and the state and Union governments have approved these projects.

The governments have sanctioned Rs 968 crore for these bridges and railway under-bridges. A senior officer said that being an election year, work on all these projects will likely begin simultaneously and will consequently lead to traffic congestion everywhere.

The state government had recently sanctioned seven new flyovers, worth Rs 335 crore. These flyovers are part of the budget and were sanctioned under the Swarnim Jayanti Chief Minister Urban Development Scheme (SJCMUDS).

However, the government has decided to release just 10% of the total cost, i.e. Rs 33.50 crore. The remaining funds will be released in phases. These seven flyovers are part of the 20 proposed in the budget.

Title: Class IX student, three others commit suicide at separate locations in Nagpur
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Four persons, including a 14-year-old boy, have committed suicide at different locations in city between Thursday and Friday. In all the cases police have registered a case of accidental death.

In the first incident, A 14-year-old boy committed suicide after his parents snatched his phone on Friday morning at his home in Gajanan Nagar. The deceased, identified as Vansh Imla, a student of std IX, hanged himself to the ceiling fan with a nylon rope on the first floor of his house.

According to police, Vansh was addicted to using mobile and used to bunk school regularly due to the addiction. Vansh’s parents, who work as labourers, had recently took away the phone from him. This drove the minor to take the drastic step. Cops have also found some objectionable material on the phone which Vansh used to operate.

In another incident, Rakesh Naidu, 35, committed suicide by hanging himself to the ceiling fan at his home with a nylon rope on Friday at Setuba Nagar. According to police, the reason behind the drastic step is unknown as no suicide note was found from the spot.

In the third incident, Atish Dhargave, 34, committed suicide by hanging himself at his home on Thursday at Gautam Nagar. Cops said, Atish was alone at his home when he committed suicide.

In the fourth incident, Bhojraj Deshmukh, 46, committed suicide by hanging himself to an iron rod on the ceiling of his house with a long scarf on Thursday at Shraddhanand Peth.

Title: Gujarat: Lokayukta, vigilance commissioner posts vacant for more than a year
Content:
Vijay Rupani

GANDHINAGAR: Gujarat chief minister Vijay Rupani claims to have declared war against corruption, but two important posts — the state vigilance commissioner and lokayukta — which are key to curbing corruption, have been vacant for more than a year.To make matters worse, the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) is functioning at just over 60% of its sanctioned strength.

Title: Dairy farmers agitate over hiked cattle feed price
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ponda: A day after Goa State Milk Producers’ Union better known as Goa Dairy hiked the rate of cattle feed by Rs 4 per kg, milk producing farmers staged a sit-in agitation on the dairy’s campus. They demanded that either the hike be rolled back or the rate at which the dairy procured milk from them be increased.

Heated arguments were witnessed between the dairy staff and agitating farmers and police had to be called in to control the situation.

The union raised the rate of cattle feed by Rs 4 per kg from Thursday claiming that it was essential to offset losses at its cattle feed plant at Usgao

The farmers demanded that they be given a two-third hike in milk procurement rate, which translates to an increase Rs 3 per litre.

According to the milk union, the plant is running in losses as rates of some the ingredients used to produce cattle feed have gone up after they were brought under the ambit of Goods and Services Tax (GST). Our feed is much cheaper than that sold by others, the union said.

The union’s plant provides cattle feed to village-level milk collection societies which supply it to its farmers in the state.

Title: CMRS clears Vasudeo Nagar Metro station
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Commissioner of Metro Rail Safety ( CMRS ) Janak Kumar Garg on Friday cleared Vasudeo Nagar Metro station for operations.

The station is on Reach III (Sitabuldi to Lokmanya Nagar) which is ready since September but is yet to be opened as MahaMetro awaits the date of CM Uddhav Thackeray and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Garg inspected the facilities at the station and also reviewed the security arrangement. According to MahaMetro officials, Garg was satisfied with the facilities.

The facilities include automatic fare collection (AFC) gate, emergency call point, emergency stop plunger, lift, escalator, facilities for passengers inside station premises — toilets, drinking water, baby care room, special toilet for handicapped persons, display board, guide for passengers, etc.

Director (project) Mahesh Kumar, director (rolling stock) Sunil Mathur, executive director (Reach III) Arun Kumar, Giridhari Paunikar, JP Dehria, Naresh Gurbani, Anil Kokate, Sudhakar Urade, Rajesh Patel, Ashish Sanghi, Himanshu Ghatwari and others were present during the inspection.

Title: Puducherry: Missing 24-year-old man found dead
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

VELLORE: A 24-year-old man reported missing since Thursday evening was found dead in Kollalam Kolli forest near Vaniyambadi on Friday.

Police said Vadivel of Nayana Seruvu near Vaniyambadi had gone out with his friends on Thursday afternoon but didn’t return till evening. Anxious relatives and friends of Vadivel who went in search of him were later shocked to find him lying dead with injuries on his chest and face.

On information, the Thimmapet police who came to the spot retrieved his body and sent it for postmortem examination at Tirupattur Government hospital. Further investigation was on.

Title: ‘If there is gadbad in NPR, our cabinet will take a call’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Hyderabad: TRS working president KT Rama Rao tells Robin David and Koride Mahesh that the Telangana government has kept its options open on NPR and NRC, and why he believes BJP is no challenge for his party in the state

You have not taken a clear stand on NPR (National Population Register) and NRC (National Register of Citizens) despite parties friendly to you, like AIMIM, requesting to reject the two. Why?

A: On CAA (Citizenship Amendment Act) at least our stands is clear. Chief minister and party president KCR Ji told our party MPs to say in both houses of Parliament that we are a secular party, which does not believe in any kind of discrimination or differentiation based on religion. The one demand we raised was to include the word ‘Muslim’ in the Citizenship (Amendment) Bill. They did not do it, so we voted against it. There is no change in that stand.

With respect to NPR and NRC, we as a party take decisions at an opportune time. We will cross the bridge when we get to it. Also, there is no communique on NRC from anyone. NPR, they say, is a usual thing that happens with the Census. If you are looking at NPR and NRC through the prism of CAA, then the home minister has contradicted himself. He says that the Prime Minister is right and he was wrong (on linking CAA with NRC).

So, are you going ahead with NPR in Telangana?

A: The fact is, so far, we have received nothing in writing (from the Centre) on this.

Some political parties have alleged that NPR is backdoor entry for NRC in the country. Your take.

A: Like I said, we have received no official communication on NRC. NPR, they say, is part of census, which happens every 10 years, but if we find that their (Centre’s) intentions are not clean, and if there is some ‘gadbad’, then we will definitely take a call in our cabinet. But at present there is no official communique. There is no point talking in thin air.

Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi has requested your government to reject NPR.

A: At the end of the day, Owaisi saab has to run an independent political party. He doesn’t answer to us, nor we to him. We have our own ideas and priorities. He can, of course, demand (that NPR be rejected) as Hyderabad MP and as president of a political party with a standing in Telangana. But the onus is on the government to take an appropriate decision at an appropriate time.

How is your relationship with the Centre now that you have voted against CAA? You have said recently that you have not been included in a number of projects like the defence industrial manufacturing corridor.

A: Let me disassociate a few things. We have supported the central government on GST when they called it ‘one-nation one-tax’. We also supported demonetisation as the Prime Minister spoke to the chief minister, and said we would go towards ‘poorna kranti’. We also supported them on the election of the President and Vice-President. But on CAB, we said it was against national interest. Our support has always been issue-based. We are, after all, an independent party and not subordinate to either Prime Minister Modi or (Congress chief) Sonia Gandhi. No one is our boss except the people of Telangana and we will follow their wishes.

But you have not been made part of a number of central projects.

A: When our chief minister comes up with a project or an agenda, he does not differentiate between TRS constituencies and other party constituencies. We believe Telangana is our state, let it be any infrastructure project like Mission Kakatiya or Mission Bhagiratha. Unfortunately, Government of India has not followed a similar principle. When it came to defence industrial corridor, there had to be a logic, a rationale behind it. Hyderabad and Bangalore have had defence establishments for decades because of geopolitical and strategic reasons. As a result, a large defence ecosystem has been created.

In 2017, I had told the then defence minister (Nirmala Sitharaman) that you must look at Hyderabad and Bangalore for a defence corridor to strengthen the ecosystem. Unfortunately, it went to Bundelkhand and between Chennai and Coimbatore. That was befuddling. Also, you can give defence land to the state government in Lucknow, but you don’t give it to us despite asking for it for four years.

Besides, why is there only one DMIC (Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor) in the country? You have only a handful of cities of the size of Hyderabad. I can’t understand why we don’t leverage these vibrant metropolises. Why can’t we have a southern industrial corridor between Hyderabad, Bangalore and Chennai? My demand is justified. If it is not justified, I should be told. We have been asking for a bullet train, but it goes to DMIC again. Why can’t Delhi be linked to Kanyakumari via Hyderabad? At least when (AB) Vajpayee was the Prime Minister, there was the Golden Quadrilateral. This is not criticism. This is a genuine grouse.

How many seats will TRS will in the civic elections?

A: Our party will secure lion’s share of seats in the 120 municipalities and municipal corporations. The party has swept all elections like ZP, gram panchayat and Huzurnagar bye-elections.

But there is a lot of dissidence in your party.

A: There was a huge demand for tickets as the elections are being fought on party symbol. About 8,000 had filed nominations claiming TRS official nominee. Ninety per cent of them have withdrawn from the fray and only 10% are still in the fray as rebels. There would be no impact on our winning chances.

BJP is looking to make inroads into Telangana. They want to be the main opposition now.

A: TRS is not considering BJP as a threat in the state. If BJP has Amit Shah, TRS has KCR. I have been observing BJP in Telangana since my school days, and it has not improved its strength since then. What it was then, it is now. There is a hungama on BJP’s strength in the state as the party is in power at the Centre.

But you can’t deny the fact that BJP secured four Lok Sabha seats in the 2019.

A: I admit TRS could not get 16 Lok Sabha seats as we had planned. We got only nine seats. May be people thought the elections were being fought on national issues and between two national parties — Congress and BJP — and TRS was marginalised. But it bounced back and swept zilla parishad elections, which were held 10 to 15 days after Lok Sabha polls. TRS even swept Karimnagar, Adilabad and Nizamabad where BJP MPs had won.

In hindsight, do you think the idea of a federal front ahead of Lok Sabha elections was premature?

A: I would not say so. TRS had aimed for 16 Lok Sabha seats and got only nine seats. But still the party got more seats than all other opposition parties together (four BJP, three Congress and one MIM). BJP is losing states and definitely regional parties will now definitely have a role to play nationally. When it comes to TRS, our party has 15 MPs (nine Lok Sabha and six in Rajya Sabha). Two more MPs would be added in Rajya Sabha next month as elections are due. As the BJP does not have required number and majority in Rajya Sabha, TRS has a big role to play in Delhi. Seventeen MPs is not a small number.

Does the economic slowdown in the country impact Telangana’s welfare schemes? Rythu Bandhu funds have been delayed, loan waiver has not been announced…

A: The TRS government is committed for implementing all welfare schemes. The state has been spending about Rs 40,000 crore on welfare schemes. It is the duty of a democratic government to take care of the vulnerable given that we are still a developing country. Farm loan waiver might be implemented in four instalments like in the previous term. Cash flows, especially from the Centre, may affect some of these schemes, but the chief minister is committed to them. He will find a way. At present, there is no proposal to put caps on Rythu Bandhu scheme. Yes, if there are any systemic inefficiencies, we will rectify them.

Title: Police seize 10 high-end cars worth Rs3.33 crore
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nashik: City police have seized 10 high-end cars and Sports Utility Vehicle (SUVs) from 10 agents of a financial company whose directors have cheated a large number of people by promising hefty returns on their investments.

Commissioner of police Vishwas Nangare-Patil said the 10 cars were seized from the agents concerned last week during the investigation of the case. These vehicles are worth Rs 3.33 crore.

“A case of cheating was registered with Mumbai Naka police station in May last year. The complainant in the case had stated that the director of a company along with few others had set up an office in Nashik and floated different financial schemes. Under the scheme, the directors took Rs 53.43 lakh from the complainant between the year 2015 and 2019 and later turned away from giving the assured interest on the investment and the principal amount,” the top cop said.

“After a complaint was lodged it was found that the directors concerned cheated the investors to the tune of at least Rs 3.83 crore,” he added.

The police found that the concerned directors had taken deposits from investors and later the agents, who brought the investors, were given full financial assistance to buy high-end cars.

After the offence was registered police prepared seven different teams to trace the agents and other directors involved in the cheating case. The teams were sent to Mumbai, Pune, Ahmednagar, Nashik, Solapur and Jalgaon.

“The directors involved in the case got anticipatory bail ever since an offence has been registered against them. However, police have frozen 27 bank accounts of the concerned directors. However, police have been able to recover only Rs 10 lakh from the bank accounts,” a police officer said.

Police have appealed to the investors to contact them with the necessary documents to register offences against the directors.

Title: French institute to hold debate on DBT
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

PUDUCHERRY: A cross-section of economists, academicians and researchers, food processors, farmers and their representatives, non-government organisations and their activists and urban and rural consumers will debate on issues surrounding a pilot project, ‘ direct cash transfer scheme ’ and the concepts of food justice and security during a workshop on ‘Local food system of Pondicherry: A discussion on food sovereignty and agroecology transition’ organised by the French Institute of Pondicherry (IFP) and the department of agriculture, Puducherry, from January 22 to 25 at the IFP.

The debate scheduled at 9am on January 23 will focus on concerns raised by a section of people on dismantling the public distribution system in favour of cash transfer to beneficiaries. Reetika Khera, associate professor of Indian Institute of Management, Ahmedabad, who will talk on’ ‘Food or cash: What the evidence does tell us?’ will analyse the results of field studies conducted in India on preferences of different sections of people, feasibility of the two modes, logistics and costs. The researchers have been of the strong view that the time to shift to cash transition has not yet arrived in the country.

IFP director Frederic Landy will talk on ‘Cash or kind transfer? The regional, national and global dimension of revamping the public distribution system’. His focus will be on gender issues pertaining to the two modes.

The workshop will also include a debate on the preservation of native and indigenous seeds like millet, rice and vegetable to sustain biodiversity and adapt to climate change and preserve water.

The four-day workshop aims to analyse the food systems in Puducherry, integrate food production, processing, distribution and consumption to enhance environmental, economic and social health of the territory. “This platform should permit collective thinking and suggest specific actions on the food priorities of Pondicherry communities,” said a note from the institute.

The workshop will also include field visits to organic farms at Kunichampattu and discussion with organic farmers on January 24 and an organic food exhibition on the street adjacent to the institute on January 25. Organic producers will display their products at the exhibition and will create awareness on their products among consumers and the public.

IFP is organizing the workshop on local food systems of Pondicherry for the second consecutive year. Agriculture minister R Kamalakannan will inaugurate the workshop on January 22 at the IFP.

Title: Goa: Finally, water treatment plant at Opa commissioned
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

The plant aims to supply piped water to new township at Kadamba Plateau in Bainguinim-Old Goa and enhance wate... Read More

PONDA: After much delay, the newly constructed 27-MLD water treatment plant at Curti-Opa was commissioned on Friday. The plant aims to supply piped water to new township at Kadamba Plateau in Bainguinim-Old Goa and enhance water supply to Panaji.

Chief minister Pramod Sawant , after commissioning the plant said that Goa is the first state in India where 78% houses get tapped water. “Most of the remaining houses come under wildlife forest where pipelines cannot be laid. But the government would pump the bore well water and supply it those areas after filtering it,” he said adding that he expects the work to complete by March end.

Sawant also assured that the contractual workers attached to PWD would be absorbed under a society by April this year. Stating that the contract workers are performing better and that they should get their minimum wages directly, the chief minister said that the workers get their salary after deductions by the labour contractor and he wants to abolish the contractor system.

PWD Minister Deepak Pauskar said that his department would soon implement spot billing to ensure that the consumers get their water bills every month. “The government also mulls to bring in smart meters for five years and the issue is being studied,” he said.

The existing plants at Opa treat 125-130MLD of water to meet the drinking needs of the Ponda and Tiswadi talukas. While 62-65MLD is supplied to Tiswadi taluka, the requirement for the state capital and areas in its vicinity continues to increase. PWD officials peg the current shortfall of treated water to Panaji and surrounding areas at15MLD. The new plant at Opa is expected to make up for this shortfall.

Work on the plant began in 2013 and was expected to be completed by 2015.

Title: Power consumption of Tamil Nadu during this Pongal lowest in recent years
Content:
Representative image

CHENNAI: Tamil Nadu’s power consumption this Pongal was the lowest in recent years. Power consumption on Wednesday, when the state celebrated ‘Kaanum Pongal’, was 219 million units, against 274 million units registered during last year’s Pongal. It is lower than the power consumption last Diwali, when it was 244.96 million units.Sources in Tangedco attributed the lower consumption to general economic slowdown, which had to a large extent affected industrial power consumption. While industrial units are shut during all festivals every year, the slowdown was a major reason behind the lower power consumption this year during Pongal, sources said.Meanwhile, Tangedco has also been able to juggle its power production by keeping many of its thermal units on standby and meeting the power demand with power sourced from central units and private power companies since the tariff was low.“Power is available in the electricity market at a lower tariff due to lower demand in northern states on account of the prevailing colder climate in the region,” a senior Tangedco official told TOI.This has worked to Tangedco’s benefit on other fronts too. By not using its thermal units, the discom is also saving coal, which will come in handy in months when the temperature increases and power demand goes up. “We have been conserving coal as power is available in the market at a cheaper cost. Our units will be generating more power mostly from middle of February, as by then the demand in the market will increase leading to increase in tariff,” said the official.Tangedco’s thermal units have generated 17,484.62 million units between April and December, 2019. Whereas, 20,510.61 million units were generated during the same period in 2018. The discom has a total 4320MW of thermal unit capacity. As per the data released by Central Electricity Authority, the plant load factor of the Tangedco units is 57.04% compared to previous year’s 67.09%.According to the official, the discom will have to depend only on its own thermal units till April, besides tapping power from other regular sources. “Wind power will be available only from mid-April. Till then, we need coal to generate power in our units,” said the official.Tangedco was also fortunate to have generated more hydro power last year, thanks to the favourable monsoons. “With the dams full and water being released, hydro power generation had begun even during southwest monsoon. Hydro power is available now too and we are using it as it is pollution-free and the cost of hydro power is one of the lowest among all power sources,” he said.

Title: Babulal remains non-committal, fans ‘joining BJP rumour’ fire
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ranchi: JVM-P chief Babulal Marandi on Thursday kept the guessing game on his possible move to BJP going. Marandi returned to the state capital on Thursday after an overseas trip. Speaking to journalists at the party’s headquarters, the former chief minister did not come clean when asked whether speculations about him are true.

“Not only the BJP but several political parties have offered me to join them in the past. There is nothing new in it,” Marandi said. “If at all such a thing happens, you will all be informed about it in advance,” he added.

Speculations have been rife for more than a fortnight that Marandi has been contemplating a move to the saffron party after getting an offer from the latter. Although BJP has not made any statement officially, rumour mills are agog that the party, which is on the hunt for a tribal face after its defeat in the recently concluded state assembly polls, has offered Marandi the post of the leader of opposition.

Marandi gave unconditional support of JVM-P’s three MLAs (including himself) to the JMM-led coalition government under chief minister Hemant Soren, even before the latter staked claimed to form the government. The 62-year-old had opted out of the coalition ahead of the assembly polls citing delay in seat-sharing talks. Before the results were declared, Marandi had ruled out any possibility of a post-poll alliance with BJP.

“There were speculations about me before also. But I do not give much importance to them and do my job with devotion,” Marandi said when prodded further. Without naming BJP, he said, “I see no harm if someone tries to get something.”

While Marandi remained non-committal, his two MLAs — Pradeep Yadav and Bandhu Tirkey — have announced publicly that they won’t go to BJP in case of a merger . On Thursday, Tirkey even asked Marandi to come clean on the issue. JVM-P sources told TOI that several of its district units are in favour of a merger.

Title: Varun Badola: "I bet Ranveer can’t get Kapil Dev’s bowling action as perfectly as me": Varun Badola
Content: Back in 2016, television actor Varun Badola made a small appearance as Kapil Dev in the Emraan Hashmi-starrer Azhar. A self-confessed cricket fan, Varun says he is now looking forward to '83, which features Ranveer Singh as Kapil.Though Varun maintains that he may not have been convincing in his look, he is sure that no other actor can nail Kapil Dev’s famous bowling action like he does. “I have had the same bowling action since childhood. In fact, in a friendly match in Mumbai, S Sreesanth pointed it out and said that my action is exactly like that of Kapil paaji,” says Varun who is currently acting in the television show Mere Dad ki Dulhan. “For Azhar, the makers called me a couple of days prior to the shoot so I didn’t have any time to prepare. But, no matter how good or bad I looked on screen, I knew one thing for sure that even at 4 in the morning if anyone told me to bowl like Kapil Dev, I would get that right" he adds.Ask him about Ranveer’s look in Kabir Khan ’s '83 and Varun smiles, “He’s done a fabulous job with the look! I'm yet to see how he gets the mannerisms onscreen, but one thing I can bet for- he can’t get Kapil paaji’s bowling action as perfectly as I can!”Varun who plays cricket in reali life too, shares that he is in touch with most members of the 1983 World Cup winning team. “I am personally in touch with most of the team. Jimmy paaji ( Mohinder Amarnath ), Ballu paaji (Balwinder Singh Sandhu) and Sandeep paaji (Sandeep Patil) are good friends and I’ve even played with Kapil paaji.”The telly actor, a huge Kapil Dev fan, says that there can never be another like the cricketer. “For the longest time, everyone has tried to get into Kapil paaji’s shoes, but no one knows what size shoes he wears! Kapil paaji can win any game he plays. A sports club in Delhi had put up a billiards table. Kapil paaji ne waha 100 ke break maarne shuru kar diye. Toh baaki logon ne khelna band kar diya soch ke ki ye aadmi table pakdega toh chodega nahi. I played a tennis ball cricket tournament with him in Goa. He was 54 then and at that age he ran and caught a flat catch! Kandha toh gaya, but what was commendable that he was so agile at that age. He was born to be an athlete,” concludes Varun.

Title: Protect Constitution from hasty change: Parekh
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Mumbai: HDFC chairman Deepak Parekh called for maintaining values of the Indian Constitution, stating that "while times and circumstances change, strong values and principles do not". The veteran banker quoted eminent jurist, the late Nani Palkhivala, who had said that the Constitution should not be subject to "hasty and ill-conceived" change.

Parekh was delivering the vote of thanks at the 17th Nani Palkhivala memorial lecture which was delivered by N Chandrasekaran, chairman, Tata Sons who spoke of "suspicion and micro-management" as the impediments faced by businesses in India.

Parekh pointed out that this was Palkhivala's birth centenary and his memories endured because of his values and beliefs. Quoting Palkhivala, Parekh said: "Our Constitution is primarily shaped and moulded for the common man...The great makers of our Constitution clearly intended that the integrity of the Constitution should be preserved against any hasty or ill-considered changes."

Palkhivala, who passed away in 2002, was a staunch defender of the constitution and had argued in several cases of constitutional importance.

Pointing out that the quotes were 50 years old, Parekh said, "The inferences are for you to interpret, but to my mind, it still seems starkly relevant in these present times."

Parekh highlighted another quote from Palkhivala: "With the growing powers of government all over the world, it is eminently desirable for any democracy to have fundamental rights which cannot be curtailed or abrogated." He said that while we should hold on to the learning that Palkhivala left behind, it is important not to be consumed by "pessimism and doom-mongering". "I am an optimist. I am confident about the future of India and that our youth will see India's best days," said Parekh.

Title: Query on parents' birthplace likely to trigger controversy
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

HYDERABAD: Respondents to the National Population Register, 2020 questionnaire will have to tell the government if their parents were born in India or in a foreign country, if the trial run conducted last year is any indication. If the parents were born in India, one will have to indicate the state and district. If they were not born outside India, the country will have to be mentioned.

This is one of two new questions that the questionnaire for the trial run, conducted in select states between October and December, had. The second question was about giving Aadhaar number, PAN number, driving license, mobile number and voter ID. Both these questions were missing in the 2010 final format NPR .

The pre-test is a mandatory exercise conducted to find out if there are any difficulties in obtaining answers. It also gives an indication on how people are responding to the questions. Sources in the government said that there can be small modifications in the final format of the questionnaire when NPR is finally rolled out.

Sources said that asking for details of country of origin of parents could become a contentious issue given the ongoing protests in different parts of the country over the CAA. Hyderabad MP and AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and other opposition leaders have been alleging that NPR is backdoor entry for a country-wide National Register of Indian Citizens (NRIC).

Title: Himanta Biswa Sarma says CAA rules won't consider religious persecution
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Assam finance minister Himanta Biswa Sarma

GUWAHATI: Denying that " religious persecution " was a criterion for offering Indian nationality to Hindu and other select communities under the amended citizenship law, Assam finance minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Friday claimed that watertight rules were being framed to detect "fraudulent conversion" and ensure strict compliance with the December 31, 2014, cut-off.

"There are three criteria for applying for citizenship. First, one has to be either a Hindu, Jain, Parsi, Christian, Sikh or Buddhist. Second, the applicant's country of origin has to be either Bangladesh , Afghanistan or Pakistan . Third, the applicant should have proof of residence in India before December 31, 2014. Religious persecution is not a criterion," Sarma told TOI.

He pointed out that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act has no provision for granting Indian nationality to a person on grounds of religious persecution because there was no way of proving an applicant faced such an ordeal before fleeing any of the three countries of origin.

"How can an applicant prove he or she is a victim of religious persecution or fled the country of origin and entered India owing to fear of religious persecuti-on? To get such proof, a person has to go back to Bangladesh or the other two countries and get a police certificate. Why should Banglade-sh, for instance, admit there is religious persecution?"

Title: Chennai: Portal penalised Rs 25,000 for delivering fake i-Phone in 2017
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A man from Ambattur who bought a new i-Phone 5S from Mintkart (formerly known as e-bay) in 2017 but instead found a fake cellphone in the package he got has been awarded Rs 25,000 by a local consumer grievances redressal forum.

M Sundararajan had booked the 5S through PayPal India, an authorised e-bay dealer from Sholinganallur, and choose to pay by cash. When he opened the package, he found a fake i-Phone . He immediately informed e-bay and sent an e-mail requesting replacement.

The firm denied Sundararajan's claim and sent him the seller's contact details. But there was no response from the seller. As his complaints went unattended, M Sundararajan approached the consumer forum.

As legal notices too went unanswered, the consumer forum recently told the parties concerned to replace the phone and pay the fine.

In another case reported last week, the forum penalised the Tambaram Sub-Registrar for entering wrong details in the encumbrance certificate (EC) issued to a resident from Velachery.

The complainant, A Muruganandam, purchased a flat at Marutham Gem Apartment at Madambakkam in May 2017 from M V Subramanian. The aale deed was executed and documents were registered.

Muruganandam applied for EC in March 2018 but found the Tambaram Sub-Registrar office got the names of buyer and seller wrong in the certificate. The sub-registrar agreed to rectify it soon. When he checked online after a month, the seller's name had been corrected but not the buyer's name. Another complaint was filed. This time both the names were again wrong in the EC.

So Muruganandam approached the forum, which directed the sub-registrar to pay 15,000 as fine for deficiency in service and compensation. The forum also directed the sub-registrar to issue the correct EC.

Title: Hazy picture on CRZ norms violations
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Are builders in Visakhapatnam flouting Coastal Regulation Zone norms and constructing buildings along the coastline of the Port City?

In the last few years, several activists from the city had filed RTI queries seeking the status of constructions in the city violating CRZ norms. However, the civic body has not replied to a single RTI.

“Along the 136-km-long coastline of Visakhapatnam district we have identified around 37 constructions violating norms. Most of them are within the city limits. There are more constructions which are under the scanner. But the civic body is not paying any heed to our RTI queries,” said Arijili Dasu, an activist protesting against illegal constructions on Beach Road.

Activists said, the constructions include both private and government properties — hotels, residential and commercial complexes and even a temple by an international organisation.

“The stretch from Rushikonda towards Bheemli on Beach Road is most vulnerable. A few properties violating CRZ are under construction on this stretch. The government and the local civic body should stop these projects,” said Sohan Hatangadi, an environmentalist from Visakhapatnam.

The Supreme Court on September 27, 2019 directed the Kerala government to demolish flats built on the coastal zone of Kochi's Maradu in 138 days and to pay Rs 25 lakh interim compensation to each flat owner within four weeks. Following this, a section of activists in Visakhapatnam are also planning to move court.

“If GVMC does not take steps against these constructions we have to think about moving court. The size of Visakhapatnam beach is shrinking by the day and this will eventually have a significant impact on the environment,” added Dasu.

When TOI contacted builders in the port city, they said they had all necessary clearances from authorities concerned. “We don’t want to comment on the issue. We are not doing anything illegal and we have required clearances from authorities for whatever it is that we are doing,” said a builder from Visakhapatnam.

GVMC officials claim they are not giving any ‘fresh’ permission for construction on Beach Road. “We have roped in a private agency from Chennai and they would soon submit a status report on what we can do along the coastline,” a GVMC official added.

Title: Cops rejoice as city celebrates ‘theft-less’ Sankranti vacation
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In what comes as good news for the safety situation of Visakhapatnam, the city police claim that they have not received a single burglary complaint in the city so far this year. The Sankranti season is otherwise infamous for thefts in locked homes and burglaries spike around this time.

Only last year, nearly 10 burglaries were reported in Vizag during the Sankranti vacation. The vacation often turns into an open season for thieves who strike upon locked homes while owners are away and decamp with valuables.

DS Sravan Kumar, assistant commissioner of police (ACP) of Central Crime Station (CCS) said, “We intensified night patrol during the festival and also appealed to residents to take all necessary precautionary measures before setting out of their home in order to prevent property offences.”

“Our efforts have yielded good results this year as not a single case of burglary was reported in the city,” ACP Kumar said.

According to the police, more than 70 per cent of those who had gone out of the city to celebrate Sankranti have returned to the city by Friday. The remaining 30 per cent is anticipated to return either within the weekend or by Monday, police sources informed.

“We are planning to take more measures to prevent thefts in the coming days,” said a police official.

Title: RPF fails to stop men barging into ladies’ coaches
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The practice of men travelling in women ’s coaches in trains seems to be going on unabated despite efforts by railway authorities including the RPF (Railway Protection Force).

The RPF has registered numerous cases against this which goes on to show the extent of the problem. The problem gets significantly exacerbated during festivals as well as the summers, in general, whenever there is a rush. Night trains are particularly subject to this issue.

According to Jitendra Srivastava, the senior security commissioner of RPF Waltair division, a total of 7,151 male passengers have been prosecuted for travelling in coaches reserved for women in 2019 and fine worth Rs6.9 lakh has been realised.

“The major complaint we receive is to do with husbands travelling with their wives in women-only coaches. The coaches are meant exclusively for women and people with disabilities,” Srivastava added.

He also said that passengers can dial railway helpline number 182 if they face any problem while travelling in coaches reserved for women.

Meanwhile, a railway official informed that of the 18 trains originating from Visakhapatnam, only 7 have railway coaches reserved for women. These include Godavari Express, LTT Visakhapatnam-Mumbai Express, Samata Express and Chennai Express. The railway provides a general class coach with these trains for women passengers.

RPF sources said that youngsters often try to enter the women-only coaches during night travel.

“Not just male passengers, unauthorised hawkers are also found in these coaches,” said a woman passenger who regularly travels in these coaches.

Male passengers travelling in women’s compartments can be punished with up to six months of imprisonment and/or a fine according to the Railway Act.

Title: Amarnath flays Pawan, calls him a ‘political freelancer’
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: YSRC spokesperson and Anakapalli MLA Gudivada Amarnath dared Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan to contest in the upcoming local body elections as an MPTC or ZPTC instead of waxing eloquent on how his party would win the elections in 2024. He also took a dig at the actor-cum-politico saying he wouldn’t win even if he were to contest for the post of a sarpanch.

Addressing the media here on Friday, Amarnath accused the Jana Sena chief of being a ‘political freelancer’, with neither ideology nor an agenda. Amarnath remarked that Pawan had courted the TDP , BJP and left parties as well.

“We all know why Jana Sena was floated. It was done to serve the political interests of the TDP chief Chandrababu Naidu. The tie-up shouldn’t be viewed as a new development. It dates back to when the BJP and TDP were allies in 2014. However, this tie-up is also an indication of the end of the pretence of Jana Sena as a political party with independent motives,” Amarnath pointed out.

Title: DSP case as good as dead under NIA: Rahul
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Amping up attack over the arrest of a key J&K cop sheltering militants, former Congress chief Rahul Gandhi on Friday asked who wanted Davinder Singh to be silenced even as he alleged that handing over the probe of the disgraced deputy SP to the NIA would be tantamount to a cover up.

"The best way to silence Terrorist DSP Davinder is to hand the case to the NIA," Rahul tweeted, adding the agency is headed by "another Modi" who investigated the Gujarat riots and the Haren Pandya case. "In Y K Modi 's care, the case is as good as dead," he added.

Title: Devotion, patriotism fill air in musical event
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Nagpur: Devotional and patriotic songs presented by ND Musical Group kept the audience spellbound at Utkarsh Hall of Mor Hindi Bhavan on Wednesday.

The programme commenced with ‘Deva ho deva’, a duet by Satish Alone and Sandhya Pathak which was followed by ‘Yashomati maiyya se bole Nandlala’, sung by Jyoti Tidke. ‘Tuj magato mi aata’, a Marathi song, was presented by Sandhya Meshram while ‘Sanj ye gokuli’ was sung by Malu Lanjewar.

In all, 25 hit Marathi and Hindi songs were presented by Ashok Burde, Tushar Rangari, Apurva Masodkar, Nilesh Patil, Aruna Chaudhary, Sharda Lanjewar, Seema Mule, Shweta Kurazkar, Veena Chanekar, Vinita Nadekar, Siddarth Dongre and Nitin Ramteke.

Devotional songs like ‘Ae malik tere bande hum’, ‘Bada natkhat hai Krishna kanhaiya’, ‘Bhole o bhole’, ‘Shyam teri bansi’, ‘Bhor bhaye panghat pe’, ‘Kanha aan padi’, ‘Airanichya deva tula’, ‘Chandan chandan zali raat’, ‘Mach gaya shor sari nagri re’ and ‘Bhim geet’ were appreciated by the audience.

Patriotic songs like ‘Kar chale hum fida’, ‘Mere des mein pavan chale purvai’, ‘Jahan daal daal par sone ki’, ‘Har karam apna karenge’, ‘Aisa des hai mera’ and ‘Jis desh mein Ganga behti hai’ presented to mark the Army Day won many a heart.

Anchor, organizer and singer Nanda Dongre kept the audience engrossed with her performance and encouraged singers throughout the programme.

The programme was coordinated by Siddarth Dongre.

Interviews: Sneha Satghare

Title: BJP pushes for Amaravati as capital
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The BJP city and district committees are demanding that the state government keep Amaravati as the capital city . The state committee of BJP passed a resolution in this regard.

Medasani Ravindra, the BJP state president along with leader Kasi Viswanatha Raju told the media today that the decision of making a place the capital is not an issue of 29 villages but of convenience of state administration. tnn

Title: JAC to seek views on Amaravati
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Telugu Shakti Organisation along with Amaravati JAC would gather public opinion on the proposal for capital city in Visakhapatnam on Sunday. BV Ram, Telugu Shakti Organisation president, said people in the city were keen on development than merely making the city the state capital.

Ram met TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu at Vijayawada on Friday and apprised him about the concerns of Vizagites.

“People are not interested about the capital city status, but keen on development,” he said. He said he had recently met President Ramnath Kovind to submit a memorandum demanding dismissal of the state government to save Amaravati. tnn

Title: Anakapalle jaggery sees slump in demand
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Anakapalle jaggery market in Visakhapatnam district which is the second-biggest jaggery market in the country is now faced with another challenge. While jaggery-makers in this region prefer to make bigger lumps weighing 10-12kgs, wholesalers now prefer smaller lumps weighing less than 5kgs.

As a result, jaggery wholesalers from Odisha, West Bengal and Jharkhand are importing jaggery from other states. While the Anakapalle jaggery is renowned for its quality, over the last few years, wholesalers have begun procuring jaggery from Odisha and Maharashtra. Consequently, the demand for Anakapalle jaggery is witnessing a slump.

KV Sarath Kumar, whose family has been in the jaggery business for three generations, now told TOI that traditional jaggery buyers from Odisha and West Bengal are choosing to procure it from Maharashtra and Uttar Pradesh because of the lower cost and smaller size of lumps.

“Since retail customers like to buy jaggery in smaller quantities, wholesalers are also switching to smaller lumps as they do not have to break them before selling,” Sarath Kumar added.

M Satynarayana, another jaggery trader in Anakapalle agrees with Sarath. He said, “We have decided to educate jaggery-makers in Anakapalle to produce smaller lumps in order to compete and have also decided on providing them financial support to convince them to switch to making smaller lumps.”

Meanwhile, K Suryanarayana, a jaggery-maker said, “We need the latest machinery and more manpower to produce smaller jiggery lumps. If there is no further investment and increase in manpower, most jiggery-makers will continue to produce the bigger lumps.”

Traders further say that the amount of jaggery reaching the market has been decreasing over the last few years. While the market received 18,000 tonnes of jaggery in 2016-17, the quantity dropped to 12,000 tonnes in 2017-18 and subsequently to 10,000 tonnes in 2018-19, they say.

“We are expecting that around 8,000 tonnes of jaggery will come into the market this time,” a trader said.

“If we fail to compete, the Anakapalle jaggery market will lose its glory,” another trader said.

Title: Lavu Rattayya to get lifetime award
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Lok Nayak Foundation will be presenting the Lok Nayak Life time achievement award to the head of Vijnan Institutions Lavu Rattayya, famously known as Vijnan Rattayya, on Saturday. The foundation chairman and state official language chairman professor Y Lakshmi Prasad said that the foundation had increased the award money from Rs 1 lakh to Rs 2 lakh this year.

Speaking to the media Friday, the chairman said that the Lokmanya award would be given to D Vijaya Kumar, famously known as Emesco Vijaya Kumar, for his services to the literary field. Retired Supreme Court judge Justice Jasti Chalameswar will preside over the function and Justice Lavu Nageswara Rao will be the chief guest. High court judge Justice AV Sesha Sai, and Telugu actor Mohan Babu will also be attending.

The Lok Nayak Foundation has given awards to many famous persons such as Boyi Bheemanna, Vasireddy Sitadevi, Gollapudi Maruthirao, Garikapati Narasimha Rao and Subbanna Satavadhani, to name a few.

Title: Navy sailor who shot self now stable
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The 22-year-old Amit Kumar, the sailor who attempted suicide by shooting himself with his service revolver on Wednesday night is reportedly stable and is responding to treatment.

Amit, a sailor with the Eastern Naval Command is from New Delhi. He attempted suicide by shooting himself near the chest on board INS Shivalik and was rushed to the Naval Hospital in Kalyani.

The naval police have informed the Malkapuram police about the incident. The Malkapuram cops are currently investigating what prompted the young sailor to attempt to kill himself. They suspect that family problems could have been to blame for his suicide bid.

The naval police have also joined in the investigation. “Once the sailor recovers from the injury, we might gain some clarity on the suicide attempt ,” a police official said.

It may be recalled that a 21-year-old Vikas Yadav from Madhya Pradesh had committed suicide by shooting himself while on sentry duty at INS Rana at ENC in Vizag a couple of years ago.

Title: Vizag startup embarks on mission to turn floral waste into incense
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Where will these end up?

Visakhapatnam: While civic bodies in the city are focussed on effective management of waste by source segregation, the management of floral waste remains largely ignored.

A huge amount of floral waste is generated in the city. The sources of this waste consist primarily of temples, rythu bazaars and flower shops. Floral waste which can be turned into manure often ends up in landfills mixed with other waste.

Environmentalists say that floral waste is thrown directly into water bodies. As a result, harmful pesticides and insecticides used to grow these flowers make way into water bodies disturbing the fragile ecosystem.

Speaking to TOI, a GVMC official said, “Floral waste is generated in every ward, depending upon the location of temples. Usually more than 1,000kgs of floral waste is generated per month. During festivals, it goes up to more than 2,000kgs.”

Taking stock of the problem, a city-based startup called Green Waves Environmental Solutions has decided to take up an initiative to recycle floral waste. Anil Chowdary, the managing director of the NGO said, “We have started collecting floral waste from near areas where religious celebrations are done. Upon collecting them, we use the flowers to make incense sticks, flower manure and soap.”

Anil further said that religious institutions have been supporting their initiative considering it takes away their landfill burden. “We mostly receive marigolds, roses, hibiscuses and chrysanthemums,” Anil informed while adding that they also receive a lot of tulsi and betel leaves.

KSLG Sastry, CMOH of GVMC said, “As of now, the floral waste generated in the city is processed along with wet waste. However, from this year on, we will be concentrating on proper collection, segregation and transportation of different kinds of waste.”

“We are planning to set up a special unit to recycle floral waste in wards where flower waste generation is high. The waste will be converted into manure,” he added.

Title: Centre stands firm, rejects Rajasthan's plea to reduce traffic penalties
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

NEW DELHI: Union road transport minister Nitin Gadkari urged states to implement the amended Motor Vehicles Act while giving a cold shoulder to a demand from Rajasthan to reduce penalties. He said only those who violate rules face the risk of paying hefty fines and the improved law favours law-abiding commuters.

He was responding to a demand from Rajasthan government to reduce traffic fines and penalties under the amended law, which came up at the 39th meeting of Transport Development Council here on Thursday. "When it was brought to his notice that a two-wheeler driver was slapped with huge fines, the minister said he was aware about the case.

He asked whether such persons who commit multiple offences should be allowed to go scot free?" said an official, who was present in the meeting.

Sources said Assam was the only state of those present to commit to implement the central law in totality. Gadkari also warned officials responsible for faulty engineering and road designs of strict action as road accidents have huge impact on country's economy.

Title: Soon, green carry bags sewn by inmates of Hindalga Jail
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Belagavi: The inmates of Hindalga Central Prison may soon join the fight against plastic. Plans are afoot to set up a tailoring unit of 50 men to make cora cotton carry bags which are becoming increasingly popular after the ban on polythene.

The Hindalga prison in Belagavi, opened in 1923, is one of the oldest prisons in the Karnataka. The jail is well-equipped to produce bags from scratch: prisoners will, in fact, weave the cloth required for the bags from cotton thread.

The Central Prison at Hindalga are charting out plan of action to sew eco-friendly bags using cora clothes. These carry-bags to be prepared by prison inmates as a transformational-cum-skill development activity.

Prison authorities are in talks with a private textile company, B B Patil Textiles of Ichalkaranji in Kolhapur district of Maharashtra, for supply of thread and marketing of the bags. Officials of the company have already visited Hindalga and spoken with the authorities.

“We have discussed about the supply of thread. Besides, the company should purchase the bags and market them on their own,” chief superintendent of police (prisons) Krishna Kumar said. “The prices will be discussed. The company will also have to pay the wages of the prisoners which is Rs 150 per person per day.”

Besides being a transformational and skill development activity for the prisoners, it will sensitise them to ecological concerns, he said. A project report will be prepared and sent to the higher-ups in the department for approval.

Around 50 male prisoners will weave the cloth and stitch bags. There is a training unit where tailoring and weaving is taught after which inmates proceed to the working unit. The prison has 27 weaving machines and 37 advanced tailoring machines through which vocational training is imparted.

Title: Ballari varsity enforces ‘decent’ dress code for staff
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Ballari: The teaching and non-teaching staff of Vijayanagar Sri Krishnadevaraya University (VSKU) were in for a rude shock on Friday as they were issued a “decent dress code”: women must stick to saris while men must not turn up in jeans and t-shirt.

While staff members opposed the directive and wondered what had triggered it, registrar Bhadravati K Tulasimala, who issued the circular, said there was nothing wrong with prescribing work wear.

“As the university is a temple of higher education, we are being watched and followed by many students. As staff, we have to be very cautious about our dress code . We have noticed that the trend of wearing jeans and t-shirt and churidar is picking up among staff, so we have to curtail it now to uphold the dignity of higher education,” the registrar said.

The circular, issued on January 13, directed teaching and non-teaching staff, permanent and on contract, to wear only “formal dress” while coming to work at the university. While men have been asked not to wear jeans and t-shirts, women staff have been told that sari is “first priority” and they may wear churidar only if it is “very necessary”.

Several faculty members said the so-called code was unwarranted and insulting. “We dress very decently to work and have never crossed the line though there was no code. The government has been stressing that its employees wear formals to work but no official circular has been sent. We don’t know why all of a sudden, such a circular has been issued,” said a staff member.

The registrar too cited the unstated government emphasis on formal wear and said, “my intention was to make our university a model one in Karnataka by upholding some values… We have to set an example for our students by practising a simple and decent dress code.”

She added that the circular was issued after consultations and the staff must fall in line. “I have issued this circular after holding a meeting with all varsity officials concerned and under the guidance of our vice-chancellor. Though we have not mentioned any specific date for following the decent dress code, issuing a circular means it should be implemented with immediate effect. I expect all 200 staff, including non-teaching members, to follow it and wear only formals,” Tulasimala said.

Title: Over 5,000 cops in Hubballi for Amit Shah’s rally
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Amit Shah

Title: After monologues in his previous films, Kartik Aaryan's impresses everyone with his dialogues in 'Love Aaj Kal'
Content: After a long wait, the trailer of ' Love Aaj Kal ' featuring Kartik Aaryan and Sara Ali Khan has been dropped over the internet. The audience loved the on-screen chemistry of Kartik and Sara. The film tells two love stories in two separate decades. This time, it’s 1990 and 2020 with Kartik Aaryan playing the lovestruck hero Raghu and Veer in both the years.Kartik who is known for monologues in his past film has some amazing dialogues to mouth in this film too! When Raghu asks his crush to ‘break-dance’ with him as said with so much earnestness that one almost falls for his charm. Also when Veer wants Zoe (Sara) to be in his life and he asks her with a glint in his eyes, "Jis moment tumhe lagta hai main tang kar raha hoon, main chala jaounga."There's another one where he say, "Mujhe full Zoe chahiye, andar wali, bahaar wali, career wali, family wali… full! Aana toh puri tarah aana, ya aana he mat!"Well, there are more in the trailer itself, we wonder how many are there in the whole film!Meanwhile, the film, helmed by Imtiaz Ali will hit the theatres this Valentine's Day.

Title: How 100 trekkers were saved from snow-hit Ladakh
Content:
This story is from January 18, 2020

Stranded trekkers board an IAF helicopter at Niraq in Ladakh.
